Utah Code Annotated - Title 32B - Alcoholic Beverage Control Act
================================================================

Utah Code Annotated - Title 32B - Chapter 1 - Alcoholic Beverage Control General Provisions
*******************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-101(1): This title is known as the "Alcoholic Beverage Control Act."
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-101(2): This chapter is known as "Alcoholic Beverage Control General Provisions."


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this title:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(1): "Airport lounge" means a business location:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(1)(a): at which an alcoholic product is sold at retail for consumption on the premises; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(1)(b): that is located at an international airport or domestic airport.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(2): Chapter 5, Retail License Act; Chapter 6, Part 5, Airport Lounge License "Airport lounge license" means a license issued in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(3): "Alcoholic beverage" means the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(3)(a): beer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(3)(b): liquor.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(4): (4)(d)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(4)(a): "Alcoholic product" means a product that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(4)(a)(i): contains at least .5% of alcohol by volume; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(4)(a)(ii): is obtained by fermentation, infusion, decoction, brewing, distillation, or other process that uses liquid or combinations of liquids, whether drinkable or not, to create alcohol in an amount equal to or greater than .5% of alcohol by volume.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(4)(b): "Alcoholic product" includes an alcoholic beverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(4)(c): (4)(d) "Alcoholic product" does not include any of the following common items that otherwise come within the definition of an alcoholic product:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(4)(c)(i): (4)(d) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(4)(c)(ii): vinegar;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(4)(c)(iii): preserved nonintoxicating cider;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(4)(c)(iv): essence;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(4)(c)(v): tincture;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(4)(c)(vi): food preparation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(4)(c)(vii): an over-the-counter medicine.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(4)(d): "Alcoholic product" includes an extract containing alcohol obtained by distillation when it is used as a flavoring in the manufacturing of an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(5): Chapter 1, Part 7, Alcohol Training and Education Act; 26B-5-205 "Alcohol training and education seminar" means a seminar that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(5)(a): Chapter 1, Part 7, Alcohol Training and Education Act required by
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(5)(b): 26B-5-205 described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(6): "Arena" means an enclosed building:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(6)(a): that is managed by:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(6)(a)(i): the same person who owns the enclosed building;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(6)(a)(ii): a person who has a majority interest in each person who owns or manages a space in the enclosed building; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(6)(a)(iii): a person who has authority to direct or exercise control over the management or policy of each person who owns or manages a space in the enclosed building;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(6)(b): that operates as a venue; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(6)(c): that has an occupancy capacity of at least 12,500.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(7): Chapter 5, Retail License Act; Chapter 8c, Arena License Act "Arena license" means a license issued in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(8): (8)(b); (8)(b) "Banquet" means an event:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(8)(a): that is a private event or a privately sponsored event;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(8)(b): that is held at one or more designated locations approved by the commission in or on the premises of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(8)(b)(i): a hotel;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(8)(b)(ii): a resort facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(8)(b)(iii): a sports center;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(8)(b)(iv): a convention center;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(8)(b)(v): a performing arts facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(8)(b)(vi): an arena; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(8)(b)(vii): a restaurant venue;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(8)(c): (8)(b); (8)(b) for which there is a contract:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(8)(c)(i): (8)(b) between a person operating a facility listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(8)(c)(ii): (8)(b) under which the person operating a facility listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(8)(d): at which food and alcoholic products may be sold, offered for sale, or furnished.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(9): Chapter 5, Retail License Act; Chapter 6, Part 4, Bar Establishment License
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(9)(a): Chapter 5, Retail License Act; Chapter 6, Part 4, Bar Establishment License "Bar establishment license" means a license issued in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(9)(b): "Bar establishment license" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(9)(b)(i): a dining club license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(9)(b)(ii): an equity license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(9)(b)(iii): a fraternal license; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(9)(b)(iv): a bar license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(10): Chapter 5, Retail License Act; Chapter 6, Part 4, Bar Establishment License "Bar license" means a license issued in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11): (11)(b)(iii)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(a): "Beer" means a product that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(a)(i): contains:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(a)(i)(A): at least .5% of alcohol by volume; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(a)(i)(B): no more than 5% of alcohol by volume or 4% by weight;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(a)(ii): is obtained by fermentation, infusion, or decoction of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(a)(ii)(A): malt; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(a)(ii)(B): a malt substitute; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(a)(iii): is clearly marketed, labeled, and identified as:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(a)(iii)(A): beer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(a)(iii)(B): ale;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(a)(iii)(C): porter;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(a)(iii)(D): stout;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(a)(iii)(E): lager;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(a)(iii)(F): a malt;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(a)(iii)(G): a malted beverage; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(a)(iii)(H): seltzer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(b): "Beer" may contain:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(b)(i): hops extract;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(b)(ii): caffeine, if the caffeine is a natural constituent of an added ingredient; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(b)(iii): a propylene glycol-, ethyl alcohol-, or ethanol-based flavoring agent that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(b)(iii)(A): is used in the production of beer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(b)(iii)(B): is in a formula approved by the federal Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau after the formula is filed for approval under 27 C.F.R. Sec. 25.55; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(b)(iii)(C): does not contribute more than 10% of the overall alcohol content of the beer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(c): (11)(b)(iii) "Beer" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(c)(i): a flavored malt beverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(c)(ii): (11)(b)(iii) a product that contains alcohol derived from:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(c)(ii)(A): (11)(b)(iii) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(c)(ii)(B): wine; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(11)(c)(iii): a product that contains an additive masking or altering a physiological effect of alcohol, including kratom, kava, cannabidiol, or natural or synthetic tetrahydrocannabinol.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(12): Chapter 5, Retail License Act; Chapter 6, Part 9, Beer-Only Restaurant License "Beer-only restaurant license" means a license issued in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(13): Chapter 7, Part 2, Off-Premise Beer Retailer Local Authority; Chapter 5, Retail License Act; Chapter 6, Part 7, On-Premise Beer Retailer License "Beer retailer" means a business that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(13)(a): is engaged, primarily or incidentally, in the retail sale of beer to a patron, whether for consumption on or off the business premises; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(13)(b): Chapter 7, Part 2, Off-Premise Beer Retailer Local Authority; Chapter 5, Retail License Act; Chapter 6, Part 7, On-Premise Beer Retailer License is licensed as:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(13)(b)(i): Chapter 7, Part 2, Off-Premise Beer Retailer Local Authority an off-premise beer retailer, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(13)(b)(ii): Chapter 5, Retail License Act; Chapter 6, Part 7, On-Premise Beer Retailer License an on-premise beer retailer, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(14): Chapter 13, Beer Wholesaling License Act "Beer wholesaling license" means a license:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(14)(a): Chapter 13, Beer Wholesaling License Act issued in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(14)(b): to import for sale, or sell beer in wholesale or jobbing quantities to one or more retail licensees or off-premise beer retailers.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(15): "Billboard" means a public display used to advertise, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(15)(a): a light device;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(15)(b): a painting;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(15)(c): a drawing;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(15)(d): a poster;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(15)(e): a sign;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(15)(f): a signboard; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(15)(g): a scoreboard.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(16): "Brewer" means a person engaged in manufacturing:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(16)(a): beer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(16)(b): heavy beer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(16)(c): a flavored malt beverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(17): Chapter 11, Part 5, Brewery Manufacturing License "Brewery manufacturing license" means a license issued in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(18): 32B-11-201 "Certificate of approval" means a certificate of approval obtained from the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(19): "Chartered bus" means a passenger bus, coach, or other motor vehicle provided by a bus company to a group of persons pursuant to a common purpose:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(19)(a): under a single contract;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(19)(b): at a fixed charge in accordance with the bus company's tariff; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(19)(c): to give the group of persons the exclusive use of the passenger bus, coach, or other motor vehicle, and a driver to travel together to one or more specified destinations.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(20): "Church" means a building:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(20)(a): set apart for worship;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(20)(b): in which religious services are held;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(20)(c): with which clergy is associated; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(20)(d): that is tax exempt under the laws of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(21): 32B-2-201 "Commission" means the Alcoholic Beverage Services Commission created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(22): "Commissioner" means a member of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(23): "Community location" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(23)(a): a public or private school;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(23)(b): a church;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(23)(c): a public library;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(23)(d): a public playground; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(23)(e): a public park.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(24): "Community location governing authority" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(24)(a): the governing body of the community location; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(24)(b): if the commission does not know who is the governing body of a community location, a person who appears to the commission to have been given on behalf of the community location the authority to prohibit an activity at the community location.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(25): "Container" means a receptacle that contains an alcoholic product, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(25)(a): a bottle;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(25)(b): a vessel; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(25)(c): a similar item.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(26): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Controlled group of manufacturers" means as the commission defines by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(27): "Convention center" means a facility that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(27)(a): in total at least 30,000 square feet; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(27)(b): otherwise defined as a "convention center" by the commission by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(28): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(28)(a): "Counter" means a surface or structure in a dining area of a licensed premises where seating is provided to a patron for service of food.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(28)(b): "Counter" does not include a dispensing structure.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(29): "Crime involving moral turpitude" is as defined by the commission by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(30): 32B-2-203 "Department" means the Department of Alcoholic Beverage Services created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(31): "Department compliance officer" means an individual who is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(31)(a): an auditor or inspector; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(31)(b): employed by the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(32): "Department sample" means liquor that is placed in the possession of the department for testing, analysis, and sampling.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(33): Chapter 5, Retail License Act; Chapter 6, Part 4, Bar Establishment License "Dining club license" means a license issued in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(34): "Director," unless the context requires otherwise, means the director of the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(35): "Disciplinary proceeding" means an adjudicative proceeding permitted under this title:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(35)(a): against a person subject to administrative action; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(35)(b): that is brought on the basis of a violation of this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(36): (36)(b); (36)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(36)(a): (36)(b) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(36)(a)(i): drawing an alcoholic product; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(36)(a)(ii): using the alcoholic product at the location from which it was drawn to mix or prepare an alcoholic product to be furnished to a patron of the retail licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(36)(b): (36) The definition of "dispense" in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(36)(b)(i): a full-service restaurant license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(36)(b)(ii): a limited-service restaurant license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(36)(b)(iii): a reception center license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(36)(b)(iv): a beer-only restaurant license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(36)(b)(v): a bar license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(36)(b)(vi): an on-premise beer retailer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(36)(b)(vii): an airport lounge license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(36)(b)(viii): an on-premise banquet license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(36)(b)(ix): a hospitality amenity license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(37): "Dispensing structure" means a surface or structure on a licensed premises:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(37)(a): where an alcoholic product is dispensed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(37)(b): from which an alcoholic product is served.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(38): Chapter 11, Part 4, Distillery Manufacturing License "Distillery manufacturing license" means a license issued in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(39): "Distressed merchandise" means an alcoholic product in the possession of the department that is saleable, but for some reason is unappealing to the public.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(40): "Domestic airport" means an airport that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(40)(a): has at least 15,000 commercial airline passenger boardings in any five-year period;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(40)(b): receives scheduled commercial passenger aircraft service; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(40)(c): is not an international airport.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(41): Chapter 5, Retail License Act; Chapter 6, Part 4, Bar Establishment License "Equity license" means a license issued in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(42): "Event permit" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(42)(a): a single event permit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(42)(b): a temporary beer event permit.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(43): 32B-1-201 "Exempt license" means a license exempt under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(44): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(44)(a): "Flavored malt beverage" means a beverage:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(44)(a)(i): that contains at least .5% alcohol by volume;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(44)(a)(ii): for which the producer is required to file a formula for approval with the federal Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau under 27 C.F.R. Sec. 25.55 because the beverage is treated by processing, filtration, or another method of manufacture that is not generally recognized as a traditional process in the production of a beer, ale, porter, stout, lager, or malt liquor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(44)(a)(iii): for which the producer is required to file a formula for approval with the federal Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau under 27 C.F.R. Sec. 25.55 because the beverage includes an ingredient containing alcohol.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(44)(b): "Flavored malt beverage" may contain a propylene glycol-, ethyl alcohol-, or ethanol-based flavoring agent that contributes to the overall alcohol content of the beverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(44)(c): "Flavored malt beverage" does not include beer or heavy beer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(44)(d): "Flavored malt beverage" is considered liquor for purposes of this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(45): Chapter 5, Retail License Act; Chapter 6, Part 4, Bar Establishment License "Fraternal license" means a license issued in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(46): Chapter 5, Retail License Act; Chapter 6, Part 2, Full-Service Restaurant License "Full-service restaurant license" means a license issued in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(47): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(47)(a): "Furnish" means by any means to provide with, supply, or give an individual an alcoholic product, by sale or otherwise.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(47)(b): "Furnish" includes to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(47)(b)(i): serve;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(47)(b)(ii): deliver; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(47)(b)(iii): otherwise make available.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(48): 32B-6-407(9) "Guest" means an individual who meets the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(49): "Hard cider" means the same as that term is defined in 26 U.S.C. Sec. 5041.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(50): Title 58, Chapter 5a, Podiatric Physician Licensing Act; Title 58, Chapter 16a, Utah Optometry Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 17b, Pharmacy Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 24b, Physical Therapy Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 40, Recreational Therapy Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 42a, Occupational Therapy Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 44a, Nurse Midwife Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 60, Mental Health Professional Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 69, Dentist and Dental Hygienist Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act "Health care practitioner" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(50)(a): Title 58, Chapter 5a, Podiatric Physician Licensing Act a podiatrist licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(50)(b): Title 58, Chapter 16a, Utah Optometry Practice Act an optometrist licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(50)(c): Title 58, Chapter 17b, Pharmacy Practice Act a pharmacist licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(50)(d): Title 58, Chapter 24b, Physical Therapy Practice Act a physical therapist licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(50)(e): Title 58, Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act a nurse or advanced practice registered nurse licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(50)(f): Title 58, Chapter 40, Recreational Therapy Practice Act a recreational therapist licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(50)(g): Title 58, Chapter 42a, Occupational Therapy Practice Act an occupational therapist licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(50)(h): Title 58, Chapter 44a, Nurse Midwife Practice Act a nurse midwife licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(50)(i): Title 58, Chapter 60, Mental Health Professional Practice Act a mental health professional licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(50)(j): Title 58, Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act a physician licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(50)(k): Title 58, Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act an osteopath licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(50)(l): Title 58, Chapter 69, Dentist and Dental Hygienist Practice Act a dentist or dental hygienist licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(50)(m): Title 58, Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act a physician assistant licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(51): 32B-1-606(3)(b); (51)(a)(i)(B); (51)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(51)(a): 32B-1-606(3)(b) "Heavy beer" means a product that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(51)(a)(i): 32B-1-606(3)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(51)(a)(i)(A): contains more than 5% alcohol by volume;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(51)(a)(i)(B): contains at least .5% of alcohol by volume and no more than 5% of alcohol by volume or 4% by weight, and a propolyne glycol-, ethyl alcohol-, or ethanol-based flavoring agent that contributes more than 10% of the overall alcohol content of the product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(51)(a)(i)(C): 32B-1-606(3)(b) contains at least .5% of alcohol by volume and no more than 5% of alcohol by volume or 4% by weight, and has a label or packaging that is rejected under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(51)(a)(ii): is obtained by fermentation, infusion, or decoction of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(51)(a)(ii)(A): malt; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(51)(a)(ii)(B): a malt substitute.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(51)(b): "Heavy beer" may, if the heavy beer contains more than 5% alcohol by volume, contain a propolyne glycol-, ethyl alcohol-, or ethanol-based flavoring agent that contributes to the overall alcohol content of the heavy beer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(51)(c): (51)(a)(i)(B); (51)(b) "Heavy beer" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(51)(c)(i): a flavored malt beverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(51)(c)(ii): (51)(a)(i)(B); (51)(b) a product that contains alcohol derived from:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(51)(c)(ii)(A): (51)(a)(i)(B); (51)(b) except as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(51)(c)(ii)(B): wine; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(51)(c)(iii): a product that contains an additive masking or altering a physiological effect of alcohol, including kratom, kava, cannabidiol, or natural or synthetic tetrahydrocannabinol.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(51)(d): "Heavy beer" is considered liquor for the purposes of this title.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(53)(a)(iii):

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(103)(b)(vii): a recording in any medium.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(104): "Residence" means a person's principal place of abode within Utah.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(105): 32B-8-102 "Resident," in relation to a resort, means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(106): 32B-8-102 "Resort" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(107): "Resort facility" is as defined by the commission by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(108): Chapter 5, Retail License Act; Chapter 8, Resort License Act "Resort license" means a license issued in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(109): "Responsible alcohol service plan" means a written set of policies and procedures that outlines measures to prevent employees from:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(109)(a): over-serving alcoholic beverages to customers;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(109)(b): serving alcoholic beverages to customers who are actually, apparently, or obviously intoxicated; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(109)(c): serving alcoholic beverages to minors.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(110): "Restaurant" means a business location:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(110)(a): at which a variety of foods are prepared;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(110)(b): at which complete meals are served; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(110)(c): that is engaged primarily in serving meals.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(111): "Restaurant license" means one of the following licenses issued under this title:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(111)(a): a full-service restaurant license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(111)(b): a limited-service restaurant license; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(111)(c): a beer-only restaurant license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(112): "Restaurant venue" means a room within a restaurant that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(112)(a): is located on the licensed premises of a restaurant licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(112)(b): is separated from the area within the restaurant for a patron's consumption of food by a permanent, opaque, floor-to-ceiling wall such that the inside of the room is not visible to a patron in the area within the restaurant for a patron's consumption of food; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(112)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(112)(c)(i): has at least 1,000 square feet that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(112)(c)(i)(A): may be reserved for a banquet; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(112)(c)(i)(B): accommodates at least 75 individuals; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(112)(c)(ii): if the restaurant is located in a small or unincorporated locality, has an appropriate amount of space, as determined by the commission, that may be reserved for a banquet.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(113): "Retail license" means one of the following licenses issued under this title:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(113)(a): a full-service restaurant license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(113)(b): a master full-service restaurant license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(113)(c): a limited-service restaurant license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(113)(d): a master limited-service restaurant license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(113)(e): a bar establishment license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(113)(f): an airport lounge license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(113)(g): an on-premise banquet license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(113)(h): an on-premise beer license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(113)(i): a reception center license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(113)(j): a beer-only restaurant license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(113)(k): a hospitality amenity license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(113)(l): a resort license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(113)(m): a hotel license; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(113)(n): an arena license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(114): "Room service" means furnishing an alcoholic product to a person in a guest room or privately owned dwelling unit of a:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(114)(a): hotel; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(114)(b): resort facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(115): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(115)(a): "School" means a building in which any part is used for more than three hours each weekday during a school year as a public or private:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(115)(a)(i): elementary school;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(115)(a)(ii): secondary school; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(115)(a)(iii): kindergarten.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(115)(b): "School" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(115)(b)(i): a nursery school;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(115)(b)(ii): a day care center;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(115)(b)(iii): a trade and technical school;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(115)(b)(iv): a preschool; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(115)(b)(v): a home school.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(116): "Secondary flavoring ingredient" means any spirituous liquor added to a beverage for additional flavoring that is different in type, flavor, or brand from the primary spirituous liquor in the beverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(117): "Sell" or "offer for sale" means a transaction, exchange, or barter whereby, for consideration, an alcoholic product is either directly or indirectly transferred, solicited, ordered, delivered for value, or by a means or under a pretext is promised or obtained, whether done by a person as a principal, proprietor, or as staff, unless otherwise defined in this title or the rules made by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(118): "Serve" means to place an alcoholic product before an individual.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(119): (119)(b) "Sexually oriented entertainer" means a person who while in a state of seminudity appears at or performs:

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(128): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(128)(a): "Staff" means an individual who engages in activity governed by this title:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(128)(a)(i): on behalf of a business, including a package agent, licensee, permittee, or certificate holder;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(128)(a)(ii): at the request of the business, including a package agent, licensee, permittee, or certificate holder; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(128)(a)(iii): under the authority of the business, including a package agent, licensee, permittee, or certificate holder.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(128)(b)(vi): an operator; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(128)(b)(vii): a representative.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(129): "State of nudity" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(129)(a): the appearance of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(129)(a)(i): the nipple or areola of a female human breast;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(129)(a)(ii): a human genital;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(129)(a)(iii): a human pubic area; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(129)(a)(iv): a human anus; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(129)(b): a state of dress that fails to opaquely cover:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(129)(b)(i): the nipple or areola of a female human breast;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(129)(b)(ii): a human genital;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(129)(b)(iii): a human pubic area; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(129)(b)(iv): a human anus.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(130): "State of seminudity" means a state of dress in which opaque clothing covers no more than:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(130)(a): the nipple and areola of the female human breast in a shape and color other than the natural shape and color of the nipple and areola; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(130)(b): the human genitals, pubic area, and anus:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(130)(b)(i): with no less than the following at its widest point:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(130)(b)(i)(A): four inches coverage width in the front of the human body; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(130)(b)(i)(B): five inches coverage width in the back of the human body; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(130)(b)(ii): with coverage that does not taper to less than one inch wide at the narrowest point.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(131): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(131)(a): "State store" means a facility for the sale of packaged liquor:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(131)(a)(i): located on premises owned or leased by the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(131)(a)(ii): operated by a state employee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(131)(b): "State store" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(131)(b)(i): a package agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(131)(b)(ii): a licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(131)(b)(iii): a permittee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(132): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(132)(a): "Storage area" means an area on licensed premises where the licensee stores an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(132)(b): "Store" means to place or maintain in a location an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(133): "Sublicense" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(133)(a): any of the following licenses issued as a subordinate license to, and contingent on the issuance of, a principal license:

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(134): "Supplier" means a person who sells an alcoholic product to the department.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(137): "Temporary domicile" means the principal place of abode within Utah of a person who does not have a present intention to continue residency within Utah permanently or indefinitely.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(138): "Translucent" means a substance that allows light to pass through, but does not allow an object or person to be seen through the substance.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(139): "Unsaleable liquor merchandise" means a container that:

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(139)(b)(ii): has contents that are:

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(139)(b)(ii)(B): spoiled; or

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(140)(a): "Wine" means an alcoholic product obtained by the fermentation of the natural sugar content of fruits, plants, honey, or milk, or other like substance, whether or not another ingredient is added.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(140)(b): "Wine" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(140)(b)(i): an alcoholic beverage defined as wine under 27 U.S.C. Sec. 211 and 27 C.F.R. Sec. 4.10; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(140)(b)(ii): hard cider.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-102(140)(c): "Wine" is considered liquor for purposes of this title, except as otherwise provided in this title.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-103 Policy.
---------------------------------------
The policies of the state are as follows:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-103(1): This title shall be administered in a manner that is nonpartisan and free of partisan political influence.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-103(2): Alcoholic product control shall be operated as a public business using sound management principles and practices.  This public business shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-103(2)(a): be governed by a commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-103(2)(b): be operated by a department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-103(2)(c): function with the intent of servicing the public demand for alcoholic products.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-103(3): The commission and department may not promote or encourage the sale or consumption of alcoholic products.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-103(4): The commission shall conduct, license, and regulate the sale of alcoholic products in a manner and at prices that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-103(4)(a): reasonably satisfy the public demand and protect the public interest, including the rights of citizens who do not wish to be involved with alcoholic products; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-103(4)(b): will promote the reduction of the harmful effects of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-103(4)(b)(i): overconsumption of alcoholic products by adults; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-103(4)(b)(ii): consumption of alcoholic products by minors.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-104 Exercise of police powers -- Severability.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-104(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-104(1)(a): This title is an exercise of the police powers of the state for the protection of the public health, peace, safety, welfare, and morals, and regulates the storage, sale, offer for sale, furnishing, consumption, manufacture, and distribution of an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-104(1)(b): This title governs alcoholic product control unless otherwise provided in this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-104(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-104(2)(a): A licensee or permittee has the rights and privileges described in this title that are applicable to the licensee's or permittee's license or permit.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-104(2)(b): A licensee or permittee may engage in an activity related to the storage, sale, offer for sale, furnishing, consumption, manufacture, or distribution of an alcoholic product only if the activity is expressly permitted under this title or a rule authorized under this title and made by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-104(3): 32B-1-103 The department and the commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-104(3)(a): 32B-1-103 shall implement and enforce the provisions of this title in accordance with the express language of the provisions of this title and in a manner consistent with the policy described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-104(3)(b): may not waive any provision of this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-104(4): If a provision of this title or the application of a provision to a person or circumstance is held invalid, the remainder of this title shall be given effect without the invalid provision or application.  The provisions of this title are severable.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201 Restrictions on number of retail licenses that may be issued -- Determining population -- Exempt licenses.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201(1): Title 41, Chapter 6a, Part 5, Driving Under the Influence and Reckless Driving; (1)(b)(i); (1)(e)(i) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201(1)(a): Title 41, Chapter 6a, Part 5, Driving Under the Influence and Reckless Driving "Alcohol-related law enforcement officer" means a law enforcement officer employed by the Department of Public Safety that has as a primary responsibility:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201(1)(a)(i): the enforcement of this title; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201(1)(a)(ii): Title 41, Chapter 6a, Part 5, Driving Under the Influence and Reckless Driving the enforcement of
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201(1)(b): (1)(b)(i) "Enforcement ratio" is the number calculated as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201(1)(b)(i): determine the quotient equal to the sum of the total number of quota retail licenses available and the total number of licensed premises operating under a master full-service restaurant license or under a master limited-service restaurant license divided by the total number of alcohol-related law enforcement officers; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201(1)(b)(ii): (1)(b)(i) round the number determined in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201(1)(c): "Quota retail license" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201(1)(c)(i): a full-service restaurant license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201(1)(c)(ii): a limited-service restaurant license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201(1)(c)(iii): a bar establishment license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201(1)(c)(iv): an on-premise banquet license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201(1)(c)(v): an on-premise beer retailer operating as a tavern; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201(1)(c)(vi): a reception center license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201(1)(d): "Total number of alcohol-related law enforcement officers" means the total number of positions designated as alcohol-related law enforcement officers that are funded as of a specified date as certified by the Department of Public Safety to the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201(1)(e): (1)(e)(i) "Total number of quota retail licenses available" means the number calculated by:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201(1)(e)(i): determining as of a specified date for each quota retail license the number of licenses that the commission may not exceed calculated by dividing the population of the state by the number specified in the relevant provision for the quota retail license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201(1)(e)(ii): (1)(e)(i) adding together the numbers determined under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201(2): (2)(b); (2)(b); (1)(d)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201(2)(a): Beginning on July 1, 2012, the department shall annually determine the enforcement ratio as of July 1 of that year.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201(2)(b): If, beginning on July 1, 2012, the enforcement ratio is greater than 52, the commission may not issue a quota retail license for the 12-month period beginning on the July 1 for which the enforcement ratio is greater than 52.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201(2)(c): (2)(b); (2)(b) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201(2)(d): (1)(d) Once the Department of Public Safety certifies under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201(3)(a): the most recent United States decennial or special census; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-201(3)(b): another population determination made by the United States or state governments.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202 Proximity to community location.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(1)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(1)(a)(i): "Outlet" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(1)(a)(i)(A): a state store;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(1)(a)(i)(B): a package agency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(1)(a)(i)(C): a retail licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(1)(a)(ii): "Outlet" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(1)(a)(ii)(A): an airport lounge licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(1)(a)(ii)(B): a restaurant.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(1)(b): "Restaurant" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(1)(b)(i): a full-service restaurant licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(1)(b)(ii): a limited-service restaurant licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(1)(b)(iii): a beer-only restaurant licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(1)(b)(iv): a restaurant venue on-premise banquet licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(2): 32B-1-202.1; 32B-1-202.1
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(2)(a): 32B-1-202.1 Except as otherwise provided in this section or Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(2)(a)(i): within 600 feet of  the proposed outlet, as measured from the nearest patron entrance of the proposed outlet by following the shortest route of ordinary pedestrian travel to the property boundary of the community location; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(2)(a)(ii): within 200 feet of  the proposed outlet, measured in a straight line from the nearest patron entrance of the proposed outlet to the nearest property boundary of the community location.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(2)(b): 32B-1-202.1 Except as otherwise provided in this section or Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(2)(b)(i): within 300 feet of the proposed restaurant, as measured from the nearest patron entrance of the proposed restaurant by following the shortest route of ordinary pedestrian travel to the property boundary of the community location; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(2)(b)(ii): within 200 feet of the proposed restaurant, measured in a straight line from the nearest patron entrance of the proposed restaurant to the nearest property boundary of the community location.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(3)(a): For an outlet or a restaurant that holds a license on May 9, 2017, and operates under a previously approved variance to one or more proximity requirements in effect before May 9, 2017, subject to the other provisions of this title, that outlet or restaurant, or another outlet or restaurant with the same type of license as that outlet or restaurant, may operate under the previously approved variance regardless of whether:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(3)(a)(i): the outlet or restaurant changes ownership;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(3)(a)(ii): the property on which the outlet or restaurant is located changes ownership; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(3)(a)(iii): there is a lapse in the use of the property as an outlet or a restaurant with the same type of license, unless during the lapse, the property is used for a different purpose.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(3)(b): An outlet or a restaurant that has continuously operated at a location since before January 1, 2007, is considered to have a previously approved variance.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(4): (3) An outlet or restaurant that holds a license on May 12, 2020, and operates in accordance with the proximity requirements in effect at the time the commission issued the license or operates under a previously approved variance described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(4)(a): the outlet or restaurant changes ownership;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(4)(b): the property on which the outlet or restaurant is located changes ownership; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(4)(c): there is a lapse of one year or less in the use of the property as an outlet or a restaurant with the same type of license, unless during the lapse the property is used for a different purpose.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(5): (3); (5)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(5)(a): (3) If, after an outlet or a restaurant obtains a license under this title, a person establishes a community location on a property that puts the outlet or restaurant in violation of the proximity requirements in effect at the time the license is issued or a previously approved variance described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(5)(a)(i): the outlet or restaurant changes ownership;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(5)(a)(ii): the property on which the outlet or restaurant is located changes ownership; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(5)(a)(iii): there is a lapse in the use of the property as an outlet or a restaurant with the same type of license, unless during the lapse the property is used for a different purpose.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(5)(b): (5) The provisions of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202(6): Nothing in this section prevents the commission from considering the proximity of an educational, religious, and recreational facility, or any other relevant factor in reaching a decision on a proposed location of an outlet.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202.1(1): 32B-8b-102 As used in this section, "hotel" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202.1(2): 32B-1-202; 10-2-301 The commission may issue a hotel license for a proposed location that does not meet the proximity requirements under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202.1(2)(a): 10-2-301 the proposed hotel is:

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202.1(2)(a)(iii): not within 300 feet of a community location, as measured from the nearest patron entrance of the proposed hotel by following the shortest route of ordinary pedestrian travel to the property boundary of the community location; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202.1(2)(a)(iv): not within 200 feet of a community location, as measured in a straight line from the nearest patron entrance of the proposed hotel to the nearest property boundary of the community location;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202.1(2)(b): the proposed sublicensed premises of a bar establishment sublicense under the hotel license:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202.1(2)(b)(i): is on the second or higher floor of a hotel;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202.1(2)(b)(ii): is not accessible at street level; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202.1(2)(b)(iii): is only accessible to an individual who passes through another area of the hotel in which the bar establishment sublicense is located; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202.1(2)(c): the applicant meets all other criteria under this title for the hotel license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-202.1(3): (2) The commission may issue authority to operate as a package agency to a hotel licensee who meets the requirements described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-203 Licensee compliance with other laws.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-203(1): A licensee and a person applying for a license shall comply with the applicable federal and state laws pertaining to payment of taxes and contributions to unemployment and insurance funds to which the licensee or person may be subject.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-203(2): The commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-203(2)(a): may not issue a license to a person who violates this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-203(2)(b): may suspend, revoke, or not renew the license of a licensee who violates this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-204 Powers of local authority.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-204(1): If this title expressly addresses an issue related to alcoholic product control in this state, a local authority may not regulate in relation to that issue except when a local authority is expressly granted regulatory authority to regulate the issue by this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-204(2): If this title does not expressly address an issue related to alcoholic product control, a local authority may regulate that issue if the regulation:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-204(2)(a): is of the sale, offer for sale, furnishing, or consumption of an alcoholic product; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-204(2)(b): does not conflict with this title.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-205 Falsifying or taking other actions with records prohibited.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-205(1): A person required to make or maintain a record under this title or rules of the commission, or a person acting for that person, may not knowingly forge, falsify, alter, cancel, destroy, conceal, or remove the record for the purpose of deceiving the commission, a commissioner, the director, the department, a department employee, or a law enforcement officer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-205(2): Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act; Chapter 4, Criminal Offenses and Procedure Act A violation of this section may result in:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-205(2)(a): Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act disciplinary action in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-205(2)(b): Chapter 4, Criminal Offenses and Procedure Act criminal prosecution if the violation is a criminal offense under


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-206 Advertising prohibited -- Exceptions.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-206(1): (1)(b); (1)(b); (1)(a)(iv); (v)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-206(1)(a): (1)(b); (1)(b) The department may not advertise liquor, except:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-206(1)(a)(i): the department may provide for an appropriate sign in the window or on the front of a state store or package agency denoting that it is a state authorized liquor retail facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-206(1)(a)(ii): the department or a package agency may provide a printed price list to the public;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-206(1)(a)(iii): the department may authorize the use of price posting and floor stacking of liquor within a state store;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-206(1)(a)(iv): (1)(b) subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-206(1)(a)(v): (1)(b) subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-206(1)(b): (1)(a)(iv); (v) A listing under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-206(2): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-206(2)(a): The department may not advertise an alcoholic product on a billboard.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-206(2)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act A package agency may not advertise an alcoholic product on a billboard, except to the extent allowed by the commission by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-206(3): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-206(3)(a): The department may not display liquor or a price list in a window or showcase visible to passersby.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-206(3)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act A package agency may not display liquor or a price list in a window or showcase visible to passersby, except to the extent allowed by the commission by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-206(4): 17B-2a-802; 17B-2a-802 A public transit district, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-206(5): Advertising of an alcoholic product may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-206(5)(a): promote the intoxicating effects of alcohol; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-206(5)(b): emphasize the high alcohol content of the alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-206(6): Except to the extent prohibited by this title, the advertising of an alcoholic product is allowed under guidelines established by the commission by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-206(7): The advertising or use of any means or media to offer an alcoholic product to the general public without charge is prohibited.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-207 Calculation of ratio of gross receipts of food to alcoholic product.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
In calculating the annual gross receipts of a retail license or sublicense for purposes of determining the percentage of gross receipts from the sale, offer for sale, or furnishing of food or an alcoholic product, a retail licensee may not include in the calculation the money from the sale of:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-207(1): a bottle of wine by the retail licensee or under a sublicense that is in excess of $175;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-207(2): 32B-5-304(2)(a) an individual portion of wine, as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-207(3): 32B-5-304(1) an individual portion of spirituous liquor, as described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-208 Percentage lease agreements.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-208(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-208(1)(a): "Percentage lease agreement" means a lease agreement in which the lessee:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-208(1)(a)(i): is a retail licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-208(1)(a)(ii): pays the lessor:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-208(1)(a)(ii)(A): a base rent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-208(1)(a)(ii)(B): percentage rent.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-208(1)(b): "Percentage rent" means a percentage:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-208(1)(b)(i): agreed upon between a lessor and lessee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-208(1)(b)(ii): of the total sales revenue that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-208(1)(b)(ii)(A): exceed a fixed dollar amount of sales revenue; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-208(1)(b)(ii)(B): the lessee earns while doing business on the rental premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-208(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-208(2)(a): The parties to a percentage lease agreement shall submit a copy of the percentage lease agreement to the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-208(2)(b): (2)(a) If there is a material change to the percentage lease agreement submitted to the department under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-208(3): If a percentage lease agreement requires a retail licensee to pay the lessor a percentage rent of 6% or less, the department may not conduct any further investigation into the percentage lease agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-208(4): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (2) The commission shall make rules in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-208(4)(a): the maximum percentage of revenue from alcohol sales a percentage lease agreement may require; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-208(4)(b): (2) the procedure for submitting a percentage lease agreement under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-208(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-208(5)(a): The provisions of this section do not apply to a percentage lease agreement in which the lessee is an airport lounge licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-208(5)(b): Nothing in this title prohibits an airport lounge licensee from entering into a percentage lease agreement, regardless of the percentage rent specified in the percentage lease agreement.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-301 Title.
--------------------------------------
This part is known as "Qualifications and Background."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-302 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
Reserved

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-303 Qualifications related to employment with the department.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-303(1): The department may not employ a person if that person has been convicted of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-303(1)(a): within seven years before the day on which the department employs the person, a felony under a federal law or state law;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-303(1)(b): within four years before the day on which the department employs the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-303(1)(b)(i): a violation of a federal law, state law, or local ordinance concerning the sale, offer for sale, warehousing, manufacture, distribution, transportation, or adulteration of an alcoholic product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-303(1)(b)(ii): a crime involving moral turpitude; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-303(1)(c): on two or more occasions within the five years before the day on which the department employs the person, driving under the influence of alcohol, drugs, or the combined influence of alcohol and drugs.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-303(2): Title 63A, Chapter 17, Utah State Personnel Management Act; (1); (1)(a); (b); (2)(b)(ii)(A) The director may terminate a department employee or take other disciplinary action consistent with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-303(2)(a): (1) after the day on which the department employs the department employee, the department employee is found to have been convicted of an offense described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-303(2)(b): (1)(a); (b); (2)(b)(ii)(A) on or after the day on which the department employs the department employee, the department employee:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-303(2)(b)(i): (1)(a); (b) is convicted of an offense described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-303(2)(b)(ii): (2)(b)(ii)(A)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-303(2)(b)(ii)(A): is convicted of driving under the influence of alcohol, drugs, or the combined influence of alcohol and drugs; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-303(2)(b)(ii)(B): (2)(b)(ii)(A) was convicted of driving under the influence of alcohol, drugs, or the combined influence of alcohol and drugs within five years before the day on which the person is convicted of the offense described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-303(3): (1)(a); (b); (3)(b)(i) The director may immediately suspend a department employee for the period during which a criminal matter is being adjudicated if the department employee:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-303(3)(a): (1)(a); (b) is arrested on a charge for an offense described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-303(3)(b): (3)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-303(3)(b)(i): is arrested on a charge for the offense of driving under the influence of alcohol, drugs, or the combined influence of alcohol and drugs; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-303(3)(b)(ii): (3)(b)(i) was convicted of driving under the influence of alcohol, drugs, or the combined influence of alcohol and drugs within five years before the day on which the person is arrested on a charge described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304 Qualifications for a package agency, license, or permit -- Minors.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(1)(a)(i): within seven years before the day on which the commission issues the package agency, license, or permit, a felony under a federal law or state law;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(1)(a)(ii): within four years before the day on which the commission issues the package agency, license, or permit:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(1)(a)(ii)(A): a violation of a federal law, state law, or local ordinance concerning the sale, offer for sale, warehousing, manufacture, distribution, transportation, or adulteration of an alcoholic product; or

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(1)(a)(iii): on two or more occasions within the five years before the day on which the package agency, license, or permit is issued, driving under the influence of alcohol, drugs, or the combined influence of alcohol and drugs.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(4)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(4)(a)(i): The commission may not issue a package agency, license, or permit to a person who has had any type of agency, license, or permit issued under this title revoked within the last three years.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(4)(a)(ii): The commission may not issue a package agency, license, or permit to a partnership, corporation, or limited liability company if a partner, managing agent, manager, officer, director, stockholder who holds at least 20% of the total issued and outstanding stock of the corporation, or member who owns at least 20% of the limited liability company is or was:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(4)(a)(ii)(A): a partner or managing agent of a partnership that had any type of agency, license, or permit issued under this title revoked within the last three years;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(4)(a)(ii)(B): a managing agent, officer, director, or stockholder who holds or held at least 20% of the total issued and outstanding stock of any corporation that had any type of agency, license, or permit issued under this title revoked within the last three years; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(4)(a)(ii)(C): a manager or member who owns or owned at least 20% of a limited liability company that had any type of agency, license, or permit issued under this title revoked within the last three years.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(4)(b): The commission may not issue a package agency, license, or permit to a partnership, corporation, or limited liability company if any of the following had any type of agency, license, or permit issued under this title revoked while acting in that person's individual capacity within the last three years:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(4)(b)(i): a partner or managing agent of a partnership;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(4)(b)(ii): a managing agent, officer, director, or stockholder who holds at least 20% of the total issued and outstanding stock of a corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(4)(b)(iii): a manager or member who owns at least 20% of a limited liability company.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(4)(c): The commission may not issue a package agency, license, or permit to a person acting in an individual capacity if that person was:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(4)(c)(i): a partner or managing agent of a partnership that had any type of agency, license, or permit issued under this title revoked within the last three years;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(4)(c)(ii): a managing agent, officer, director, or stockholder who held at least 20% of the total issued and outstanding stock of a corporation that had any type of agency, license, or permit issued under this title revoked within the last three years; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(4)(c)(iii): a manager or member who owned at least 20% of the limited liability company that had any type of agency, license, or permit issued under this title revoked within the last three years.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(5): (5)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(5)(a): The commission may not issue a package agency, license, or permit to a minor.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(5)(b): The commission may not issue a package agency, license, or permit to a partnership, corporation, or limited liability company if any of the following is a minor:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(5)(b)(i): a partner or managing agent of the partnership;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(5)(b)(ii): a managing agent, officer, director, or stockholder who holds at least 20% of the total issued and outstanding stock of the corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(5)(b)(iii): a manager or member who owns at least 20% of the limited liability company.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(5)(c): (5)(b) For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(6): 32B-8-501 Except as described in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(7)(a)(ii): (1)(c) Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(7)(b)(i): (1)(a); (1)(b) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-304(7)(b)(ii): (1)(c) Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305 Requirement for a background check.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(1): (2) The department shall require an individual listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(1)(a): provide a signed waiver from the individual whose fingerprints may be registered in the Federal Bureau of Investigation Rap Back system that notifies the signee:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(1)(a)(i): that a criminal history background check will be conducted;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(1)(a)(ii): who will see the information; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(1)(a)(iii): how the information will be used;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(1)(b): submit to a background check in a form acceptable to the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(1)(c): consent to a background check by:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(1)(c)(i): the Utah Bureau of Criminal Identification; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(1)(c)(ii): the Federal Bureau of Investigation.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(2): (1); (2)(d) The following shall comply with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(2)(a): an individual applying for employment with the department if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(2)(a)(i): the department makes the decision to offer the individual employment with the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(2)(a)(ii): once employed, the individual will receive benefits;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(2)(b): an individual applying to the commission to operate a package agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(2)(c): an individual applying to the commission for a license, unless the license is an off-premise beer retailer state license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(2)(d): an individual who with regard to an entity that is applying to the commission to operate a package agency or for a license is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(2)(d)(i): a partner;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(2)(d)(ii): a managing agent;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(2)(d)(iii): a manager;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(2)(d)(iv): an officer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(2)(d)(v): a director;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(2)(d)(vi): a stockholder who holds at least 20% of the total issued and outstanding stock of a corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(2)(d)(vii): a member who owns at least 20% of a limited liability company; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(2)(d)(viii): an individual employed to act in a supervisory or managerial capacity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(2)(e): (2)(d) an individual who becomes involved with an entity that operates a package agency or holds a license, if the individual is in a capacity listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(2)(e)(i): is approved to operate a package agency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(2)(e)(ii): is licensed by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(3): (3)(b); (1); (3)(a); (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(3)(a): (3)(b); (1) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(3)(b): (3)(a); (1) The commission may require an individual described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(4): (2)(e) The department shall require compliance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(4)(a): continued operation of a package agency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(4)(b): renewal of a license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(5): The department may require as a condition of continued employment that a department employee:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(5)(a): submit to a background check in a form acceptable to the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(5)(b): consent to a fingerprint criminal background check by:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(5)(b)(i): the Utah Bureau of Criminal Identification; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-305(5)(b)(ii): the Federal Bureau of Investigation.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-306 Use of information from a criminal background check.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The commission or department may use information obtained pursuant to SectionUtah Code Annotated § 32B-1-306(1): enforcing this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-306(2): 32B-1-305(2) determining whether an individual is convicted of any of the following offenses that disqualify the individual under this title from acting in a capacity described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-306(2)(a): within the previous seven years, a felony under federal law or state law;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-306(2)(b): within the previous four years:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-306(2)(b)(i): a violation of a federal law, state law, or local ordinance concerning the sale, offer for sale, warehousing, manufacture, distribution, transportation, or adulteration of an alcoholic product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-306(2)(b)(ii): a crime involving moral turpitude; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-306(2)(c): on two or more occasions within the previous five years, driving under the influence of alcohol, drugs, or the combined influence of alcohol and drugs;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-306(3): determining whether an individual fails to accurately disclose the individual's criminal history on an application or document filed with the department or commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-306(4): approving or denying an application for employment with the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-306(5): taking disciplinary action against a department employee, including possible termination of employment;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-306(6): issuing or denying an application to operate a package agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-306(7): issuing or denying an application for a license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-306(8): issuing or denying the renewal of a package agency agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-306(9): issuing or denying the renewal of a license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-306(10): suspending the operation of a package agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-306(11): terminating a package agency contract; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-306(12): suspending or revoking a license.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-401 Title.
--------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Proof of Age Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-402 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-402(1): "Authorized person" means a person authorized by law to sell or otherwise handle an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-402(2): "Restricted area" means a place where an alcoholic product is sold or consumed, but where under this title a minor is not permitted.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-402(3): 32B-1-405 "Statement of age" means a statement signed under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-403 Unlawful transfer or use of proof of age -- False information.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-403(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-403(1)(a): It is unlawful for a person to transfer that person's proof of age to another person to aid that person:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-403(1)(a)(i): in procuring an alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-403(1)(a)(ii): in gaining admittance to a restricted area; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-403(1)(a)(iii): in obtaining employment that under this title may not be obtained by a minor.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-403(1)(b): (1)(a) A person who permits that person's proof of age to be used by another for a purpose stated in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-403(2): 32B-4-411; (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-403(2)(a): It is unlawful for a person to use a proof of age containing false information with the intent to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-403(2)(a)(i): procure an alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-403(2)(a)(ii): gain admittance to a restricted area; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-403(2)(a)(iii): obtain employment that under this title may not be obtained by a minor.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-403(2)(b): 32B-4-411; (2) Except as provided in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-404 Presentation of proof of age upon request.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-404(1): (2) To obtain one or more of the following, an individual shall present proof of age at the request of a person listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-404(1)(a): an alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-404(1)(b): admittance to a restricted area; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-404(1)(c): employment that under this title may not be obtained by a minor.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-404(2): (1); (1); 53-10-301 To determine whether the individual described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-404(2)(a): an authorized person;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-404(2)(b): a peace officer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-404(2)(c): 53-10-301 a representative of the State Bureau of Investigation of the Department of Public Safety, established in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-404(2)(d): an authorized department employee.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-405(1): 32B-1-404; (1)(b); (1)

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-405(1)(a)(ii): the number assigned to the individual's proof of age by the issuing authority.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-405(2)(a)(ii): maintain a statement of age on file for three years.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-405(2)(b)(iii): an authorized department employee.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-406 Acceptance of identification.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-406(1): 32B-1-405 An authorized person may accept as evidence of the legal age of the individual presenting the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-406(1)(a): proof of age; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-406(1)(b): 32B-1-405 if a statement of age is required under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-406(1)(b)(ii): a statement of age.
