Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-406(2)(a): selling, offering for sale, or furnishing an alcoholic product to the individual who signed the statement of age;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-406(2)(b): admitting the individual who signed the statement of age into a restricted area; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-406(2)(c): allowing the individual who signed the statement of age to be employed in employment that under this title may not be obtained by a minor.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-406(3): 53-3-207 An authorized person may not accept a driving privilege card issued in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407 Verification of proof of age by applicable licensees.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(1): As used in this section, "applicable licensee" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(1)(a): a dining club;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(1)(b): a bar;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(1)(c): a tavern;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(1)(d): a full-service restaurant;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(1)(e): a limited-service restaurant; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(1)(f): a beer-only restaurant.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(2): Notwithstanding any other provision of this part, an applicable licensee shall require that an authorized person for the applicable licensee verify proof of age as provided in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(3): An authorized person is required to verify proof of age under this section before an individual who appears to be 35 years of age or younger:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(3)(a): gains admittance to the premises of a bar licensee or tavern;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(3)(b): procures an alcoholic product on the premises of a dining club licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(3)(c): procures an alcoholic product in a dispensing area in the premises of a full-service restaurant licensee, a limited-service restaurant licensee, or a beer-only restaurant licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(4): (3); (5); (4)(b)(i) To comply with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(4)(a): request the individual present proof of age; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(4)(b): (5); (4)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(4)(b)(i): (5) verify the validity of the proof of age electronically under the verification program created in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(4)(b)(ii): (4)(b)(i) if the proof of age cannot be electronically verified as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(5): (2) The commission shall establish by rule an electronic verification program that includes the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(5)(a): (2) the specifications for the technology used by the applicable licensee to electronically verify proof of age, including that the technology display to the person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(5)(a)(i): the name;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(5)(a)(ii): the age;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(5)(a)(iii): the number assigned to the individual's proof of age by the issuing authority;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(5)(a)(iv): the birth date;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(5)(a)(v): the gender; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(5)(a)(vi): the status and expiration date of the individual's proof of age; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(5)(b): the security measures that shall be used by an applicable licensee to ensure that information obtained under this section is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(5)(b)(i): used by the applicable licensee only for purposes of verifying proof of age in accordance with this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(5)(b)(ii): retained by the applicable licensee for seven days after the day on which the applicable licensee obtains the information.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(6): Chapter 5, Part 3, Retail Licensee Operational Requirements
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(6)(a): An applicable licensee may not disclose information obtained under this section except as provided under this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-407(6)(b): Chapter 5, Part 3, Retail Licensee Operational Requirements Information obtained under this section is considered a record for any purpose under


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-408 Penalty.
----------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-408(1): 32B-4-411 Unless otherwise provided in this title, including Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-408(2): A person is not subject to a penalty for a violation of this part if it is proved to the commission or the court hearing the matter that the person charged with the violation acted in good faith.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-501 Title.
--------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Attire, Conduct, and Entertainment Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-502 Purpose -- Application to other laws.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-502(1): This part establishes reasonable and uniform time, place, and manner of operation requirements relating to attire, conduct, and sexually oriented entertainers on premises or at an event at which an alcoholic product is sold, offered for sale, furnished, or allowed to be consumed under a retail license or permit issued by the commission so as to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-502(1)(a): reduce the adverse secondary effects that the attire, conduct, and sexually oriented entertainers may have upon communities of this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-502(1)(b): protect the health, peace, safety, welfare, and morals of the residents of communities of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-502(2): Nothing in this part allows the showing or display of any matter that is contrary to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-502(2)(a): applicable federal or state statutes prohibiting obscenity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-502(2)(b): state statutes relating to lewdness or indecent public displays.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-502(3): A local authority may be more restrictive of attire, conduct, or sexually oriented entertainers of the type prohibited in this part.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-503 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
Reserved

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504 General requirements on attire and conduct.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(1): As used in this section, "obscene" means that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(1)(a): the average individual, applying contemporary community standards, would find the conduct or material, taken as a whole, appeals to the prurient interest;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(1)(b): the conduct or material depicts or describes sexual conduct in a patently offensive way; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(1)(c): the conduct or material, taken as a whole, lacks serious literary, artistic, political, or scientific value.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2): The following attire and conduct on premises or at an event regulated by the commission under this title are considered contrary to the public health, peace, safety, welfare, and morals, and are prohibited:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(a): employing or using a person in the sale, offer for sale, or furnishing of an alcoholic product while the person is in:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(a)(i): a state of nudity;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(a)(ii): a state of seminudity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(a)(iii): performance attire or clothing that exposes to view any portion of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(a)(iii)(A): the female breast below the top of the areola; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(a)(iii)(B): the cleft of the buttocks;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(b): employing or using the services of a person to mingle with patrons while the person is in:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(b)(i): a state of nudity;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(b)(ii): a state of seminudity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(b)(iii): performance attire or clothing that exposes to view any portion of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(b)(iii)(A): the female breast below the top of the areola; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(b)(iii)(B): the cleft of the buttocks;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(c): encouraging or permitting a person to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(c)(i): engage in or simulate an act of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(c)(i)(A): sexual intercourse;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(c)(i)(B): masturbation;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(c)(i)(C): sodomy;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(c)(i)(D): bestiality;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(c)(i)(E): oral copulation;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(c)(i)(F): flagellation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(c)(i)(G): a sexual act that is prohibited by Utah law; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(c)(ii): caress or fondle the breast, anus, or genitals of any other person;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(d): permitting a person to wear or use a device or covering that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(d)(i): is exposed to view; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(d)(ii): simulates all or any portion of the human genitals, anus, pubic area, or female breast;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(e): permitting a person to use an artificial device or inanimate object to depict an act prohibited by this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(f): permitting a person to remain on premises or at an event who exposes to public view any portion of that person's:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(f)(i): genitals, pubic area, or anus; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(f)(ii): in the case of a female, the areola and nipple of the breast; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(2)(g): showing a film, still picture, electronic reproduction, or other visual reproduction depicting conduct or material that is obscene or in violation of other state or federal law regarding pornography or obscenity.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(3): (2) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(3)(a): when taken as a whole, has serious literary, artistic, political, or scientific value;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(3)(b): is not in violation of state or federal law regarding pornography or obscenity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-504(3)(c): occurs on premises or at an event regulated by the commission under this title that is not predominantly used for performances by sexually oriented entertainers.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505 Sexually oriented entertainer.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(1): Subject to the requirements of this part, live entertainment is permitted on premises or at an event regulated by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(2): (1) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(2)(a): appear or perform in a state of nudity;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(2)(b): perform or simulate an act of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(2)(b)(i): sexual intercourse;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(2)(b)(ii): masturbation;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(2)(b)(iii): sodomy;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(2)(b)(iv): bestiality;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(2)(b)(v): oral copulation;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(2)(b)(vi): flagellation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(2)(b)(vii): a sexual act that is prohibited by Utah law; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(2)(c): touch, caress, or fondle the breast, buttocks, anus, or genitals.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(3): A sexually oriented entertainer may perform in a state of seminudity:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(3)(a): only in:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(3)(a)(i): a tavern; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(3)(a)(ii): a bar license premises; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(3)(b): only if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(3)(b)(i): the windows, doors, and other apertures to the premises are darkened or otherwise constructed to prevent anyone outside the premises from seeing the performance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(3)(b)(ii): the outside entrance doors of the premises remain unlocked.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(4): A sexually oriented entertainer may perform only upon a stage or in a designated performance area that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(4)(a): approved by the commission in accordance with rules made by the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(4)(b): configured so as to preclude a patron from:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(4)(b)(i): touching the sexually oriented entertainer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(4)(b)(ii): placing any money or object on or within the performance attire or the person of the sexually oriented entertainer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(4)(c): configured so as to preclude the sexually oriented entertainer from touching a patron.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(5): A sexually oriented entertainer may not touch a patron:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(5)(a): during the sexually oriented entertainer's performance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(5)(b): while the sexually oriented entertainer is dressed in performance attire.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(6): A sexually oriented entertainer, while in the portion of the premises used by patrons, shall be dressed in opaque clothing which covers and conceals the sexually oriented entertainer's performance attire from the top of the breast to the knee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(7): A patron may not be on the stage or in the performance area while a sexually oriented entertainer is appearing or performing on the stage or in the performance area.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(8): A patron may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(8)(a): touch a sexually oriented entertainer:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(8)(a)(i): during the sexually oriented entertainer's performance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(8)(a)(ii): while the sexually oriented entertainer is dressed in performance attire; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(8)(b): place money or any other object on or within the performance attire or the person of the sexually oriented entertainer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(9): (3) A minor may not be on premises described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(10): A person who appears or performs for the entertainment of patrons on premises or at an event regulated by the commission that is not a tavern or bar licensee:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(10)(a): may not appear or perform in a state of nudity or a state of seminudity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(10)(b): may appear or perform in opaque clothing that completely covers the person's genitals, pubic area, and anus if the covering:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(10)(b)(i): is not less than the following at its widest point:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(10)(b)(i)(A): four inches coverage width in the front of the human body; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(10)(b)(i)(B): five inches coverage width in the back of the human body;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(10)(b)(ii): does not taper to less than one inch wide at the narrowest point; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-505(10)(b)(iii): if covering a female, completely covers the breast below the top of the areola.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-506 Compliance -- Administrative enforcement.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-506(1): A retail licensee, a permittee, and staff of a licensee or permittee shall comply with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-506(2): Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act Failure to comply with this part may result in a disciplinary proceeding pursuant to
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-506(2)(a): a licensee or permittee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-506(2)(b): staff of the licensee or permittee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-506(2)(c): both a licensee and staff of the licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-506(2)(d): both a permittee and staff of the permittee.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-601 Title.
--------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Malted Beverage Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-602 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-602(1): "Malted beverage" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-602(1)(a): beer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-602(1)(b): a flavored malt beverage; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-602(1)(c): heavy beer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-602(2): "Packaging" means the outer packaging that is visible to a consumer such as a carton, case, or other wrapper of a container.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603 Power of the commission and department to classify flavored malt beverages.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603(1): The commission and department shall regulate a flavored malt beverage as liquor.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603(2)(a): The department shall make available to the public on the Internet a list of the flavored malt beverages authorized to be sold in this state as liquor.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603(2)(b): (2)(a) The list described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603(3): Chapter 11, Part 5, Brewery Manufacturing License; (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603(3)(a): Chapter 11, Part 5, Brewery Manufacturing License A manufacturer shall file, under penalty of perjury, a report with the department listing each flavored malt beverage manufactured by the manufacturer that the manufacturer wants to distribute in this state subject to the manufacturer holding:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603(3)(a)(i): Chapter 11, Part 5, Brewery Manufacturing License a brewery manufacturing license issued in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603(3)(a)(ii): a certificate of approval.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603(3)(b): (3) A manufacturer may not distribute or sell in this state a flavored malt beverage if the manufacturer does not list the flavored malt beverage in a filing with the department in accordance with this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603(4): The department may require a manufacturer of a flavored malt beverage to provide the department with a copy of the following filed with the federal Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau, pursuant to 27 C.F.R. Sec. 25.55:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603(4)(a): a statement of process; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603(4)(b): a formula.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603(5): (5); (5); (5)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603(5)(a): A manufacturer of an alcoholic product that the department is classifying or proposes to classify as a flavored malt beverage may submit evidence to the department that the manufacturer's alcoholic product should not be treated as a flavored malt beverage under this section because the alcoholic product is beer or heavy beer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603(5)(b): (5) The department shall review the evidence submitted by the manufacturer under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603(5)(c): (5) The department shall make available to the public on the Internet a list of the alcoholic products authorized under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603(5)(d): (5) A decision of the department under this Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5 Requirements for beer flavorings -- Procedure for approval -- Department review.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(1): 32B-1-102(11)(b)(iii); 32B-1-604; 32B-1-606 A manufacturer of a beer that contains a propylene glycol-, ethyl alcohol-, or ethanol-based flavoring agent as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(1)(a): the department's approval to sell or distribute the beer under this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(1)(b): 32B-1-604; 32B-1-606 the department's approval of the label and packaging of the beer under Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(2): 32B-1-102(11)(b)(iii); 32B-1-102(11)(b)(iii)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(2)(a): 32B-1-102(11)(b)(iii) To obtain approval to sell or distribute a beer that contains a propylene glycol-, ethyl alcohol-, or ethanol-based flavoring agent as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(2)(b): 32B-1-102(11)(b)(iii) The application shall require:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(2)(b)(i): a copy of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(2)(b)(i)(A): the statement of process and formula filed with the federal Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau under 27 C.F.R. Sec. 25.55 for the beer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(2)(b)(i)(B): the formula approval from the federal Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau for the beer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(2)(b)(ii): a complete list of each propylene glycol-, ethyl alcohol-, or ethanol-based flavoring agent in the beer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(2)(b)(iii): a description of the total amount of alcohol each propylene glycol-, ethyl alcohol-, or ethanol-based flavoring agent contributes to the beer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(2)(b)(iv): 32B-1-102(11)(b)(iii) other information required by the department to determine whether the beer complies with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(3): 63J-1-504; 32B-1-102(11)(b)(iii) The department may:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(3)(a): 63J-1-504 assess a fee established under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(3)(b): 32B-1-102(11)(b)(iii) approve a manufacturer's application to sell or distribute a beer that contains a propylene glycol-, ethyl alcohol-, or ethanol-based flavoring agent after determining that the beer complies with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(4): If a manufacturer of a beer revises the formula for the beer that the department approved for sale or distribution, the manufacturer shall obtain the department's approval for the revised formula before selling or distributing the beer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(5): (5)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(5)(a): The department may revoke a previous approval under this section upon determining that the beer is not in compliance with this title or the rules of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(5)(b): The department shall notify the manufacturer that applied for an approval under this section at least 30 business days before the day on which the approval is revoked.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(5)(c): (5)(b) Within 20 business days after the day on which a manufacturer receives the notice under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(6): (6)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(6)(a): A manufacturer that applies for approval under this section may appeal a denial or revocation of the approval to the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(6)(b): (6)(a) During the period in which a manufacturer appeals a denial or revocation to the commission under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(7): 32B-1-102(11)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(7)(a): 32B-1-102(11) Before July 1, 2024, the department shall review each beer that is sold or distributed in this state to determine whether the beer complies with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(7)(b): Before November 30, 2024, the department shall provide a report to the Business and Labor Interim Committee regarding:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(7)(b)(i): the process used to conduct the review;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(7)(b)(ii): the results of the review; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-603.5(7)(b)(iii): any recommendations for legislation based on the results.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-604 Requirements for labeling and packaging -- Authority of the commission and department.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-604(1): A manufacturer may not distribute or sell a malted beverage:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-604(1)(a): unless the label and packaging of the malted beverage:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-604(1)(a)(i): complies with the federal label requirements of 27 C.F.R.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-604(1)(a)(ii): clearly gives notice to the public that the malted beverage is an alcoholic product; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-604(1)(b): until the day on which the department in accordance with this title and rules of the commission approves the label and packaging of the malted beverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-604(2): (1)(a) The department shall review the label and packaging of a malted beverage to ensure that the label and packaging meet the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-604(3): 32B-1-606; (1)(a)(ii) Except as otherwise required under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-604(3)(a): beer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-604(3)(b): ale;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-604(3)(c): porter;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-604(3)(d): stout;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-604(3)(e): lager;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-604(3)(f): lager beer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-604(3)(g): hard seltzer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-604(3)(h): spiked seltzer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-604(3)(i): another class or type designation commonly applied to a malted beverage that conveys by a recognized term that the product contains alcohol.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-605 General procedure for approval.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-605(1): To obtain approval of the label and packaging of a malted beverage, the manufacturer of the malted beverage shall submit an application to the department for approval.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-605(2): (1) The application described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-605(2)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-605(2)(a)(i): a copy of a federal certificate of label approval from the United States Department of Treasury, Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-605(2)(a)(ii): if the United States Department of Treasury, Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau does not require label approval, a copy of formula approval from the United States Department of Treasury, Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-605(2)(b): a complete set of original labels for each size of container of the malted beverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-605(2)(c): a description of the size of the container on which a label will be placed;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-605(2)(d): a description of each type of container of the malted beverage; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-605(2)(e): a description of any packaging for the malted beverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-605(3): The department may assess a reasonable fee for reviewing a label and packaging for approval.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-605(4): (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-605(4)(a): The department shall notify a manufacturer within 30 days after the day on which the manufacturer submits a complete application whether the label and packaging is approved or denied.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-605(4)(b): (4)(a) If the department determines that an unusual circumstance requires additional time, the department may extend the time period described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-605(5): A manufacturer shall obtain the approval of the department of a revision of a previously approved label and packaging before a malted beverage using the revised label and packaging may be distributed or sold in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-605(6): (6)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-605(6)(a): The department may revoke a label and packaging previously approved upon a finding that the label and packaging is not in compliance with this title or rules of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-605(6)(b): The department shall notify the manufacturer who applied for an approved label and packaging at least 30 business days before the day on which the label and packaging approval is considered revoked.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-605(6)(c): (6)(b) Within 20 business days after the day on which a manufacturer receives the notice under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-605(7): (7)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-605(7)(a): A manufacturer that applies for approval of a label and packaging may appeal a denial or revocation of a label and packaging approval to the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-605(7)(b): (7)(a) During the period in which a manufacturer appeals a denial or revocation of a label and packaging approval to the commission, as permitted under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606 Special procedure for approval of labeling and packaging for certain malted beverages.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(1): 32B-1-604; 32B-1-605 A manufacturer of a malted beverage may not distribute or sell the malted beverage in the state until the day on which the manufacturer receives approval of the labeling and packaging of the malted beverage from the department in accordance with:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(1)(a): 32B-1-604; 32B-1-605 Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(1)(b): this section, if the malted beverage is labeled or packaged in a manner that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(1)(b)(i): similar to a label or packaging used for a nonalcoholic beverage; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(1)(b)(ii): likely to confuse or mislead a patron to believe the malted beverage is a nonalcoholic beverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(2): (1); 32B-1-604; (2)(a); (b); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (2)(a)(ii); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The department may not approve the labeling and packaging of a malted beverage described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(2)(a): the front of the label on the malted beverage bears a prominently displayed label or a firmly affixed sticker that provides the following information in a font that measures at least three millimeters high and is in obvious and clearly visible contrast to the background of the text:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(2)(a)(i): the statement:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(2)(a)(i)(A): "alcoholic beverage"; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(2)(a)(i)(B): "contains alcohol"; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(2)(a)(ii): the alcohol content of the malted beverage, if the alcohol content is not otherwise provided:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(2)(a)(ii)(A): in a serving facts statement on the container; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(2)(a)(ii)(B): in a format allowed by the Federal Alcohol and Tobacco Tax Trade Bureau;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(2)(b): the packaging of the malted beverage prominently includes, either imprinted on the packaging or imprinted on a sticker firmly affixed to the packaging in a font that measures at least three millimeters high and is in obvious and clearly visible contrast to the background of the text, the statement:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(2)(b)(i): "alcoholic beverage"; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(2)(b)(ii): "contains alcohol";
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(2)(c): (2)(a); (b); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act a statement required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(2)(d): (2)(a)(ii); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act a statement of alcohol content required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(2)(d)(i): states the alcohol content as a percentage of alcohol by volume or by weight; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(2)(d)(ii): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act is in a format required under rule made by the commission in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(3): (2); (2) The department:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(3)(a): (2) may reject a label or packaging for a malted beverage that appears designed to obscure the information required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(3)(b): (2) shall reject a label or packaging for a malted beverage to be sold by an off-premise beer retailer if the label or packaging for the malted beverage complies with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(4): (1) To determine whether a malted beverage is described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(4)(a): whether the coloring, carbonation, and packaging of the malted beverage:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(4)(a)(i): is similar to those of a nonalcoholic beverage or product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(4)(a)(ii): can be confused with a nonalcoholic beverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(4)(b): whether the malted beverage possesses a character and flavor distinctive from a traditional malted beverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(4)(c): whether the malted beverage:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(4)(c)(i): is prepackaged;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(4)(c)(ii): contains high levels of caffeine and other additives; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(4)(c)(iii): is marketed as a beverage that is specifically designed to provide energy;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(4)(d): whether the malted beverage contains added sweetener or sugar substitutes; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-606(4)(e): whether the malted beverage contains an added fruit flavor or other flavor that masks the taste of a traditional malted beverage.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-607 Rulemaking authority.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-607(1): The commission may adopt rules necessary to implement this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-607(2): 32B-1-102(12); (51); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act Notwithstanding Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-607(2)(a): up to 0.18% above or below when measured by volume; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-607(2)(b): up to 0.15% above or below when measured by weight.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-608 Disciplinary proceeding for violation.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
A person who violates this part:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-608(1): Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act is subject to a disciplinary proceeding under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-608(2): Chapter 4, Criminal Offenses and Procedure Act may be subject to penalties under


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-701 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-701(1): Chapter 7, Off-Premise Beer Retailer Act "Off-premise retail manager" means an individual who manages operations at a premises that is licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-701(2): Chapter 7, Off-Premise Beer Retailer Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-701(2)(a): Chapter 7, Off-Premise Beer Retailer Act "Off-premise retail staff" means an individual who sells beer at a premises that is licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-701(2)(b): "Off-premise retail staff" does not include an off-premise retail manager.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-701(3): Chapter 5, Retail License Act; Chapter 5, Retail License Act "Retail manager" means an individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-701(3)(a): Chapter 5, Retail License Act manages operations at a premises that is licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-701(3)(b): Chapter 5, Retail License Act supervises the furnishing of an alcoholic product at a premises that is licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-701(4): Chapter 5, Retail License Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-701(4)(a): Chapter 5, Retail License Act "Retail staff" means an individual who serves an alcoholic product at a premises licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-701(4)(b): "Retail staff" does not include a retail manager.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-702 Alcohol training and education -- Revocation, suspension, or nonrenewal of retail license.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-702(1): The commission may suspend, revoke, or not renew a license of a retail licensee if any of the following individuals fail to complete an alcohol training and education seminar:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-702(1)(a): a retail manager; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-702(1)(b): retail staff.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-702(2): A city, town, metro township, or county in which a retail licensee conducts business may suspend, revoke, or not renew the business license of the retail licensee if a retail manager or retail staff fails to complete an alcohol training and education seminar.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-702(3): A local authority that issues an off-premise beer retailer license to a business that is engaged in the retail sale of beer for consumption off the beer retailer's premises may immediately suspend the off-premise beer retailer license if any of the following individuals fails to complete an alcohol training and education seminar:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-702(3)(a): an off-premise retail manager; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-702(3)(b): off-premise retail staff.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-703 Alcohol training and education for off-premise consumption.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-703(1): (1)(b); 26B-5-205; (1)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-703(1)(a): (1)(b) A local authority that issues an off-premise beer retailer license to a business to sell beer at retail for off-premise consumption shall require the following to have a valid record that the individual completed an alcohol training and education seminar in the time periods required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-703(1)(a)(i): an off-premise retail manager; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-703(1)(a)(ii): off-premise retail staff.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-703(1)(b): 26B-5-205 If an individual on the date the individual becomes staff to an off-premise beer retailer does not have a valid record that the individual has completed an alcohol training and education seminar for purposes of this part, the individual shall complete an alcohol training and education seminar in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-703(1)(c): (1)(b) An off-premise beer retailer may not permit an individual who is not in compliance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-703(1)(c)(i): directly supervise the sale of beer to a customer for consumption off the premises of the off-premise beer retailer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-703(1)(c)(ii): sell beer to a customer for consumption off the premises of the off-premise beer retailer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-703(2): 32B-1-702 A licensee that violates this section is subject to Section


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704 Department training programs.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(1): No later than January 1, 2018, the department shall develop the following training programs that are provided either in-person or online:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(1)(a): a training program for retail managers that addresses:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(1)(a)(i): the statutes and rules that govern alcohol sales and consumption in the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(1)(a)(ii): the requirements for operating as a retail licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(1)(a)(iii): using compliance assistance from the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(1)(a)(iv): any other topic the department determines beneficial to a retail manager; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(1)(b): a training program for an individual employed by a retail licensee or an off-premise beer retailer who violates a provision of this title related to the sale, service, or furnishing of an alcoholic beverage to an intoxicated individual or a minor, that addresses:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(1)(b)(i): the statutes and rules that govern the most common types of violations under this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(1)(b)(ii): how to avoid common violations; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(1)(b)(iii): any other topic the department determines beneficial to the training program.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(2): No later than January 1, 2019, the department shall develop a training program for off-premise retail managers that is provided either in-person or online and addresses:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(2)(a): the statutes and rules that govern sales at an off-premise beer retailer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(2)(b): the requirements for operating an off-premise beer retailer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(2)(c): using compliance assistance from the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(2)(d): any other topic the department determines beneficial to an off-premise retail manager.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(3): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(3)(a): the requirements for each training program described in this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(3)(b): measures that accurately identify each individual who takes and completes a training program;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(3)(c): measures that ensure an individual taking a training program is focused and actively engaged in the training material throughout the training program;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(3)(d): a record that certifies that an individual has completed a training program; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(3)(e): a fee for participation in a training program to cover the department's cost of providing the training program.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(4): (1)(a); (2); (1)(b); (1)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(4)(a): (1)(a) Each retail manager shall complete the training described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(4)(a)(i): 30 days after the day on which the retail manager is hired; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(4)(a)(ii): the day on which the retail licensee obtains a retail license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(4)(b): (2) Each off-premise retail manager shall  complete the training described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(4)(b)(i): 30 days after the day on which the off-premise retail manager is hired; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(4)(b)(ii): 30 days after the day on which the off-premise beer retailer obtains an off-premise beer retailer state license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(4)(c): (1)(b); (1)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(4)(c)(i): (1)(b) If the commission finds that a retail licensee violated a provision of this title related to the sale, service, or furnishing of an alcoholic beverage to an intoxicated individual or a minor for a second time within 36 consecutive months after the day on which the first violation was adjudicated, the violator, all retail staff, and each retail manager shall complete the training program described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(4)(c)(ii): (1)(b) If the commission finds that an off-premise beer retailer violated a provision of this title related to the sale, service, or furnishing of an alcoholic beverage to an intoxicated individual or a minor for a second time within 36 consecutive months after the day on which the first violation was adjudicated, the violator and each off-premise retail manager shall complete the training program described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(5): If an individual fails to complete a required training program under this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(5)(a): the commission may suspend, revoke, or not renew the retail license or off-premise beer retailer state license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(5)(b): a city, town, metro township, or county in which the retail licensee or off-premise beer retailer is located may suspend, revoke, or not renew the retail licensee's or off-premise beer retailer's business license; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-1-704(5)(c): a local authority may suspend, revoke, or not renew the off-premise beer retailer's license.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 32B - Chapter 2 - Alcoholic Beverage Services Administration Act
********************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Alcoholic Beverage Services Administration Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
Reserved

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-201 Alcoholic Beverage Services Commission created.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-201(1): There is created the "Alcoholic Beverage Services Commission." The commission is the governing board over the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-201(2): Title 63G, Chapter 24, Part 2, Vacancies
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-201(2)(a): Title 63G, Chapter 24, Part 2, Vacancies The commission is composed of seven part-time commissioners appointed by the governor with the advice and consent of the Senate in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-201(2)(b): No more than four commissioners may be of the same political party.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-201(3): (3)(b); (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-201(3)(a): (3)(b) Except as required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-201(3)(b): (3)(a) Notwithstanding the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-201(4): (6)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-201(4)(a): When a vacancy occurs on the commission for any reason, the governor shall appoint a replacement for the unexpired term with the advice and consent of the Senate.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-201(4)(b): (6) Unless removed in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-201(5): A commissioner shall take the oath of office.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-201(6): (6)(a); (6); (6); (6)(d); (6)(d); (6)

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-201(6)(a)(ii): an impartial hearing examiner appointed by the governor to conduct the hearing.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-201(6)(b)(ii): the alleged grounds for the removal.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-201(6)(c): The commissioner shall have an opportunity to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-201(6)(c)(i): attend the hearing;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-201(6)(c)(ii): present witnesses and other evidence; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-201(6)(c)(iii): confront and cross examine witnesses.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-201(6)(d): (6) After a hearing under this Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-201(6)(d)(ii): the governor shall serve a copy of the prepared findings and conclusions upon the commissioner.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-201(6)(g)(i): (6) issue the final order under this Subsection

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-201.5(1)(b): "Operations and Procurement Subcommittee."
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-201.5(2): A subcommittee shall have four members, including the chair of the commission.  The chair of the commission shall appoint the members to a subcommittee.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-202 Powers and duties of the commission.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-202(1): (5); (5); 32B-5-205; 32B-7-406; 63J-1-504; Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act The commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-202(1)(a): consistent with the policy established by the Legislature by statute, act as a general policymaking body on the subject of alcoholic product control;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-202(1)(b): adopt and issue policies, rules, and procedures;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-202(1)(c): set policy by written rules that establish criteria and procedures for:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-202(1)(c)(i): issuing, denying, not renewing, suspending, or revoking a package agency, license, permit, or certificate of approval; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-202(1)(c)(ii): determining the location of a state store, package agency, or retail licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-202(1)(d): decide within the limits, and under the conditions imposed by this title, the number and location of state stores, package agencies, and retail licensees in the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-202(1)(e): (5); (5) issue, deny, suspend, revoke, or not renew the following package agencies, licenses, sublicenses, permits, or certificates of approval for the purchase, storage, sale, offer for sale, furnishing, consumption, manufacture, and distribution of an alcoholic product:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-202(1)(e)(i): a package agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-202(1)(e)(ii): a full-service restaurant license;

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-202(1)(e)(xi): a reception center license;

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-203 Department of Alcoholic Beverage Services created.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-203(1): There is created the Department of Alcoholic Beverage Services.  The department is governed by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-203(2): 32B-2-205 The director of alcoholic beverage services appointed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-203(3): The director shall allocate the duties within the department into the divisions, bureaus, sections, offices, and committees as the director considers necessary for the administration of this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-203(4): The department shall cooperate with any other recognized agency in the administration of this title and in the enforcement of a policy or rule of the commission or policy of the director.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204 Powers and duties of the department -- Immunity.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204(1): The department shall control liquor merchandise inventory including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204(1)(a): listing and delisting a product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204(1)(b): the procedures for testing a new product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204(1)(c): purchasing policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204(1)(d): turnover requirements for a regularly coded product to be continued; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204(1)(e): the disposition of discontinued, distressed, or unsaleable merchandise.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204(2): (2); (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204(2)(a): The department shall report to the governor on the administration of this title:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204(2)(a)(i): as the governor may require; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204(2)(a)(ii): annually by no later than November 30, for the fiscal year ending June 30 of the year in which the report is made.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204(2)(b): (2) A report under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204(2)(b)(i): a statement of the nature and amount of the business transacted by the department during the year;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204(2)(b)(ii): a statement of the department's assets and liabilities including a profit and loss account, and other accounts and matters necessary to show the results of operations of the department for the year;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204(2)(b)(iii): general information on the application of this title in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204(2)(b)(iv): any other information requested by the governor.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204(2)(c): (2) The department shall submit a copy of a report described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204(3): The department shall maintain insurance against loss on each motor vehicle operated by it on any public highway.  A motor vehicle shall be covered for:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204(3)(a): liability imposed by law upon the department for damages from bodily injuries suffered by one or more persons by reason of the ownership, maintenance, or use of the motor vehicle; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204(3)(b): liability or loss from damage to or destruction of property of any description, including liability of the department for the resultant loss of use of the property, which results from accident due to the ownership, maintenance, or use of the motor vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204(4)(a): The department may sue, be sued, and defend in a proceeding, in a court of law or otherwise, in the name of the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204(4)(b): An action may not be taken:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204(4)(b)(i): against the commission; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204(4)(b)(ii): in the name of a commissioner.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-204(5): The department is liable to respond in damages in a case if a private corporation under the same circumstances would be liable.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205 Director of alcoholic beverage services.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(1): (1)(b); (1)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(1)(a): (1)(b) In accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(1)(b)(i): The governor shall appoint the director from nominations made by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(1)(b)(ii): The commission shall submit the nomination of three individuals to the governor for appointment of the director.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(1)(b)(iii): By no later than 30 calendar days from the day on which the governor receives the three nominations submitted by the commission, the governor may:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(1)(b)(iii)(A): appoint the director; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(1)(b)(iii)(B): reject the three nominations.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(1)(b)(iv): If the governor rejects the nominations or fails to take action within the 30-day period, the commission shall nominate three different individuals from which the governor may appoint the director or reject the nominations until such time as the governor appoints the director.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(1)(b)(v): The governor may reappoint the director without seeking nominations from the commission.  Reappointment of a director is subject to the advice and consent of the Senate.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(1)(c): (1)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(1)(c)(i): (1)(b) If there is a vacancy in the position of director, during the nomination process described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(1)(c)(ii): If a director is not appointed within the 30-day period, the interim director may continue to serve beyond the 30-day period subject to the advice and consent of the Senate at the next scheduled time for the Senate giving consent to appointments of the governor.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(1)(c)(iii): Except that if the Senate does not act on the consent to the appointment of the interim director within 60 days of the end of the initial 30-day period, the interim director may continue as the interim director.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(1)(d): The director may be terminated by:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(1)(d)(i): the commission by a vote of four commissioners; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(1)(d)(ii): the governor after consultation with the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(1)(e): The director may not be a commissioner.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(1)(f): The director shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(1)(f)(i): be qualified in administration;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(1)(f)(ii): be knowledgeable by experience and training in the field of business management; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(1)(f)(iii): possess any other qualification prescribed by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(2): Title 67, Chapter 22, State Officer Compensation The governor shall establish the director's compensation within the salary range fixed by the Legislature in
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(3): The director shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(3)(a): carry out the policies of the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(3)(b): carry out the policies of the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(3)(c): fully inform the commission of the operations and administrative activities of the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-205(3)(d): assist the commission in the proper discharge of the commission's duties.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206 Powers and duties of the director.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Subject to the powers and responsibilities of the commission under this title, the director:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(1)(a): shall prepare and propose to the commission general policies, rules, and procedures governing the administrative activities of the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(1)(b): may submit other recommendations to the commission as the director considers in the interest of the commission's or the department's business;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(2): within the general policies, rules, and procedures of the commission, shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(2)(a): provide day-to-day direction, coordination, and delegation of responsibilities in the administrative activities of the department's business; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(2)(b): make internal department policies and procedures relating to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(2)(b)(i): department personnel matters; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(2)(b)(ii): the day-to-day operation of the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(3): 32B-2-207; Title 63A, Chapter 17, Utah State Personnel Management Act subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(3)(a): prescribe the conditions of employment;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(3)(b): define the respective duties and powers; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(3)(c): Title 63A, Chapter 17, Utah State Personnel Management Act fix the remuneration in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(4): shall establish and secure adherence to a system of reports, controls, and performance in matters relating to personnel, security, department property management, and operation of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(4)(a): a department office;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(4)(b): a warehouse;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(4)(c): a state store; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(4)(d): a package agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(5): within the policies, rules, and procedures approved by the commission and provisions of law, shall purchase, store, keep for sale, sell, import, and control the storage, sale, furnishing, transportation, or delivery of an alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(6): 32B-2-202(1)(o) shall prepare for commission approval:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(6)(a): recommendations regarding the location, establishment, relocation, and closure of a state store or package agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(6)(b): recommendations regarding the issuance, denial, nonrenewal, suspension, or revocation of a license, permit, or certificate of approval;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(6)(c): an annual budget, proposed legislation, and reports as required by law and sound business principles;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(6)(d): plans for reorganizing divisions of the department and the functions of the divisions;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(6)(e): manuals containing commission and department policies, rules, and procedures;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(6)(f): an inventory control system;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(6)(g): any other report or recommendation requested by the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(6)(h): 32B-2-202(1)(o) rules described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(6)(i): rules governing the calibration, maintenance, and regulation of a calibrated metered dispensing system;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(6)(j): rules governing the display of a list of types and brand names of liquor furnished through a calibrated metered dispensing system;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(6)(k): price lists issued and distributed showing the price to be paid for each class, variety, or brand of liquor kept for sale at a state store, package agency, or retail licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(6)(l): policies or rules prescribing the books of account maintained by the department and by a state store, package agency, or retail licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(6)(m): a policy prescribing the manner of giving and serving a notice required by this title or rules made under this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(7): shall make available through the department to any person, upon request, a copy of a policy made by the director;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(8): shall make and maintain a current copy of a manual that contains the rules and policies of the commission and department available for public inspection;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(9): (9)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(9)(a): after consultation with the governor, shall determine whether an alcoholic product should not be sold, offered for sale, or otherwise furnished in an area of the state during a period of emergency that is proclaimed by the governor to exist in that area; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(9)(b): (9)(a) shall issue a necessary public announcement or policy with respect to the determination described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(10): Chapter 9, Event Permit Act issue event permits in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-206(11): shall perform any other duty required by the commission or by law.

---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-207(1): 63A-17-301; 32B-2-302.5 "Upper management" means the director, a deputy director, or other Schedule AD, AR, or AS employee of the department, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-207(2): Chapter 1, Part 3, Qualifications and Background; 32B-1-303
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-207(2)(a): Chapter 1, Part 3, Qualifications and Background Subject to this title, including the requirements of
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-207(2)(b): The director may hire an employee who is upper management only with the approval of four commissioners voting in an open meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-207(2)(c): 32B-1-303 Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-207(3): Title 63A, Chapter 17, Utah State Personnel Management Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-207(3)(a): A person who seeks employment with the department shall file with the department an application under oath or affirmation in a form prescribed by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-207(3)(b): Upon receiving an application, the department shall determine whether the individual is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-207(3)(b)(i): of good moral character; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-207(3)(b)(ii): qualified for the position sought.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-207(3)(c): Title 63A, Chapter 17, Utah State Personnel Management Act The department shall select an individual for employment or advancement with the department in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-207(4): The following are not considered a department employee:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-207(4)(a): a package agent;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-207(4)(b): a licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-207(4)(c): a staff member of a package agent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-207(4)(d): staff of a licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-207(5): The department may not employ a minor to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-207(5)(a): work in:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-207(5)(a)(i): a state store; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-207(5)(a)(ii): a department warehouse; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-207(5)(b): engage in an activity involving the handling of an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-207(6): 63G-22-102; Title 63G, Chapter 22, State Training and Certification Requirements The department shall ensure that any training or certification required of a public official or public employee, as those terms are defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-207(6)(a): under this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-207(6)(b): by the department; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-207(6)(c): by an agency or division within the department.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-208 Services of State Health Laboratory.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
The State Health Laboratory shall make its services available to the department when necessary.  The department shall pay for the services from the Liquor Control Fund to the Department of Health and Human Services.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209 Prohibited interests, relationships, and actions.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(1)(a): "Applicable department employee" means a department employee who is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(1)(a)(i): designated as a deputy or assistant director;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(1)(a)(ii): a chief administrative officer of a division within the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(1)(a)(iii): a department compliance officer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(1)(a)(iv): an employee directly performing purchasing, licensing, or compliance functions of the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(1)(b): "Immediate family" means an individual's:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(1)(b)(i): spouse; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(1)(b)(ii): child who is younger than 18 years of age.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(1)(c): "Permit" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(1)(c)(i): an industrial or manufacturing use permit;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(1)(c)(ii): a scientific or educational use permit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(1)(c)(iii): a religious wine use permit.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(2): Title 67, Chapter 16, Utah Public Officers' and Employees' Ethics Act In addition to being subject to
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(2)(a): have a pecuniary interest, whether as the holder of stock or other securities other than a mutual fund, in a person who applies for or holds a package agency, license, or permit under this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(2)(b): otherwise have a conflict of interest with a person who applies for or holds a package agency, license, or permit under this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(2)(c): have an office, position, or relationship, or be engaged in a business or avocation that interferes or is incompatible with the effective and objective fulfillment of the duties of office or employment;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(2)(d): have a direct business relationship with a person subject to administrative action under this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(2)(e): accept a gift, gratuity, emolument, or employment from:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(2)(e)(i): a person who applies for or holds a package agency, license, or permit under this title; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(2)(e)(ii): an officer, agent, or employee of a person who applies for or holds a package agency, license, or permit under this title, except that a commissioner, the director, or an applicable department employee may accept a gift from an officer, agent, or employee if the gift is equal to or less than $50; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(2)(f): solicit, suggest, request, or recommend, directly or indirectly, the appointment of any person to any office or employment with a person who applies for or holds a package agency, license, or permit under this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(3): An immediate family member of a commissioner, the director, or an applicable department employee may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(3)(a): have a pecuniary interest, whether as the holder of stock or other securities other than a mutual fund, in a person who applies for or holds a package agency, license, or permit under this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(3)(b): otherwise have a conflict of interest with a person who applies for or holds a package agency, license, or permit under this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(3)(c): have an office, position, or relationship, or be engaged in a business or avocation that interferes or is incompatible with the effective and objective fulfillment of the duties of office or employment of the commissioner, director, or applicable department employee for whom the person is immediate family;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(3)(d): accept a gift, gratuity, emolument, or employment from:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(3)(d)(i): a person who applies for or holds a package agency, license, or permit under this title; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(3)(d)(ii): an officer, agent, or employee of a person who applies for or holds a package agency, license, or permit under this title, except that an immediate family member may accept a gift from an officer, agent, or employee if the gift is equal to or less than $50; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(3)(e): solicit, suggest, request, or recommend, directly or indirectly, the appointment of any person to any office or employment with a person who applies for or holds a package agency, license, or permit under this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(4): An officer, agent, attorney, or employee of a person who applies for or holds a package agency, license, or permit under this title may not directly or indirectly solicit, request, or recommend to the governor, any state senator, the commission, or the department the appointment of any person:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(4)(a): as a commissioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(4)(b): as director of the department; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(4)(c): to a department staff position.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(5): (5)(a); (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(5)(a): A commissioner shall disclose during a meeting of the commission a potential violation of this section, including the existence and nature of a professional, financial, business, or personal interest with a person who holds, or an applicant for, a package agency, license, or permit issued under this title that may result in a violation of this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(5)(b): (5)(a); (5)(a) After a commissioner makes a disclosure under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(5)(b)(i): the commission may, by motion, determine whether there is a potential violation of this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(5)(b)(ii): if the commission determines that there is a potential violation of this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(5)(b)(ii)(A): the commission shall notify the governor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(5)(b)(ii)(B): the commissioner may not vote on any matter that would result in the potential violation of this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(5)(b)(iii): (5)(a) if the commission determines that there is not a potential violation of this section, a commissioner may elect whether to vote on the issue that gives rise to the disclosure under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-209(5)(c): The commission shall record any declaration of a potential violation of this section in the minutes of the meeting.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210 Alcoholic Beverage Services Advisory Board.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(1): There is created within the department an advisory board known as the "Alcoholic Beverage Services Advisory Board."
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(2): The advisory board shall consist of eight voting members and one nonvoting member as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(2)(a): four voting members appointed by the commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(2)(a)(i): one of whom represents the retail alcohol industry;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(2)(a)(ii): one of whom represents the wholesale alcohol industry;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(2)(a)(iii): one of whom represents the alcohol manufacturing industry; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(2)(a)(iv): one of whom represents the restaurant industry;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(2)(b): two voting members appointed by the commission, each of whom represents an organization that addresses alcohol or drug abuse prevention, alcohol or drug related enforcement, or alcohol or drug related education;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(2)(c): the director of the Division of Substance Abuse and Mental Health or the director's designee who serves as a voting member;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(2)(d): the chair of the Utah Substance Use and Mental Health Advisory Council, or the chair's designee, who serves as a voting member; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(2)(e): the chair of the commission or the chair's designee from the members of the commission, who serves as a nonvoting member.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(3): (3)(b); (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(3)(a): (3)(b) Except as required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(3)(b): (3)(a) Notwithstanding the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(3)(c): No two members of the board may be employed by the same company or nonprofit organization.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(4)(a): When a vacancy occurs in the membership for any reason, the commission shall appoint a replacement for the unexpired term.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(4)(b): The commission shall terminate the term of a voting advisory board member who ceases to be representative as designated by the member's original appointment.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(5): The advisory board shall meet as called by the chair for the purpose of advising the commission and the department, with discussion limited to administrative rules made under this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(6): The chair of the commission or the chair's designee shall serve as the chair of the advisory board and call the necessary meetings.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(7)(a): Five members of the board constitute a quorum of the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(7)(b): An action of the majority when a quorum is present is the action of the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(8): The department shall provide staff support to the advisory board.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(9): 63A-3-106; 63A-3-107; 63A-3-106; 63A-3-107 A member may not receive compensation or benefits for the member's service, but may receive per diem and travel expenses in accordance with:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(9)(a): 63A-3-106 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(9)(b): 63A-3-107 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-210(9)(c): 63A-3-106; 63A-3-107 rules made by the Division of Finance pursuant to Sections

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301 State property -- Liquor Control Fund -- Money to be retained by department -- Department building process.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(1): As used in this section, "base budget" means the same as that term is defined in legislative rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(2): The following are property of the state:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(2)(a): the money received in the administration of this title, except as otherwise provided; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(2)(b): property acquired, administered, possessed, or received by the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(3): 32B-2-304; 32B-2-305; 32B-2-306; 32B-2-304
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(3)(a): There is created an enterprise fund known as the "Liquor Control Fund."
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(3)(b): 32B-2-304; 32B-2-305; 32B-2-306; 32B-2-304 Except as provided in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(3)(b)(i): money received in the administration of this title; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(3)(b)(ii): 32B-2-304 money received from the markup described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(3)(c): The department may draw from the Liquor Control Fund only to the extent appropriated by the Legislature or provided by statute.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(3)(d): The net position of the Liquor Control Fund may not fall below zero.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(4): (3)(c)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(4)(a): (3)(c) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(4)(a)(i): to purchase an alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(4)(a)(ii): to transport an alcoholic product from the supplier to a warehouse of the department; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(4)(a)(iii): for variances related to an alcoholic product, including breakage or theft.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(4)(b): If the balance of the Liquor Control Fund is not adequate to cover a warrant that the department draws against the Liquor Control Fund, to the extent necessary to cover the warrant, the cash resources of the General Fund may be used.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(5): The department's base budget shall include as an appropriation from the Liquor Control Fund:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(5)(a): credit card related fees paid by the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(5)(b): package agency compensation;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(5)(c): the department's costs of shipping and warehousing alcoholic products; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(5)(d): the amount needed, as the Division of Human Resource Management determines, to make the median department salary in the previous fiscal year equal the median market salary in the previous fiscal year for the following positions:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(5)(d)(i): state store manager or equivalent;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(5)(d)(ii): state store assistant manager or equivalent;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(5)(d)(iii): full-time sales clerk at a state store or equivalent;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(5)(d)(iv): part-time sales clerk at a state store or equivalent;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(5)(d)(v): department warehouse manager or equivalent;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(5)(d)(vi): department warehouse assistant manager or equivalent;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(5)(d)(vii): full-time department warehouse worker or equivalent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(5)(d)(viii): part-time department warehouse worker or equivalent.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(6): (6); 51-5-6(2)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(6)(a): (6) The Division of Finance shall transfer annually from the Liquor Control Fund to the General Fund a sum equal to the amount of net profit earned from the sale of liquor since the preceding transfer of money under this Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(7): 51-7-3
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(7)(a): 51-7-3 By the end of each day, the department shall:
