Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-301(7)(c): Money deposited in a qualified depository is entitled to the same priority of payment as other public funds of the state.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-302.5 Internal audits.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-302.5(1): Title 63I, Chapter 5, Utah Internal Audit Act In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-302.5(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-302.5(2)(a): The commission shall appoint an internal audit director who shall serve at the pleasure of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-302.5(2)(b): The internal audit director shall hire auditors in the division with the approval of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-302.5(2)(c): The internal audit director may dismiss an auditor with the approval of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-302.5(3): 63I-5-301 Notwithstanding Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-302.5(4): 63I-5-401 Subject to the other provisions of this section, the internal audit director shall have the powers and duties described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-302.5(5): (5)(b); (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-302.5(5)(a): Once an internal audit is completed, the internal audit director shall provide an internal audit report to the director, the chair of the commission, and the other commissioners.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-302.5(5)(b): Within five business days of receipt of the internal audit, the director shall prepare a written response and deliver it to the chair of the commission and the other commissioners.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-302.5(5)(c): (5)(b) Within five business days of receipt of the director's written response under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-302.5(5)(d): (5)(a) Within 12 business days of the internal audit being given to the director, chair of the commission, and the other commissioners under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-302.5(5)(d)(i): the governor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-302.5(5)(d)(ii): the legislative auditor general; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-302.5(5)(d)(iii): the Legislative Management Committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-302.5(5)(e): Within 120 calendar days of an internal audit being completed, the commission shall prepare a report to the governor describing steps taken to implement the recommendations of the audit or a detailed explanation of why recommendations have not been implemented.  The chair of the commission shall forward the report to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-302.5(5)(e)(i): the legislative auditor general; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-302.5(5)(e)(ii): the Legislative Management Committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-302.5(5)(f): The chair of the commission shall make such other reports as the governor requests.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304 Liquor price -- School lunch program -- Remittance of markup.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(1): For purposes of this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(1)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(1)(a)(i): "Landed case cost" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(1)(a)(i)(A): the cost of the product; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(1)(a)(i)(B): inbound shipping costs incurred by the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(1)(a)(ii): "Landed case cost" does not include the outbound shipping cost from a warehouse of the department to a state store.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(1)(b): "Proof gallon" means the same as that term is defined in 26 U.S.C. Sec. 5002.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(2): (3); (4) Except as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(2)(a): spirituous liquor sold by the department within the state shall be marked up in an amount not less than 88% above the landed case cost to the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(2)(b): wine sold by the department within the state shall be marked up in an amount not less than 88% above the landed case cost to the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(2)(c): heavy beer sold by the department within the state shall be marked up in an amount not less than 66.5% above the landed case cost to the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(2)(d): a flavored malt beverage sold by the department within the state shall be marked up in an amount not less than 88% above the landed case cost to the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(3): (3)(c)(i)(B); (3)(b); (c); (3)(b); (c); (3)(b); (c); (d); (3)(b); (c); (d)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(3)(a): Liquor sold by the department to a military installation in Utah shall be marked up in an amount not less than 17% above the landed case cost to the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(3)(b): Except for spirituous liquor sold by the department to a military installation in Utah, spirituous liquor that is sold by the department within the state shall be marked up 49% above the landed case cost to the department if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(3)(b)(i): the spirituous liquor is manufactured by a manufacturer producing less than 30,000 proof gallons of spirituous liquor in a calendar year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(3)(b)(ii): the manufacturer applies to the department for a reduced markup.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(3)(c): (3)(c)(i)(B) Except for wine sold by the department to a military installation in Utah, wine that is sold by the department within the state shall be marked up 49% above the landed case cost to the department if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(3)(c)(i): (3)(c)(i)(B)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(3)(c)(i)(A): (3)(c)(i)(B) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(3)(c)(i)(B): for hard cider, the hard cider is manufactured by a manufacturer producing less than 620,000 gallons of hard cider in a calendar year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(3)(c)(ii): the manufacturer applies to the department for a reduced markup.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(3)(d): Except for heavy beer sold by the department to a military installation in Utah, heavy beer that is sold by the department within the state shall be marked up 32% above the landed case cost to the department if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(3)(d)(i): a small brewer manufactures the heavy beer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(3)(d)(ii): the small brewer applies to the department for a reduced markup.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(3)(e): (3)(b); (c); (3)(b); (c) The department shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(3)(e)(i): (3)(b); (c) for purposes of Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(3)(e)(i)(A): by, if the manufacturer is part of a controlled group of manufacturers, including the combined volume totals of spirituous liquor, wine, or cider, as applicable, for all manufacturers that constitute the controlled group of manufacturers; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(3)(e)(i)(B): without considering the manufacturer's production of any other type of alcoholic product; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(3)(e)(ii): (3)(b); (c) verify that a manufacturer meets a production amount described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(3)(f): (3)(b); (c); (d) A manufacturer seeking to obtain a reduced markup under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(3)(g): (3)(b); (c); (d) The department may, at any time, revoke a reduced markup granted to a manufacturer under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(4): 32B-2-702 Wine the department purchases on behalf of a subscriber through the wine subscription program established in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(5): 53E-3-510 The department shall deposit 10% of the total gross revenue from sales of liquor with the state treasurer to be credited to the Uniform School Fund and used to support the school meals program administered by the State Board of Education under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-304(6): This section does not prohibit the department from selling discontinued items at a discount.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-401 Title.
--------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Alcoholic Beverage and Substance Abuse Enforcement and Treatment Restricted Account Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402 Definitions -- Calculations.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1): 32B-2-403; 63M-7-301; 41-6a-502; 41-6a-510(1); 76-5-207; Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 17-43-201 As used in this part:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(a): 32B-2-403 "Account" means the Alcoholic Beverage and Substance Abuse Enforcement and Treatment Restricted Account created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(b): 63M-7-301 "Advisory council" means the Utah Substance Use and Mental Health Advisory Council created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(c): 41-6a-502; 41-6a-510(1); 76-5-207 "Alcohol-related offense" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(c)(i): 41-6a-502; 41-6a-510(1); 76-5-207 a violation of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(c)(i)(A): 41-6a-502 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(c)(i)(B): 41-6a-510(1); 76-5-207 an ordinance that complies with the requirements of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(c)(i)(B)(I): 41-6a-510(1) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(c)(i)(B)(II): 76-5-207 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(c)(ii): an offense involving the illegal:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(c)(ii)(A): sale of an alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(c)(ii)(B): consumption of an alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(c)(ii)(C): distribution of an alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(c)(ii)(D): transportation of an alcoholic product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(c)(ii)(E): possession of an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(d): "Annual conviction time period" means the time period that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(d)(i): begins on July 1 and ends on June 30; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(d)(ii): immediately precedes the fiscal year for which an appropriation under this part is made.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(e): "Municipality" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(e)(i): a city;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(e)(ii): a town; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(e)(iii): a metro township.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(f): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 17-43-201
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(f)(i): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Prevention" is as defined by rule, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(f)(ii): 17-43-201 In defining the term "prevention," the Division of Substance Abuse and Mental Health shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(f)(ii)(A): include only evidence-based or evidence-informed programs; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(1)(f)(ii)(B): 17-43-201 provide for coordination with local substance abuse authorities designated to provide substance abuse services in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(2): 32B-2-404(1)(b)(iii) For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(2)(a): is the number determined by the department to be so located;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(2)(b): includes the aggregate number of premises of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(2)(b)(i): a state store;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(2)(b)(ii): a package agency; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(2)(b)(iii): a retail licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(2)(c): for a county, consists only of the number located within an unincorporated area of the county.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(3): 32B-2-404(1)(b)(i); 32B-2-404(1)(b)(iv) The department shall determine:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(3)(a): a population figure according to the most current population estimate prepared by the Utah Population Committee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(3)(b): 32B-2-404(1)(b)(i) a county's population for the 25% distribution to municipalities and counties under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(3)(c): 32B-2-404(1)(b)(iv) a county's population for the 25% distribution to counties under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(4)(a): A conviction occurs in the municipality or county that actually prosecutes the offense to judgment.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-402(4)(b): If a conviction is based upon a guilty plea, the conviction is considered to occur in the municipality or county that, except for the guilty plea, would have prosecuted the offense.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-403 Alcoholic Beverage and Substance Abuse Enforcement and Treatment Restricted Account created.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-403(1): 59-15-109; (1)(c)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-403(1)(a): There is created in the General Fund a restricted account known as the "Alcoholic Beverage and Substance Abuse Enforcement and Treatment Restricted Account."
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-403(1)(b): 59-15-109; (1)(c) The account is funded from:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-403(1)(b)(i): 59-15-109 money deposited by the state treasurer in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-403(1)(b)(ii): appropriations made to the account by the Legislature; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-403(1)(b)(iii): (1)(c) interest described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-403(1)(c): Interest earned on the account shall be deposited into the account.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-403(2): 32B-1-103(4)(b); (2)(b); (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-403(2)(a): 32B-1-103(4)(b); (2)(b) Consistent with the policies provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-403(2)(b): The portion distributed under this part to a county may also be used for the confinement or treatment of persons arrested for or convicted of offenses in which alcohol or substance abuse is a contributing factor.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-403(2)(c): (2) A municipality or county entitled to receive money shall use the money exclusively as required by this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-403(3): 32B-2-404; (2); (2) The appropriations provided for under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-403(3)(a): (2) intended to supplement the budget of the appropriate agencies of each municipality and county within the state to enable the municipalities and counties to more effectively fund the programs and projects described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-403(3)(b): (2) not intended to replace money that would otherwise be allocated for the programs and projects in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-403(4): It is the intent of the Legislature that the appropriations distributed under this part be used to fund a balanced approach to reducing the harmful effects of substance abuse, overconsumption of alcoholic products by adults, and alcohol consumption by minors.  To this end, the Legislature encourages municipalities and counties receiving money under this part to use the most effective formula allocation to fund evidence-based and evidence-informed prevention programs.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404 Alcoholic Beverage and Substance Abuse Enforcement and Treatment Restricted Account distribution.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404(1): 32B-2-403; 59-15-109; (1); (1)(c)(ii); (1)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404(1)(a): 32B-2-403; 59-15-109; (1) The money deposited into the account under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404(1)(a)(i): 59-15-109 to the extent appropriated by the Legislature, except that the Legislature shall appropriate each fiscal year an amount equal to at least the amount deposited in the account in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404(1)(a)(ii): (1) as provided in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404(1)(b): The amount appropriated from the account shall be distributed as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404(1)(b)(i): 25% to municipalities and counties on the basis of the percentage of the state population residing in each municipality and county;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404(1)(b)(ii): 30% to municipalities and counties on the basis of each municipality's and county's percentage of the statewide convictions for all alcohol-related offenses;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404(1)(b)(iii): 20% to municipalities and counties on the basis of the percentage of the following in the state that are located in each municipality and county:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404(1)(b)(iii)(A): state stores;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404(1)(b)(iii)(B): package agencies;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404(1)(b)(iii)(C): retail licensees; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404(1)(b)(iii)(D): off-premise beer retailers; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404(1)(b)(iv): 25% to the counties for confinement and treatment purposes authorized by this part on the basis of the percentage of the state population located in each county.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404(1)(c): (1)(c)(ii); (1)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404(1)(c)(i): (1)(c)(ii) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404(1)(c)(i)(A): the municipality may not receive money under this part; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404(1)(c)(i)(B): the State Tax Commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404(1)(c)(i)(B)(I): may not distribute the money the municipality would receive but for the municipality not having a law enforcement agency to that municipality; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404(1)(c)(i)(B)(II): shall distribute the money that the municipality would have received but for it not having a law enforcement agency to the county in which the municipality is located for use by the county in accordance with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404(1)(c)(ii): (1)(c)(i) If the advisory council finds that a municipality described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404(2): (1)(b)(ii); 41-6a-502; 41-6a-510(1); 76-5-207; (2)(a)(i); (2)(a)(i); (2)(a); (2)(b) To determine the distribution required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404(2)(a): 41-6a-502; 41-6a-510(1); 76-5-207; (2)(a)(i); (2)(a)(i) for an annual conviction time period:

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404(3)(b): the advisory council shall notify the State Tax Commission of any municipality that does not have a law enforcement agency.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404(4): (1)(c)(ii); (1)(c)(i); 32B-2-405(2)(a); 32B-2-405(2) By not later than December 1 of each year, the advisory council shall notify the State Tax Commission for the fiscal year of appropriation of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-404(4)(a): (1)(c)(ii) a municipality that may receive a distribution under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-501 Commission's power to establish a state store.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-501(1): The commission may establish state stores in the numbers and at places, owned or leased by the department, that the commission considers proper for the sale of liquor by employees of the state, in accordance with this title and the rules made under this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-501(2): The commission may not establish a total number of state stores that at any time exceeds the number determined by dividing the population of the state by 48,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-501(3): 32B-1-202 The commission may not establish a state store at premises that do not meet the proximity requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-501(4): 32B-1-303; 32B-2-207 An employee of a state store is considered a department employee and shall meet the qualification requirements for employment in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-501(5): (5)(b); (5)(a); (5)(c); (5)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-501(5)(a): (5)(b) The commission shall ensure that signage installed or replaced at or near a state store, on or after May 11, 2010, complies with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-501(5)(a)(i): attached to the exterior of the premises of a state store; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-501(5)(a)(ii): not attached to the premises of a state store, but otherwise alerts or directs a person to the location of a state store.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-501(5)(b): (5)(a); (5)(c) Signage described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-501(5)(b)(i): "state"; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-501(5)(b)(ii): "State of Utah."
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-501(5)(c): (5)(b) The text described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502 Commission and department duties before establishing a state store.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(1)(a): Before the commission may establish a state store, the department shall conduct an investigation and may hold public hearings to gather information and make recommendations to the commission to assure appropriate service to the general population of the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(1)(b): (1)(a) The department shall forward the information and recommendations described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2): Before establishing a state store, the commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(a): determine that the local authority of the locality where the state store will be located is consulted;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(b): determine that the state store complies with the zoning ordinances of the locality where the state store will be located;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(c): consider the locality within which the proposed state store will be located including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(c)(i): economic factors, such as:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(c)(i)(A): bid price;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(c)(i)(B): lease terms;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(c)(i)(C): operating costs; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(c)(i)(D): local taxes;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(c)(ii): physical characteristics, such as:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(c)(ii)(A): condition of the premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(c)(ii)(B): space availability;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(c)(ii)(C): parking;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(c)(ii)(D): common areas;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(c)(ii)(E): conformance to building and safety codes;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(c)(ii)(F): delivery access; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(c)(ii)(G): expandability; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(c)(iii): operational factors, such as:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(c)(iii)(A): tourist traffic;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(c)(iii)(B): access to the public;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(c)(iii)(C): demographics;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(c)(iii)(D): population to be served;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(c)(iii)(E): the nature of surrounding establishments;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(c)(iii)(F): proximity to and density of other state stores, package agencies, and retail licensees;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(c)(iii)(G): proximity to residential communities; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(c)(iii)(H): proximity to educational, religious, and recreational facilities; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-502(2)(d): consider any other factor the commission considers necessary.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503 Operational requirements for a state store.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(1): (1)(a)(i); (iii); (1)(a)(iv); (v); (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(1)(a): A state store shall display in a prominent place in the store a sign in large letters that consists of text in the following order:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(1)(a)(i): a header that reads: "WARNING";
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(1)(a)(ii): a warning statement that reads: "Drinking alcoholic beverages during pregnancy can cause birth defects and permanent brain damage for the child.";
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(1)(a)(iii): a statement in smaller font that reads: "Call the Utah Department of Health at [insert most current toll-free number] with questions or for more information.";
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(1)(a)(iv): a header that reads: "WARNING"; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(1)(a)(v): a warning statement that reads: "Driving under the influence of alcohol or drugs is a serious crime that is prosecuted aggressively in Utah."
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(1)(b): (1)(a)(i); (iii); (1)(a)(iv); (v); (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(1)(b)(i): (1)(a)(i); (iii); (1)(a)(iv); (v) The text described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(1)(b)(ii): (1)(a) The warning statements in the sign described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(1)(c): The Department of Health shall work with the commission and department to facilitate consistency in the format of a sign required under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(2): A state store may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish liquor except at a price fixed by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(3): A state store may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish liquor to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(3)(a): a minor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(3)(b): a person actually, apparently, or obviously intoxicated;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(3)(c): a known interdicted person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(3)(d): a known habitual drunkard.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(4): (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(4)(a): A state store employee may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(4)(a)(i): consume an alcoholic product on the premises of a state store; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(4)(a)(ii): allow any person to consume an alcoholic product on the premises of a state store.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(4)(b): (4) A violation of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(5)(a): Sale or delivery of liquor may not be made on or from the premises of a state store, and a state store may not be kept open for the sale of liquor:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(5)(a)(i): on Sunday; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(5)(a)(ii): on a state or federal legal holiday.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(5)(b): Sale or delivery of liquor may be made on or from the premises of a state store, and a state store may be open for the sale of liquor, only on a day and during hours that the commission directs by rule or order.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(6): (6)(a); (6)(b); (6)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(6)(a): A minor may not be admitted into, or be on the premises of, a state store unless accompanied by a person who is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(6)(a)(i): 21 years of age or older; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(6)(a)(ii): the minor's parent, legal guardian, or spouse.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(6)(b): (6)(a) A state store employee that has reason to believe that a person who is on the premises of a state store is under the age of 21 and is not accompanied by a person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(6)(b)(i): ask the suspected minor for proof of age;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(6)(b)(ii): ask the person who accompanies the suspected minor for proof of age; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(6)(b)(iii): ask the suspected minor or the person who accompanies the suspected minor for proof of parental, guardianship, or spousal relationship.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(6)(c): (6)(b) A state store employee shall refuse to sell liquor to the suspected minor and to the person who accompanies the suspected minor into the state store if the suspected minor or person fails to provide information specified in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(6)(d): (6)(b) A state store employee shall require a suspected minor and the person who accompanies the suspected minor into the state store to immediately leave the premises of the state store if the suspected minor or person fails to provide information specified in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(7)(a): A state store may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish liquor except in a sealed container.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(7)(b): A person may not open a sealed container on the premises of a state store.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-503(8): On or after October 1, 2011, a state store may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish heavy beer in a sealed container that exceeds two liters.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-504 Delivery of liquor to state store.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-504(1): Liquor to be sold from a state store may be transported from a warehouse authorized by the department to the state store if transported by a person authorized by the department to transport the liquor to the state store, including a common carrier.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-504(2): A person, while in or about a vehicle in which liquor is being transported, may not open, break, or allow to be opened or broken, a container containing liquor.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-504(3): A person may not drink, use, or allow to be drunk or used, liquor while it is in transit under this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-505 Reporting requirements -- Building plan and market survey required -- Department performance measures.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-505(1): In 2018 and each year thereafter, the department shall present a five-year building plan to the Infrastructure and General Government Appropriations Subcommittee that describes the department's anticipated property acquisition, building, and remodeling for the five years following the day on which the department presents the five-year building plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-505(2): (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-505(2)(a): (1) In 2018 and every other year thereafter, the department shall complete a market survey to inform the department's five-year building plan described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-505(2)(b): The department shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-505(2)(b)(i): provide a copy of each market survey to the Infrastructure and General Government Appropriations Subcommittee and the Business and Labor Interim Committee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-505(2)(b)(ii): upon request, appear before the Infrastructure and General Government Appropriations Subcommittee to present the results of the market survey.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-505(3): For fiscal year 2018-19 and each fiscal year thereafter, before the fiscal year begins, the Governor's Office of Planning and Budget, in consultation with the department and the Office of the Legislative Fiscal Analyst, shall establish performance measures and goals to evaluate the department's operations during the fiscal year.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-505(4): (4)(a); (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-505(4)(a): The department may not submit a request to the Division of Facilities Construction and Management for a capital development project unless the department first obtains approval from the Governor's Office of Planning and Budget.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-505(4)(b): (4)(a); (3) In determining whether to grant approval for a request described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601 Commission's power to issue package agency.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(1)(a): The commission may, when the commission considers proper, issue authority to operate as a package agency by directing the department to enter into a package agency agreement with a person to sell, offer for sale, or furnish liquor in sealed containers from premises other than those owned or leased by the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(1)(b): The commission shall authorize a person to operate a package agency by issuing a record that designates the person in charge of the package agency as a "package agent."
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(2): (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(2)(a): (2) Subject to this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(2)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(2)(b)(i): The commission may issue a seasonal package agency in an area the commission considers proper.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(2)(b)(ii): A seasonal package agency shall be for a period of six consecutive months.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(2)(b)(iii): A seasonal package agency issued for operation during a summer time period is known as a "Seasonal A" package agency.  The period of operation for a Seasonal A package agency shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(2)(b)(iii)(A): begin on May 1; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(2)(b)(iii)(B): end on October 31.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(2)(b)(iv): A seasonal package agency issued for operation during a winter time period is known as a "Seasonal B" package agency.  The period of operation for a Seasonal B package agency shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(2)(b)(iv)(A): begin on November 1; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(2)(b)(iv)(B): end on April 30.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(2)(b)(v): In determining the number of package agencies that the commission may issue under this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(2)(b)(v)(A): a seasonal package agency is counted as one-half of one package agency; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(2)(b)(v)(B): each Seasonal A package agency shall be paired with a Seasonal B package agency.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(2)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(2)(c)(i): If the location, design, and construction of a hotel may require more than one package agency sales location to serve the public convenience, the commission may authorize a single package agent to sell liquor at as many as three locations within the hotel under one package agency if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(2)(c)(i)(A): the hotel has a minimum of 150 guest rooms; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(2)(c)(i)(B): all locations under the package agency are:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(2)(c)(i)(B)(I): within the same hotel; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(2)(c)(i)(B)(II): on premises that are managed or operated, and owned or leased, by the package agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(2)(c)(ii): A facility other than a hotel shall have a separate package agency for each location where liquor may be sold, offered for sale, or furnished.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(3)(a): A package agent, under the direction of the department, is responsible for implementing and enforcing this title and the rules adopted under this title to the extent this title and the rules relate to the conduct of the package agency and a package agency's sale of liquor.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(3)(b): A package agent may not be a state employee.  A package agent may not be construed to be a state employee or otherwise entitled to any benefit of employment from the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(3)(c): A package agent, when selling liquor from a package agency, is considered an agent of the state only to the extent specifically expressed in the package agency agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-601(4): The commission may prescribe by rule one or more types of package agencies issued under this part that are consistent with this title.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-602 Application and renewal requirements for a package agency.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-602(1): Before a person may store, sell, offer for sale, or furnish liquor in a sealed container on its premises under a package agency, the person shall first obtain a package agency issued by the commission in accordance with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-602(2): 32B-1-202; 32B-2-604 To obtain a package agency, a person seeking to be the package agent under this part shall submit to the department:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-602(2)(a): a written application in a form prescribed by the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-602(2)(b): a nonrefundable application fee of $125;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-602(2)(c): written consent of the local authority;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-602(2)(d): 32B-1-202 evidence of proximity to any community location, with proximity requirements being governed by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-602(2)(e): 32B-2-604 a bond as specified by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-602(2)(f): a floor plan of the premises, including a description and highlighting of that part of the premises in which the person proposes that the package agency be located;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-602(2)(g): evidence that the package agency is carrying public liability insurance in an amount and form satisfactory to the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-602(2)(h): a signed consent form stating that the package agent permits any authorized representative of the commission, department, or any law enforcement officer to have unrestricted right to enter the premises of the package agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-602(2)(i): if the person applying is an entity, verification that a person who signs the package agency application is authorized to sign on behalf of the entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-602(2)(j): any other information the commission or department may require.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-602(3): 32B-1-304 The commission may not issue a package agency to a person who is disqualified under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-602(4): 32B-1-202 The commission may not issue a package agency for premises that do not meet the proximity requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-602(5): For the renewal of a package agency agreement, the package agent shall submit to the department any information the commission or department may require.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603 Commission and department duties before issuing a package agency.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(1)(a): Before the commission may issue a package agency, the department shall conduct an investigation and may hold public hearings to gather information and make recommendations to the commission to assure appropriate service to the general population of the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(1)(b): (1)(a) The department shall forward the information and recommendations described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2): 32B-2-602; 32B-1-304 Before issuing a package agency, the commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2)(a): 32B-2-602 determine that the person filed a complete application and is in compliance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2)(b): 32B-1-304 determine that the person is not disqualified under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2)(c): determine that the package agency premises complies with the zoning ordinances of the locality where the package agency will be located;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2)(d): consider the locality within which the proposed package agency will be located, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2)(d)(i): physical characteristics, such as:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2)(d)(i)(A): condition of the premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2)(d)(i)(B): square footage;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2)(d)(i)(C): parking; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2)(d)(i)(D): delivery access; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2)(d)(ii): operational factors, such as:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2)(d)(ii)(A): tourist traffic;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2)(d)(ii)(B): access to the public;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2)(d)(ii)(C): demographics;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2)(d)(ii)(D): population to be served;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2)(d)(ii)(E): the nature of surrounding establishments;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2)(d)(ii)(F): proximity to and density of other state stores, package agencies, and retail licensees;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2)(d)(ii)(G): proximity to residential communities; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2)(d)(ii)(H): the extent of and proximity to educational, religious, and recreational facilities;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2)(e): consider the person's ability to manage and operate a package agency, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2)(e)(i): management experience;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2)(e)(ii): past retail liquor experience;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2)(e)(iii): the type of establishment or business in which the package agency may be located;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2)(e)(iv): hours of operation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2)(e)(v): ability to maintain inventory levels as set by the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-603(2)(f): consider any other factor the commission considers necessary.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-604 Bond related to package agency.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-604(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-604(1)(a): A package agent who has a consignment liquor inventory owned by the state shall post a:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-604(1)(a)(i): consignment surety bond:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-604(1)(a)(i)(A): payable to the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-604(1)(a)(i)(B): in the amount of the consignment inventory; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-604(1)(a)(ii): cash or surety bond:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-604(1)(a)(ii)(A): payable to the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-604(1)(a)(ii)(B): in the penal amount of at least $1,000, as the department determines.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-604(1)(b): A package agent who has a consignment liquor inventory shall ensure that a consignment surety bond is conditioned upon a package agent's return of the unsold consignment liquor inventory at the termination of a package agency agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-604(2): A package agent that owns the package agency's liquor inventory shall post a cash bond or surety bond:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-604(2)(a): in the penal amount of at least $1,000, as the department determines; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-604(2)(b): payable to the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-604(3): A package agent shall procure and maintain the bond required under this section for as long as the package agent continues to operate as a package agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-604(4): A bond required under this section shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-604(4)(a): in a form approved by the attorney general; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-604(4)(b): conditioned upon the package agent's faithful compliance with this title, the rules of the commission, and the package agency agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-604(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-604(5)(a): If a surety bond posted by a package agency under this section is canceled due to the package agent's or package agency's negligence, the department may assess a $300 reinstatement fee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-604(5)(b): No part of a bond posted by a package agent under this section may be withdrawn:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-604(5)(b)(i): during the period the package agency is in effect; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-604(5)(b)(ii): while a revocation of the package agency is pending against the package agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-604(6): (6)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-604(6)(a): A bond posted under this section by a package agent may be forfeited if the package agency is revoked.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-604(6)(b): (6)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605 Operational requirements for package agency.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(1)(a): A person may not operate a package agency until a package agency agreement is entered into by the package agent and the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(1)(b): A package agency agreement shall state the conditions of operation by which the package agent and the department are bound.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(1)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(1)(c)(i): If a package agent or staff of the package agent violates this title, rules under this title, or the package agency agreement, the department may take any action against the package agent that is allowed by the package agency agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(1)(c)(ii): An action against a package agent is governed solely by its package agency agreement and may include suspension or revocation of the package agency.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(1)(c)(iii): A package agency agreement shall provide procedures to be followed if a package agent fails to pay money owed to the department including a procedure for replacing the package agent or operator of the package agency.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(1)(c)(iv): A package agency agreement shall provide that the package agency is subject to covert investigations for selling an alcoholic product to a minor.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(1)(c)(v): Notwithstanding that this part refers to "package agency" or "package agent," staff of the package agency or package agent is subject to the same requirement or prohibition.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(2): (2); (2)(f); (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(2)(a): A package agency shall be operated by an individual who is either:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(2)(a)(i): the package agent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(2)(a)(ii): an individual designated by the package agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(2)(b): (2) An individual who is a designee under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(2)(b)(i): an employee of the package agent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(2)(b)(ii): responsible for the operation of the package agency.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(2)(c): The conduct of the designee is attributable to the package agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(2)(d): A package agent shall submit the name of the person operating the package agency to the department for the department's approval.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(2)(e): A package agent shall state the name and title of a designee on the application for a package agency.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(2)(f): (2)(f) A package agent shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(2)(f)(i): inform the department of a proposed change in the individual designated to operate a package agency; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(2)(f)(ii): (2)(f) receive prior approval from the department before implementing the change described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(2)(g): (2) Failure to comply with the requirements of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(3): (3)(b)(i); (iii); (3)(b)(iv); (v); (3)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(3)(a): A package agent shall display in a prominent place in the package agency the record issued by the commission that designates the package agency.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(3)(b): A package agent that displays or stores liquor at a location visible to the public shall display in a prominent place in the package agency a sign in large letters that consists of text in the following order:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(3)(b)(i): a header that reads: "WARNING";
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(3)(b)(ii): a warning statement that reads: "Drinking alcoholic beverages during pregnancy can cause birth defects and permanent brain damage for the child.";
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(3)(b)(iii): a statement in smaller font that reads: "Call the Utah Department of Health at [insert most current toll-free number] with questions or for more information.";
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(3)(b)(iv): a header that reads: "WARNING"; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(3)(b)(v): a warning statement that reads: "Driving under the influence of alcohol or drugs is a serious crime that is prosecuted aggressively in Utah."
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(3)(c): (3)(b)(i); (iii); (3)(b)(iv); (v); (3)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(3)(c)(i): (3)(b)(i); (iii); (3)(b)(iv); (v) The text described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(3)(c)(ii): (3)(b) The warning statements in the sign described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(3)(d): The Department of Health shall work with the commission and department to facilitate consistency in the format of a sign required under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(4): A package agency may not display liquor or a price list in a window or showcase that is visible to passersby.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(5)(a): A package agency may not purchase liquor from a person except from the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(5)(b): At the discretion of the department, the department may provide liquor to a package agency for sale on consignment.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(6): A package agency may not store, sell, offer for sale, or furnish liquor in a place other than as designated in the package agent's application, unless the package agent first applies for and receives approval from the department for a change of location within the package agency premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(7): (7)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(7)(a): (7)(b) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(7)(b): A package agency may provide as room service one alcoholic product free of charge per guest reservation, per guest room, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(7)(b)(i): the package agency is the type of package agency that authorizes the package agency to sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product as part of room service;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(7)(b)(ii): staff of the package agency provides the alcoholic product:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(7)(b)(ii)(A): in person; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(7)(b)(ii)(B): only to an adult guest in the guest room;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(7)(b)(iii): staff of the package agency does not leave the alcoholic product outside a guest room for retrieval by a guest; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(7)(b)(iv): the alcoholic product:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(7)(b)(iv)(A): is not a spirituous liquor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(7)(b)(iv)(B): is in an unopened container not to exceed 750 milliliters.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(8): A package agency may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish liquor to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(8)(a): a minor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(8)(b): a person actually, apparently, or obviously intoxicated;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(8)(c): a known interdicted person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(8)(d): a known habitual drunkard.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(9): (9)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(9)(a): A package agency may not employ a minor to handle liquor.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(9)(b): (9)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(9)(b)(i): Staff of a package agency may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(9)(b)(i)(A): consume an alcoholic product on the premises of a package agency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(9)(b)(i)(B): allow any person to consume an alcoholic product on the premises of a package agency.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(9)(b)(ii): (9)(b) Violation of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(10): (10)(a); (10)(c)(i); (10)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(10)(a): A package agency may not close or cease operation for a period longer than 72 hours, unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(10)(a)(i): the package agency notifies the department in writing at least seven days before the day on which the package agency closes or ceases operation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(10)(a)(ii): the closure or cessation of operation is first approved by the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(10)(b): (10)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(10)(c): (10)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(10)(c)(i): The department may authorize a closure or cessation of operation for a period not to exceed 60 days.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(10)(c)(ii): (10)(c)(i) The department may extend the initial period described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(10)(c)(iii): A closure or cessation of operation may not exceed a total of 90 days without commission approval.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(10)(d): (10)(a) The notice required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(10)(d)(i): the dates of closure or cessation of operation;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(10)(d)(ii): the reason for the closure or cessation of operation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(10)(d)(iii): the date on which the package agency will reopen or resume operation.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(10)(e): Failure of a package agency to provide notice and to obtain department authorization before closure or cessation of operation results in an automatic termination of the package agency agreement effective immediately.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(10)(f): Failure of a package agency to reopen or resume operation by the approved date results in an automatic termination of the package agency agreement effective on that date.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(11): A package agency may not transfer the package agency's operations from one location to another location without prior written approval of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(12): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(12)(a): A person, having been issued a package agency, may not sell, transfer, assign, exchange, barter, give, or attempt in any way to dispose of the package agency to another person, whether for monetary gain or not.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(12)(b): A package agency has no monetary value for any type of disposition.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(13): (13); (13)(a); Chapter 11, Manufacturing and Related Licenses Act; (13)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(13)(a): (13) Subject to the other provisions of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(13)(a)(i): sale or delivery of liquor may not be made on or from the premises of a package agency, and a package agency may not be kept open for the sale of liquor:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(13)(a)(i)(A): on Sunday; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(13)(a)(i)(B): on a state or federal legal holiday; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(13)(a)(ii): sale or delivery of liquor may be made on or from the premises of a package agency, and a package agency may be open for the sale of liquor, only on a day and during hours that the commission directs by rule or order.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(13)(b): (13)(a); Chapter 11, Manufacturing and Related Licenses Act A package agency located at a manufacturing facility is not subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(13)(b)(i): Chapter 11, Manufacturing and Related Licenses Act the package agency is located at a manufacturing facility licensed in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(13)(b)(ii): the package agency only sells an alcoholic product produced at the manufacturing facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(13)(c): (13)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(13)(c)(i): (13)(a) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(13)(c)(i)(A): a resort licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(13)(c)(i)(B): a hotel licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(13)(c)(ii): The commission may by rule define what constitutes a package agency that sells liquor "in a manner similar to a state store."
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(14): (14)(a); (14)(b); (14)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(14)(a): Except to the extent authorized by commission rule, a minor may not be admitted into, or be on the premises of, a package agency unless accompanied by a person who is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(14)(a)(i): 21 years old or older; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(14)(a)(ii): the minor's parent, legal guardian, or spouse.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(14)(b): (14)(a) A package agent or staff of a package agency that has reason to believe that a person who is on the premises of a package agency is under 21 years old and is not accompanied by a person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(14)(b)(i): ask the suspected minor for proof of age;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(14)(b)(ii): ask the person who accompanies the suspected minor for proof of age; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(14)(b)(iii): ask the suspected minor or the person who accompanies the suspected minor for proof of parental, guardianship, or spousal relationship.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(14)(c): (14)(b) A package agent or staff of a package agency shall refuse to sell liquor to the suspected minor and to the person who accompanies the suspected minor into the package agency if the minor or person fails to provide any information specified in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(14)(d): (14)(b) A package agent or staff of a package agency shall require the suspected minor and the person who accompanies the suspected minor into the package agency to immediately leave the premises of the package agency if the minor or person fails to provide information specified in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(15): (15)(a); 32B-5-304
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(15)(a): A package agency shall sell, offer for sale, or furnish liquor in a sealed container.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(15)(b): A person may not open a sealed container on the premises of a package agency.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(15)(c): (15)(a); 32B-5-304 Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(15)(c)(i): if the package agency is the type of package agency that authorizes the package agency to sell, offer for sale, or furnish the liquor as part of room service;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(15)(c)(ii): if the liquor is sold, offered for sale, or furnished as part of room service; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(15)(c)(iii): 32B-5-304 subject to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(15)(c)(iii)(A): staff of the package agency providing the liquor in person only to an adult guest in the guest room or privately owned dwelling unit;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(15)(c)(iii)(B): staff of the package agency not leaving the liquor outside a guest room or privately owned dwelling unit for retrieval by a guest or resident; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(15)(c)(iii)(C): 32B-5-304 the same limits on the portions in which an alcoholic product may be sold by a retail licensee under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(16): A package agency may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish heavy beer in a sealed container that exceeds two liters.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(17): The department may pay or otherwise remunerate a package agent on any basis, including sales or volume of business done by the package agency.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(18): The commission may prescribe by policy or rule general operational requirements of a package agency that are consistent with this title and relate to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(18)(a): physical facilities;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(18)(b): conditions of operation;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(18)(c): hours of operation;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(18)(d): inventory levels;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(18)(e): payment schedules;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(18)(f): methods of payment;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(18)(g): premises security; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(18)(h): any other matter considered appropriate by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-605(19): A package agency may not maintain a minibar.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-606 Delivery of liquor to package agency.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-606(1): Liquor to be sold from a package agency may be transported from a warehouse or state store authorized by the department to the package agency if transported by a person authorized by the department to transport the liquor to the package agency, including a common carrier.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-606(2): A person, while in or about a vehicle in which liquor is being transported, may not open, break, or allow to be opened or broken, a container containing liquor.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-606(3): A person may not drink, use, or allow to be drunk or used, any liquor while the liquor is in transit under this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-607 Return of inventory by package agent.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
A package agent shall immediately return to the department liquor previously received from the department on consignment that remains unsold at the time the package agent's package agency agreement terminates or the liquor is subject to immediate seizure by the department.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-701 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-701(1): 32B-2-212 "Division" means the Division of Consumer Purchasing created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-701(2): 32B-2-702(2) "Subscriber" means an individual who subscribes to a wine subscription as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-701(3): 32B-2-702 "Subscription program" means the wine subscription program established in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-701(4): "Wine subscription" means an arrangement in which a customer pays a recurring price at regular intervals for a product that involves the shipment or transportation of wine.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-701(5): "Wine subscription business" means a person that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-701(5)(a): sells or offers for sale a wine subscription; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-701(5)(b): contracts with the department to participate in the subscription program.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-702 Wine subscription program.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-702(1): The division shall establish and administer a wine subscription program as described in this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-702(2): 32B-2-304(4); 32B-2-703(1) The subscription program shall permit an individual to subscribe to a wine subscription that a wine subscription business sells or offers for sale by:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-702(2)(a): enrolling in the wine subscription program in a manner the division prescribes;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-702(2)(b): authorizing the division to purchase the wine subscription in the individual's name;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-702(2)(c): 32B-2-304(4); 32B-2-703(1) paying the division, in a manner the division prescribes:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-702(2)(c)(i): the price of the wine subscription;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-702(2)(c)(ii): 32B-2-304(4) in addition to any tax, the markup described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-702(2)(c)(iii): 32B-2-703(1) a fee the division charges in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-702(2)(d): designating the state store or package agency at which the individual would prefer to collect the wine.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-702(3): (3)(b) The division shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-702(3)(a): designate by contract with a wine subscription business the department warehouse to which the wine subscription business ships or transports wine under the subscription program;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-702(3)(b): deliver wine purchased through the subscription program to the appropriate state store or package agency; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-702(3)(c): (3)(b) notify a subscriber when wine purchased through the subscription program is ready for the subscriber to collect from the state store or package agency described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-703(1)(a): 63J-1-504 in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-703(1)(b): to cover costs to the division for administering the subscription program.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-801 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-801(1): 32B-2-802 "Consumer purchasing system" means the consumer purchasing system established in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-801(2): 32B-2-212 "Division" means the Division of Consumer Purchasing created in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-802 Consumer purchasing system.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-802(1): (1)(a)(i); (1)(a); 32B-2-304 The division shall establish and administer a consumer purchasing system that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-802(1)(a): (1)(a)(i) allows a person to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-802(1)(a)(i): order an alcoholic product from an approved vendor through the division; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-802(1)(a)(ii): (1)(a)(i) pick up an alcoholic product ordered as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-802(1)(b): (1)(a); 32B-2-304 requires a person ordering an alcoholic product as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-802(1)(b)(i): designate a state store or package agency at which the person would prefer to collect the alcoholic product; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-802(1)(b)(ii): 32B-2-304 pay the division for the alcoholic product order in full, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-802(1)(b)(ii)(A): the cost of the alcoholic product; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-802(1)(b)(ii)(B): 32B-2-304 in addition to any tax, the markup described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-802(2): The division shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-802(2)(a): ensure that an alcoholic product ordered through the consumer purchasing system is shipped or transported to a department warehouse;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-802(2)(b): deliver an alcoholic product ordered through the consumer purchasing system to the appropriate state store or package agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-802(2)(c): notify the person who ordered an alcoholic product through the consumer purchasing system when the alcoholic product is ready for the person to collect; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-802(2)(d): administer the consumer purchasing system in a manner that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-802(2)(d)(i): is efficient;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-802(2)(d)(ii): ensures timely delivery of alcoholic products; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-802(2)(d)(iii): frequently updates a person who orders an alcoholic product through the consumer purchasing system on the status of the order.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-802(3): The division may not require that a person order a specific quantity of an alcoholic product that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-802(3)(a): different than a quantity the vendor offers for sale; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-802(3)(b): larger than the smallest quantity the vendor offers for sale.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-2-803 Rulemaking.
-------------------------------------------
The commission may make rules in accordance with

Utah Code Annotated - Title 32B - Chapter 3 - Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act
**************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-102(1): "Aggravating circumstances" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-102(1)(a): prior warnings about compliance problems;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-102(1)(b): a prior violation history;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-102(1)(c): a lack of written policies governing employee conduct;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-102(1)(d): multiple violations during the course of an investigation;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-102(1)(e): efforts to conceal a violation;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-102(1)(f): an intentional violation;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-102(1)(g): the violation involved more than one patron or employee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-102(1)(h): a violation that results in injury or death.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-102(2): "Final adjudication" means an adjudication for which a final judgment or order is issued that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-102(2)(a): is not appealed, and the time to appeal the judgment has expired; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-102(2)(b): is appealed, and is affirmed, in whole or in part, on appeal.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-102(3): "Mitigating circumstances" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-102(3)(a): no prior violation history for the licensee or permittee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-102(3)(b): no prior violation history for the individual who committed the violation;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-102(3)(c): motive for the individual who engaged in or allowed the violation to retaliate against the licensee or permittee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-102(3)(d): extraordinary cooperation with the investigation of the violation that demonstrates that the licensee or permittee and the individual who committed the violation accept responsibility for the violation.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-201 Nature of adjudicative proceedings under title.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-201(1): An adjudicative proceeding under this title, including a disciplinary proceeding, is a civil action, notwithstanding whether at issue in the adjudicative proceeding is a violation of statute that can be prosecuted criminally.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-201(2): Title 76, Chapter 1, General Provisions; Title 76, Chapter 2, Principles of Criminal Responsibility; Title 76, Chapter 3, Punishments; Title 76, Chapter 4, Inchoate Offenses Unless specifically adopted in this title, a procedure or principle that is applicable to a criminal proceeding does not apply to an adjudicative proceeding permitted under this title including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-201(2)(a): Title 76, Chapter 1, General Provisions
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-201(2)(b): Title 76, Chapter 2, Principles of Criminal Responsibility
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-201(2)(c): Title 76, Chapter 3, Punishments
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-201(2)(d): Title 76, Chapter 4, Inchoate Offenses
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-201(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-201(3)(a): The burden of proof in an adjudicative proceeding under this title is by a preponderance of the evidence.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-201(3)(b): If the subject of an adjudicative proceeding under this title asserts an affirmative defense, the subject has the burden of proof to establish the affirmative defense by the preponderance of the evidence.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-201(4): In an adjudicative proceeding under this title, to find a violation of this title the commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-201(4)(a): is required to determine whether the conduct that constitutes the violation occurred; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-201(4)(b): is not required to make a finding of knowledge or intent unless knowledge or intent is expressly made an element of the violation by statute.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202 Timing of reporting violations.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(1): (1)(a)(i); (5); (1)(a); (1)(a); (1)(a) The department or the commission may not take administrative action against a person subject to administrative action before:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(1)(a): (1)(a)(i) a nondepartment enforcement agency or enforcement officer or a department compliance officer submits to the department a report:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(1)(a)(i): containing facts that could support a finding that the person subject to administrative action violated this title or a commission rule; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(1)(a)(ii): (1)(a)(i) no more than eight business days after the day on which the nondepartment enforcement agency or officer or the compliance officer completes the investigation containing the facts described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(1)(b): (5); (1)(a); (1)(a); (1)(a) subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(1)(b)(i): (1)(a) received the report described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(1)(b)(ii): (1)(a) may initiate or maintain a disciplinary proceeding on the basis, in whole or in part, on the facts contained in the report described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(2)(a): The department may provide the notice required under this section orally, if after the oral notification the department provides written notification.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(2)(b): (2)(a) The department may provide the written notification described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(3): The department shall maintain a record of a notification required under this section that includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(3)(a): the name of the person notified;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(3)(b): the date of the notification; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(3)(c): the type of notification given.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(4): (1)(a); (4)(a); 32B-1-304; Chapter 18, Change of Alcohol License or Location Act; (4); Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(4)(a): (1)(a) The department may issue an order to show cause if the department receives a report described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(4)(a)(i): this title regarding necessary licensing requirements; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(4)(a)(ii): a commission rule regarding necessary licensing requirements.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(4)(b)(i): maintaining an approved, licensed premise;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(4)(b)(ii): maintaining insurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(4)(b)(iii): maintaining a bond;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(4)(b)(iv): 32B-1-304 following the requirements in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(4)(b)(v): maintaining required store hours;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(4)(b)(vi): failing to utilize the license issued; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(4)(b)(vii): Chapter 18, Change of Alcohol License or Location Act transferring a license in violation of
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(4)(c): (4); Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act The department's issuance of an order to show cause in accordance with this Subsection
