Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(4)(c)(ii): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act is not subject to
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-202(5): (1)(b) The department is not required to provide notice as described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-203 Initiating a disciplinary proceeding.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Subject to SectionUtah Code Annotated § 32B-3-203(1): (2); Chapter 15, Alcoholic Product Liability Act The department may initiate a disciplinary proceeding described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-203(1)(a): a report from an investigator alleging that a person subject to administrative action violated this title or the rules of the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-203(1)(b): a final adjudication of criminal liability against a person subject to administrative action on the basis of an alleged violation of this title; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-203(1)(c): Chapter 15, Alcoholic Product Liability Act a final adjudication of civil liability in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-203(2): (1) If the condition of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-203(2)(a): whether a person subject to administrative action violated this title or rules of the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-203(2)(b): if a violation is found, the appropriate sanction to be imposed.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-203(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-203(3)(a): Unless waived by the respondent, a disciplinary proceeding shall be held:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-203(3)(a)(i): if required by law;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-203(3)(a)(ii): before revoking or suspending a license, permit, or certificate of approval issued under this title; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-203(3)(a)(iii): before imposing a fine against a person subject to administrative action.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-203(3)(b): Inexcusable failure of a respondent to appear at a scheduled disciplinary proceeding hearing after receiving proper notice is an admission of the charged violation.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-203(3)(c): The validity of a disciplinary proceeding is not affected by the failure of a person to attend or remain in attendance.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204 Disciplinary proceeding procedure.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(1): 32B-3-202; 32B-2-605; (1)(a); Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; (3)(b); Title 52, Chapter 4, Open and Public Meetings Act; (1)(a); Title 63A, Chapter 17, Utah State Personnel Management Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(1)(a): 32B-3-202 Subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(1)(a)(i): the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(1)(a)(ii): a hearing examiner appointed by the commission to conduct a suspension, non-renewal, or revocation hearing required by law;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(1)(a)(iii): the director; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(1)(a)(iv): the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(1)(b): 32B-2-605; (1)(a); Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act Except as provided in this section or Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(1)(c): (3)(b); Title 52, Chapter 4, Open and Public Meetings Act Except when otherwise provided by law, an adjudicative proceeding before the commission or a hearing examiner appointed by the commission shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(1)(c)(i): video or audio recorded; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(1)(c)(ii): (3)(b); Title 52, Chapter 4, Open and Public Meetings Act subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(1)(d): (1)(a); Title 63A, Chapter 17, Utah State Personnel Management Act A person listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(1)(e): A hearing that is informational, fact gathering, and nonadversarial in nature shall be conducted in accordance with rules, policies, and procedures made by the commission, director, or department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(2): 32B-3-202; (2)(b); (2)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(2)(a): 32B-3-202 Subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(2)(b): (2)(b); (2)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(2)(b)(i): The commission may appoint a necessary officer, including a hearing examiner, from within or without the department, to administer the disciplinary proceeding process.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(2)(b)(ii): A hearing examiner appointed by the commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(2)(b)(ii)(A): may conduct a disciplinary proceeding hearing on behalf of the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(2)(b)(ii)(B): shall submit to the commission a report including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(2)(b)(ii)(B)(I): findings of fact determined on the basis of a preponderance of the evidence presented at the hearing;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(2)(b)(ii)(B)(II): conclusions of law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(2)(b)(ii)(B)(III): recommendations.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(2)(b)(iii): (2)(b) A report of a hearing examiner under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(2)(b)(iv): (2)(b) A copy of a hearing examiner report under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(2)(b)(v): Before final commission action, the commission shall give a respondent and the department reasonable opportunity to file a written objection to a hearing examiner report.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(3): 32B-3-202; (3)(c); (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(3)(a): The commission or an appointed hearing examiner shall preside over a disciplinary proceeding hearing.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(3)(b): A disciplinary proceeding hearing may be closed only after the commission or hearing examiner makes a written finding that the public interest in an open hearing is clearly outweighed by factors enumerated in the closure order.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(3)(c): 32B-3-202; (3)(c)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(3)(c)(i): 32B-3-202 The commission or an appointed hearing examiner as part of a disciplinary proceeding hearing may:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(3)(c)(i)(A): administer an oath or affirmation;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(3)(c)(i)(B): 32B-3-202 take evidence, including evidence provided in relation to an order to show cause the department issued in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(3)(c)(i)(C): take a deposition within or without this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(3)(c)(i)(D): require by subpoena from a place within this state:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(3)(c)(i)(D)(I): the testimony of a person at a hearing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(3)(c)(i)(D)(II): the production of a record or other evidence considered relevant to the inquiry.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(3)(c)(ii): (3)(c) A person subpoenaed in accordance with this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(3)(c)(iii): A witness subpoenaed, called to testify, or called to produce evidence who claims a privilege against self-incrimination may not be compelled to testify, but the commission or the hearing examiner shall file a written report with the county attorney or district attorney in the jurisdiction where the privilege is claimed or where the witness resides setting forth the circumstance of the claimed privilege.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(3)(c)(iv): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(3)(c)(iv)(A): A person is not excused from obeying a subpoena without just cause.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(3)(c)(iv)(B): A district court within the judicial district in which a person alleged to be guilty of willful contempt of court or refusal to obey a subpoena is found or resides, upon application by the party issuing the subpoena, may issue an order requiring the person to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(3)(c)(iv)(B)(I): appear before the issuing party; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(3)(c)(iv)(B)(II): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(3)(c)(iv)(B)(II)(Aa): produce documentary evidence if so ordered; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(3)(c)(iv)(B)(II)(Bb): give evidence regarding the matter in question.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(3)(c)(iv)(C): Failure to obey an order of the court may be punished by the court as contempt.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(3)(d): (2) In a case heard by the commission, the commission shall issue its final decision and order in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(4)(a): The commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(4)(a)(i): render a final decision and order on a disciplinary action; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(4)(a)(ii): cause its final order to be prepared in writing, issued, and served on all parties.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(4)(b): An order of the commission is final on the date the order is issued.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(4)(c): The commission, after the commission renders its final decision and order, may require the director to prepare, issue, and cause to be served on the parties the final written order on behalf of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(5): 63G-4-204; 63G-4-209; Chapter 1, Part 5, Attire, Conduct, and Entertainment Act; Chapter 4, Part 7, Trade Practices Act; 32B-4-702; (5)(c); (5)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(5)(a): 63G-4-204; 63G-4-209; Chapter 1, Part 5, Attire, Conduct, and Entertainment Act; Chapter 4, Part 7, Trade Practices Act; 32B-4-702 If a respondent requests a disciplinary proceeding hearing, the hearing held by the commission or a hearing examiner appointed by the commission shall proceed formally in accordance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(5)(a)(i): the alleged violation poses, or potentially poses, a grave risk to public safety, health, and welfare;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(5)(a)(ii): Chapter 1, Part 5, Attire, Conduct, and Entertainment Act; Chapter 4, Part 7, Trade Practices Act; 32B-4-702 the alleged violation involves:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(5)(a)(ii)(A): selling or furnishing an alcoholic product to a minor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(5)(a)(ii)(B): Chapter 1, Part 5, Attire, Conduct, and Entertainment Act attire, conduct, or entertainment prohibited by
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(5)(a)(ii)(C): fraud, deceit, willful concealment, or misrepresentation of the facts by or on behalf of the respondent;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(5)(a)(ii)(D): interfering or refusing to cooperate with:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(5)(a)(ii)(D)(I): an authorized official of the department or the state in the discharge of the official's duties in relation to the enforcement of this title; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(5)(a)(ii)(D)(II): a peace officer in the discharge of the peace officer's duties in relation to the enforcement of this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(5)(a)(ii)(E): Chapter 4, Part 7, Trade Practices Act an unlawful trade practice under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(5)(a)(ii)(F): unlawful importation of an alcoholic product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(5)(a)(ii)(G): 32B-4-702 unlawful supply of liquor by a liquor industry member, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(5)(a)(iii): the department determines to seek in a disciplinary proceeding hearing:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(5)(a)(iii)(A): an administrative fine exceeding $3,000;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(5)(a)(iii)(B): a suspension of a license, permit, or certificate of approval of more than 10 days; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(5)(a)(iii)(C): a revocation of a license, permit, or certificate of approval.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(5)(b): (5)(c) If a respondent does not request a disciplinary proceeding hearing, a hearing shall proceed informally unless it is designated as a formal proceeding pursuant to rules adopted by the commission in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(5)(c): (5) The commission shall make rules to provide a procedure to implement this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(6): (2); (6)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(6)(a): If the department recommends nonrenewal of a license, the department shall notify the licensee of the recommendation at least 15 days before the commission takes action on the nonrenewal.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-204(6)(b): (2); (6)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205 Penalties.
------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(1): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; (2); (1) If the commission is satisfied that a person subject to administrative action violates this title or the commission's rules, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(1)(a): suspend or revoke the person's license, permit, or certificate of approval;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(1)(b): (2) subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(1)(c): assess the administrative costs of a disciplinary proceeding to the person if the person is a licensee, permittee, or certificate holder; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(1)(d): (1) take a combination of actions described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(2)(a): A fine imposed may not exceed $25,000 in the aggregate for:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(2)(a)(i): a single notice of agency action; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(2)(a)(ii): a single action against a package agency.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(2)(b): The commission shall by rule establish a schedule setting forth a range of fines for each violation.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(2)(c): When a presiding officer imposes a fine, the presiding officer shall consider any aggravating circumstances or mitigating circumstances in deciding where within the applicable range to set the fine.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(3): 32B-2-301 The department shall transfer the costs assessed under this section into the General Fund in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(4): (4); (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(4)(a): If a license or permit is suspended under this section, the licensee or permittee shall prominently display a sign provided by the department:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(4)(a)(i): during the suspension; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(4)(a)(ii): at the entrance of the premises of the licensee or permittee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(4)(b): (4) The sign required by this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(4)(b)(i): read "The Utah Alcoholic Beverage Services Commission has suspended the alcoholic product license or permit of this establishment.  An alcoholic product may not be sold, offered for sale, furnished, or consumed on these premises during the period of suspension."; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(4)(b)(ii): include the dates of the suspension period.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(4)(c): (4) A licensee or permittee may not remove, alter, obscure, or destroy a sign required to be displayed under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(5): (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(5)(a): If a license or permit is revoked, the commission may order the revocation of a bond posted by the licensee or permittee under this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(5)(b): (5)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(6): A licensee or permittee whose license or permit is revoked may not reapply for a license or permit under this title for three years from the date on which the license or permit is revoked.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(7): If a staff member of a licensee, permittee, or certificate holder is found to have violated this title, in addition to imposing another penalty authorized by this title, the commission may prohibit the staff member from handling, selling, furnishing, distributing, manufacturing, wholesaling, or warehousing an alcoholic product in the course of acting as staff with a licensee, permittee, or certificate holder under this title for a period determined by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(8): (8)(b); (8)(a)(i); (8)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(8)(a): (8)(b); (8)(a)(i) If the commission makes the finding described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(8)(a)(i): the removal of an alcoholic product of the manufacturer's, supplier's, or importer's from the department's sales list; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(8)(a)(ii): (8)(a)(i) a suspension of the department's purchase of an alcoholic product described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(8)(b): (8)(a) The commission may take the action described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(8)(b)(i): a manufacturer, supplier, or importer of liquor or its staff or representative violates this title; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(8)(b)(ii): the manufacturer, supplier, or importer:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(8)(b)(ii)(A): directly commits the violation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(8)(b)(ii)(B): solicits, requests, commands, encourages, or intentionally aids another to engage in the violation.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(9): If the commission makes a finding that the brewer holding a certificate of approval violates this title or rules of the commission, the commission may take an action against the brewer holding a certificate of approval that the commission could take against a licensee including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(9)(a): suspension or revocation of the certificate of approval; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(9)(b): imposition of a fine.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(10): 53-13-103 Notwithstanding the other provisions of this title, the commission may not order a disciplinary action or fine in accordance with this section if the disciplinary action or fine is ordered on the basis of a violation:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(10)(a): of a provision in this title related to intoxication or becoming intoxicated; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(10)(b): 53-13-103 if the violation is first investigated by a law enforcement officer, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-205(11): The commission shall expunge each record that relates to an individual's violation of a provision of this title, if the individual does not violate a provision of this title for a period of 36 consecutive months from the day on which the individual's last violation was adjudicated.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-206 Dishonored checks.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-206(1): (1) If a check issued in payment of a fee or cost authorized or required by this title is returned to the department as dishonored:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-206(1)(a): the department may assess a service charge in an amount set by commission rule against the person on whose behalf the check was tendered;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-206(1)(b): if the check that is returned to the department is from a package agent, licensee, or permittee, the commission may:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-206(1)(b)(i): suspend or revoke the license or permit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-206(1)(b)(ii): suspend or terminate the operation of the package agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-206(1)(c): the department may require that the person who payed with the dishonored check only pay money owed to the department under this title with cash for the time period determined by the department; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-206(1)(d): (1) the department or commission may take a combination of actions as provided in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-206(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-206(2)(a): If a license or permit is revoked under this section, the commission may require the forfeiture of the bond of the licensee or permittee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-206(2)(b): (2)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-206(3): (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-206(3)(a): If the operation of a package agency is terminated under this section and the department has posted a bond for the package agency, the commission may require the forfeiture of the bond.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-206(3)(b): (3)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-207 Judicial review -- Enforcement.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-207(1): 63G-4-401; 63G-4-405 In a disciplinary proceeding, a respondent found in a final order of the commission to have violated this title or rules of the commission made under this title may seek judicial review in a court of competent jurisdiction pursuant to the judicial review provisions of Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-207(2): 63G-4-403(4)(g) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-207(3): 63G-4-501 In addition to another remedy provided by law, the commission may seek enforcement of a commission order in a disciplinary proceeding by seeking civil enforcement in a state district court in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-301 Title.
--------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Nuisance Retail Licensee Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-302 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-302(1): 32B-4-208; 32B-3-303 "Nuisance activity" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-302(1)(a): 32B-4-208 a judicial finding that a licensed establishment is a nuisance under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-302(1)(b): 32B-3-303 an act described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-302(2): "Objecting governmental entity" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-302(2)(a): a local government entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-302(2)(b): a prosecutor's office; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-302(2)(c): a law enforcement agency.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303 Acts making a person subject to this part.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1): Title 58, Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act; Title 58, Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act; Title 76, Chapter 10, Part 12, Pornographic and Harmful Materials and Performances; Title 76, Chapter 10, Part 11, Gambling; 76-10-1101 One or more of the following acts constitute a nuisance activity:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(a): a single felony conviction within the last two years of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(a)(i): a retail licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(a)(ii): supervisory or managerial level staff of the retail licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(b): Title 58, Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act a single conviction under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(b)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(b)(i)(A): of a retail licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(b)(i)(B): staff of the retail licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(b)(ii): within the last two years; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(b)(iii): made on the basis of an act that occurs on the licensed premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(c): Title 58, Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act three or more convictions of patrons of a retail licensee under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(c)(i): the convictions are made on the basis of an act that occurs on the licensed premises; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(c)(ii): there is evidence that the retail licensee knew or should have known of the illegal activity;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(d): Title 76, Chapter 10, Part 12, Pornographic and Harmful Materials and Performances; Title 76, Chapter 10, Part 11, Gambling; 76-10-1101 a single conviction within the last two years of a retail licensee or staff of the retail licensee that is made on the basis of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(d)(i): Title 76, Chapter 10, Part 12, Pornographic and Harmful Materials and Performances pornographic and harmful materials:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(d)(i)(A): Title 76, Chapter 10, Part 12, Pornographic and Harmful Materials and Performances that violate
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(d)(i)(B): if the violation occurs on the licensed premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(d)(ii): prostitution;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(d)(iii): Title 76, Chapter 10, Part 11, Gambling engaging in or permitting gambling, as defined and proscribed in
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(d)(iv): 76-10-1101 having any fringe gaming device, video gaming device, or gambling device or record as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(d)(v): on the licensed premises engaging in or permitting a contest, game, gaming scheme, or gaming device that requires the risking of something of value for a return or for an outcome when the return or outcome is based upon an element of chance, excluding the playing of an amusement device that confers only an immediate and unrecorded right of replay not exchangeable for value;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(d)(vi): a disturbance of the peace that occurs on the licensed premises; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(d)(vii): disorderly conduct that occurs on the licensed premises; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(e): three or more adjudicated violations of this title within the last two years by a retail licensee or by staff of the retail licensee that result in a criminal citation or an administrative referral to the department relating to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(e)(i): the sale, offer for sale, or furnishing of an alcoholic product to a minor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(e)(ii): the sale, offer for sale, or furnishing of an alcoholic product to a person actually, apparently, or obviously intoxicated;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(e)(iii): the sale, offer for sale, or furnishing of an alcoholic product after the lawful hours for the sale or furnishing; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(1)(e)(iv): acts or conduct on the licensed premises contrary to the public welfare and morals involving lewd acts or lewd entertainment prohibited by this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(2): (1); (1)(c); (1)(c) For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(2)(a): a partner;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(2)(b): a managing agent;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(2)(c): a manager;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(2)(d): an officer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(2)(e): a director;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(2)(f): a stockholder who holds at least 20% of the total issued and outstanding stock of a corporate retail licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-303(2)(g): a member who owns at least 20% of a limited liability company retail licensee.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-304 Rulemaking.
-------------------------------------------
In accordance with this chapter, the commission may make rules that govern the filing under this chapter of:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-304(1): a formal objection to the renewal of a retail license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-304(2): a request for hearing filed by a retail licensee.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-305 Commission to prohibit nuisance activity by licensee -- License not renewed.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-305(1): 32B-1-104 In accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-305(2): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; 32B-3-306; 32B-3-307; (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-305(2)(a): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; 32B-3-306; 32B-3-307 In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-305(2)(a)(i): a formal objection to the renewal is filed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-305(2)(a)(ii): the commission determines that the retail licensee has engaged in a nuisance activity to such an extent that the nuisance activity has adversely impacted the public health, peace, safety, welfare, or morals of the neighboring community of the licensed premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-305(2)(b): (2) In making a determination under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-305(2)(b)(i): the type of nuisance activity in which a retail licensee engages;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-305(2)(b)(ii): the frequency or pattern of the nuisance activity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-305(2)(b)(iii): the retail licensee's notice of and failure to abate or correct the nuisance activity.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-306 Formal objections to renewal.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-306(1): The department shall notify governmental entities that in accordance with this part an objecting governmental entity may file with the commission an objection to the renewal of a retail licensee's license in the objecting governmental entity's community.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-306(2): The department or an objecting governmental entity may file with the commission a formal objection to a retail license being renewed by the commission if the formal objection:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-306(2)(a): is filed on the basis of a nuisance activity;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-306(2)(b): is filed no later than 60 days before the expiration date of the retail licensee's license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-306(2)(c): states with particularity all relevant facts and circumstances relating to the nuisance activity that forms the basis for the formal objection.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307 Hearing on formal objections to renewal.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(1): 32B-3-306 Upon receipt of a formal objection that meets the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(1)(a): issue a notice of agency action; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(1)(b): serve on the retail licensee no later than 30 days before the expiration of the retail licensee's license:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(1)(b)(i): the notice of agency action; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(1)(b)(ii): a copy of the formal objection.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(2): (1); (2)(a); (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(2)(a): (1) A retail licensee against whom a notice of agency action is served under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(2)(b): (2)(a) The request for hearing described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(2)(b)(i): in writing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(2)(b)(ii): filed with the commission within 10 days of the day on which the notice of agency action is served on the retail licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(2)(c): (2) If a retail licensee fails to file a request for hearing in accordance with this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(3): (2); (3)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(3)(a): (2) Upon receipt of a request for hearing meeting the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(3)(a)(i): held no later than 10 days before the expiration date of the retail licensee's license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(3)(a)(ii): electronically recorded by the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(3)(b): The retail licensee or an objecting governmental entity, at its own expense, may have a reporter approved by the department prepare a transcript from the department's record of the hearing.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(3)(c): (3)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(3)(c)(i): The department shall present information at the hearing that supports a finding that a nuisance activity occurred.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(3)(c)(ii): (3)(c)(i) The information described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(3)(d): A retail licensee shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(3)(d)(i): have the opportunity to challenge or explain whether any of the nuisance activity that forms the basis for the formal objection occurred; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(3)(d)(ii): be permitted to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(3)(d)(ii)(A): testify;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(3)(d)(ii)(B): present evidence; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(3)(d)(ii)(C): comment on the issues at the hearing.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(4): (4)(a); (b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(4)(a): A hearing held under this part shall be conducted under the authority of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(4)(b): The commission is responsible for rendering a final order on whether a retail licensee's license shall be renewed.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(4)(c): (4)(a); (b) Notwithstanding Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(4)(d): The commission or the hearing examiner appointed by the commission shall serve as the presiding officer at a hearing held under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(4)(e): The presiding officer at a hearing held under this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(4)(e)(i): shall evaluate:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(4)(e)(i)(A): the information presented at the hearing in support of the formal objection; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(4)(e)(i)(B): any explanation and evidence offered by the retail licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(4)(e)(ii): may consider such factors as:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(4)(e)(ii)(A): the length of time the retail licensee has operated the licensed premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(4)(e)(ii)(B): the condition of the licensed premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(4)(e)(ii)(C): whether the retail licensee knew or should have known of the nuisance activity in question;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(4)(e)(ii)(D): whether the retail licensee failed to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(4)(e)(ii)(D)(I): make a substantial effort to correct the nuisance activity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(4)(e)(ii)(D)(II): work with law enforcement to curtail the nuisance activity;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(4)(e)(ii)(E): whether the nuisance activity has been ongoing or temporary;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(4)(e)(ii)(F): whether the retail licensee or the retail licensee's staff:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(4)(e)(ii)(F)(I): initiated contact with the law enforcement agency on the nuisance activity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(4)(e)(ii)(F)(II): cooperated with the law enforcement agency's investigation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(4)(e)(ii)(G): whether prior efforts to stop the nuisance activity by the community or the retail licensee have been unsuccessful.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(5): An order issued under this section shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(5)(a): be based on the evidence presented at the hearing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(5)(b): state whether:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(5)(b)(i): the continued operation of the licensed premises will endanger the public health, peace, safety, welfare, or morals of the community; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(5)(b)(ii): the retail license should or should not be renewed.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(6): (5)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(6)(a): (5) If the presiding officer is a hearing examiner appointed by the commission, the hearing officer shall issue a signed order in writing that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(6)(a)(i): (5) complies with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(6)(a)(ii): recommends to the commission whether the retail license should or should not be renewed;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(6)(a)(iii): states the reasons for the hearing officer's decision; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(6)(a)(iv): notifies the retail licensee and the objecting governmental entity that the hearing examiner's order will be considered by the commission at the next regularly scheduled meeting of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(6)(b): The department shall promptly mail a copy of the hearing examiner's order to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(6)(b)(i): the retail licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(6)(b)(ii): any objecting governmental entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(6)(c): The commission at its next regularly scheduled meeting after receipt of a hearing examiner's order, shall decide whether to renew or not renew the retail license on the basis of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(6)(c)(i): the record and evidence presented at the hearing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(6)(c)(ii): the hearing examiner's recommendation.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(7): (7)(b)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(7)(a): As an alternative to ordering that a retail license not be renewed under this section, the commission may conditionally renew a retail license by requiring that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(7)(a)(i): the retail licensee and the licensed premises be closely monitored during the licensing year by:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(7)(a)(i)(A): the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(7)(a)(i)(B): local government officials; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(7)(a)(i)(C): law enforcement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(7)(a)(ii): the matter be reviewed before the next renewal period.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(7)(b): (7)(b)(ii) The commission may conditionally renew a retail license contingent on a person listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(7)(b)(i): the retail licensee is a partnership, corporation, or limited liability company; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(7)(b)(ii): the formal objection filed under this section if filed solely on the basis of a felony conviction:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(7)(b)(ii)(A): of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(7)(b)(ii)(A)(I): a partner;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(7)(b)(ii)(A)(II): a managing agent;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(7)(b)(ii)(A)(III): a manager;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(7)(b)(ii)(A)(IV): an officer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(7)(b)(ii)(A)(V): a director;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(7)(b)(ii)(A)(VI): a stockholder who holds at least 20% of the total issued and outstanding stock of a corporate licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(7)(b)(ii)(A)(VII): a member who owns at least 20% of a limited liability company licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(7)(b)(ii)(B): for illegal activity that occurred off of the licensed premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(8): (8)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(8)(a): In accordance with this section, the commission shall issue a written order setting forth the commission's decision and the reason for the commission's decision.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(8)(b): (8)(a) The order described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(8)(c): The department shall serve a copy of the order on the retail licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(9): 32B-3-207 A retail licensee whose retail license is not renewed by order of the commission may seek judicial review under the procedures provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-3-307(10): A retail licensee whose retail license is not renewed may not reapply for a license under this title for three years from the date the retail license is not renewed.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 32B - Chapter 4 - Criminal Offenses and Procedure Act
*********************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Criminal Offenses and Procedure Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter, "capitol hill complex" means the same as that term is defined in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-201 Applicability of Utah Code of Criminal Procedure.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Except as otherwise provided in this title, the procedure in a criminal case arising under this title is governed by

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-202 Duties to enforce this title.
-------------------------------------------------------------
It is the duty of the following to diligently enforce this title in their respective capacities:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-202(1): the governor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-202(2): a commissioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-202(3): the director;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-202(4): an official, inspector, or department employee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-202(5): a prosecuting official of the state or its political subdivisions;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-202(6): a county, city, town, or metro township;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-202(7): a peace officer, sheriff, deputy sheriff, constable, marshal, or law enforcement official;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-202(8): a state health official; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-202(9): a clerk of the court.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-203 Authority to inspect.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-203(1): (1); (1)(a); (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-203(1)(a): (1) This Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-203(1)(a)(i): a commissioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-203(1)(a)(ii): an authorized representative of the commission or department; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-203(1)(a)(iii): a law enforcement or peace officer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-203(1)(b): (1)(a); (1) An individual described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-203(1)(b)(i): shall be given access, ingress, and egress to and from premises or a conveyance used in the storage, sale, furnishing, manufacture, or transportation of an alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-203(1)(b)(ii): may open a container containing, or supposed to contain, an article sold, or exposed for sale, held in possession, or manufactured with intent to sell in violation of this title or commission rules; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-203(1)(b)(iii): (1) may inspect the contents and take samples of the contents for analysis from a container described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-203(2): (1); (2) The following shall assist, when requested by a person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-203(2)(a): a dealer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-203(2)(b): a clerk;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-203(2)(c): a bookkeeper;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-203(2)(d): an express agent;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-203(2)(e): a railroad or airline official;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-203(2)(f): a common or other carrier; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-203(2)(g): (2) an employee of a person listed in this Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-204 Arrests.
----------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-204(1): Title 77, Chapter 7, Arrest, by Whom, and How Made Except as otherwise provided in this chapter, an arrest of a person for a violation of this title shall be made in accordance with:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-204(1)(a): Title 77, Chapter 7, Arrest, by Whom, and How Made
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-204(1)(b): Rules 6 and 7, Utah Rules of Criminal Procedure.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-204(2): A summons in lieu of a warrant of arrest shall be in accordance with Rule 6, Utah Rules of Criminal Procedure.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-205 Prosecutions.
---------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-205(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-205(1)(a): A prosecution for a violation of this title shall be in the name of the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-205(1)(b): A criminal action for violation of a county or municipal ordinance enacted in furtherance of this title shall be in the name of the governmental entity involved.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-205(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-205(2)(a): A prosecution for violation of this title shall be brought by the county attorney of the county or district attorney of the prosecution district where the violation occurs.  If a county attorney or district attorney fails to initiate or diligently pursue a prosecution authorized and warranted under this title, the attorney general shall exercise supervisory authority over the county attorney or district attorney to ensure prosecution is initiated and diligently pursued.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-205(2)(b): If a violation occurs within a city or town, prosecution may be brought by either the county, district, or city attorney, notwithstanding any provision of law limiting the powers of a city attorney.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-205(2)(c): A city or town prosecutor has the responsibility of initiating and diligently pursuing prosecutions for a violation of a local ordinance enacted in furtherance of this title or commission rules.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-205(3): (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-205(3)(a): A prosecution for a violation of this title shall be commenced by the return of an indictment or the filing of an information with the district court of the county in which the offense occurs or where the premises are located upon which an alcoholic product is seized, if the offense involves an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-205(3)(b): (3)(a) An offense prescribed by this title that is not described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-205(4): (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-205(4)(a): Unless otherwise provided by law, an information may not be filed charging the commission of a felony or class A misdemeanor under this title unless authorized by a prosecuting attorney.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-205(4)(b): (4) This Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-205(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-205(5)(a): In describing an offense respecting the sale, keeping for sale, or other disposal of an alcoholic product, or the possessing, keeping, purchasing, consumption, or giving of an alcoholic product in an information, indictment, summons, judgment, warrant, or proceeding under this title, it is sufficient to state the possessing, purchasing, keeping, sale, keeping for sale, giving, consumption, or disposal of the alcoholic product without stating:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-205(5)(a)(i): the name or kind of alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-205(5)(a)(ii): the price of the alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-205(5)(a)(iii): any person to whom the alcoholic product is sold or disposed of;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-205(5)(a)(iv): by whom the alcoholic product is taken or consumed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-205(5)(a)(v): from whom the alcoholic product is purchased or received.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-205(5)(b): It is not necessary to state the quantity of alcoholic product possessed, purchased, kept, kept for sale, sold, given, consumed, or disposed of, except in the case of an offense when the quantity is essential, and then it is sufficient to allege the sale or disposal of more or less than the quantity.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-205(6): If an offense is committed under a local ordinance enacted to carry out this title, it is sufficient if the charging document refers to the chapter and section of the ordinance under which the offense is committed.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-206 Disposition of fines and forfeitures.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Except when otherwise provided, a fine or forfeiture levied under this title shall be paid to the county treasurer of the county in which the prosecution occurred.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-207 Right of appeal.
------------------------------------------------
In a case arising under this title, the commission or the state has the right of appeal as to a question of law.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208 Nuisances.
------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208(1): (1)(a) As used in this section, "nuisance" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208(1)(a): a room, house, building, structure, place, aircraft, vehicle, vessel, or other conveyance where an alcoholic product is possessed, purchased, used, kept, stored, sold, offered for sale, furnished, given, received, warehoused, manufactured, distributed, shipped, carried, transported, or adulterated in violation of this title; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208(1)(b): (1)(a) an alcoholic product, container, equipment, or other property kept or used in maintaining an item or property described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208(2): A person who maintains or assists in maintaining a nuisance is guilty of a class B misdemeanor.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208(3): If a person has knowledge that, or has reason to believe that the person's room, house, building, structure, place, aircraft, vehicle, vessel, or other conveyance is occupied or used as a nuisance, or allows it to be occupied or used as a nuisance, the nuisance property is subject to a lien for and may be sold to pay the fines and costs assessed against the person guilty of the common nuisance.  This lien may be enforced by action in a court having jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208(4): (4); (4); (4)(h); (4)(g)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208(4)(a): The department shall bring an action to abate a nuisance in the name of the department in a court having jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208(4)(b): (4) An action brought under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208(4)(c): (4) The department may not be required to post a bond to initiate an action under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208(4)(d): A court may issue:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208(4)(d)(i): if it appears that a nuisance exists, a temporary writ of injunction restraining the defendant from conducting or permitting the continuance of the nuisance until the conclusion of the trial; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208(4)(d)(ii): an order restraining the defendant and any other person from removing or interfering with an alcoholic product, container, equipment, or other property kept or used in violation of this title or commission rules.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208(4)(e): In an action to abate or enjoin a nuisance, the court need not find that the property involved is being unlawfully used at the time of the hearing.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208(4)(f): On finding that a material allegation of a petition or complaint is true, the court shall order that an alcoholic product may not be possessed, purchased, used, kept, stored, sold, offered for sale, furnished, given, received, warehoused, manufactured, distributed, shipped, carried, transported, or adulterated, in any portion of the room, house, building, structure, place, aircraft, vehicle, vessel, or other conveyance.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208(4)(g): (4)(h) Upon judgment of a court ordering abatement of the nuisance, the court may order that the premises or conveyance in question may not be occupied or used for any purpose for one year, except under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208(4)(h): (4)(g) A court may permit premises or conveyance described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208(4)(h)(i): if its owner, lessee, tenant, or occupant gives bond in an appropriate amount with sufficient surety, approved by the court, payable to the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208(4)(h)(ii): on the condition that an alcoholic product will not be present in or on the premises or the conveyance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208(4)(h)(iii): on the condition that payment of the fines, costs, and damages assessed for violation of this title or commission rules will be made.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208(5): If a tenant of the premises uses the premises or any part of the premises in maintaining a nuisance, or knowingly permits use by another, the lease is void and the right to possession reverts to the owner or lessor who is entitled to the remedy provided by law for forcible detention of the premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208(6): 76-10-804 A person is guilty of assisting in maintaining a nuisance as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208(6)(a): knowingly permits a building or premises owned or leased by the person, or under the person's control, or any part of a building or premises, to be used in maintaining a nuisance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208(6)(b): after being notified in writing by a prosecutor or other citizen of the unlawful use, fails to take all proper measures to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208(6)(b)(i): abate the nuisance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-208(6)(b)(ii): remove the one or more persons from the premises.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-209 Lawful detention.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-209(1): (1)(c); (1)(b); (1)(a); (1)(b)(ii); (iv); (1)(b); (1)(a); 32B-4-409; 32B-4-412; 32B-4-413
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-209(1)(a): (1)(c); (1)(b) To inform a peace officer of a suspected violation and subject to the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-209(1)(a)(i): detain a person; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-209(1)(a)(ii): hold any form of identification presented by the person.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-209(1)(b): (1)(a); (1)(b)(ii); (iv) The following may take an action described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-209(1)(b)(i): a state store employee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-209(1)(b)(ii): a package agent;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-209(1)(b)(iii): a licensee or permittee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-209(1)(b)(iv): a beer retailer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-209(1)(b)(v): (1)(b)(ii); (iv) staff of a person described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-209(1)(c): (1)(b); (1)(a); 32B-4-409; 32B-4-412; 32B-4-413 A person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-209(1)(c)(i): 32B-4-409; 32B-4-412; 32B-4-413 if that person has reason to believe that the person against whom the action is taken is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-209(1)(c)(i)(A): in a facility where liquor or beer is sold; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-209(1)(c)(i)(B): 32B-4-409; 32B-4-412; 32B-4-413 in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-209(1)(c)(ii): in a reasonable manner; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-209(1)(c)(iii): for a reasonable length of time.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-209(2): Unless the detention is unreasonable under all circumstances, the detention or failure to detain does not create criminal or civil liability for:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-209(2)(a): false arrest;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-209(2)(b): false imprisonment;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-209(2)(c): slander; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-209(2)(d): unlawful detention.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-301 Applicability of Utah Criminal Code.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Except as otherwise provided,

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-302 Criminal responsibility for conduct of another.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
In addition toUtah Code Annotated § 32B-4-302(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-302(1)(a): If a violation of this title is committed by a person in the employ of the occupant of premises in which the offense is committed, or by a person who is required by the occupant to be or remain in or upon the premises, or to act in any way for the occupant, notwithstanding the fact that the offense is committed by a person who is not proved to have committed it under or by the direction of the occupant, the occupant is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-302(1)(a)(i): prima facie considered a party to the offense committed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-302(1)(a)(ii): liable as a principal offender.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-302(1)(b): This section does not relieve the person actually committing the offense from liability.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-302(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-302(2)(a): If a violation of this title is committed by a corporation, association, partnership, or limited liability company, an officer or agent of the corporation or association, a partner of the partnership, or a manager or member of the limited liability company in charge of the premises in which the offense is committed is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-302(2)(a)(i): prima facie considered a party to the offense committed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-302(2)(a)(ii): personally liable to the penalties prescribed for the offense as a principal offender.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-302(2)(b): This section does not relieve the corporation, association, partnership, or limited liability company, or the person who actually committed the offense from liability.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-303 Special burdens of proof -- Inferences and presumptions.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-303(1): In a prosecution of an offense defined in this title or in a proceeding brought to enforce this title:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-303(1)(a): it is not necessary that the state or commission establish:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-303(1)(a)(i): the precise description or quantity of an alcoholic product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-303(1)(a)(ii): the precise consideration, if any, given or received for an alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-303(1)(b): there is an inference, absent proof to the contrary, that an alcoholic product in question is an alcoholic product if the witness describes it:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-303(1)(b)(i): as an alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-303(1)(b)(ii): by a name that is commonly applied to an alcoholic product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-303(1)(b)(iii): as intoxicating;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-303(1)(c): if it is alleged that an entity for which a record is required to be filed with the Division of Corporations and Commercial Code to be organized or conduct business in this state has violated this title, the fact of the entity is presumed absent proof to the contrary;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-303(1)(d): a record signed or purporting to be signed by a state chemist, assistant state chemist, or state crime laboratory chemist, as to the analysis or ingredients of an alcoholic product is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-303(1)(d)(i): prima facie evidence:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-303(1)(d)(i)(A): of the facts stated in that record; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-303(1)(d)(i)(B): of the authority of the person giving or making the record; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-303(1)(d)(ii): admissible in evidence without proof of appointment or signature absent proof to the contrary; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-303(1)(e): a copy of an entry made in a record of the United States internal revenue collector, certified by the collector or a qualified notary public, showing the payment of the United States internal revenue special tax for the manufacture or sale of an alcoholic product is prima facie evidence of the manufacture or sale by the party named in the entry within the period set forth in the record.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-303(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-303(2)(a): In proving the unlawful purchase, sale, gift, or disposal, gratuitous or otherwise, or consumption of an alcoholic product, it is not necessary that the state or commission establish that money or other consideration actually passed or that an alcoholic product is actually consumed if the court or trier of fact is satisfied that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-303(2)(a)(i): a transaction in the nature of a purchase, sale, gift, or disposal actually occurs; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-303(2)(a)(ii): consumption of an alcoholic product is about to occur.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-303(2)(b): Proof of consumption or intended consumption of an alcoholic product on premises on which consumption is prohibited, by some person not authorized to consume an alcoholic product on those premises, is evidence that an alcoholic product is sold, given to, or purchased by the person consuming, about to consume, or carrying away the alcoholic product as against the occupant of the premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-303(3): For purposes of a provision applicable under this chapter to a retail licensee or staff of a retail licensee, the provision is applicable to a resort licensee or hotel licensee or a person operating under a sublicense of the resort licensee or hotel licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-303(4): 53-13-103 Notwithstanding the other provisions of this chapter, a criminal offense identified in this title as a criminal offense may not be enforced under this chapter if the criminal offense relates to a violation:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-303(4)(a): of a provision in this title related to intoxication or becoming intoxicated; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-303(4)(b): 53-13-103 if the violation is first investigated by a law enforcement officer, as defined in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-304 Violation of title a misdemeanor.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-304(1): Unless otherwise provided in this title, a person is guilty of a class B misdemeanor if that person violates:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-304(1)(a): this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-304(1)(b): a provision of this title that is expressly identified as a criminal offense.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-304(2): Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act; (1); (1) This section is not applicable to an adjudicative proceeding under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-304(2)(a): (1) makes a violation described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-304(2)(b): (1) establishes a penalty for a violation described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-305 Additional criminal penalties.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-305(1): Title 76, Chapter 3, Punishments
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-305(1)(a): As used in this section, "business entity" means a corporation, partnership, association, limited liability company, or similar entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-305(1)(b): Title 76, Chapter 3, Punishments In addition to the penalties provided in
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-305(2): 76-3-201(4) Upon a defendant's conviction of an offense defined in this title, the court may order the defendant to pay restitution or costs in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-305(3): (3)(a); (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-305(3)(a): Upon a business entity's conviction of an offense defined in this title, and a failure of the business entity to pay a fine imposed upon it:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-305(3)(a)(i): if the business entity is a domestic business entity, the powers, rights, and privileges of the business entity may be suspended or revoked; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-305(3)(a)(ii): if the business entity is a foreign business entity, it forfeits its right to do intrastate business in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-305(3)(b): (3)(a) The department shall transmit the name of a business entity described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-305(3)(c): (3) A suspension, revocation, or forfeiture under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-305(3)(d): A certificate of the Division of Corporations and Commercial Code is prima facie evidence of a suspension, revocation, or forfeiture.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-305(3)(e): This section may not be construed as affecting, limiting, or restricting a proceeding that otherwise may be taken for the imposition of any other punishment or the modes of enforcement or recovery of fines or penalties.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-305(4): (4); (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-305(4)(a): Upon the conviction of a business entity required to have a business license to operate the business entity's activities, or upon the conviction of any of the business entity's staff of any offense defined in this title, with the knowledge, consent, or acquiescence of the business entity, the department shall forward a copy of the judgment of conviction to the appropriate governmental entity responsible for issuing and revoking the business license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-305(4)(b): (4) A governmental entity that receives a copy of a judgment under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-305(4)(c): (4) Upon revocation under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-305(4)(d): Upon the conviction for a second or other offense, the governmental entity may not issue a business license for at least two years from the date of revocation.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-305(5): Title 58, Chapter 28, Veterinary Practice Act; Title 58, Occupations and Professions; Title 58, Occupations and Professions; (5)(a); (5)(b); Title 58, Occupations and Professions; Title 58, Occupations and Professions

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-401 Unlawful sale or furnishing.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-401(1): It is unlawful for a retail licensee, a permittee, or staff of a retail licensee or permittee to keep for sale, or to directly or indirectly, sell, offer for sale, or furnish to another, an alcoholic product, except as otherwise provided by this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-401(2): It is unlawful for a person in the business of selling liquor, a manufacturer, a supplier, an importer of liquor, or staff of the person, manufacturer, supplier, or importer to sell, ship, transport, or cause to be sold, shipped, or transported liquor from an out-of-state location directly or indirectly into this state except to the extent authorized by this title to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-401(2)(a): the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-401(2)(b): a military installation;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-401(2)(c): a holder of a special use permit, to the extent authorized in the special use permit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-401(2)(d): a liquor warehouser licensee licensed to distribute and transport liquor to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-401(2)(d)(i): the department; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-401(2)(d)(ii): an out-of-state wholesaler or retailer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-401(3): (3)(a); 32B-11-503(5)

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-402 Unauthorized sale, offer for sale, or furnishing.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A person authorized by this title to sell an alcoholic product and staff of that person may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish, an alcoholic product in any place, or at any day or time other than as authorized by this title or the rules of the commission.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-403 Unlawful sale, offer for sale, or furnishing to minor.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-403(1): A person may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product to a minor.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-403(2): (3); (1); (2)(a); (3); (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-403(2)(a): (3); (1); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-403(2)(a)(i): (3); (1) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-403(2)(a)(ii): (2)(a) As used in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-403(2)(b): (3); (1) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-403(3): This section does not apply to the furnishing of an alcoholic product to a minor in accordance with this title:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-403(3)(a): for medicinal purposes by:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-403(3)(a)(i): the parent or guardian of the minor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-403(3)(a)(ii): the health care practitioner of the minor, if the health care practitioner is authorized by law to write a prescription; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-403(3)(b): as part of a religious organization's religious services.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-404 Unlawful sale, offer for sale, or furnishing to intoxicated person.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-404(1): A person may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product directly to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-404(1)(a): a person who is actually or apparently intoxicated; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-404(1)(b): a person whom the person furnishing the alcoholic product knows or should know from the circumstances is actually or apparently intoxicated.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-404(2): (1); (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-404(2)(a): (1) A person who negligently or recklessly violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-404(2)(b): (1) A person who knowingly violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-404(3): (2)(a) As used in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-405 Unlawful sale, offer for sale, or furnishing to interdicted person.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-405(1): A person may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product to a known interdicted person.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-405(2): This section does not apply to the sale, offer for sale, or furnishing of an alcoholic product to an interdicted person:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-405(2)(a): under an order of a health care practitioner who is authorized by law to write a prescription; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-405(2)(b): administered by a hospital or health care practitioner authorized by law to administer the alcoholic product for medicinal purposes.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-406 Unlawful sale, offer for sale, or furnishing of an alcoholic product.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-406(1): (2) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-406(1)(a): a person may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish beer to the general public in a container that exceeds two liters; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-406(1)(b): a person may not purchase or possess beer in a container that exceeds two liters.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-406(2): 32B-5-304; 32B-5-304; (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-406(2)(a): 32B-5-304 A retail licensee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish beer on draft subject to the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-406(2)(b): 32B-5-304 A retail licensee may purchase or possess beer in a container that exceeds two liters to be dispensed on draft for consumption subject to the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-406(2)(c): (2)(a) A beer wholesaler licensee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish beer in a container that exceeds two liters to a retail licensee described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-406(3): On or after October 1, 2011:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-406(3)(a): A person may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish heavy beer in a container that exceeds two liters.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-406(3)(b): A person may not purchase or possess heavy beer in a container that exceeds two liters.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-407 Unlawful sale, offer for sale, or furnishing during emergency.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
During a period of emergency proclaimed by the governor to exist in an area of the state, it is unlawful for a person to sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product in that area if the director publicly announces and directs that in that area a person may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product in that area during the period of emergency.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-408 Unlawful purchase or acceptance.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-408(1): It is unlawful for a person or the person's staff to purchase, take, or accept an alcoholic product from another person, except as provided by this title or the rules of the commission adopted under this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-408(2): (1) An act is unlawful under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-408(2)(a): directly or indirectly; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-408(2)(b): upon a pretense or device.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-409 Unlawful purchase, possession, consumption by minor -- Measurable amounts in body.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-409(1): Unless specifically authorized by this title, it is unlawful for a minor to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-409(1)(a): purchase an alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-409(1)(b): attempt to purchase an alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-409(1)(c): solicit another person to purchase an alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-409(1)(d): possess an alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-409(1)(e): consume an alcoholic product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-409(1)(f): have measurable blood, breath, or urine alcohol concentration in the minor's body.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-409(2): It is unlawful for the purpose of purchasing or otherwise obtaining an alcoholic product for a minor for:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-409(2)(a): a minor to misrepresent the minor's age; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-409(2)(b): any other person to misrepresent the age of a minor.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-409(3): It is unlawful for a minor to possess or consume an alcoholic product while riding in a limousine or chartered bus.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-409(4): 41-6a-501; 41-6a-501; 41-6a-501; 41-6a-501; 41-6a-501; 41-6a-501

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-409(10): This section does not apply to a minor's consumption of an alcoholic product in accordance with this title:
