Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411 Minor's unlawful use of proof of age.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(1): Chapter 1, Part 4, Proof of Age Act; Chapter 1, Part 4, Proof of Age Act; 32B-4-409; 32B-4-410 As used in this section, "proof of age violation" means a violation by a minor of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(1)(a): Chapter 1, Part 4, Proof of Age Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(1)(b): Chapter 1, Part 4, Proof of Age Act; 32B-4-409; 32B-4-410 if as part of the violation the minor uses a proof of age in violation of
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(1)(b)(i): 32B-4-409 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(1)(b)(ii): 32B-4-410 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(2): (1); 41-6a-501; 41-6a-501; 80-6-701; 80-6-707; 53-3-220; (2)(a); 80-6-701; 80-6-709 If a court finds a minor engaged in a proof of age violation, notwithstanding the penalties provided for in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(2)(a): 41-6a-501; 41-6a-501
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(2)(a)(i): for a first violation, the minor is guilty of a class B misdemeanor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(2)(a)(ii): for a second violation, the minor is guilty of a class A misdemeanor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(2)(a)(iii): 41-6a-501; 41-6a-501 for a third or subsequent violation, the minor is guilty of a class A misdemeanor, except that the court may impose:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(2)(a)(iii)(A): a fine of up to $5,000;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(2)(a)(iii)(B): 41-6a-501 screening, assessment, or substance use disorder treatment, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(2)(a)(iii)(C): 41-6a-501 an educational series, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(2)(a)(iii)(D): alcoholic product related community service or compensatory service work program hours;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(2)(a)(iii)(E): fees for restitution and treatment costs;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(2)(a)(iii)(F): defensive driver education courses; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(2)(a)(iii)(G): a combination of these penalties;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(2)(b): 80-6-701; 80-6-707; 53-3-220
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(2)(b)(i): 80-6-701; 80-6-707 for a minor who is younger than 18 years old:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(2)(b)(i)(A): 80-6-701 the court may forward to the Driver License Division a record of an adjudication under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(2)(b)(i)(B): 80-6-707 the provisions regarding suspension of a driver license under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(2)(b)(ii): 53-3-220 for a minor who is at least 18 years old, but younger than 21 years old:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(2)(b)(ii)(A): the court shall forward to the Driver License Division a record of conviction for a violation under this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(2)(b)(ii)(B): 53-3-220 the Driver License Division shall suspend the person's license under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(2)(c): (2)(a); 80-6-701; 80-6-709 notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(2)(c)(i): substance use disorder treatment or an educational series only if the minor has an assessed need for the intervention based on the results of a validated assessment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(2)(c)(ii): 80-6-709 a fine, fee, service hours, or costs in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(3): (2)(b); 53-3-220(1)(e); 80-6-707(4)(a)(ii)(A); 41-6a-501; (2)(b); 53-3-220(1)(e); 80-6-707(4)(a)(ii)(B); 41-6a-501; 53-3-220(1)(e); 80-6-707(4)(b)(ii)(A); 53-3-220(1)(e); 80-6-707(4)(b)(ii)(B)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(3)(a): (2)(b); 53-3-220(1)(e); 80-6-707(4)(a)(ii)(A); 41-6a-501 Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(3)(a)(i): the violation is the minor's first violation of this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(3)(a)(ii): 41-6a-501
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(3)(a)(ii)(A): 41-6a-501 the minor completes an educational series as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(3)(a)(ii)(B): the minor demonstrates substantial progress in substance use disorder treatment.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(3)(b): (2)(b); 53-3-220(1)(e); 80-6-707(4)(a)(ii)(B); 41-6a-501; 53-3-220(1)(e); 80-6-707(4)(b)(ii)(A); 53-3-220(1)(e); 80-6-707(4)(b)(ii)(B) Notwithstanding the requirement in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(3)(b)(i): the violation is the minor's second or subsequent violation of this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(3)(b)(ii): 41-6a-501 the person has completed an educational series as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(3)(b)(iii): 53-3-220(1)(e); 80-6-707(4)(b)(ii)(A); 53-3-220(1)(e); 80-6-707(4)(b)(ii)(B)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(3)(b)(iii)(A): 53-3-220(1)(e); 80-6-707(4)(b)(ii)(A) the person is 18 years old or older and provides a sworn statement to the court that the person has not unlawfully consumed alcohol or drugs for at least a one-year consecutive period during the suspension period imposed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(3)(b)(iii)(B): 53-3-220(1)(e); 80-6-707(4)(b)(ii)(B) the minor is under 18 years old and has the minor's parent or legal guardian provide an affidavit or sworn statement to the court certifying that to the parent or legal guardian's knowledge the minor has not unlawfully consumed alcohol or drugs for at least a one-year consecutive period during the suspension period imposed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(4): When the Department of Public Safety receives the arrest or conviction record of an individual for a driving offense committed while the individual's license is suspended pursuant to this section, the Department of Public Safety shall extend the suspension for an additional like period of time.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-411(5): A court may not fail to enter a judgment of conviction under this section under a plea in abeyance agreement.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-412 Unlawful purchase by intoxicated person.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
A person may not purchase an alcoholic product if the person is intoxicated.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-413 Unlawful purchase by interdicted person.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
A person may not purchase or possess an alcoholic product if that person is an interdicted person, except:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-413(1): under an order of a health care practitioner who is authorized by law to write a prescription; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-413(2): when administered by a hospital or health care practitioner authorized by law to administer the alcoholic product for medicinal purposes.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-414 Unlawful possession -- Exceptions.
------------------------------------------------------------------
A person may not possess liquor within this state unless authorized by this title or the rules of the commission, except that:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-414(1): a person who clears United States Customs when entering this country may possess for personal consumption and not for sale or resale, a maximum of nine liters of liquor purchased from without the United States;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-414(2): a person who enters this state may possess for personal consumption and not for sale or resale, a maximum of nine liters of liquor purchased from without the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-414(3): a person who moves the person's residence to this state from outside of this state may possess for personal consumption and not for sale or resale, liquor previously purchased outside the state and brought into this state during the move;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-414(4): a person who inherits liquor as a beneficiary of an estate that is located outside the state, may possess the liquor and transport or cause the liquor to be transported into the state if the person  provides sufficient documentation to the department to establish the person's legal right to the liquor as a beneficiary; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-414(5): (5) a person may transport or possess liquor if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-414(5)(a): the person transports or possesses the liquor:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-414(5)(a)(i): for personal household use and consumption; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-414(5)(a)(ii): not for:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-414(5)(a)(ii)(A): sale;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-414(5)(a)(ii)(B): resale;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-414(5)(a)(ii)(C): gifting to another; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-414(5)(a)(ii)(D): consumption on premises licensed by the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-414(5)(b): the liquor is purchased from a store or facility on a military installation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-414(5)(c): (5) the maximum amount the person transports or possesses under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-414(5)(c)(i): two liters of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-414(5)(c)(i)(A): spirituous liquor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-414(5)(c)(i)(B): wine; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-414(5)(c)(i)(C): a combination of spirituous liquor and wine; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-414(5)(c)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-414(5)(c)(ii)(A): one case of heavy beer that does not exceed 288 ounces; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-414(5)(c)(ii)(B): one case of a flavored malt beverage that does not exceed 288 ounces.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415 Unlawful bringing onto premises for consumption.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(1): (4); 32B-5-307 Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(1)(a): a retail licensee or person required to be licensed under this title as a retail licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(1)(b): an establishment that conducts a business similar to a retail licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(1)(c): an event where an alcoholic product is sold, offered for sale, or furnished under a single event permit or temporary beer event permit issued under this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(1)(d): an establishment open to the general public; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(1)(e): the capitol hill complex.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(2): (4); 32B-5-307; 63C-9-201; (2)(a); (e) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(2)(a): a retail licensee or a person required to be licensed under this title as a retail licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(2)(b): an establishment that conducts a business similar to a retail licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(2)(c): a single event permittee or temporary beer event permittee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(2)(d): an establishment open to the general public;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(2)(e): 63C-9-201 the State Capitol Preservation Board created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(2)(f): (2)(a); (e) staff of a person listed in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(3): (4)(c)(i)(A) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(3)(a): a location from which the passenger departs in a private vehicle; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(3)(b): the capitol hill complex.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(4): 32B-5-307
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(4)(a): 32B-5-307 A person may bring bottled wine onto the premises of the following and consume the wine pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(4)(a)(i): a full-service restaurant licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(4)(a)(ii): a limited restaurant licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(4)(a)(iii): a bar establishment licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(4)(a)(iv): a person operating under a spa sublicense.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(4)(b): A passenger of a limousine may bring onto, possess, and consume an alcoholic product in the limousine if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(4)(b)(i): the travel of the limousine begins and ends at:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(4)(b)(i)(A): the residence of the passenger;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(4)(b)(i)(B): the hotel of the passenger, if the passenger is a registered guest of the hotel; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(4)(b)(i)(C): the temporary domicile of the passenger;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(4)(b)(ii): the driver of the limousine is separated from the passengers by partition or other means approved by the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(4)(b)(iii): the limousine is not located on the capitol hill complex.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(4)(c): A passenger of a chartered bus may bring onto, possess, and consume an alcoholic product on the chartered bus:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(4)(c)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(4)(c)(i)(A): but may consume only during travel to a specified destination of the chartered bus and not during travel back to the place where the travel begins; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(4)(c)(i)(B): if the travel of the chartered bus begins and ends at:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(4)(c)(i)(B)(I): the residence of the passenger;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(4)(c)(i)(B)(II): the hotel of the passenger, if the passenger is a registered guest of the hotel; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(4)(c)(i)(B)(III): the temporary domicile of the passenger;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(4)(c)(ii): if the chartered bus has a nondrinking designee other than the driver traveling on the chartered bus to monitor consumption; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(4)(c)(iii): if the chartered bus is not located on the capitol hill complex.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(5): A person may bring onto any premises, possess, and consume an alcoholic product at a private event.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(6): (5) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(7): (2); (3); 32B-8-102; 32B-8b-102; (4) The restrictions of Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-415(7)(a): 32B-8-102; 32B-8b-102 the boundary of a resort building, as defined in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-416 Unlawful permitting of consumption by minor.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-416(1): A person may not permit a minor to consume an alcoholic product in a chartered bus or limousine of which the person is the owner or operator.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-416(2): (1) A violation of Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-417 Unlawful possession by licensee or permittee.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Except as authorized by SectionUtah Code Annotated § 32B-4-417(1): the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-417(2): a state store; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-417(3): a package agency.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-418 Unlawful storage.
-------------------------------------------------
It is unlawful for a person to store:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-418(1): liquor on premises for which the person is authorized to sell beer for on-premise consumption, but for which the person is not licensed under this title to sell liquor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-418(2): an alcoholic beverage for sale on premises for which the person is not licensed or otherwise authorized under this title to sell the alcoholic beverage.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-419 Unlawful permitting of intoxication.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-419(1): A person may not permit another person to become intoxicated or an intoxicated person to consume an alcoholic product in:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-419(1)(a): premises of which the person is the owner, tenant, or occupant; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-419(1)(b): a chartered bus or limousine of which the person is the owner or operator.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-419(2): (1) A violation of Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420 Unlawful adulteration.
------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(1): For purposes of this section, "tamper" means to do one or more of the following to the contents of a container:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(1)(a): fortify;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(1)(b): adulterate;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(1)(c): contaminate;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(1)(d): dilute;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(1)(e): change its character or purity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(1)(f): otherwise change.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(2): A person may not, for any purpose, mix or allow to be mixed with an alcoholic product sold or supplied by the person as a beverage any of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(2)(a): a drug;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(2)(b): methylic alcohol;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(2)(c): a crude, unrectified, or impure form of ethylic alcohol; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(2)(d): another deleterious substance.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(3): (3)(b); (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(3)(a): (3)(b) The following may not engage in an act listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(3)(a)(i): a package agent;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(3)(a)(ii): a retail licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(3)(a)(iii): a permittee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(3)(a)(iv): a beer wholesaler licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(3)(a)(v): a liquor warehouser licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(3)(a)(vi): a supplier; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(3)(a)(vii): an importer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(3)(b): (3)(a) A person listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(3)(b)(i): tamper with the contents of a container of alcoholic product as originally marketed by a manufacturer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(3)(b)(ii): refill or partly refill with any substance the contents of an original container of alcoholic product as originally marketed by a manufacturer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(3)(b)(iii): misrepresent the brand of an alcoholic product sold or offered for sale; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-420(3)(b)(iv): sell or furnish a brand of alcoholic product that is not the same as that ordered by a purchaser without first advising the purchaser of the difference.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-421 Unlawful consumption in public place.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-421(1): A person may not consume liquor in a public building, park, or stadium, except as provided by this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-421(2): A violation of this section is a class C misdemeanor.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-422 Unlawful dispensing.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-422(1): (1)(d)(ii) A retail licensee licensed under this title to sell, offer for sale, or furnish spirituous liquor for consumption on the licensed premises, or staff of the retail licensee may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-422(1)(a): sell, offer for sale, or furnish a primary spirituous liquor to a person on the licensed premises except in a quantity that does not exceed 1.5 ounces per beverage dispensed through a calibrated metered dispensing system approved by the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-422(1)(b): sell, offer for sale, or furnish more than a total of 2.5 ounces of spirituous liquor per beverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-422(1)(c): allow a person on the licensed premises to have more than a total of 2.5 ounces of spirituous liquor at a time; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-422(1)(d): (1)(d)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-422(1)(d)(i): (1)(d)(ii) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-422(1)(d)(ii): allow a person on the premises of the following to have more than one spirituous liquor beverage at a time:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-422(1)(d)(ii)(A): a full-service restaurant licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-422(1)(d)(ii)(B): a person operating under a full-service restaurant sublicense;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-422(1)(d)(ii)(C): an on-premise banquet licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-422(1)(d)(ii)(D): a person operating under an on-premise banquet sublicense; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-422(1)(d)(ii)(E): a single event permittee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-422(2): A violation of this section is a class C misdemeanor.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-423 Immunity regarding alcohol consumption offenses when seeking emergency aid for another person.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-423(1): (2) A law enforcement officer may not cite or arrest a person solely because of a person's violation of a provision under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-423(1)(a): the person had requested or acted in concert with another person to request emergency medical assistance for a third party who reasonably appeared to be in need of medical care due to the consumption of alcohol;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-423(1)(b): the officer was responding to the request for emergency medical assistance;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-423(1)(c): the person provided to the officer the person's name and identifying information as requested by the officer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-423(1)(d): the person remained at the location where the third party was located until emergency medical response personnel arrived at the location; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-423(1)(e): the person cooperated with the emergency medical assistance personnel and law enforcement officers at the location.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-423(2): (1); 32B-4-403; 32B-4-409(1); 76-9-701(1) Offenses referred to in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-423(2)(a): 32B-4-403 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-423(2)(b): 32B-4-409(1) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-423(2)(c): 76-9-701(1) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-423(3): (1) An officer who declines to cite or arrest a person while acting in good faith under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-424 Powdered alcohol.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-424(1): As used in this section, "powdered alcohol" means a product that is in a powdered or crystalline form and contains any amount of alcohol.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-424(2): It is unlawful for a person to use, offer for use, purchase, offer to purchase, sell, offer to sell, furnish, or possess powdered alcohol for human consumption.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-424(3): It is unlawful for a holder of a retail license to use powdered alcohol as an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-424(4): 53B-2-101 This section does not apply to the use of powdered alcohol for a commercial use specifically approved by state law or bona fide research purposes by a:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-424(4)(a): health care practitioner that operates primarily for the purpose of conducting scientific research;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-424(4)(b): 53B-2-101 department, commission, board, council, agency, institution, division, office, committee, authority, laboratory, library, unit, bureau, panel, or other administrative unit of the state, including a state institution of higher education listed in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-424(4)(c): private college or university research facility; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-424(4)(d): pharmaceutical or biotechnology company.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-501 Operating without a license or permit.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-501(1): (1)(a); (g) A person may not operate the following businesses without first obtaining a license under this title if the business allows a person to purchase or consume an alcoholic product on the premises of the business:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-501(1)(a): a restaurant;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-501(1)(b): an airport lounge;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-501(1)(c): a business operated in the same manner as a bar establishment licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-501(1)(d): a resort;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-501(1)(e): a business operated to sell, offer for sale, or furnish beer for on-premise consumption;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-501(1)(f): a business operated as an on-premise banquet licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-501(1)(g): a hotel; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-501(1)(h): (1)(a); (g) a business similar to one listed in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-501(2): A person conducting an event that is open to the general public may not directly or indirectly sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product to a person attending the event without first obtaining an event permit under this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-501(3): A person conducting a private event may not directly or indirectly sell or offer for sale an alcoholic product to a person attending the private event without first obtaining an event permit under this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-501(4): A person may not operate the following businesses in this state without first obtaining a license under this title:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-501(4)(a): a winery manufacturer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-501(4)(b): a distillery manufacturer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-501(4)(c): a brewery manufacturer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-501(4)(d): a local industry representative of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-501(4)(d)(i): a manufacturer of an alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-501(4)(d)(ii): a supplier of an alcoholic product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-501(4)(d)(iii): an importer of an alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-501(4)(e): a liquor warehouser; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-501(4)(f): a beer wholesaler.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-501(5): A person may not operate a public conveyance in this state without first obtaining a public service permit under this title if that public conveyance allows a person to purchase or consume an alcoholic product:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-501(5)(a): on the public conveyance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-501(5)(b): on the premises of a hospitality room located within a depot, terminal, or similar facility at which a service is provided to a patron of the public conveyance.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-502 Storing or possessing pursuant to federal stamp.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-502(1): Except as otherwise provided by this title, it is unlawful for a person who holds a stamp issued by the Bureau of Internal Revenue of the United States as a retail dealer in fermented malt liquor, or the person's operator or staff, to possess, hold, or store liquor in or on premises described in the stamp while the stamp remains in effect unless that person is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-502(1)(a): acting for the commission; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-502(1)(b): licensed under this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-502(2): (1) This section may not be construed to prevent a person from possessing and consuming, but not storing, liquor on premises described by the fermented malt liquor stamp, if that person is not:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-502(2)(a): (1) an owner or operator of a retail dealer described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-502(2)(b): a staff member of either the owner or operator.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-503 Tampering with a record.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-503(1): (1)(a) It is unlawful for a person who has custody of a record required to be filed or deposited with the commission or the department under this title to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-503(1)(a): steal, falsify, alter, willfully destroy, mutilate, deface, remove, or conceal in whole or in part that record; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-503(1)(b): (1)(a) knowingly permit another person to take an action described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-503(2): (2)(b); (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-503(2)(a): (2)(b) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-503(2)(b): (1) A person who violates Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-504 Making false statements.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-504(1): (1)(a); 76-8-501
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-504(1)(a): A person who makes a false material statement under oath or affirmation in an official proceeding before the commission or the department is guilty of a second degree felony.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-504(1)(b): (1)(a); 76-8-501 As used in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-504(2): A person is guilty of a class B misdemeanor if that person knowingly:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-504(2)(a): makes a false statement under oath or affirmation in an official proceeding before the commission or the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-504(2)(b): makes a false statement with a purpose to mislead a public servant in performing that public servant's official functions under this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-504(2)(c): makes a false statement and the statement is required by this title to be sworn or affirmed before a notary or other person authorized to administer oaths;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-504(2)(d): makes a false written statement on or pursuant to a record required by this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-504(2)(e): creates a false impression in a record required by this title by omitting information necessary to prevent a statement in them from being misleading;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-504(2)(f): makes a false written statement with intent to deceive a public servant in the performance of that public servant's official functions under this title; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-504(2)(g): submits or invites reliance on a record required under this title which that person knows to lack authenticity.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-504(3): (2) A person is not guilty under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-505 Obstructing a search, official proceeding, or investigation.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-505(1): A person who is in the premises or has charge over premises may not refuse or fail to admit to the premises or obstruct the entry of any of the following who demands entry when acting under this title:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-505(1)(a): a commissioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-505(1)(b): an authorized representative of the commission or department; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-505(1)(c): a law enforcement officer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-505(2): A person who is in the premises or has charge of the premises may not interfere with any of the following who is conducting an investigation under this title at the premises:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-505(2)(a): a commissioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-505(2)(b): an authorized representative of the commission or department; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-505(2)(c): a law enforcement officer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-505(3): Chapter 15, Alcoholic Product Liability Act; 41-6a-502; 41-6a-517 After receiving written notice of an official proceeding or investigation under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-505(4): A person who believes that an official proceeding or investigation is pending or about to be instituted under this title may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-505(4)(a): alter, destroy, conceal, or remove a record with a purpose to impair the record's verity or availability in the proceeding or investigation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-505(4)(b): make, present, or use anything that the person knows to be false with the purpose to deceive any of the following who may be engaged in the proceeding or investigation:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-505(4)(b)(i): a commissioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-505(4)(b)(ii): an authorized representative of the commission or department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-505(4)(b)(iii): a law enforcement officer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-505(4)(b)(iv): another person.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-505(5): (5)(b); (1); (2); (3); (3); 32B-4-404; (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-505(5)(a): (5)(b); (1); (2); (3) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-505(5)(b): (3); 32B-4-404 A violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-505(5)(c): (4) A violation of Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-508 Offering or soliciting bribe, gift, or profits.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-508(1): 67-16-5 If a person sold, sells, offered for sale, or offers to sell an alcoholic product to the commission or department, that person may not offer, make, tender, or in any way deliver or transfer to a commissioner, the director, a department employee, or a law enforcement officer responsible for the enforcement of this title the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-508(1)(a): a bribe;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-508(1)(b): 67-16-5 a gift, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-508(1)(c): a share of profits.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-508(2): 67-16-3; 67-16-5 A commissioner, the director, a department employee, or a law enforcement officer responsible for the enforcement of this title may not knowingly solicit, receive, accept, take, or seek, directly or indirectly, any of the following from a person who sold, sells, offered for sale, or offers to sell an alcoholic product:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-508(2)(a): a commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-508(2)(b): 67-16-3 compensation, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-508(2)(c): 67-16-5 a gift, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-508(2)(d): a loan.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-509 Forgery.
----------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-509(1): 76-6-501; (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-509(1)(a): 76-6-501 A person who with a purpose to defraud the commission or the department, or who with knowledge that the person is facilitating a fraud to be perpetrated by anyone, forges a record required under this title, is guilty of forgery as provided under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-509(1)(b): (1)(a) A violation of Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-601 Unlawful removal from conveyance or diversion of shipment.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-601(1): It is unlawful for a person transporting an alcoholic product, including a motor carrier, in interstate or other commerce intended for, or consigned to, or claimed to be intended for or consigned to a person outside of this state, to remove or to permit a person to remove the alcoholic product or any part of the alcoholic product from the conveyance in which it is carried while within this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-601(2): (1); (1) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-601(3): It is unlawful for a person to receive for storage or another purpose, or to possess an alcoholic product, that is removed from a vehicle or other conveyance in violation of this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-601(4): It is unlawful for a person, including a motor vehicle, to divert to any place within this state, or to deliver to any person in this state, an alcoholic product that is consigned for shipment to any place without this state, unless the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-601(4)(a): first notifies the department in writing at least 24 hours before the intended diversion or delivery; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-601(4)(b): complies with the instructions given by the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-601(5): (2); (4) Upon receiving a notice under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-602 Unlawful transportation.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-602(1): It is unlawful for a person, including a motor carrier, or staff of the person to order or purchase an alcoholic product or to cause an alcoholic product to be shipped, carried, or transported into this state, or from one place to another within this state except as otherwise authorized by this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-602(2): This section does not prohibit a person, including a motor carrier, from:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-602(2)(a): transporting an alcoholic product in the course of export from the state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-602(2)(b): transporting an alcoholic product across any part of this state while in transit pursuant to a bona fide consignment of the alcoholic product to a person outside of this state.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-603 Carriers' records.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-603(1): (1)(b)(ii); (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-603(1)(a): A person, including a motor carrier, transporting an alcoholic product into or within this state shall make and maintain a record in which is entered, immediately on the receipt of an alcoholic product:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-603(1)(a)(i): the name of every person to whom the alcoholic product is consigned;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-603(1)(a)(ii): the amount and kind of alcoholic product received; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-603(1)(a)(iii): the date when the alcoholic product is delivered.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-603(1)(b): (1)(b)(ii); (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-603(1)(b)(i): (1)(b)(ii) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-603(1)(b)(ii): (1)(a) If the consignee is a corporation, partnership, or limited liability company, an agent authorized in writing shall sign the record described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-603(2): (1) A person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-603(3): A record under this section constitutes prima facie evidence of the facts stated in the record and is admissible as evidence in a court proceeding to enforce this title.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-701 Title.
--------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Trade Practices Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(1): 32B-4-703; 32B-4-704
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(1)(a): 32B-4-703 For purposes of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(1)(b): 32B-4-704 For purposes of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(2): (2)(a)(i); (vii)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(2)(a): (2)(a)(i); (vii) "Industry member" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(2)(a)(i): an alcoholic product manufacturer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(2)(a)(ii): a producer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(2)(a)(iii): a supplier;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(2)(a)(iv): an importer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(2)(a)(v): a wholesaler;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(2)(a)(vi): a bottler;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(2)(a)(vii): a warehouser and bottler; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(2)(a)(viii): (2)(a)(i); (vii) for a person described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(2)(a)(viii)(A): affiliates;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(2)(a)(viii)(B): subsidiaries;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(2)(a)(viii)(C): officers;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(2)(a)(viii)(D): directors;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(2)(a)(viii)(E): partners;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(2)(a)(viii)(F): agents;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(2)(a)(viii)(G): employees; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(2)(a)(viii)(H): representatives.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(2)(b): "Industry member" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(2)(b)(i): the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(2)(b)(ii): a commissioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(2)(b)(iii): the director;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(2)(b)(iv): the department; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(2)(b)(v): a department employee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(3): "Product" means an alcoholic product or item associated with an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(4): (4)(a) "Retailer" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(4)(a): the holder of a license or permit issued by the commission or by a local authority to allow the holder to engage in the sale of an alcoholic product to a patron whether for consumption on or off the premises; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-702(4)(b): (4)(a) an agent, officer, director, shareholder, partner, or employee of a holder described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703 Exclusive outlets.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(1): It is unlawful for an industry member, directly or indirectly, or through an affiliate, to require, by agreement or otherwise, that the department or a retailer purchase a product from the industry member or the department to the exclusion in whole or in part of a product that is sold or offered for sale by another person.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(2): (1); (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(2)(a): (1) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(2)(a)(i): one or more industry members; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(2)(a)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(2)(a)(ii)(A): the department; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(2)(a)(ii)(B): one or more retailers.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(2)(b): (1) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(3): (1) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(4): (1); (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(4)(a): (1) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(4)(b): (4)(a) Examples of a contract or agreement described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(4)(b)(i): an advertising contract between an industry member and a retailer with the express or implied requirement of the purchase of the advertiser's product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(4)(b)(ii): a sales contract awarded on a competitive bid basis that has the effect of prohibiting the department or retailer from purchasing from another industry member by:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(4)(b)(ii)(A): requiring that the retailer purchase a product or line of products exclusively from the industry member for the period of the agreement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(4)(b)(ii)(B): requiring that the retailer purchase a specific or minimum quantity during the period of the agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(5): (1); (5); (5)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(5)(a): (1) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(5)(b): (5) This Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(5)(c): (5) Examples of a contract, agreement, or other arrangement described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(5)(c)(i): a contract, agreement, or arrangement:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(5)(c)(i)(A): with a third party, such as a ball club or municipal or private corporation, that is not a retailer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(5)(c)(i)(B): under which the third party leases the concession rights and is able to control the purchasing decisions of a retailer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(5)(c)(i)(C): that requires the retailer to purchase the industry member's product to the exclusion in whole or in part of a product sold or offered for sale by another person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(5)(c)(ii): a contract, agreement, or arrangement with a third party nonretailer that requires a retailer to purchase the industry member's product to the exclusion in whole or in part of a product sold or offered for sale by another person in return for which the third party provides a service or other thing of value such as:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(5)(c)(ii)(A): sponsoring radio or television broadcasting;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(5)(c)(ii)(B): paying for advertising; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-703(5)(c)(ii)(C): providing other services or things of value.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704 Tied house -- Prohibitions.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(1)(a): It is unlawful for an industry member, directly or indirectly, or through an affiliate, to induce a retailer to purchase an alcoholic product from the industry member or from the department to the exclusion in whole or in part of a product sold or offered for sale by another person by acquiring or holding an interest in a license with respect to the premises of a retailer, except when the license is held by a retailer that is completely owned by the industry member.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(1)(b): Interest in a retail license includes an interest acquired by a corporate official, partner, employee, or other representative of the industry member.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(1)(c): An interest in a retail license acquired by a separate corporation in which the industry member or the industry member's officials hold ownership or are otherwise affiliated is an interest in a retail license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(1)(d): (1)(a) Less than complete ownership of a retail business by an industry member constitutes an interest in a retail license within the meaning of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(2)(a): It is unlawful for an industry member, directly or indirectly, or through an affiliate, to induce a retailer to purchase an alcoholic product from the industry member or from the department to the exclusion in whole or in part of a product sold or offered for sale by another person by acquiring an interest in real or personal property owned, occupied, or used by the retailer in the conduct of the retailer's business.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(2)(b): (2)(a) For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(2)(b)(i): "interest" does not include complete ownership of a retail business by an industry member;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(2)(b)(ii): interest in retail property includes an interest acquired by a corporate official, partner, employee, or other representative of the industry member;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(2)(b)(iii): any interest in a retail license acquired by a separate corporation in which the industry member or its officials hold ownership or are otherwise affiliated is an interest in the retailer's property;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(2)(b)(iv): less than complete ownership of a retail business by an industry member constitutes an interest in retail property;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(2)(b)(v): the acquisition of a mortgage on a retailer's real or personal property by an industry member constitutes an interest in the retailer's property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(2)(b)(vi): the renting of display space by an industry member at a retail establishment constitutes an interest in the retailer's property.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(3): 32B-4-705; (3); (3)(b)(i); 32B-4-705; 32B-4-705; (3)(a); (3)(a); (3)(a); (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(3)(a): 32B-4-705 Subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(3)(b): (3); (3)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(3)(b)(i): (3) For purposes of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(3)(b)(i)(A): furnishing a thing of value to a third party when the benefit resulting from the thing of value flows to an individual retailer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(3)(b)(i)(B): making a payment for advertising to a retailer association or a display company when the resulting benefits flow to an individual retailer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(3)(b)(ii): (3)(b)(i) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(3)(b)(ii)(A): the thing of value is furnished to a retailer by the third party without the knowledge or intent of the industry member; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(3)(b)(ii)(B): the industry member does not reasonably foresee that the thing of value would be furnished to a retailer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(3)(c): 32B-4-705 Anything that may lawfully be furnished, given, rented, lent, or sold by industry members to retailers under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(3)(d): 32B-4-705; (3)(a); (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(3)(d)(i): 32B-4-705; (3)(a) A transaction in which equipment is sold to a retailer by an industry member, except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(3)(d)(ii): (3)(a) The negotiation by an industry member of a special price to a retailer for equipment from an equipment company is the furnishing of a thing of value within the meaning of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(3)(e): (3)(a) The furnishing of free warehousing by delaying delivery of an alcoholic product beyond the time that payment for the product is received, or if a retailer is purchasing on credit, delaying final delivery of products beyond the close of the period of time for which credit is lawfully extended, is the furnishing of a service or thing of value within the meaning of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(3)(f): (3)(a) A financial, legal, administrative, or influential assistance given a retailer by an industry member in the retailer's acquisition of the retailer's license is the furnishing of a service or thing of value within the meaning of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(4): It is unlawful for an industry member, directly or indirectly, or through an affiliate, to induce a retailer to purchase an alcoholic product from the industry member or from the department to the exclusion in whole or in part of a product sold or offered for sale by another person by paying or crediting the retailer for an advertising, display, or distribution service:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(4)(a): as defined in and to the extent restricted by 27 C.F.R. Sec. 6.51 through 6.56; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(4)(b): subject to the exceptions:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(4)(b)(i): for newspaper cuts listed in 27 C.F.R. Sec. 6.92; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(4)(b)(ii): for advertising services listed in 27 C.F.R. Sec. 6.98.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(5): It is unlawful for an industry member, directly or indirectly, or through an affiliate, to induce a retailer to purchase an alcoholic product from the industry member or from the department to the exclusion in whole or in part of a product sold or offered for sale by another person by guaranteeing a loan or the repayment of a financial obligation of the retailer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(6): (6)(a); (6)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(6)(a): It is unlawful for an industry member, directly or indirectly, or through an affiliate, to induce a retailer to purchase beer from the industry member to the exclusion in whole or in part of a beer product sold or offered for sale by another person by extending to a retailer credit for a period in excess of 15 days from the date of delivery to the date of full legal discharge from all indebtedness arising from the transaction by the retailer paying cash or its equivalent, unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(6)(a)(i): beer purchased or delivered during the first 15 days of any month is paid for in cash or its equivalent on or before the 25th day of the same month; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(6)(a)(ii): beer purchased or delivered after the 15th day of any month is paid for in cash or its equivalent on or before the 10th day of the next succeeding month.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(6)(b): (6)(a) A first party in-state check is considered cash payment if the check is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(6)(b)(i): honored on presentment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(6)(b)(ii): (6)(a) received under the terms prescribed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(6)(c): (6)(a) An extension of credit for product purchased by an industry member to a retailer whose account is in arrears does not constitute a violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(7): (7)(b); (7)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(7)(a): It is unlawful for an industry member, directly or indirectly, or through an affiliate, to induce a retailer to purchase an alcoholic product from the industry member or from the department to the exclusion in whole or in part of a product sold or offered for sale by another person by requiring:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(7)(a)(i): the department to take and dispose of a certain quota of a product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(7)(a)(ii): a beer retailer to take and dispose of a certain quota of a beer product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(7)(b): (7)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(7)(b)(i): It is an unlawful means to induce to require:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(7)(b)(i)(A): the department to purchase one product in order to purchase another product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(7)(b)(i)(B): a beer retailer to purchase one beer product in order to purchase another beer product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(7)(b)(ii): (7)(b) This Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(7)(b)(ii)(A): the requirement to take a minimum quantity of a product in standard packaging in order to obtain the same product in some type of premium container such as:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(7)(b)(ii)(A)(I): a distinctive decanter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(7)(b)(ii)(A)(II): a wooden or tin box; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(7)(b)(ii)(B): combination sales if one or more products may be purchased only in combination with another product and not individually.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(7)(c): (7) This Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(7)(c)(i): has the option of purchasing either product at the usual price; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(7)(c)(ii): is not required to purchase a product the department or beer retailer does not want.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(7)(d): An industry member may package and distribute an alcoholic product in combination with other nonalcoholic items.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-704(7)(e): A combination package shall be designed to be delivered intact to the consumer and the additional cost incurred by the industry member shall be included in the cost to the department or beer retailer.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705 Exclusions from tied house prohibitions.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(1): 32B-4-704(3) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(1)(a): this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(1)(b): the applicable federal laws cited in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(2): The following may be furnished by an industry member:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(2)(a): a product display as provided in 27 C.F.R. Sec. 6.83;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(2)(b): point of sale advertising material or a consumer advertising specialty as provided in 27 C.F.R. Sec. 6.84;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(2)(c): a thing of value to a temporary retailer to the extent allowed in 27 C.F.R. Sec. 6.85;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(2)(d): equipment and supplies as provided in 27 C.F.R. Sec. 6.88;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(2)(e): combination packaging as provided in 27 C.F.R. Sec. 6.93;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(2)(f): an educational seminar as provided in 27 C.F.R. Sec. 6.94;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(2)(g): a consumer promotion as provided in 27 C.F.R. Sec. 6.96;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(2)(h): an advertising service as provided in 27 C.F.R. Sec. 6.98;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(2)(i): stocking, rotation, and pricing service as provided in 27 C.F.R. Sec. 6.99;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(2)(j): merchandise as provided in 27 C.F.R. Sec. 6.101; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(2)(k): an outside sign as provided in 27 C.F.R. Sec. 6.102.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(3): The following exceptions provided in federal law are not applicable:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(3)(a): the exception for a sample as provided in 27 C.F.R. Sec. 6.91;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(3)(b): the exception for a consumer tasting or sampling at a retail establishment as provided in 27 C.F.R. Sec. 6.95; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(3)(c): the exception for participation in a retailer association activity provided in 27 C.F.R. Sec. 6.100.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(4): To the extent required by 27 C.F.R. Sec. 6.81(b) an industry member shall maintain a record:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(4)(a): of an item furnished to a retailer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(4)(b): on the premises of the industry member; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(4)(c): for a three-year period.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5): (5)(c)(i); (5)(g); (5) A sample of liquor may be provided to the department under the following conditions:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(a): With the department's permission, an industry member may submit a department sample to the department for product testing, analysis, and sampling.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(b): No more than two department samples of a particular type, vintage, and production lot of a particular branded product may be submitted to the department for department testing, analysis, and sampling within a consecutive 120-day period.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(c): (5)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(c)(i): A department sample may not exceed 1 liter.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(c)(ii): (5)(c)(i) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(c)(ii)(A): wine;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(c)(ii)(B): heavy beer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(c)(ii)(C): a flavored malt beverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(d): A department sample submitted to the department:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(d)(i): shall be shipped prepaid by the industry member by common carrier; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(d)(ii): may not be shipped by United States mail directly to the department's central administrative warehouse office.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(e): A department sample may not be shipped to any other location within the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(f): The industry member shall submit with a department sample submitted to the department a letter from the industry member that clearly:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(f)(i): identifies the product as a "department sample"; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(f)(ii): states the FOB case price of the product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(g): (5)(g)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(g)(i): The department may transfer a listed item from current stock:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(g)(i)(A): for use as a comparison control sample; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(g)(i)(B): to verify product spoilage as considered appropriate.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(g)(ii): (5)(g) The department shall charge back a sample transferred under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(h): The department shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(h)(i): account for, label, and record a department sample received or transferred;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(h)(ii): account for the department sample's disposition; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(h)(iii): maintain a record of the sample and its disposition for a two-year period.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(i): The department shall affix to each container of a department sample a label clearly identifying the product as a "department sample."
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(j): The department shall dispose of a department sample delivered to the department or transferred from the department's current stock in one of the following ways as chosen by the department:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(j)(i): test and analyze the department sample, with the remaining contents destroyed under controlled and audited conditions established by the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(j)(ii): destroy the entire contents of the department sample under controlled and audited conditions established by the department; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(j)(iii): add the department sample to the inventory of the department for sale to the public.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(k): A person other than an authorized department official may not be in possession of a department sample except as otherwise provided.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(l): (5) The department shall handle a liquor item received by the department from a supplier that is not designated as a sample by the supplier, but that is an item not specifically listed on a department purchase order, in accordance with this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(m): The department may not use its money to pay freight or charges on a sample or a liquor item:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(m)(i): shipped to the department by a supplier; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(5)(m)(ii): not listed on a department purchase order.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(6): (6) A sample of beer may be provided by a beer industry member to a retailer under the conditions listed in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(6)(a): A sample of beer may be provided by an industry member only to a retailer who has not purchased the brand of beer from that industry member within the last 12 months.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(6)(b): For each retailer, the industry member may give not more than three gallons of any brand of beer, except that if a particular product is not available in a size within the quantity limitation, an industry member may furnish the next largest size.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(7): (7); (7)(a)(i)(A); (D); (7)(a) An educational seminar may involve an industry member under the conditions listed in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(7)(a): (7)(a)(i)(A); (D) An industry member may provide or participate in an educational seminar:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(7)(a)(i): (7)(a)(i)(A); (D) involving:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(7)(a)(i)(A): the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(7)(a)(i)(B): a retailer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(7)(a)(i)(C): a holder of a scientific or educational special use permit;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(7)(a)(i)(D): another industry member; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(7)(a)(i)(E): (7)(a)(i)(A); (D) an employee of a person listed in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(7)(a)(ii): regarding a topic such as:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(7)(a)(ii)(A): merchandising and product knowledge;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(7)(a)(ii)(B): use of equipment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(7)(a)(ii)(C): a tour of an alcoholic product manufacturing facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(7)(b): (7)(a) An industry member may not pay the expenses of or compensate a person who is a department employee, a retailer, or a permittee for attending a seminar or tour described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(8): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(8)(a): A liquor industry member may conduct a tasting of a liquor product of the industry member:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(8)(a)(i): for the department, at the department's request; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(8)(a)(ii): for a licensed industry representative, but only at the department's central administrative warehouse office.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(8)(b): A liquor industry member may only use a department sample or industry representative sample when conducting a tasting of the industry member's liquor product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(8)(c): A beer industry member may conduct a tasting of a beer product for a beer retailer either at:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(8)(c)(i): the industry member's premises; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(8)(c)(ii): a retail establishment.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(8)(d): Except to the extent authorized by commission rule, an alcoholic product industry member may not conduct tasting or sampling activities with:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(8)(d)(i): a retailer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(8)(d)(ii): a member of the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(9): A beer industry member may participate in a beer retailer association activity to the extent authorized by 27 C.F.R. Sec. 6.100.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(10): (10)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(10)(a): An industry member may contribute to a charitable, civic, religious, fraternal, educational, or community activity, except the contribution may not be given to influence a retailer in the selection of a product that may be sold at the activity.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(10)(b): (10) An industry member or retailer violates this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(10)(b)(i): the industry member's contribution influences, directly or indirectly, the retailer in the selection of a product; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(10)(b)(ii): a competitor's product is excluded in whole or in part from sale at the activity.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(11): (11)(b); (11)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(11)(a): (11)(b) An industry member may lease or furnish equipment listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(11)(a)(i): the equipment is leased or furnished for a special event;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(11)(a)(ii): a reasonable rental or service fee is charged for the equipment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(11)(a)(iii): the period for which the equipment is leased or furnished does not exceed 30 days.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(11)(b): (11) This Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(11)(b)(i): a picnic pump;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(11)(b)(ii): a cold plate;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(11)(b)(iii): a tub;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(11)(b)(iv): a keg box;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(11)(b)(v): a refrigerated trailer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(11)(b)(vi): a refrigerated van; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(11)(b)(vii): a refrigerated draft system.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(12): (5)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(12)(a): A liquor industry member may assist the department in:

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(12)(b)(i)(B): (5) submit to the department a sample of the liquor industry member's products under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(12)(b)(ii)(B): An industry member is confined to the office area of a state warehouse when the industry member visits a state warehouse unless otherwise approved.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(13)(a): ordering, shipping, and delivering beer merchandise;
