Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(14)(a): solicit an order from a beer retailer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-705(14)(b): (5) submit to a beer retailer a sample of the beer industry member's beer products under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-706 Commercial bribery.
---------------------------------------------------
This section adopts and makes applicable to an industry member, including a beer industry member, doing business in this state, 27 U.S.C. Sec. 205(c) and 27 C.F.R. Sec. 10.1 through 10.54, which make it unlawful for an industry member, directly or indirectly, or through an affiliate, to induce a wholesaler or retailer engaged in the sale of an alcoholic product to purchase the industry member's products, to the complete or partial exclusion of alcoholic beverages sold or offered for sale by other persons, by commercial bribery, or by offering or giving a bonus, premium, compensation, or other thing of value, to any officer, employee, or representative of the wholesaler or retailer.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-707 Consignment sale.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-707(1): This section adopts and makes applicable to an industry member, including a beer industry member, doing business in this state, 27 U.S.C. Sec. 205(d) and 27 C.F.R. Sec. 11.1 through 11.46, which make it unlawful for an industry member, directly or indirectly, or through an affiliate to sell, offer for sale, or contract to sell to any wholesaler or retailer engaged in the sale of an alcoholic product, or for any wholesaler or retailer to purchase, offer to purchase, or contract to purchase any of those products on consignment or under conditional sale or with the privilege of return or on any basis otherwise than a bona fide sale, or where any part of the transaction involves, directly or indirectly, the acquisition by that person from the wholesaler or retailer or that person's agreement to acquire from the wholesaler or retailer other alcoholic beverages, if the sale, purchase, offer, or contract is made in the course of interstate or foreign commerce, or if the person or wholesaler or retailer engages in such practice to an extent so as substantially to restrain or prevent transactions in interstate or foreign commerce in any of those products or if the direct effect of the sale, purchase, offer, or contract is to prevent, deter, hinder, or restrict other persons from selling or offering for sale any of those products to the wholesaler or retailer in interstate or foreign commerce.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-707(2): This section does not apply to a transaction involving solely the bona fide return of merchandise for ordinary and usual commercial reasons arising after the merchandise has been sold.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-708 Unlawful act involving consumers.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-708(1): (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-708(1)(a): It is unlawful for an industry member, directly or indirectly, or through an affiliate, to give away any of its product to a person except for testing, analysis, and sampling purposes by the department or local industry representative licensee to the extent authorized by this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-708(1)(b): (1) This Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-708(1)(b)(i): as part of a promotion of the industry member's product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-708(1)(b)(ii): as a subterfuge to provide a sample to a person for product testing, analysis, or sampling purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-708(2): It is unlawful for an industry member or retailer, directly or indirectly, or through an affiliate, to engage in an advertisement or promotional scheme that requires the purchase or sale of an alcoholic product, or consumption of an alcoholic product, in order to participate in a promotion, program, or other activity.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-708(3): It is unlawful for an industry member or retailer, directly or indirectly, or through an affiliate, to pay, give, or deliver to a person money or any other thing of value, including a rebate, refund, or prize, on the basis of the purchase, display, use, sale, or consumption of an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-708(4): It is unlawful for an industry member or retailer to sponsor or underwrite an athletic, theatrical, scholastic, artistic, or scientific event that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-708(4)(a): overtly promotes the consumption of a product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-708(4)(b): offers a product to the general public without charge; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-4-708(4)(c): takes place on the premises of a school, college, university, or other educational institution.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 32B - Chapter 5 - Retail License Act
****************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Retail License Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201 Application requirements for retail license.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(1): (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(1)(a): Before a person may store, sell, offer for sale, furnish, or permit consumption of an alcoholic product on licensed premises as a retail licensee, the person shall first obtain a retail license issued by the commission, notwithstanding whether the person holds a local license or a permit issued by a local authority.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(1)(b): (1) Violation of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2): 32B-1-202; 32B-5-204; 32B-1-701; Chapter 1, Part 7, Alcohol Training and Education Act To obtain a retail license under this title, a person shall submit to the department:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(a): a written application in a form prescribed by the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(b): a nonrefundable application fee in the amount specified in the relevant chapter or part for the type of retail license for which the person is applying;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(c): an initial license fee:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(c)(i): in the amount specified in the relevant chapter or part for the type of retail license for which the person is applying; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(c)(ii): that is refundable if a retail license is not issued;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(d): written consent of the local authority, including, if applicable, consent for each proposed sublicense;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(e): a copy of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(e)(i): every license the local authority requires, including the person's current business license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(e)(ii): if the person is applying for a principal license, the current business license for each proposed sublicense, except if the local authority determines that the business license for a proposed sublicense is included in the person's current business license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(f): 32B-1-202 evidence of the proposed retail licensee's proximity to any community location, with proximity requirements being governed by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(g): 32B-5-204 a bond as specified by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(h): a floor plan, and boundary map where applicable, of the premises of the retail license and each, if any, accompanying sublicense, including any:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(h)(i): consumption area; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(h)(ii): area where the person proposes to store, sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic beverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(i): evidence that the retail licensee carries public liability insurance in an amount and form satisfactory to the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(j): evidence that the retail licensee carries dramshop insurance coverage of at least:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(j)(i): $1,000,000 per occurrence and $2,000,000 in the aggregate;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(j)(ii): if the retail licensee is a hotel licensee or a resort licensee, $1,000,000 per occurrence and $2,000,000 in the aggregate to cover both the principal license and all accompanying sublicenses; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(j)(iii): if the retail licensee is an arena licensee, $10,000,000 per occurrence and $20,000,000 in the aggregate to cover both the arena license and all accompanying sublicenses.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(k): a signed consent form stating that the retail licensee will permit any authorized representative of the commission, department, or any law enforcement officer to have unrestricted right to enter:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(k)(i): the premises of the retail licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(k)(ii): if applicable, the premises of each of the retail licensee's accompanying sublicenses;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(l): if the person is an entity, proper verification evidencing that a person who signs the application is authorized to sign on behalf of the entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(m): a responsible alcohol service plan;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(n): 32B-1-701; Chapter 1, Part 7, Alcohol Training and Education Act evidence that each individual the person has hired to work as a retail manager, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(2)(o): any other information the commission or department may require.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(3): 32B-1-304 The commission may not issue a retail license to a person who:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(3)(a): 32B-1-304 is disqualified under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(3)(b): is not lawfully present in the United States.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-201(4): 32B-1-202 Unless otherwise provided in the relevant chapter or part for the type of retail license for which the person is applying, the commission may not issue a retail license to a person if the proposed licensed premises does not meet the proximity requirements of Section


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-202 Renewal requirements.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-202(1): A retail license expires each year on the day specified in the relevant chapter or part for that type of retail license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-202(2): 32B-5-302
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-202(2)(a): 32B-5-302 To renew a person's retail license, a retail licensee shall, on or before the day specified in the relevant chapter or part for the type of retail license that the person seeks to renew, submit:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-202(2)(a)(i): a completed renewal application in a form prescribed by the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-202(2)(a)(ii): a renewal fee in the amount specified in the relevant chapter or part for the type of retail license that the person seeks to renew;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-202(2)(a)(iii): a responsible alcohol service plan if, since the retail licensee's most recent application or renewal, the retail licensee:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-202(2)(a)(iii)(A): made substantial changes to the retail licensee's responsible alcohol service plan; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-202(2)(a)(iii)(B): violated a provision of this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-202(2)(a)(iv): 32B-5-302 a certification in a form prescribed by the department of the retail licensee's compliance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-202(2)(b): The department may audit a retail licensee's responsible alcohol service plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-202(3): Failure to meet the renewal requirements results in an automatic forfeiture of the retail license effective on the day on which the existing retail license expires.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203 Commission and department duties before issuing a retail license.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(1)(a): Before the commission may issue a retail license, the department shall conduct an investigation and may hold public hearings to gather information and make recommendations to the commission as to whether a retail license and, if applicable, each accompanying sublicense should be issued.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(1)(b): (1)(a) The department shall forward the information and recommendations described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2): 32B-5-201; 32B-1-304 Before issuing a retail license, the commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(a): 32B-5-201 determine that the person filed a complete application and is in compliance with:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(a)(i): 32B-5-201 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(a)(ii): the specific licensing requirements specified in the relevant chapter or part for the type of retail license for which the person is applying;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(b): 32B-1-304 determine that the person and, if applicable, each of the person's accompanying sublicenses is not disqualified under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(c): consider the locality within which the proposed licensed premises and, if applicable, each proposed sublicensed premises is located, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(c)(i): physical characteristics such as:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(c)(i)(A): condition of the licensed or sublicensed premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(c)(i)(B): square footage; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(c)(i)(C): parking availability; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(c)(ii): operational factors such as:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(c)(ii)(A): tourist traffic;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(c)(ii)(B): demographics;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(c)(ii)(C): population to be served;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(c)(ii)(D): proximity to and density of other state stores, package agencies, and retail licensees; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(c)(ii)(E): the extent of and proximity to any community location;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(d): consider the person's ability to manage and operate a retail license, and if applicable the ability of each individual who will act in a supervisory or managerial capacity for each accompanying sublicense to supervise or manage a sublicense, of the type for which the person is applying, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(d)(i): management experience;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(d)(ii): past retail alcoholic product experience; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(d)(iii): the type of management scheme to be used by the retail licensee or accompanying sublicensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(e): consider the nature or type of retail licensee operation, and if applicable each proposed accompanying sublicensee's operation, of the proposed retail licensee, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(e)(i): the type of menu items that will be offered and emphasized;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(e)(ii): whether the retail licensee or the retail licensee's accompanying sublicensee will emphasize service to an adult clientele or to minors;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(e)(iii): the proposed hours of operation;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(e)(iv): the seating capacity of the premises; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(e)(v): the estimated gross sales of food items; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(2)(f): consider any other factor the commission considers necessary.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(3): The commission shall determine whether an applicant under this section has an adequate kitchen or culinary facilities by considering:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(3)(a): the type of retail license or sublicense for which the person is applying;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(3)(b): the purpose of the proposed retail license or sublicense; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-203(3)(c): the locality within which the proposed licensed or sublicensed premises is located.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-204 Bond for retail license.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-204(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-204(1)(a): A retail licensee shall post a cash bond or surety bond:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-204(1)(a)(i): in the amount specified in the relevant chapter or part for the type of retail license for which the person is applying; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-204(1)(a)(ii): payable to the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-204(1)(b): A retail licensee shall procure and maintain the bond required under this section for as long as the retail licensee continues to operate as a retail licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-204(2): A bond required under this section shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-204(2)(a): in a form approved by the attorney general; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-204(2)(b): conditioned upon the retail licensee's faithful compliance with this title and the rules of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-204(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-204(3)(a): If a surety bond posted by a retail licensee under this section is canceled due to the retail licensee's negligence, the department may assess a $300 reinstatement fee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-204(3)(b): No part of a bond posted by a retail licensee under this section may be withdrawn:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-204(3)(b)(i): during the period the retail license is in effect; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-204(3)(b)(ii): while a revocation proceeding is pending against the retail licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-204(4): (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-204(4)(a): A bond posted under this section by a retail licensee may be forfeited if the retail license is revoked.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-204(4)(b): (4)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205 Conditional retail license.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(1): 32B-1-701; Chapter 1, Part 7, Alcohol Training and Education Act; (3) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(1)(a): 32B-1-701; Chapter 1, Part 7, Alcohol Training and Education Act; (3) "Conditional retail license" means a retail license that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(1)(a)(i): 32B-1-701; Chapter 1, Part 7, Alcohol Training and Education Act conditions the holder's ability to obtain a valid retail license on the person submitting to the department:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(1)(a)(i)(A): a copy of every license or permit the local authority requires for the valid retail license, including the holder's current business license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(1)(a)(i)(B): a bond;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(1)(a)(i)(C): evidence that the person carries public liability insurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(1)(a)(i)(D): evidence that the person carries dramshop insurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(1)(a)(i)(E): 32B-1-701; Chapter 1, Part 7, Alcohol Training and Education Act evidence that each individual the conditional retail licensee has hired to work as a retail manager, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(1)(a)(i)(F): any other information the department or commission may require for licensure; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(1)(a)(ii): (3) provides that the holder will be issued a valid retail license if the holder complies with the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(1)(b): "Valid retail license" means a retail license issued pursuant to this part under which the holder is permitted to sell, offer for sale, furnish, or allow the consumption of an alcoholic product on the holder's licensed premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(2): 32B-1-701; Chapter 1, Part 7, Alcohol Training and Education Act Subject to the requirements of this section, the commission may issue a conditional retail license to a person if the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(2)(a): 32B-1-701; Chapter 1, Part 7, Alcohol Training and Education Act meets each requirement to obtain the retail license for which the person is applying, except a requirement to submit to the department:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(2)(a)(i): a copy of every license or permit the local authority requires for the retail license, including the person's current business license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(2)(a)(ii): a bond;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(2)(a)(iii): evidence that the person carries public liability insurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(2)(a)(iv): evidence that the person carries dramshop insurance coverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(2)(a)(v): 32B-1-701; Chapter 1, Part 7, Alcohol Training and Education Act evidence that each individual the conditional retail licensee has hired to work as a retail manager, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(2)(a)(vi): a menu; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(2)(b): agrees not to sell, offer for sale, furnish, or allow the consumption of an alcoholic product on the conditional retail licensee's licensed premises before obtaining a valid retail license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(3): (3)(b); 32B-5-204; 32B-5-201; 32B-1-701; Chapter 1, Part 7, Alcohol Training and Education Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(3)(a): (3)(b) A conditional retail license becomes a valid retail license on the day on which the department notifies the person who holds the conditional retail license that the department finds that the person has complied with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(3)(b): 32B-5-204; 32B-5-201; 32B-1-701; Chapter 1, Part 7, Alcohol Training and Education Act For a conditional retail license to become a valid retail license, a person who holds the conditional retail license shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(3)(b)(i): 32B-5-204; 32B-5-201; 32B-1-701; Chapter 1, Part 7, Alcohol Training and Education Act submit to the department:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(3)(b)(i)(A): a copy of every license or permit the local authority requires for the retail license, including the person's current business license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(3)(b)(i)(B): 32B-5-204 a bond as specified by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(3)(b)(i)(C): evidence that the conditional retail licensee carries public liability insurance in an amount and form satisfactory to the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(3)(b)(i)(D): 32B-5-201 evidence that the conditional retail licensee carries dramshop insurance coverage as specified in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(3)(b)(i)(E): 32B-1-701; Chapter 1, Part 7, Alcohol Training and Education Act evidence that each individual the conditional retail licensee has hired to work as a retail manager, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(3)(b)(i)(F): any other information the department or commission may require; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(3)(b)(ii): provide to the department evidence satisfactory to the department that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(3)(b)(ii)(A): there has been no change in the information submitted to the commission as part of the person's application for a retail license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(3)(b)(ii)(B): the person continues to qualify for the retail license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(4): (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(4)(a): A conditional retail license expires 18 months after the day on which the commission issues the conditional retail license, unless the conditional retail license becomes a valid retail license before that day.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(4)(b): (4)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(4)(b)(i): has an active building permit related to the licensed premises; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-205(4)(b)(ii): is engaged in a good faith effort to pursue completion within the six-month period.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-206 Seasonal retail license.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-206(1): Chapter 6, Specific Retail License Act If authorized in the relevant part under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-206(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-206(2)(a): A seasonal retail license shall be for a period of six consecutive months.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-206(2)(b): A seasonal retail license issued for operation during a summer time period is known as a "Seasonal A" retail license.  The period of operation for a Seasonal A retail license:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-206(2)(b)(i): begins on May 1; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-206(2)(b)(ii): ends on October 31.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-206(2)(c): A seasonal retail license issued for operation during a winter time period is known as a "Seasonal B" retail license.  The period of operation for a Seasonal B retail license:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-206(2)(c)(i): begins on November 1; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-206(2)(c)(ii): ends on April 30.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-206(3): Chapter 6, Specific Retail License Act In determining the number of each type of retail license that the commission may issue under the relevant part under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-206(3)(a): a seasonal retail license is counted as one-half of one retail license of the specific type of retail license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-206(3)(b): each Seasonal A retail license shall be paired with a Seasonal B retail license of the same type of retail license.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207 Multiple retail licenses on same premises.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(1): As used in this section, "license" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(1)(a): a retail license; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(1)(b): a sublicense.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(2): (3) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(3)(a): The commission may issue and one or more licensees may hold more than one type of license for the same premises if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(3)(a)(i): the applicant or licensee satisfies the requirements for each license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(3)(a)(ii): the types of licenses issued or held are two or more of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(3)(a)(ii)(A): a restaurant license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(3)(a)(ii)(B): an on-premise beer retailer license that is not a tavern;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(3)(a)(ii)(C): an on-premise banquet license or a reception center license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(3)(a)(ii)(D): a hospitality amenity license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(3)(a)(iii): the licenses do not operate at the same time on the same day.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(3)(b): The commission may issue and two or more restaurant licensees may share an area of each restaurant licensee's licensed premises designated for alcoholic beverage consumption, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(3)(b)(i): the applicants or licensees satisfy the requirements for each license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(3)(b)(ii): the only shared premises between the issued or held restaurant licenses is the area for alcoholic beverage consumption.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(3)(c): The commission may issue and two or more licensees may share a kitchen or culinary facilities located in or on one or more of the licensees' licensed premises, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(3)(c)(i): the types of licenses issued or held are two or more sublicenses of a principal licensee:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(3)(c)(i)(A): one of which is an on-premise banquet sublicense; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(3)(c)(i)(B): one of which is a restaurant license that is a sublicense, an on-premise beer retailer sublicense that is not a tavern, or a bar sublicense; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(3)(c)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(3)(c)(ii)(A): the same person applies for or holds each license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(3)(c)(ii)(B): the licensed premises are each owned or leased by the same person and located in the same building; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(3)(c)(ii)(C): the only shared premises between the issued or held licenses is the kitchen or culinary facilities area, including any pathway necessary to transport an item to and from the area.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(4): (3)(a) When one or more licensees hold more than one type of license for the same premises under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(4)(a): measures 8-1/2 inches by 11 inches; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(4)(b): states whether the premises is currently operating as:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(4)(b)(i): a restaurant;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(4)(b)(ii): an on-premise beer retailer that is not a tavern;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(4)(b)(iii): a banquet or a reception center; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(4)(b)(iv): a hospitality amenity.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(5): (3)(b) When two or more restaurant licensees share an area of each restaurant licensee's licensed premises designated for alcoholic beverage consumption in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(5)(a): maintain control over the licensee's patrons; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(5)(b): use a visual marker to clearly identify which licensee served each patron.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(6): (3)(a); (6)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(6)(a): (3)(a) For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(6)(b): (6)(a) For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(6)(b)(i): each shared permanent wall between the premises licensed as a bar or a tavern and the premises licensed as a restaurant measures at least eight feet high;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(6)(b)(ii): the premises for each license has a separate entryway that does not require a patron to pass through the premises licensed as a bar or a tavern to access the premises licensed as a restaurant; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(6)(b)(iii): if a patron must pass through the premises licensed as a restaurant to access the entryway to the premises licensed as a bar or a tavern, a patron on the premises licensed as a restaurant cannot see a dispensing structure on the premises licensed as a bar or a tavern.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(7): Chapter 8, Resort License Act; Chapter 8b, Hotel License Act; (7)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(7)(a): Chapter 8, Resort License Act; Chapter 8b, Hotel License Act The commission may issue more than one type of sublicense to a resort licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(7)(b): (7)(a) A patron may not transport an alcoholic beverage between two sublicensed premises located in the same room in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-207(7)(c): Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary, a minor may momentarily pass through a sublicensed premises that is a bar to reach another location where a minor may lawfully be, if there is no practical alternative route to the location.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301 General operational requirements.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(1): (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(1)(a): A retail licensee and staff of a retail licensee shall comply with this title and the rules of the commission, including the relevant chapter or part for the specific type of retail license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(1)(b): (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act Failure to comply as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(1)(b)(i): a retail licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(1)(b)(ii): individual staff of a retail licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(1)(b)(iii): both a retail licensee and staff of the retail licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(2)(a): If there is a conflict between this part and the relevant chapter or part for the specific type of retail license, the relevant chapter or part for the specific type of retail license governs.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(2)(b): Notwithstanding that this part refers to "liquor" or an "alcoholic product," a retail licensee may only sell, offer for sale, furnish, or allow the consumption of an alcoholic product specifically authorized by the relevant chapter or part for the retail licensee's specific type of retail license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(2)(c): Notwithstanding that this part or the relevant chapter or part for a specific retail licensee refers to "retail licensee," staff of the retail licensee is subject to the same requirement or prohibition.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(3): (3)(b)(i); (iii); (3)(b)(iv); (v); (3)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(3)(a): A retail licensee shall display in a prominent place in the licensed premises the retail license that is issued by the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(3)(b): A retail licensee shall display in a prominent place a sign in large letters that consists of text in the following order:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(3)(b)(i): a header that reads: "WARNING";
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(3)(b)(ii): a warning statement that reads: "Drinking alcoholic beverages during pregnancy can cause birth defects and permanent brain damage for the child.";
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(3)(b)(iii): a statement in smaller font that reads: "Call the Utah Department of Health at [insert most current toll-free number] with questions or for more information.";
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(3)(b)(iv): a header that reads: "WARNING"; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(3)(b)(v): a warning statement that reads: "Driving under the influence of alcohol or drugs is a serious crime that is prosecuted aggressively in Utah."
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(3)(c): (3)(b)(i); (iii); (3)(b)(iv); (v); (3)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(3)(c)(i): (3)(b)(i); (iii); (3)(b)(iv); (v) The text described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(3)(c)(ii): (3)(b) The warning statements in the sign described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(3)(d): The Department of Health shall work with the commission and department to facilitate consistency in the format of a sign required under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(4): 76-10-1101; 76-10-1101; 76-10-1101 A retail licensee may not on the licensed premises:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(4)(a): 76-10-1101; 76-10-1101 engage in or permit any form of gambling, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(4)(b): 76-10-1101 have any fringe gaming device, video gaming device, or gambling device or record as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(4)(c): engage in or permit a contest, game, gaming scheme, or gaming device that requires the risking of something of value for a return or for an outcome when the return or outcome is based upon an element of chance, excluding the playing of an amusement device that confers only an immediate and unrecorded right of replay not exchangeable for value.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(5): Title 58, Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act; 58-37-2; 58-37a-3 A retail licensee may not knowingly allow a person on the licensed premises to, in violation of
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(5)(a): 58-37-2 sell, distribute, possess, or use a controlled substance, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(5)(b): 58-37a-3 use, deliver, or possess with the intent to deliver drug paraphernalia, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(6): (6)(a) Upon the presentation of credentials, at any time during which a retail licensee is open for the transaction of business, the retail licensee shall immediately:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(6)(a): admit a commissioner, authorized department employee, or law enforcement officer to the retail licensee's premises; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(6)(b): (6)(a) permit, without hindrance or delay, the person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(6)(b)(i): the entire premises of the retail licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(6)(b)(ii): the records of the retail licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(7): An individual may not consume an alcoholic product on the licensed premises of a retail licensee on any day during the period:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(7)(a): beginning one hour after the time of day that the period during which a retail licensee may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product on the licensed premises begins; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(7)(b): ending at the time specified in the relevant chapter or part for the retail licensee's specific type of retail license when the retail licensee may first sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product on the licensed premises on that day.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(8): An employee of a retail licensee who sells, offers for sale, or furnishes an alcoholic product to a patron shall wear an identification badge.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(9): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (8) In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(9)(a): (8) related to the requirement described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(9)(b): for dispensing systems and dispensing areas of restaurant licensees, bar licensees, and taverns, establishing standards:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(9)(b)(i): in accordance with the provisions of this title; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-301(9)(b)(ii): prohibiting a dispensing system to remain at a patron's table.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302 Recordkeeping -- Retention.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(1): (1)(a); (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(1)(a): A retail licensee shall make and maintain a record showing in detail:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(1)(a)(i): quarterly expenditures made separately for:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(1)(a)(i)(A): malt or brewed beverages;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(1)(a)(i)(B): liquor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(1)(a)(i)(C): set-ups;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(1)(a)(i)(D): food; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(1)(a)(i)(E): any other item required by the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(1)(a)(ii): sales made separately for:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(1)(a)(ii)(A): malt or brewed beverages;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(1)(a)(ii)(B): set-ups;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(1)(a)(ii)(C): food; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(1)(a)(ii)(D): any other item required by the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(1)(b): (1)(a) A retail licensee shall make and maintain a record required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(1)(b)(i): in a form approved by the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(1)(b)(ii): current for each three-month period.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(1)(c): A retail licensee shall support an expenditure by:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(1)(c)(i): a delivery ticket;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(1)(c)(ii): an invoice;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(1)(c)(iii): a receipted bill;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(1)(c)(iv): a canceled check;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(1)(c)(v): a petty cash voucher; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(1)(c)(vi): other sustaining datum or memorandum.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(1)(d): (1)(a) In addition to a record required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(2): Chapter 15, Alcoholic Product Liability Act; 41-6a-502; 41-6a-517 After receiving written notice of an official proceeding or investigation under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(3)(a): A record of a retail licensee is subject to inspection by an authorized representative of the commission or the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(3)(b): A retail licensee shall allow the department, through an auditor or examiner of the department, to audit the records of the retail licensee at times the department considers advisable.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-302(4): 32B-1-205; 32B-4-505 Sections


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-303 Purchase and storage of an alcoholic product by a retail licensee.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-303(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-303(1)(a): A retail licensee may not purchase liquor except from a state store or package agency.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-303(1)(b): A retail licensee may transport liquor purchased from a state store or package agency from the place of purchase to the licensed premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-303(1)(c): A retail licensee shall pay for liquor in accordance with rules established by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-303(2): (2)(a); (2)(a); 32B-13-301; (2)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-303(2)(a): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-303(2)(a)(i): A retail licensee may not purchase, acquire, possess for the purpose of resale, or sell beer except beer that the retail licensee purchases from:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-303(2)(a)(i)(A): a beer wholesaler licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-303(2)(a)(i)(B): a small brewer that manufactures the beer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-303(2)(a)(ii): (2)(a) Violation of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-303(2)(b): (2)(a); 32B-13-301; (2)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-303(2)(b)(i): (2)(a); 32B-13-301 If a retail licensee purchases beer under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-303(2)(b)(ii): (2)(b) Violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-303(3): A retail licensee may not store, sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product in a place other than as designated in the retail licensee's application, unless the retail licensee first applies for and receives approval from the department for a change of location within the licensed premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-303(4): A liquor storage area shall remain locked at all times except when:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-303(4)(a): liquor sales are authorized by law; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-303(4)(b): the licensee:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-303(4)(b)(i): inventories or restocks the alcoholic product in the liquor storage area; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-303(4)(b)(ii): repairs or cleans the liquor storage area.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304 Portions in which alcoholic product may be sold.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(1)(a): A retail licensee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish spirituous liquor that is a primary spirituous liquor only in a quantity that does not exceed 1.5 ounces per beverage dispensed through a calibrated metered dispensing system approved by the department in accordance with commission rules adopted under this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(1)(b): A retail license is not required to dispense spirituous liquor through a calibrated metered dispensing system if the spirituous liquor is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(1)(b)(i): a secondary flavoring ingredient;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(1)(b)(ii): used as a flavoring on a dessert; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(1)(b)(iii): used to set aflame a food dish, drink, or dessert.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(1)(c): A retail licensee that dispenses spirituous liquor that is a secondary flavoring ingredient shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(1)(c)(i): designate a location where the retail licensee stores secondary flavoring ingredients on the floor plan the retail licensee submits to the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(1)(c)(ii): clearly and conspicuously label each secondary flavoring ingredient's container "flavorings".
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(1)(d): A patron may have no more than 2.5 ounces of spirituous liquor at a time.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(2): (2)(a); (b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(2)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(2)(a)(i): A retail licensee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish wine by the glass or in an individual portion that does not exceed 5 ounces per glass or individual portion.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(2)(a)(ii): A retail licensee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish an individual portion of wine to a patron in more than one glass if the total amount of wine does not exceed 5 ounces.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(2)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(2)(b)(i): A retail licensee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish wine in a container not exceeding 1.5 liters at a price fixed by the commission to a table of four or more persons.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(2)(b)(ii): A retail licensee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish wine in a container not to exceed 750 milliliters at a price fixed by the commission to a table of less than four persons.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(2)(c): (2)(a); (b) Notwithstanding Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(3): A retail licensee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish heavy beer in an original container at a price fixed by the commission, except that the original container may not exceed one liter.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(4): A retail licensee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish a flavored malt beverage in an original container at a price fixed by the commission, except that the original container may not exceed one liter.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(5): (5)(a)(ii); (5)(a)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(5)(a): (5)(a)(ii); (5)(a)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(5)(a)(i): (5)(a)(ii) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(5)(a)(i)(A): in an open original container; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(5)(a)(i)(B): in a container on draft.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(5)(a)(ii): (5)(a)(i) A retail licensee may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish beer under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(5)(a)(ii)(A): in a size of container that exceeds two liters; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(5)(a)(ii)(B): to an individual patron in a size of container that exceeds one liter.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(5)(b): A retail licensee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish beer for off-premise consumption:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(5)(b)(i): in a sealed container; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(5)(b)(ii): in a size of container that does not exceed two liters.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-304(5)(c): A retail licensee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish a flight of beer to an individual patron if the total amount of beer does not exceed 16 ounces.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-305 Pricing of alcoholic product -- Other charge.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-305(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-305(1)(a): A retail licensee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish liquor only at a price fixed by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-305(1)(b): A retail licensee may not sell an alcoholic product at a discount price on any date or at any time.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-305(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-305(2)(a): A retail licensee may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product at less than the cost of the alcoholic product to the retail licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-305(2)(b): A retail licensee may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product at a special or reduced price that encourages overconsumption or intoxication.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-305(2)(c): A retail licensee may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product at a special or reduced price for only certain hours of the retail licensee's business day, such as a "happy hour."
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-305(2)(d): A retail licensee may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish more than one alcoholic product for the price of a single alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-305(2)(e): A retail licensee may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish an indefinite or unlimited number of alcoholic products during a set period for a fixed price.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-305(2)(f): A retail licensee may not engage in a promotion involving or offering a free alcoholic product to the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-305(3): 32B-5-307 As authorized by commission rule, a retail licensee may charge a patron for providing:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-305(3)(a): a service related to liquor purchased at the licensed premises; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-305(3)(b): 32B-5-307 wine service performed for wine carried in by a patron in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-306 Purchasing or selling alcoholic product.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-306(1): A retail licensee may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-306(1)(a): a minor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-306(1)(b): a person actually, apparently, or obviously intoxicated;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-306(1)(c): a known interdicted person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-306(1)(d): a known habitual drunkard.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-306(2): (2)(a); (b); 32B-5-307
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-306(2)(a): A patron may only purchase an alcoholic product in the licensed premises of a retail licensee from and be served by an individual who is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-306(2)(a)(i): staff of the retail licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-306(2)(a)(ii): designated and trained by the retail licensee to sell and serve an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-306(2)(b): An individual may sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product to a patron only if the individual is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-306(2)(b)(i): staff of the retail licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-306(2)(b)(ii): designated and trained by the retail licensee to sell and serve an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-306(2)(c): (2)(a); (b); 32B-5-307 Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-306(3): The following may not purchase an alcoholic product for a patron:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-306(3)(a): a retail licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-306(3)(b): staff of a retail licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-306(4): After a retail licensee closes the retail licensee's business at the licensed premises, the retail licensee may transfer the retail licensee's inventory of alcoholic product from that premises to another premises licensed under this chapter that is owned by the same retail licensee.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307 Bringing alcoholic product onto or removing alcoholic product from premises.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(1): (3); (4) Except as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(1)(a): a person may not bring onto the licensed premises of a retail licensee an alcoholic product for on-premise consumption;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(1)(b): a retail licensee may not allow a person to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(1)(b)(i): bring onto licensed premises an alcoholic product for on-premise consumption; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(1)(b)(ii): consume an alcoholic product brought onto the licensed premises by a person other than the retail licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(1)(c): a retail licensee may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product through a window or door to a location off the licensed premises or to a vehicular traffic area.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(2): (3); (4); 32B-4-415(5); (2)(a) Except as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(2)(a): a person may not carry from the licensed premises of a retail licensee an open container that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(2)(a)(i): is used primarily for drinking purposes; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(2)(a)(ii): contains an alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(2)(b): (2)(a) a retail licensee may not permit a patron to carry from the licensed premises an open container described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(2)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(2)(c)(i): a person may not carry from the licensed premises of a retail licensee a sealed container of liquor that has been purchased from the retail licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(2)(c)(ii): a retail licensee may not permit a patron to carry from the licensed premises of the retail licensee a sealed container of liquor that has been purchased from the retail licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(3): (3); (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(3)(a): A patron may bring a bottled wine onto the premises of a retail licensee for on-premise consumption if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(3)(a)(i): permitted by the retail licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(3)(a)(ii): the retail licensee is authorized to sell, offer for sale, or furnish wine.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(3)(b): If a patron carries bottled wine onto the licensed premises of a retail licensee, the patron shall deliver the bottled wine to a server or other representative of the retail licensee upon entering the licensed premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(3)(c): (3) A retail licensee authorized to sell, offer for sale, or furnish wine, may provide a wine service for a bottled wine carried onto the licensed premises in accordance with this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(3)(d): (3) A patron may remove from a licensed premises the unconsumed contents of a bottle of wine purchased at the licensed premises, or brought onto the licensed premises in accordance with this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(4): Neither a patron nor a retail licensee violates this section if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(4)(a): the patron is in shared seating; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(4)(b): the patron purchased the patron's alcoholic beverage from a restaurant licensee whose licensed premises include the shared seating area the patron is in.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(5)(a): A patron may carry from a retail licensee's licensed premises a sealed container of beer that has been purchased from the retail licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-307(5)(b): A retail licensee may permit a patron to carry from the retail licensee's licensed premises a sealed container of beer that has been purchased from the retail licensee.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-308 Requirements on staff or others on premises -- Employing a minor.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-308(1): Staff of a retail licensee, while on duty, may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-308(1)(a): consume an alcoholic product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-308(1)(b): be intoxicated.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-308(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-308(2)(a): A retail licensee may not employ a minor to sell, offer for sale, furnish, or dispense an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-308(2)(b): (2)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-308(3): A full-service restaurant licensee, limited-service restaurant licensee, or beer-only restaurant licensee may employ a minor who is at least 16 years of age to bus tables, including containers that contain an alcoholic product.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309 Ceasing operation.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309(1): (8) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309(1)(a): the retail licensee notifies the department in writing at least seven days before the day on which the retail licensee closes or ceases operation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309(1)(b): the closure or cessation of operation is first approved by the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309(2): (1) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309(3): (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309(3)(a): The department may authorize an initial closure or cessation of operation of a retail licensee for a period not to exceed 60 days.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309(3)(b): (3)(a) Upon written request of the retail licensee and a showing of good cause, the department may extend the initial period described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309(3)(b)(i): 30 days; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309(3)(b)(ii): the number of days until the day on which the commission holds the commission's next regularly scheduled meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309(4): (3) A closure or cessation of operation may not exceed the time limits described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309(5): A notice required under this section shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309(5)(a): the dates of closure or cessation of operation;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309(5)(b): the reason for the closure or cessation of operation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309(5)(c): the date on which the retail licensee will reopen or resume operation.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309(6): If a retail licensee fails to provide notice and to obtain department approval before closure or cessation of operation, the commission may:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309(6)(a): suspend, revoke, or deem forfeited the retail license; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309(6)(b): deem the unused portion of the retail license fee for the remainder of the retail license year forfeited.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309(7): (3); (4) If a retail licensee fails to reopen or resume operation by the date approved under Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309(7)(a): suspend, revoke, or deem forfeited the retail license; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309(7)(b): deem the unused portion of the retail license fee for the remainder of the retail license year forfeited.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309(8): This section does not apply to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309(8)(a): an on-premise beer retailer who is not a tavern;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309(8)(b): an airport lounge licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309(8)(c): a hospitality amenity licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-309(9): For purposes of this section, the department may not base a determination that a retail licensee has ceased operation solely upon the retail licensee's lack of sales.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311 Use of breathalyzers.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(1): 7-16a-102 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(1)(a): "Breathalyzer" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(1)(a)(i): a device that uses electromechanical fuel cell sensor technology in the blood alcohol content testing process; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(1)(a)(ii): a single-use, disposable alcohol breath tester that is cleared with the United States Food and Drug Administration as a Class 1 medical device with at least 99.8% accuracy and having a detection cut-off of 0.08 relative percent blood alcohol concentration.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(1)(b): "Calibration" means the manual setting of specific levels on a breathalyzer by a person trained to reset the device to ensure as accurate results as possible.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(1)(c): 7-16a-102
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(1)(c)(i): "Financial transaction card" means a card, code, or other means of access to a person's account issued to a person that allows the person to obtain, purchase, or receive goods, services, money, or anything else of value.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(1)(c)(ii): 7-16a-102 "Financial transaction card" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(1)(c)(ii)(A): a credit card;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(1)(c)(ii)(B): a credit plate;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(1)(c)(ii)(C): a bank services card;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(1)(c)(ii)(D): a banking card;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(1)(c)(ii)(E): a check guarantee card;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(1)(c)(ii)(F): a debit card;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(1)(c)(ii)(G): a telephone credit card; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(1)(c)(ii)(H): 7-16a-102 a device for access as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(2): (1)(a)(i) If a retail licensee voluntarily installs, or sells or otherwise provides, a breathalyzer on its premises:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(2)(a): the breathalyzer may not store financial transaction card data or associate breathalyzer results with financial transaction card data;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(2)(b): (1)(a)(i) for a breathalyzer described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(2)(b)(i): the breathalyzer shall collect data that can be downloaded by a third-party that performs the calibration of the breathalyzer, except that the downloaded information may not be used for any purpose other than calibration;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(2)(b)(ii): the retail licensee shall ensure that a breathalyzer installed inside of the licensed premises is calibrated by a third-party the sooner of every:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(2)(b)(ii)(A): 30 days; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(2)(b)(ii)(B): 300 uses;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(2)(b)(iii): the owner of the breathalyzer shall annually report to the department compliance with the calibration requirements of this section for the breathalyzer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(2)(b)(iv): the breathalyzer may be able to be shut down remotely; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(2)(c): the retail licensee shall post in a conspicuous location by the breathalyzer:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(2)(c)(i): a notice to the user of the breathalyzer that the timing of when a breathalyzer test is taken may affect the results of the breathalyzer test; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(2)(c)(ii): a notice that states: "The National Transportation Safety Board has found that crash risk is consistently and significantly elevated by the time an individual reaches a blood alcohol content of 0.05."
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(3): Data from a breathalyzer installed in the licensed premises of, or sold or otherwise provided by, a retail licensee may not be used for enforcement purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-5-311(4): (1)(a)(i); (1)(a)(ii) If a retail licensee or owner of the breathalyzer violates this section, the department may require the retail licensee to remove the installed breathalyzer described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated - Title 32B - Chapter 6 - Specific Retail License Act
*************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Specific Retail License Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
Reserved

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-201 Title.
--------------------------------------
This part is known as "Full-service Restaurant License."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-202 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-202(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-202(1)(a): "Dining area" means an area in the licensed premises of a full-service restaurant licensee that is primarily used for the service and consumption of food by one or more patrons.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-202(1)(b): "Dining area" does not include a dispensing area.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-202(2): (2)(b); Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act; Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act; (2)(a)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-202(2)(a): (2)(b); Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act; Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act "Dispensing area" means an area in the licensed premises of a full-service restaurant licensee where a dispensing structure is located and that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-202(2)(a)(i): is physically separated from the dining area and any waiting area by a structure or other barrier that prevents a patron seated in the dining area or a waiting area from viewing the dispensing of alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-202(2)(a)(ii): (2)(b) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-202(2)(a)(iii): Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act; Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act is physically separated from the dining area and any waiting area by a permanent physical structure that complies with the provisions of
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-202(2)(a)(iii)(A): at least 42 inches high; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-202(2)(a)(iii)(B): at least 60 inches from the inside edge of the barrier to the nearest edge of the dispensing structure.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-202(2)(b): (2)(a)(ii) "Dispensing area" does not include any area described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-202(3): 32B-6-404.1; (2)(a)(ii) "Small full-service restaurant licensee" means a converted full-service restaurant licensee as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-202(3)(a): (2)(a)(ii) when measured in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-202(3)(b): based on the licensee's floor plan on file with the department on July 1, 2017.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-202(4): "Waiting area" includes a lobby.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-203 Commission's power to issue full-service restaurant license.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-203(1): Before a person may store, sell, offer for sale, furnish, or allow the consumption of an alcoholic product on its premises as a full-service restaurant, the person shall first obtain a full-service restaurant license from the commission in accordance with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-203(2): The commission may issue a full-service restaurant license to establish full-service restaurant licensed premises at places and in numbers the commission considers proper for the storage, sale, offer for sale, furnishing, and consumption of an alcoholic product on premises operated as a full-service restaurant.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-203(3): 32B-1-201; 32B-5-206 Subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-203(3)(a): the commission may not issue a total number of full-service restaurant licenses that at any time exceeds the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-203(3)(a)(i): 30; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-203(3)(a)(ii): the number determined by dividing the population of the state by 4,467;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-203(3)(b): 32B-5-206 the commission may issue a seasonal full-service restaurant license in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-203(3)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-203(3)(c)(i): if the location, design, and construction of a hotel may require more than one full-service restaurant sales location within the hotel to serve the public convenience, the commission may authorize the sale, offer for sale, or furnishing of an alcoholic product at as many as three full-service restaurant locations within the hotel under one full-service restaurant license if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-203(3)(c)(i)(A): the hotel has a minimum of 150 guest rooms; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-203(3)(c)(i)(B): the locations under the full-service restaurant license are:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-203(3)(c)(i)(B)(I): within the same hotel; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-203(3)(c)(i)(B)(II): on premises that are managed or operated, and owned or leased, by the full-service restaurant licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-203(3)(c)(ii): except for a hotel, a facility shall have a separate full-service restaurant license for each full-service restaurant where an alcoholic product is sold, offered for sale, or furnished.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-203(4): 32B-1-202; 32B-1-202(2) Except as otherwise provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-203(5): To be licensed as a full-service restaurant, a person shall maintain at least 70% of the restaurant's gross revenues from the sale of food, which does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-203(5)(a): mix for an alcoholic product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-203(5)(b): a service charge.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-204 Specific licensing requirements for full-service restaurant license.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-204(1): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process To obtain a full-service restaurant license a person shall comply with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-204(2): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-204(2)(a): A full-service restaurant license expires on October 31 of each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-204(2)(b): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process To renew a person's full-service restaurant license, a person shall comply with the renewal requirements of
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-204(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-204(3)(a): The nonrefundable application fee for a full-service restaurant license is $330.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-204(3)(b): The initial license fee for a full-service restaurant license is $2,200.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-204(3)(c): The renewal fee for a full-service restaurant license is $1,650.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-204(4): The bond amount required for a full-service restaurant license is the penal sum of $10,000.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2 Specific operational requirements for a full-service restaurant license -- On and after July 1, 2018, or July 1, 2022.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(1): Chapter 5, Part 3, Retail Licensee Operational Requirements; (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(1)(a): Chapter 5, Part 3, Retail Licensee Operational Requirements In addition to complying with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(1)(b): (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act Failure to comply with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(1)(b)(i): a full-service restaurant licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(1)(b)(ii): individual staff of a full-service restaurant licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(1)(b)(iii): both a full-service restaurant licensee and staff of the full-service restaurant licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(2): (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(2)(a): An individual who serves an alcoholic product in a full-service restaurant licensee's premises shall make a beverage tab for each table or group that orders or consumes an alcoholic product on the premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(2)(b): (2) A beverage tab described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(3): A full-service restaurant licensee may not make an individual's willingness to serve an alcoholic product a condition of employment with a full-service restaurant licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(4)(a): A full-service restaurant licensee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish liquor at the licensed premises during the following time periods only:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(4)(a)(i): on a weekday, during the period that begins at 11:30 a.m. and ends at 11:59 p.m.; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(4)(a)(ii): on a weekend or a state or federal legal holiday or for a private event, during the period that begins at 10:30 a.m. and ends at 11:59 p.m.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(4)(b): A full-service restaurant licensee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish beer at the licensed premises during the following time periods only:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(4)(b)(i): on a weekday, during the period that begins at 11:30 a.m. and ends at 12:59 a.m.; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(4)(b)(ii): on a weekend or a state or federal legal holiday or for a private event, during the period that begins at 10:30 a.m. and ends at 12:59 a.m.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(5): (5)(b); 32B-5-304; (5)(b)(ii)(B); (5)(b)(i); 32B-5-307

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(5)(a)(i): the patron to whom the full-service restaurant licensee furnishes the alcoholic product is seated at:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(5)(a)(i)(A): a table that is located in a dining area or a dispensing area;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(5)(a)(i)(B): a counter that is located in a dining area or a dispensing area; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(5)(a)(i)(C): a dispensing structure that is located in a dispensing area; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(5)(a)(ii): (5)(b) the full-service restaurant licensee confirms that the patron intends to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(5)(a)(ii)(A): order food prepared, sold, and furnished at the licensed premises; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(5)(a)(ii)(B): (5)(b) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(5)(b): 32B-5-304; (5)(b)(ii)(B); (5)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(5)(b)(i): 32B-5-304 While a patron waits for a seat at a table or counter in the dining area of a full-service restaurant licensee, the full-service restaurant licensee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish to the patron one drink that contains a single portion of an alcoholic product as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(5)(b)(i)(A): the patron is in a dispensing area and seated at a table, counter, or dispensing structure; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(5)(b)(i)(B): the full-service restaurant licensee first confirms that after the patron is seated in the dining area, the patron intends to order food prepared, sold, and furnished at the licensed premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(5)(b)(ii): (5)(b)(ii)(B)

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(5)(b)(iii): (5)(b)(i) For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(5)(c): 32B-5-307 Notwithstanding Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(5)(d): A full-service restaurant licensee shall maintain on the licensed premises adequate culinary facilities for food preparation and dining accommodations.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(6): A patron may consume an alcoholic product on the full-service restaurant licensee's licensed premises only if the patron is seated at:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(6)(a): a table that is located in a dining area or dispensing area;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(6)(b): a counter that is located in a dining area or dispensing area; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(6)(c): a dispensing structure located in a dispensing area.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(7)(b): A patron may not have more than one spirituous liquor drink at a time before the patron.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(7)(c): (7)(a) An individual portion of wine is considered to be one alcoholic product under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(8): In accordance with the provisions of this section, an individual who is at least 21 years old may consume food and beverages in a dispensing area.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(9): (9)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(9)(a): (9)(b) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(9)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(9)(b)(i): A minor may be in a dispensing area if the minor is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(9)(b)(i)(A): at least 16 years old and working as an employee of the full-service restaurant licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(9)(b)(i)(B): performing maintenance and cleaning services as an employee of the full-service restaurant licensee when the full-service restaurant licensee is not open for business.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(9)(b)(ii): If there is no alternative route available, a minor may momentarily pass through a dispensing area without remaining or sitting in the dispensing area en route to an area of the full-service restaurant licensee's premises in which the minor is permitted to be.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(10): 32B-5-307(3); (10)(a) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(10)(a): the alcoholic product is dispensed from:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(10)(a)(i): a dispensing structure that is located in a dispensing area;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(10)(a)(ii): an area that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(10)(a)(ii)(A): separated from an area for the consumption of food by a patron by a solid, translucent, permanent structural barrier such that the facilities for the dispensing of an alcoholic product are not readily visible to a patron and not accessible by a patron; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(10)(a)(ii)(B): apart from an area used for dining, for staging, or as a waiting area; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(10)(a)(iii): the premises of a bar licensee that is:

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(10)(b): (10)(a) any instrument or equipment used to dispense alcoholic product is located in an area described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(12): A full-service restaurant licensee may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(12)(a): transfer, dispense, or serve an alcoholic product on or from a movable cart; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.2(12)(b): display an alcoholic product or a product intended to appear like an alcoholic product by moving a cart or similar device around the licensed premises.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-205.4(1)(b): the minor is accompanied by an individual who is 21 years of age or older; and
