Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206 Master full-service restaurant license.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(1)(a): The commission may issue a master full-service restaurant license that authorizes a person to store, sell, offer for sale, furnish, or allow the consumption of an alcoholic product on premises at multiple locations as full-service restaurants if the person applying for the master full-service restaurant license:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(1)(a)(i): owns each of the full-service restaurants;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(1)(a)(ii): except for the fee requirements, establishes to the satisfaction of the commission that each location of a full-service restaurant under the master full-service restaurant license separately meets the requirements of this part; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(1)(a)(iii): the master full-service restaurant license includes at least five full-service restaurant locations.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(1)(b): The person seeking a master full-service restaurant license shall designate which full-service restaurant locations the person seeks to have under the master full-service restaurant license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(1)(c): A full-service restaurant location under a master full-service restaurant license is considered separately licensed for purposes of this title, except as provided in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(2): (1); 32B-6-203(3)(a) A master full-service restaurant license and each location designated under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(3): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(3)(a): A master full-service restaurant license expires on October 31 of each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(3)(b): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process To renew a person's master full-service restaurant license, a person shall comply with the renewal requirements of
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(4): 32B-6-204(3)(b); 32B-6-204(3)(c)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(4)(a): The nonrefundable application fee for a master full-service restaurant license is $330.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(4)(b): 32B-6-204(3)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(4)(b)(i): 32B-6-204(3)(b) The initial license fee for a master full-service restaurant license is $5,000 plus a separate initial license fee for each newly licensed full-service restaurant license under the master full-service restaurant license determined in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(4)(b)(ii): The department may prorate the $5,000 initial license fee based on the number of months out of a year the master full-service restaurant licensee is licensed before the day on which the master full-service restaurant license expires.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(4)(c): 32B-6-204(3)(c) To renew a master full-service restaurant license the master full-service restaurant licensee shall pay a separate renewal fee for each full-service license under the master full-service restaurant license determined in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(5): A new location may be added to a master full-service restaurant license after the master full-service restaurant license is issued if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(5)(a): the master full-service restaurant licensee pays a nonrefundable application fee of $330; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(5)(b): including payment of the initial license fee, the location separately meets the requirements of this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(6)(a): A master full-service restaurant licensee shall notify the department of a change in the persons managing a location covered by a master full-service restaurant license:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(6)(a)(i): immediately, if the management personnel is not management personnel at a location covered by the master full-service restaurant licensee at the time of the change; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(6)(a)(ii): within 30 days of the change, if the master full-service restaurant licensee is transferring management personnel from one location to another location covered by the master full-service restaurant licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(6)(b): A location covered by a master full-service restaurant license shall keep the location's own records on the location's premises so that the department may audit the records.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(6)(c): A master full-service restaurant licensee may not transfer alcoholic products between different locations covered by the master full-service restaurant license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(7): Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act; (7)(a); (b) If there is a violation of this title at a location covered by a master full-service restaurant license, the violation may result in disciplinary action in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(7)(a): the single location under a master full-service restaurant license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(7)(b): individual staff of the location under the master full-service restaurant license; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(7)(c): (7)(a); (b) a combination of persons or locations described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-206(8): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The commission may make rules, in accordance with


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-301 Title.
--------------------------------------
This part is known as "Limited-service Restaurant License."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-302 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-302(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-302(1)(a): "Dining area" means an area in the licensed premises of a limited-service restaurant licensee that is primarily used for the service and consumption of food by one or more patrons.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-302(1)(b): "Dining area" does not include a dispensing area.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-302(2): (2)(b); Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act; Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act; (2)(a)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-302(2)(a): (2)(b); Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act; Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act "Dispensing area" means an area in the licensed premises of a limited-service restaurant licensee where a dispensing structure is located and that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-302(2)(a)(i): is physically separated from the dining area and any waiting area by a structure or other barrier that prevents a patron seated in the dining area or a waiting area from viewing the dispensing of alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-302(2)(a)(ii): (2)(b) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-302(2)(a)(iii): Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act; Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act is physically separated from the dining area and any waiting area by a permanent physical structure that complies with the provisions of
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-302(2)(a)(iii)(A): at least 42 inches high; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-302(2)(a)(iii)(B): at least 60 inches from the inside edge of the barrier to the nearest edge of the dispensing structure.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-302(2)(b): (2)(a)(ii) "Dispensing area" does not include any area described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-302(3): (2)(a)(ii) "Small limited-service restaurant licensee" means a limited-service restaurant licensee that has a grandfathered bar structure whose dispensing area includes more than 45% of the available seating for patrons on the licensed premises, excluding outdoor seating:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-302(3)(a): (2)(a)(ii) when measured in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-302(3)(b): based on the licensee's floor plan on file with the department on July 1, 2017.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-302(4): "Waiting area" includes a lobby.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-303 Commission's power to issue limited-service restaurant license.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-303(1): Before a person may store, sell, offer for sale, furnish, or allow the consumption of wine, heavy beer, or beer on its premises as a limited-service restaurant, the person shall first obtain a limited-service restaurant license from the commission in accordance with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-303(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-303(2)(a): The commission may issue a limited-service restaurant license to establish limited-service restaurant licensed premises at places and in numbers the commission considers proper for the storage, sale, offer for sale, furnishing, and consumption of wine, heavy beer, or beer on premises operated as a limited-service restaurant.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-303(2)(b): A person may not sell, offer for sale, furnish, or allow the consumption of the following on the licensed premises of a limited-service restaurant licensee:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-303(2)(b)(i): spirituous liquor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-303(2)(b)(ii): a flavored malt beverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-303(3): 32B-1-201; 32B-5-206 Subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-303(3)(a): The commission may not issue a total number of limited-service restaurant licenses that at any time exceeds the number determined by dividing the population of the state by 6,817.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-303(3)(b): 32B-5-206 The commission may issue a seasonal limited-service restaurant license in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-303(3)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-303(3)(c)(i): If the location, design, and construction of a hotel may require more than one limited-service restaurant sales location within the hotel to serve the public convenience, the commission may authorize the sale of wine, heavy beer, and beer at as many as three limited-service restaurant locations within the hotel under one limited-service restaurant license if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-303(3)(c)(i)(A): the hotel has a minimum of 150 guest rooms; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-303(3)(c)(i)(B): the locations under the limited-service restaurant license are:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-303(3)(c)(i)(B)(I): within the same hotel; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-303(3)(c)(i)(B)(II): on premises that are managed or operated, and owned or leased, by the limited-service restaurant licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-303(3)(c)(ii): A facility other than a hotel shall have a separate limited-service restaurant license for each limited-service restaurant where wine, heavy beer, or beer is sold, offered for sale, or furnished.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-303(4): 32B-1-202; 32B-1-202(2) Except as otherwise provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-303(5): To be licensed as a limited-service restaurant, a person shall maintain at least 70% of the restaurant's gross revenues from the sale of food, which does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-303(5)(a): mix for an alcoholic product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-303(5)(b): a service charge.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-304 Specific licensing requirements for limited-service restaurant license.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-304(1): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process To obtain a limited-service restaurant license a person shall comply with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-304(2): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-304(2)(a): A limited-service restaurant license expires on October 31 of each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-304(2)(b): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process To renew a person's limited-service restaurant license, a person shall comply with the renewal requirements of
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-304(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-304(3)(a): The nonrefundable application fee for a limited-service restaurant license is $330.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-304(3)(b): The initial license fee for a limited-service restaurant license is $1,275.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-304(3)(c): The renewal fee for a limited-service restaurant license is $750.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-304(4): The bond amount required for a limited-service restaurant license is the penal sum of $5,000.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2 Specific operational requirements for a limited-service restaurant license -- On and after July 1, 2018, or July 1, 2022.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(1): Chapter 5, Part 3, Retail Licensee Operational Requirements; (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(1)(a): Chapter 5, Part 3, Retail Licensee Operational Requirements In addition to complying with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(1)(b): (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act Failure to comply with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(1)(b)(i): a limited-service restaurant licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(1)(b)(ii): individual staff of a limited-service restaurant licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(1)(b)(iii): both a limited-service restaurant licensee and staff of the limited-service restaurant licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(2): (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(2)(a): An individual who serves an alcoholic product in a limited-service restaurant licensee's premises shall make a beverage tab for each table or group that orders or consumes an alcoholic product on the premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(2)(b): (2) A beverage tab described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(3): A limited-service restaurant licensee may not make an individual's willingness to serve an alcoholic product a condition of employment with a limited-service restaurant licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(4)(a): A limited-service restaurant licensee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish wine or heavy beer at the licensed premises during the following time periods only:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(4)(a)(i): on a weekday, during the period that begins at 11:30 a.m. and ends at 11:59 p.m.; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(4)(a)(ii): on a weekend or a state or federal legal holiday or for a private event, during the period that begins at 10:30 a.m. and ends at 11:59 p.m.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(4)(b): A limited-service restaurant licensee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish beer at the licensed premises during the following time periods only:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(4)(b)(i): on a weekday, during the period that begins at 11:30 a.m. and ends at 12:59 a.m.; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(4)(b)(ii): on a weekend or a state or federal legal holiday or for a private event, during the period that begins at 10:30 a.m. and ends at 12:59 a.m.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(5): (5)(b); 32B-5-304; (5)(b)(ii)(B); (5)(b)(i); 32B-5-307
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(5)(a): (5)(b) A limited-service restaurant licensee may not furnish an alcoholic product for on-premise consumption except after:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(5)(a)(i): the patron to whom the limited-service restaurant licensee furnishes the alcoholic product is seated at:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(5)(a)(i)(A): a table that is located in a dining area or a dispensing area;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(5)(a)(i)(B): a counter that is located in a dining area or a dispensing area; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(5)(a)(i)(C): a dispensing structure that is located in a dispensing area; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(5)(a)(ii): (5)(b) the limited-service restaurant licensee confirms that the patron intends to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(5)(a)(ii)(A): order food prepared, sold, and furnished at the licensed premises; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(5)(a)(ii)(B): (5)(b) except as provided in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(5)(b)(i)(A): the patron is in a dispensing area and seated at a table, counter, or dispensing structure; and

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(5)(c): 32B-5-307 Notwithstanding Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(5)(d): A limited-service restaurant licensee shall maintain on the licensed premises adequate culinary facilities for food preparation and dining accommodations.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(6)(a): a table that is located in a dining area or a dispensing area;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(6)(b): a counter that is located in a dining area or a dispensing area; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(6)(c): a dispensing structure located in a dispensing area.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(9)(a): (9)(b) Except as provided in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(9)(b)(i)(A): at least 16 years old and working as an employee of the limited-service restaurant licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(9)(b)(i)(B): performing maintenance and cleaning services as an employee of the limited-service restaurant licensee when the limited-service restaurant licensee is not open for business.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(9)(b)(ii): If there is no alternative route available, a minor may momentarily pass through a dispensing area without remaining or sitting in the dispensing area en route to an area of the limited-service restaurant licensee's premises in which the minor is permitted to be.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(10): 32B-5-307(3); (10)(a) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(10)(a): the alcoholic product is dispensed from:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(10)(a)(i): a dispensing structure that is located in a dispensing area;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(10)(a)(ii): an area that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(10)(a)(ii)(A): separated from an area for the consumption of food by a patron by a solid, translucent, permanent structural barrier such that the facilities for the dispensing of an alcoholic product are not readily visible to a patron and not accessible by a patron; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(10)(a)(ii)(B): apart from an area used for dining, for staging, or as a waiting area; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(10)(a)(iii): the premises of a bar licensee that is:

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(10)(b): (10)(a) any instrument or equipment used to dispense alcoholic product is located in an area described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(12): A limited-service restaurant licensee may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(12)(a): transfer, dispense, or serve an alcoholic product on or from a movable cart; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(12)(b): display an alcoholic product or a product intended to appear like an alcoholic product by moving a cart or similar device around the licensed premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(13): A limited-service restaurant licensee may state in a food or alcoholic product menu a charge or fee made in connection with the sale, service, or consumption of wine or heavy beer, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(13)(a): a set-up charge;

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.2(14)(b): The department shall audit the records of a limited-service restaurant licensee at least once each calendar year.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.4 Small limited-service restaurant licensee -- Exemption.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.4(1): 32B-6-305; 32B-6-305.2; (2) Notwithstanding the provisions of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.4(1)(a): seating in the dispensing area is the only seating available for patrons on the licensed premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.4(1)(b): the minor is accompanied by an individual who is 21 years of age or older; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.4(1)(c): the small limited-service restaurant licensee applies for and obtains approval from the department to seat minors in the dispensing area in accordance with this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.4(2): A minor may not sit, remain, or consume food or beverages at a dispensing structure.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.4(3): (1)(c); 32B-6-302(5); (1)(c) The department shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.4(3)(a): (1)(c); 32B-6-302(5) grant an approval described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-305.4(3)(b): (1)(c) for each application described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306 Master limited-service restaurant license.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(1)(a): The commission may issue a master limited-service restaurant license that authorizes a person to store, sell, offer for sale, furnish, or allow the consumption of an alcoholic product on premises at multiple locations as limited-service restaurants if the person applying for the master limited-service restaurant license:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(1)(a)(i): owns each of the limited-service restaurants;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(1)(a)(ii): except for the fee requirements, establishes to the satisfaction of the commission that each location of a limited-service restaurant under the master limited-service restaurant license separately meets the requirements of this part; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(1)(a)(iii): the master limited-service restaurant includes at least five limited-service restaurant locations.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(1)(b): The person seeking a master limited-service restaurant license shall designate which limited-service restaurant locations the person seeks to have under the master limited-service restaurant license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(1)(c): A limited-service restaurant location under a master limited-service restaurant license is considered separately licensed for purposes of this title, except as provided in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(2): (1); 32B-6-303(3)(a) A master limited-service restaurant license and each location under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(3): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(3)(a): A master limited-service restaurant license expires on October 31 of each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(3)(b): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process To renew a person's master limited-service restaurant license, a person shall comply with the renewal requirements of
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(4): 32B-6-304(3)(b); 32B-6-304(3)(c)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(4)(a): The nonrefundable application fee for a master limited-service restaurant license is $330.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(4)(b): 32B-6-304(3)(b) The initial license fee for a master limited-service restaurant license is $5,000 plus a separate initial license fee for each newly licensed limited-service restaurant license under the master limited-service restaurant license determined in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(4)(c): 32B-6-304(3)(c) The renewal fee for a master limited-service restaurant license is $500 plus a separate renewal fee for each limited-service license under the master limited-service restaurant license determined in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(5): A new location may be added to a master limited-service restaurant license after the master limited-service restaurant license is issued if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(5)(a): the master limited-service restaurant licensee pays a nonrefundable application fee of $330; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(5)(b): including payment of the initial license fee, the location separately meets the requirements of this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(6)(a): A master limited-service restaurant licensee shall notify the department of a change in the persons managing a location covered by a master limited-service restaurant license:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(6)(a)(i): immediately, if the management personnel is not management personnel at a location covered by the master limited-service restaurant licensee at the time of the change; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(6)(a)(ii): within 30 days of the change, if the master limited-service restaurant licensee is transferring management personnel from one location to another location covered by the master limited-service restaurant licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(6)(b): A location covered by a master limited-service restaurant license shall keep its own records on its premises so that the department may audit the records.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(6)(c): A master limited-service restaurant licensee may not transfer alcoholic products between different locations covered by the master limited-service restaurant license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(7): Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act; (7)(a)(i); (ii); (7)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(7)(a): Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act; (7)(a)(i); (ii) If there is a violation of this title at a location covered by a master limited-service restaurant license, the violation may result in disciplinary action in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(7)(a)(i): the single location under a master limited-service restaurant license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(7)(a)(ii): individual staff of the location under the master limited-service restaurant license; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(7)(a)(iii): (7)(a)(i); (ii) a combination of persons or locations described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(7)(b): (7)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act In addition to disciplinary action under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(7)(b)(i): at least 25% of the locations covered by the master limited-service restaurant license have been found by the commission to have committed a serious or grave violation of this title, as defined by rule made by the commission; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(7)(b)(ii): at least 50% of the locations covered by the master limited-service restaurant license have been found by the commission to have violated this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-306(8): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The commission may make rules, in accordance with


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-401 Title.
--------------------------------------
This part is known as "Bar Establishment License."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-402 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
Reserved

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-403 Commission's power to issue bar establishment license.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-403(1): Before a person may store, sell, offer for sale, furnish, or allow the consumption of an alcoholic product on the person's premises as a bar establishment licensee, the person shall first obtain a bar establishment license from the commission in accordance with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-403(2): The commission may issue a bar establishment license to establish bar establishment licensed premises at places and in numbers the commission considers proper for the storage, sale, offer for sale, furnishing, and consumption of an alcoholic product on premises operated by a bar establishment licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-403(3): 32B-1-201; 32B-5-206; (3)(d); (3)(a); (3)(g); (3)(f); (3)(a); (3)(f); (3)(a) Subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-403(3)(a): the commission may not issue a total number of bar establishment licenses that at any time exceeds the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-403(3)(a)(i): 15; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-403(3)(a)(ii): the number determined by dividing the population of the state by 10,200;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-403(3)(b): 32B-5-206 the commission may issue a seasonal bar establishment license in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-403(3)(c): the commission may authorize as many as three bar establishment license locations within a hotel under one bar establishment license if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-403(3)(c)(i): the location, design, and construction of the hotel requires more than one bar license location within the hotel to serve the public convenience;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-403(3)(c)(ii): the hotel has a minimum of 150 guest rooms;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-403(3)(c)(iii): all locations under the bar establishment license are:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-403(3)(c)(iii)(A): within the same hotel; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-403(3)(c)(iii)(B): on premises that are managed or operated, and owned or leased, by the bar establishment licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-403(3)(d): the commission may authorize up to five dispensing structures under one equity license if the locations under the equity license:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-403(3)(d)(i): are connected by a private roadway to which the equity licensee, each member of the equity licensee, and each guest has a legal right of access; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-403(3)(d)(ii): are managed or operated, and owned or leased, by the equity licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-403(3)(e): (3)(d) except for a facility operating in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-403(3)(f): (3)(a); (3)(g); (3)(f); (3)(a) when a business establishment undergoes a change of ownership, the commission may issue a bar establishment license to the new owner of the business establishment notwithstanding that there is no bar establishment license available under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-403(3)(f)(i): the primary business activity at the business establishment before and after the change of ownership is not the sale, offer for sale, or furnishing of an alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-403(3)(f)(ii): before the change of ownership there are two or more licensed premises on the business establishment that operate under a retail license, with at least one of the retail licenses being a bar establishment license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-403(3)(f)(iii): (3)(g); (3)(f) subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-403(3)(f)(iv): (3)(a) the person who is the new owner of the business establishment qualifies for the bar establishment license, except for there being no bar establishment license available under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-403(3)(g): (3)(f); (3)(a) if a bar establishment licensee of a bar establishment license issued under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404 Types of bar license.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(1): (8) To obtain an equity license, in addition to meeting the other requirements of this part, a person shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(1)(a): whether incorporated or unincorporated:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(1)(a)(i): be organized and operated solely for a social, recreational, patriotic, or fraternal purpose;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(1)(a)(ii): have members;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(1)(a)(iii): limit access to its licensed premises to a member or a guest of the member; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(1)(a)(iv): desire to maintain premises upon which an alcoholic product may be stored, sold to, offered for sale to, furnished to, and consumed by a member or a guest of a member;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(1)(b): (8) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(1)(b)(i): a golf course; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(1)(b)(ii): a tennis facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(1)(c): have at least 50% of the total membership having an equal share of the equity of the entity or a right to redemption or refund at the equal value; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(1)(d): if there is more than one class of membership, have at least one class of membership that entitles each member in that class to an equal share of the equity of the entity or a right to redemption or refund at the equal value.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(2): (2)(c) To obtain a fraternal license, in addition to meeting the other requirements of this part, a person shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(2)(a): whether incorporated or unincorporated:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(2)(a)(i): be organized and operated solely for a social, recreational, patriotic, or fraternal purpose;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(2)(a)(ii): have members;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(2)(a)(iii): limit access to its licensed premises to a member or a guest of the member; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(2)(a)(iv): desire to maintain premises upon which an alcoholic product may be stored, sold to, offered for sale to, furnished to, and consumed by a member or a guest of a member;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(2)(b): have no capital stock;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(2)(c): exist solely for:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(2)(c)(i): the benefit of its members and their beneficiaries; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(2)(c)(ii): a lawful social, intellectual, educational, charitable, benevolent, moral, fraternal, patriotic, or religious purpose for the benefit of its members or the public, carried on through voluntary activity of its members in their local lodges;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(2)(d): have a representative form of government;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(2)(e): (2)(c) have a lodge system in which:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(2)(e)(i): there is a supreme governing body;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(2)(e)(ii): subordinate to the supreme governing body are local lodges, however designated, into which individuals are admitted as members in accordance with the laws of the fraternal;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(2)(e)(iii): the local lodges are required by the laws of the fraternal to hold regular meetings at least monthly; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(2)(e)(iv): (2)(c) the local lodges regularly engage in one or more programs involving member participation to implement the purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(2)(f): own or lease a building or space in a building used for lodge activities.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(3): To obtain a dining club license, in addition to meeting the other requirements of this part, a person shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(3)(a): maintain at least the following percentages of its total club business from the sale of food, not including mix for alcoholic products, or service charges:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(3)(a)(i): for a dining club license that is issued as an original license on or after July 1, 2011, 60%; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(3)(a)(ii): for a dining club license that is issued on or before June 30, 2011:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(3)(a)(ii)(A): 50% on or before June 30, 2012; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(3)(a)(ii)(B): 60% on and after July 1, 2012; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(3)(b): obtain a determination by the commission that the person will operate as a dining club licensee, as part of which the commission may consider:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(3)(b)(i): the square footage and seating capacity of the premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(3)(b)(ii): what portion of the square footage and seating capacity will be used for a dining area in comparison to the portion that will be used as a lounge or bar area;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(3)(b)(iii): whether full meals including appetizers, main courses, and desserts are served;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(3)(b)(iv): whether the person will maintain adequate on-premise culinary facilities to prepare full meals, except a person who is located on the premise of a hotel or resort facility may use the culinary facilities of the hotel or resort facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(3)(b)(v): whether the entertainment provided at the premises is suitable for minors; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(3)(b)(vi): the club management's ability to manage and operate a dining club license including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(3)(b)(vi)(A): management experience;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(3)(b)(vi)(B): past dining club licensee or restaurant management experience; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(3)(b)(vi)(C): the type of management scheme used by the dining club license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(4): (1); (2); (3) To obtain a bar license, a person is required to meet the requirements of this part except those listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(5)(a): At the time that the commission issues a bar establishment license, the commission shall designate the type of bar establishment license for which the person qualifies.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(5)(b): If requested by a bar establishment licensee, the commission may approve a change in the type of bar establishment license in accordance with rules made by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(6): To the extent not prohibited by law, this part does not prevent a dining club licensee or bar licensee from restricting access to the licensed premises on the basis of an individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(6)(a): paying a fee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(6)(b): agreeing to being on a list of individuals who have access to the licensed premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(7): (7); (7)(b)(i)(A); (7)(b)(i); 32B-6-404.1; (7); 32B-6-203; 32B-6-403; (7)(a); (b); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (7)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(7)(a): (7)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(7)(a)(i): On or after July 1, 2017, the commission may not issue or renew a dining club license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(7)(a)(ii): (7) No later than July 1, 2018, the department shall convert each dining club license to a full-service restaurant license or a bar license in accordance with the provisions of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(7)(b): (7)(b)(i)(A); (7)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(7)(b)(i): (7)(b)(i)(A)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(7)(b)(i)(A): A person licensed as a dining club on July 1, 2017, shall notify the department no later than May 31, 2018, whether the person elects to be licensed as a full-service restaurant or a bar.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(7)(b)(i)(B): (7)(b)(i)(A) No later than July 1, 2018, the department shall convert a dining club license to a full-service restaurant license or a bar license in accordance with the dining club licensee's election under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(7)(b)(ii): (7)(b)(i) If a dining club licensee fails to timely notify the department in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(7)(c): 32B-6-404.1 Subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(7)(d): (7); 32B-6-203; 32B-6-403 After a dining club license converts to a full-service restaurant license or a bar license in accordance with this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(7)(d)(i): 32B-6-203 the full-service restaurant license is not considered in determining the total number of full-service restaurant licenses available under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-404(7)(d)(ii): 32B-6-403 the bar license is not considered in determining the total number of bar establishment licenses available under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-405 Specific licensing requirements for bar establishment license.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-405(1): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process To obtain a bar establishment license, in addition to complying with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-405(1)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-405(1)(a)(i): a statement as to whether the person is seeking to qualify as:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-405(1)(a)(i)(A): an equity licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-405(1)(a)(i)(B): a fraternal licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-405(1)(a)(i)(C): a dining club licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-405(1)(a)(i)(D): a bar licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-405(1)(a)(ii): evidence that the person meets the requirements for the type of bar establishment license for which the person is applying;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-405(1)(b): evidence that the person operates a premises where a variety of food is prepared and served in connection with dining accommodations; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-405(1)(c): if the person is applying for an equity license or fraternal license, a copy of the entity's bylaws or house rules, and an amendment to those records.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-405(2): The commission may refuse to issue a bar establishment license to a person for an equity license or fraternal license if the commission determines that a provision of the person's bylaws or house rules, or amendments to those records is not:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-405(2)(a): reasonable; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-405(2)(b): consistent with:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-405(2)(b)(i): the declared nature and purpose of the bar establishment licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-405(2)(b)(ii): the purposes of this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-405(3): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-405(3)(a): A bar establishment license expires on June 30 of each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-405(3)(b): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process To renew a bar establishment license, a person shall comply with the requirements of
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-405(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-405(4)(a): The nonrefundable application fee for a bar establishment license is $300.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-405(4)(b): The initial license fee for a bar establishment license is $2,750.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-405(4)(c): The renewal fee for a bar establishment license is $2,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-405(5): The bond amount required for a bar establishment license is the penal sum of $10,000.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406 Specific operational requirements for a bar establishment license.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(1): Chapter 5, Part 3, Retail Licensee Operational Requirements; (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(1)(a): Chapter 5, Part 3, Retail Licensee Operational Requirements In addition to complying with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(1)(b): (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act Failure to comply as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(1)(b)(i): a bar establishment licensee;

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(1)(b)(iii): both a bar establishment licensee and staff of the bar establishment licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(2): 32B-5-301(3) In addition to complying with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(2)(a): measures at least 8-1/2 inches long and 11 inches wide; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(2)(b): clearly states that the bar licensee is a bar and that no one under 21 years old is allowed.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(3)(c): The department shall audit the records of a bar establishment licensee at least once annually.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(4): Part 7, On-Premise Beer Retailer License; (4)(a); (b); (4)(c)(i)(C)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(4)(a): A bar establishment licensee may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish liquor on the licensed premises on any day during a period that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(4)(a)(i): begins at 1 a.m.; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(4)(a)(ii): ends at 9:59 a.m.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(4)(c): (4)(a); (b); (4)(c)(i)(C)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(4)(c)(i): (4)(a); (b); (4)(c)(i)(C) Notwithstanding Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(4)(c)(i)(A): a single drink containing spirituous liquor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(4)(c)(i)(B): (4)(c)(i)(C) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(4)(c)(i)(C): a single serving not exceeding 16 ounces of hard cider that is furnished in a sealed container and contains no more than 5% of alcohol by volume;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(4)(c)(i)(D): a single serving of heavy beer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(4)(c)(i)(E): a single serving not exceeding 26 ounces of beer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(4)(c)(i)(F): a single serving of a flavored malt beverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(4)(c)(ii): A bar establishment licensee is not required to remain open:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(4)(c)(ii)(A): after all patrons have vacated the premises; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(4)(c)(ii)(B): during an emergency.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(5): 32B-6-406.1; 32B-5-308; 32B-5-308; 32B-5-308

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(5)(a)(i)(B): 32B-6-406.1 a bar licensee, except to the extent provided for under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(5)(a)(iii): may not remain or sit in the lounge or bar area of an equity licensee's or fraternal licensee's licensed premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(5)(b): 32B-5-308 Notwithstanding Section

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(5)(d): 32B-5-308 Nothing in this part or Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(6): A bar establishment licensee shall have food available at all times when an alcoholic product is sold, offered for sale, furnished, or consumed on the licensed premises.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(7)(c): (7)(a) An individual portion of wine is considered to be one alcoholic product under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406(12)(b): A bar establishment licensee may not maintain licensed premises in a manner that barricades or conceals the bar establishment licensee's operation.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1 Specific operational restrictions related to dance or concert hall.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(1): (2) A minor who is at least 18 years of age may be admitted into, use, or be on the premises of a dance or concert hall if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(1)(a): the dance or concert hall is located:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(1)(a)(i): on the licensed premises of a bar licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(1)(a)(ii): on the property that immediately adjoins the licensed premises of and is operated by a bar licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(1)(b): (2) the bar licensee holds a permit to operate a dance or concert hall that was issued on or before May 11, 2009:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(1)(b)(i): (2) on the basis of the operational requirements described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(1)(b)(ii): when the bar licensee was licensed as a class D private club.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(2): A bar licensee that holds a dance or concert hall permit shall operate in such a way that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(2)(a): the bar licensee's lounge, dispensing structure, or other area for alcoholic product consumption is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(2)(a)(i): not accessible to a minor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(2)(a)(ii): clearly defined; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(2)(a)(iii): separated from the dance or concert hall area by one or more walls, multiple floor levels, or other substantial physical barriers;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(2)(b): a dispensing structure or area where alcoholic product is dispensed is not visible to a minor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(2)(c): consumption of an alcoholic product may not occur in:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(2)(c)(i): the dance or concert hall area; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(2)(c)(ii): an area of the bar license premises accessible to a minor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(2)(d): the bar licensee maintains sufficient security personnel to prevent the passing of beverages from the bar licensee's lounge, dispensing structure, or other area for alcoholic product consumption to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(2)(d)(i): the dance or concert hall area; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(2)(d)(ii): an area of the bar licensee premises accessible to a minor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(2)(e): there are one or more separate entrances, exits, and restroom facilities from the bar licensee's lounge, dispensing structure, or other area for alcoholic product consumption than for:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(2)(e)(i): the dance or concert hall area; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(2)(e)(ii): an area accessible to a minor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(2)(f): the bar licensee complies with any other requirements imposed by the commission by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(3): (1); (2); (1); (2); (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(3)(a): (1); (2) A minor under 18 years of age who is accompanied at all times by a parent or legal guardian may be admitted into, use, or be on the premises of a concert hall described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(3)(a)(i): (2) the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(3)(a)(ii): signage, product, and dispensing equipment containing recognition of an alcoholic product is not visible to the minor.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(3)(b): (1); (2); (3)(a) A minor under 18 years of age but who is 14 years of age or older who is not accompanied by a parent or legal guardian may be admitted into, use, or be on the premises of a concert hall described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(3)(b)(i): (2); (3)(a) the requirements of Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(3)(b)(ii): there is no alcoholic product, sales, furnishing, or consumption on the premises of the bar licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(4): Title 58, Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act; Title 58, Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act The commission may suspend or revoke a dance or concert permit issued to a bar licensee and suspend or revoke the license of the bar licensee if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(4)(a): the bar licensee fails to comply with the requirements in this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(4)(b): the bar licensee sells, offers for sale, or furnishes an alcoholic product to a minor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(4)(c): Title 58, Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act the bar licensee or a supervisory or managerial level staff of the bar licensee is convicted under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(4)(c)(i): the licensed premises; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(4)(c)(ii): the dance or concert hall that is located on property that immediately adjoins the licensed premises of and is operated by the bar licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(4)(d): Title 58, Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act there are three or more convictions of patrons of the bar licensee under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(4)(d)(i): the licensed premises; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(4)(d)(ii): the dance or concert hall that is located on property that immediately adjoins the licensed premises of and is operated by the bar licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(4)(d)(iii): there is more than one conviction:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(4)(d)(iii)(A): of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(4)(d)(iii)(A)(I): the bar licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(4)(d)(iii)(A)(II): staff of the bar licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(4)(d)(iii)(A)(III): an entertainer contracted by the bar licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(4)(d)(iii)(A)(IV): a patron of the bar licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(4)(d)(iii)(B): made on the basis of a lewd act or lewd entertainment prohibited by this title that occurs on:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(4)(d)(iii)(B)(I): the licensed premises; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(4)(d)(iii)(B)(II): the dance or concert hall that is located on property that immediately adjoins the licensed premises of and is operated by the bar licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(4)(e): the commission finds acts or conduct contrary to the public welfare and morals involving lewd acts or lewd entertainment prohibited by this title that occurs on:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(4)(e)(i): the licensed premises; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(4)(e)(ii): the dance or concert hall that is located on property that immediately adjoins the licensed premises of and is operated by the bar licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-406.1(5): Nothing in this section prohibits a bar licensee from selling, offering for sale, or furnishing an alcoholic product in a dance or concert area located on the bar licensed premises on days and times when the bar licensee does not allow a minor into those areas.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407 Specific operational requirements for equity license or fraternal license.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(1): As used in this section, "equity or fraternal licensee" means an equity licensee or fraternal licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(2): (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(2)(a): An equity or fraternal licensee shall have a governing body that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(2)(a)(i): consists of three or more members of the equity or fraternal licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(2)(a)(ii): holds regular meetings to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(2)(a)(ii)(A): review membership applications; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(2)(a)(ii)(B): conduct other business as required by the bylaws or house rules of the equity or fraternal licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(2)(b): (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(2)(b)(i): An equity or fraternal licensee shall maintain a minute book that is posted currently by the equity or fraternal licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(2)(b)(ii): (2) The minute book required by this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(3): An equity or fraternal licensee may admit an individual as a member only on written application signed by the person, subject to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(3)(a): the person paying an application fee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(3)(b): investigation, vote, and approval of a quorum of the governing body.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(4): An equity or fraternal licensee shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(4)(a): record an admission of a member in the official minutes of a regular meeting of the governing body; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(4)(b): whether approved or disapproved, file an application as a part of the official records of the equity or fraternal licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(5): The spouse of a member of an equity or fraternal licensee has the rights and privileges of the member:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(5)(a): to the extent permitted by the bylaws or house rules of the equity or fraternal licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(5)(b): except to the extent restricted by this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(6): A minor child of a member of an equity or fraternal licensee has the rights and privileges of the member:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(6)(a): to the extent permitted by the bylaws or house rules of the equity or fraternal licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(6)(b): except to the extent restricted by this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(7): An equity or fraternal licensee shall maintain:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(7)(a): a current and complete membership record showing:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(7)(a)(i): the date of application of a proposed member;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(7)(a)(ii): a member's address;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(7)(a)(iii): the date the governing body approved a member's admission;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(7)(a)(iv): the date initiation fees and dues are assessed and paid; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(7)(a)(v): the serial number of the membership card issued to a member;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(7)(b): a membership list; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(7)(c): a current record indicating when a member is removed as a member or resigns.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(8): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(8)(a): An equity or fraternal licensee shall have bylaws or house rules that include provisions respecting the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(8)(a)(i): standards of eligibility for members;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(8)(a)(ii): limitation of members, consistent with the nature and purpose of the equity or fraternal licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(8)(a)(iii): the period for which dues are paid, and the date upon which the period expires;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(8)(a)(iv): provisions for removing a member from the equity or fraternal licensee's membership for the nonpayment of dues or other cause;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(8)(a)(v): provisions for guests; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(8)(a)(vi): application fees and membership dues.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(8)(b): An equity or fraternal licensee shall maintain a current copy of the equity or fraternal licensee's current bylaws and current house rules.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(8)(c): An equity or fraternal licensee shall maintain its bylaws or house rules, and any amendments to those records, on file with the department at all times.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(9): An equity or fraternal licensee may, in its discretion, allow an individual to be admitted to or use the licensed premises as a guest subject to the following conditions:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(9)(a): the individual is allowed to use the equity or fraternal licensee premises only to the extent permitted by the equity or fraternal licensee's bylaws or house rules;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(9)(b): the individual shall be previously authorized by a member of the equity or fraternal licensee who agrees to host the individual as a guest;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(9)(c): the individual has only those privileges derived from the individual's host for the duration of the individual's visit to the equity or fraternal licensee premises; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(9)(d): an equity or fraternal licensee or staff of the equity or fraternal licensee may not enter into an agreement or arrangement with a member of the equity or fraternal licensee to indiscriminately host a member of the general public into the equity or fraternal licensee premises as a guest.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(10): (9) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(10)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(10)(a)(i): the equity or fraternal licensee is an equity licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(10)(a)(ii): the individual is a member of an equity licensee that has reciprocal guest privileges with the equity licensee for which the individual is a guest;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(10)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(10)(b)(i): the equity or fraternal licensee is a fraternal licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(10)(b)(ii): the individual is a member of the same fraternal organization as the fraternal licensee for which the individual is a guest; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(10)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(10)(c)(i): the equity or fraternal licensee is a fraternal licensee that holds the fraternal license on July 1, 2013;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(10)(c)(ii): the equity or fraternal licensee's bylaws permit guests in the equity or fraternal licensed premises without a host except that a minor may not be admitted as a guest without a host; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(10)(c)(iii): the equity or fraternal licensee maintains 60% of its total business from the sale of food, not including mix for alcoholic products, or service charges.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(11): Unless the patron is a member or guest, an equity or fraternal licensee may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(11)(a): sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product to the patron; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(11)(b): allow the patron to be admitted to or use the licensed premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-407(12): A minor may not be a member, officer, director, or trustee of an equity or fraternal licensee.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-408 Information obtained by investigator.
---------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-501 Title.
--------------------------------------
This part is known as "Airport Lounge License."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-502 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter, "total passengers" means the number of total passengers in a calendar year that is reported in the most current comprehensive annual financial report for the airport in which an airport lounge is located.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-503 Commission's power to issue airport lounge license.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-503(1): Before a person may store, sell, offer for sale, furnish, or allow the consumption of an alcoholic product on its premises as an airport lounge licensee, the person shall first obtain an airport lounge license from the commission in accordance with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-503(2): (3) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-503(2)(a): to establish airport lounge licensed premises beyond the security point at an international airport or a domestic airport; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-503(2)(b): in the numbers the commission considers proper for the storage, sale, offer for sale, furnishing, and consumption of an alcoholic product on licensed premises operated as an airport lounge.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-503(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-503(3)(a): The commission may not issue more than 26 airport lounge licenses for an international airport at any time.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-503(3)(b): The commission may not issue a total number of domestic airport airport lounge licenses that at any time exceeds three.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-504 Specific licensing requirements for airport lounge license.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-504(1): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process To obtain an airport lounge license, in addition to complying with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-504(1)(a): both the written consent of the local authority and the written consent of the airport authority; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-504(1)(b): a copy of the sign proposed to be used by the airport lounge licensee on its licensed premises to inform the public that alcoholic products are sold and consumed on the licensed premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-504(2): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-504(2)(a): An airport lounge license expires on October 31 of each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-504(2)(b): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process To renew a person's airport lounge license, a person shall comply with the renewal requirements of
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-504(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-504(3)(a): The nonrefundable application fee for an airport lounge license is $300.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-504(3)(b): The initial license fee for an airport lounge license is $8,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-504(3)(c): The renewal fee for an airport lounge license is $6,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-504(4): The bond amount required for an airport lounge license is the penal sum of $10,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-504(5): 32B-1-202 An airport lounge license is not subject to the proximity requirements of Section

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-505(4)(b): (4) A beverage tab required by this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-505(5): An airport lounge licensee may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product at an airport lounge on any day during a period that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-505(5)(a): begins at midnight; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-505(5)(b): ends at 7:59 a.m.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-505(6): (6); (6)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-505(6)(a): (6) Subject to the other provisions of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-505(6)(b): A patron may not have two spirituous liquor drinks before the patron if one of the spirituous liquor drinks consists only of the primary spirituous liquor for the other spirituous liquor drink.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-505(6)(c): (6) An individual portion of wine is considered to be one alcoholic product under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-505(7): An airport lounge licensee may state in a food or alcoholic product menu a charge or fee made in connection with the sale, furnishing, or consumption of liquor menu including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-505(7)(a): a set-up charge;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-505(7)(b): a service charge; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-505(7)(c): a chilling fee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-505(8): An airport lounge liquor licensee's premises may not be leased for a private event.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-601 Title.
--------------------------------------
This part is known as "On-premise Banquet License."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-602 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
Reserved

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-603 Commission's power to issue on-premise banquet license -- Contracts as host.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-603(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-603(1)(a): Before a person may store, sell, offer for sale, furnish, or allow the consumption of an alcoholic product in connection with the person's banquet and room service activities at one of the following, the person shall first obtain an on-premise banquet license in accordance with this part:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-603(1)(a)(i): a hotel;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-603(1)(a)(ii): a resort facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-603(1)(a)(iii): a sports center;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-603(1)(a)(iv): a convention center;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-603(1)(a)(v): a performing arts facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-603(1)(a)(vi): an arena; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-603(1)(a)(vii): a restaurant venue.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-603(1)(b): (1)(a) This part does not prohibit an alcoholic product on the premises of a person listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-603(1)(c): This section does not prohibit a person who applies for an on-premise banquet license to also apply for a package agency if otherwise qualified.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-603(2): The commission may issue an on-premise banquet license to establish on-premise banquet licensees in the numbers the commission considers proper for the storage, sale, offer for sale, furnishing, and consumption of an alcoholic product at a banquet or as part of room service activities operated by an on-premise banquet licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-603(3): 32B-1-201 Subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-603(3)(a): may not issue a total number of restaurant venue on-premise banquet licenses that at any time exceeds 25; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-603(3)(b): may not issue a total number of on-premise banquet licenses that at any time exceeds the number determined by dividing the population of the state by 28,765.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-603(4): Pursuant to a contract between the host of a banquet and an on-premise banquet licensee:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-603(4)(a): the host of the banquet may request an on-premise banquet licensee to provide an alcoholic product served at the banquet; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-603(4)(b): an on-premise banquet licensee may provide an alcoholic product served at the banquet.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-603(5): At a banquet, an on-premise banquet licensee may furnish an alcoholic product:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-603(5)(a): without charge to a patron at a banquet, except that the host of the banquet shall pay for an alcoholic product furnished at the banquet; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-603(5)(b): with a charge to a patron at the banquet.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-603(6): To be licensed as an on-premise banquet, a person shall maintain at least 50% of the person's total annual banquet gross receipts from the sale of food, which does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-603(6)(a): mix for an alcoholic product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-603(6)(b): a charge in connection with the furnishing of an alcoholic product.
