Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-605(12)(b): An alcoholic product may not be left outside a guest room or privately owned dwelling unit for retrieval by a guest or resident.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-605(13): An on-premise banquet licensee may not maintain a minibar.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-701 Title.
--------------------------------------
This part is known as "On-premise Beer Retailer License."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(1): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Commission-approved activity" means a leisure activity that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(1)(a): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act the commission approves by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(1)(b): does not involve the use of a dangerous weapon.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2): (2)(a); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a): "Recreational amenity" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(i): a billiard parlor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(ii): a pool parlor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(iii): a bowling facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(iv): a golf course;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(v): miniature golf;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(vi): a golf driving range;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(vii): a tennis club;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(viii): a sports facility that hosts professional sporting events and has a seating capacity equal to or greater than 6,500;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(ix): a concert venue that has a seating capacity equal to or greater than 6,500;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(x): one of the following if owned by a government agency:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(x)(A): a convention center;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(x)(B): a fair facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(x)(C): an equestrian park;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(x)(D): a theater; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(x)(E): a concert venue;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(xi): an amusement park:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(xi)(A): with one or more permanent amusement rides; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(xi)(B): located on at least 50 acres;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(xii): a ski resort;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(xiii): a venue for live entertainment if the venue:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(xiii)(A): is not regularly open for more than five hours on any day;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(xiii)(B): is operated so that food is available whenever beer is sold, offered for sale, or furnished at the venue; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(xiii)(C): is operated so that no more than 15% of its total annual receipts are from the sale of beer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(xiv): concessions operated within the boundary of a park administered by the:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(xiv)(A): Division of State Parks; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(xiv)(B): National Parks Service;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(xv): a facility or venue that is a recreational amenity for a person licensed under this part before May 12, 2020;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(xvi): a venue for karaoke; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(a)(xvii): an enterprise developed around a commission-approved activity.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-702(2)(b): (2)(a); (2)(a) "Recreational amenity" does not include an item described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703 Commission's power to issue on-premise beer retailer license.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(1): Before a person may store, sell, offer for sale, furnish, or allow the consumption of beer on the premises as an on-premise beer retailer, the person shall first obtain an on-premise beer retailer license from the commission in accordance with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2): (2)(d); (2)(d)(ii)(A); (2)(e)(iii); (2)(e)(i); (2)(e)(i)(A); (2)(e)(i)(A); (2)(e)(i)(A)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(a): The commission may issue an on-premise beer retailer license to establish on-premise beer retailer licensed premises at places and in numbers as the commission considers proper for the storage, sale, offer for sale, furnishing, and consumption of beer on premises operated as an on-premise beer retailer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(b): At the time that the commission issues an on-premise beer retailer license, the commission shall designate whether the on-premise beer retailer is a tavern.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(c): The commission may change its designation of whether an on-premise beer retailer is a tavern in accordance with rules made by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(d): (2)(d); (2)(d)(ii)(A)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(d)(i): In determining whether an on-premise beer retailer is a tavern, the commission shall determine whether the on-premise beer retailer will engage primarily in the retail sale of beer for consumption on the establishment's premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(d)(ii): (2)(d); (2)(d)(ii)(A) In making a determination under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(d)(ii)(A): whether the on-premise beer retailer will operate as one of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(d)(ii)(A)(I): a beer bar;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(d)(ii)(A)(II): a parlor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(d)(ii)(A)(III): a lounge;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(d)(ii)(A)(IV): a cabaret; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(d)(ii)(A)(V): a nightclub;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(d)(ii)(B): (2)(d)(ii)(A) if the on-premise beer retailer will operate as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(d)(ii)(B)(I): whether the on-premise beer retailer will sell food in the establishment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(d)(ii)(B)(II): if the on-premise beer retailer sells food, whether the revenue from the sale of beer will exceed the revenue of the sale of food;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(d)(ii)(C): whether full meals including appetizers, main courses, and desserts will be served;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(d)(ii)(D): the square footage and seating capacity of the premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(d)(ii)(E): what portion of the square footage and seating capacity will be used for a dining area in comparison to the portion that will be used as a lounge or bar area;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(d)(ii)(F): whether the person will maintain adequate on-premise culinary facilities to prepare full meals, except a person that is located on the premises of a hotel or resort facility may use the culinary facilities of the hotel or resort facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(d)(ii)(G): whether the entertainment provided on the premises of the beer retailer will be suitable for minors; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(d)(ii)(H): the beer retailer management's ability to manage and operate an on-premise beer retailer license including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(d)(ii)(H)(I): management experience;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(d)(ii)(H)(II): past beer retailer management experience; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(d)(ii)(H)(III): the type of management scheme that will be used by the beer retailer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(e): (2)(e)(iii); (2)(e)(i); (2)(e)(i)(A); (2)(e)(i)(A); (2)(e)(i)(A)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(e)(i): (2)(e)(iii) To be licensed as an on-premise beer retailer that is not a tavern, a person shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(e)(i)(A): (2)(e)(iii) own or operate a recreational amenity and maintain at least 70% of the person's total gross revenues from business directly related to the recreational amenity on or directly adjoining the licensed premises of the beer retailer, except that a person may include gross revenue from business directly related to a recreational amenity that is owned or operated by a political subdivision if the person has a contract meeting the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(e)(i)(B): own or operate a recreational amenity on or directly adjoining the licensed premises of the beer retailer and maintain at least 70% of the person's total gross revenues from the sale of food; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(e)(i)(C): if the licensed premises of the on-premise beer retailer is on or directly adjoining a ski resort on January 1, 2021, obtain the consent of the ski resort to operate as an on-premise beer retailer that is not a tavern and maintain at least 70% of the person's total gross revenues from the sale of food.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(e)(ii): (2)(e)(i) The commission may not license a person as an on-premise beer retailer if the person does not:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(e)(ii)(A): (2)(e)(i) meet the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(e)(ii)(B): operate as a tavern.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(e)(iii): (2)(e)(i)(A); (2)(e)(i)(A); (2)(e)(i)(A) A contract described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(e)(iii)(A): (2)(e)(i)(A) allow the beer retailer to include the total gross revenue from operations of the recreational amenity in the beer retailer's total gross receipts for purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(2)(e)(iii)(B): (2)(e)(i)(A) give the department the authority to audit financial information of the political subdivision to the extent necessary to confirm that the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(3): 32B-1-201; 32B-5-206 Subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(3)(a): the commission may not issue a total number of on-premise beer retailer licenses that are taverns that at any time exceeds the number determined by dividing the population of the state by 73,666; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(3)(b): 32B-5-206 the commission may issue a seasonal on-premise beer retailer license for a tavern in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(4): (4)(b); (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(4)(a): (4)(b) Unless otherwise provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(4)(a)(i): only one on-premise beer retailer license is required for each building or resort facility owned or leased by the same person; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(4)(a)(ii): a separate license is not required for each retail beer dispensing location in the same building or on the same resort premises owned or operated by the same person.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(4)(b): (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(4)(b)(i): (4)(a) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(4)(b)(ii): If each retail beer dispensing location does not operate in the same manner:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(4)(b)(ii)(A): one on-premise beer retailer license designated as a tavern is required for the locations in the same building or on the same resort premises that operate as a tavern; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-703(4)(b)(ii)(B): one on-premise beer retailer license is required for the locations in the same building or on the same resort premises that do not operate as a tavern.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-704 Local authority to issue a license.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-704(1): Title 11, Chapter 10, Business Allowing Consumption of Liquor on Premises A local authority may issue a license to operate as an on-premise beer retailer, subject to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-704(1)(a): the requirement under this part that a person obtain an on-premise beer retailer license issued by the commission to operate as an on-premise beer retailer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-704(1)(b): Title 11, Chapter 10, Business Allowing Consumption of Liquor on Premises subject to
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-704(2): (1) For a violation of this title, rules of the commission, or a local ordinance, a local authority may suspend or revoke a business license described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-704(3): (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-704(3)(a): If the commission suspends or revokes an on-premise beer retailer license issued by the commission under this title, the on-premise beer retailer may not continue to operate under a license issued by a local authority.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-704(3)(b): (1) If a local authority suspends or revokes a business license described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-704(4): (1) A person issued a business license issued by a local authority as described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-705 Specific licensing requirements for on-premise beer retailer license.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-705(1): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process; 32B-5-201 To obtain an on-premise beer retailer license a person shall comply with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-705(2): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-705(2)(a): An on-premise beer retailer license expires on the last day of February each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-705(2)(b): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process To renew a person's on-premise beer retailer license, a person shall comply with the renewal requirements of
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-705(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-705(3)(a): The nonrefundable application fee for an on-premise beer retailer license is $300.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-705(3)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-705(3)(b)(i): The initial license fee for an on-premise beer retailer license that is not a tavern is $300.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-705(3)(b)(ii): The initial license fee for an on-premise beer retailer license that is a tavern is $1,500.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-705(3)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-705(3)(c)(i): The renewal fee for an on-premise beer retailer license that is not a tavern is $350.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-705(3)(c)(ii): The renewal fee for an on-premise beer retailer license that is a tavern is $1,250.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-705(4): The bond amount required for an on-premise beer retailer license is the penal sum of $5,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-705(5): 32B-5-204 Notwithstanding the other provisions of this part, if an applicant is a state agency or political subdivision of the state it is not required to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-705(5)(a): pay an application fee, initial license fee, or renewal fee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-705(5)(b): obtain the written consent of the local authority;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-705(5)(c): submit a copy of the applicant's current business license; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-705(5)(d): 32B-5-204 post a bond as specified by Section

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-707 Application of part to other retail license type.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-707(1): A retail licensee who is not an on-premise beer retailer, but who sells, offers for sale, or furnishes beer pursuant to a different part under this chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-707(1)(a): may sell, offer for sale, or furnish beer without obtaining a separate on-premise beer retailer license from the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-707(1)(b): shall comply with the operational requirements under this part that apply to an on-premise beer retailer, except when a requirement of this part is inconsistent with or less restrictive than an operational requirement under the relevant part under this chapter for the type of retail license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-707(2): Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act Failure of a retail licensee or staff of the retail licensee to comply with a requirement of this part may result in disciplinary action in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-707(2)(a): a retail licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-707(2)(b): individual staff of a retail licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-707(2)(c): both a retail licensee and staff of the retail licensee.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-801 Title.
--------------------------------------
This part is known as "Reception Center License."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-802 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
Reserved

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-803 Commission's power to issue reception center license.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-803(1): Before a person may store, sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product on the person's premises as a reception center, the person shall first obtain a reception center license from the commission in accordance with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-803(2): The commission may issue a reception center license to establish reception center licensed premises at places and in numbers the commission considers proper for the storage, sale, offer for sale, furnishing, and consumption of an alcoholic product on premises operated as a reception center.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-803(3): 32B-1-201 Subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-803(4): 32B-1-202 The commission may not issue a reception center license for premises that do not meet the proximity requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-803(5): (5)(a); (5)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-803(5)(a): To be licensed as a reception center, a person may not maintain more than 30% of the person's total annual gross receipts from the sale of alcoholic products.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-803(5)(b): (5)(a) For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-803(5)(b)(i): an alcoholic product includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-803(5)(b)(i)(A): mix for an alcoholic product; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-803(5)(b)(i)(B): a charge in connection with the furnishing of an alcoholic product; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-803(5)(b)(ii): gross receipts do not include any charge for renting a room or facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-803(5)(c): (5) A reception center licensee shall report the information necessary to show compliance with this Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-804 Specific licensing requirements for reception center license.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-804(1): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process To obtain a reception center license a person shall comply with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-804(2): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-804(2)(a): A reception center license expires on October 31 of each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-804(2)(b): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process To renew a person's reception center license, a person shall comply with the renewal requirements of
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-804(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-804(3)(a): The nonrefundable application fee for a reception center license is $300.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-804(3)(b): The initial license fee for a reception center license is $750.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-804(3)(c): The renewal fee for a reception center license is $750.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-804(4): The bond amount required for a reception center license is the penal sum of $10,000.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(3)(b)(i): an authorized representative of the commission or the department; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(3)(b)(ii): a law enforcement officer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(4): 32B-5-307
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(4)(a): Except as otherwise provided in this title, a reception center licensee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product at an event only for consumption at the reception center's licensed premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(4)(b): A host of an event, a patron, or a person other than the reception center licensee or staff of the reception center licensee, may not remove an alcoholic product from the reception center's licensed premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(4)(c): 32B-5-307 Notwithstanding Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(5): (5)(b); (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(5)(a): A reception center licensee may not leave an unsold alcoholic product at an event following the conclusion of the event.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(5)(b): At the conclusion of an event, a reception center licensee shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(5)(b)(i): destroy an opened and unused alcoholic product that is not saleable, under conditions established by the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(5)(b)(ii): return to the reception center licensee's approved locked storage area any:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(5)(b)(ii)(A): opened and unused alcoholic product that is saleable; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(5)(b)(ii)(B): unopened container of an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(5)(c): (5)(b); (2) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(5)(c)(i): (2) shall store the alcoholic product in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(5)(c)(ii): may use the alcoholic product at more than one event.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(6): 32B-5-308 Notwithstanding Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(7): A person's willingness to serve an alcoholic product may not be made a condition of employment as a server with a reception center licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(8): A reception center licensee may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product at the licensed premises on any day during the period that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(8)(a): begins at 1 a.m.; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(8)(b): ends at 9:59 a.m.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(9): A reception center licensee may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product at an event at which a minor is present unless the reception center licensee makes food available at all times when an alcoholic product is sold, offered for sale, furnished, or consumed during the event.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(10): (10); (10)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(10)(a): (10) Subject to the other provisions of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(10)(b): (10)(a) An individual portion of wine is considered to be one alcoholic product under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(11): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(11)(a): A reception center licensee shall supervise and direct a person involved in the sale, offer for sale, or furnishing of an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(11)(b): A person involved in the sale, offer for sale, or furnishing of an alcoholic product shall complete an alcohol training and education seminar.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(12): A staff person of a reception center licensee shall remain at an event at all times when an alcoholic product is sold, offered for sale, furnished, or consumed at the event.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(13): A reception center licensee may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product to a patron, and a patron may not consume an alcoholic product at a bar structure.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(14): (15); (14)(a); (14)(a); (14)(a); (14)(a); (14)(a) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(14)(a): the alcoholic product is dispensed from an area that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(14)(a)(i): separated from an area for the consumption of food by a patron by a solid, translucent, permanent structural barrier such that the facilities for the storage or dispensing of an alcoholic product are:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(14)(a)(i)(A): not readily visible to a patron; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(14)(a)(i)(B): not accessible by a patron; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(14)(a)(ii): apart from an area used:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(14)(a)(ii)(A): for staging; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(14)(a)(ii)(B): as a lobby or waiting area;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(14)(b): (14)(a); (14)(a); (14)(a); (14)(a) the reception center licensee uses an alcoholic product that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(14)(b)(i): (14)(a) stored in an area described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(14)(b)(ii): (14)(a); (14)(a); (14)(a) in an area not described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(14)(b)(ii)(B): (14)(a) the unopened container is taken to an area described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(14)(b)(ii)(C): (14)(a) once opened, the container is stored in an area described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(14)(c): (14)(a) any instrument or equipment used to dispense an alcoholic product is located in an area described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(15): A reception center licensee may dispense an alcoholic product from a mobile serving area that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(15)(a): is moved only by staff of the reception center licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(15)(b): is capable of being moved by only one individual; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(15)(c): is no larger than 6 feet long and 30 inches wide.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(16): (16)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(16)(a): A reception center licensee may not have an event on the licensed premises unless the event:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(16)(a)(i): is pursuant to a contract between a third party host of the event and the reception center licensee under which the reception center licensee provides an alcoholic product sold, offered for sale, or furnished at an event; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(16)(a)(ii): is a private event.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(16)(b): At an event, a reception center licensee may furnish an alcoholic product:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(16)(b)(i): without charge to a patron, except that the third party host of the event shall pay for an alcoholic product furnished at the event; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(16)(b)(ii): with a charge to a patron at the event.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(16)(c): (16) The commission may by rule define what constitutes a "third-party host" for purposes of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(17): A reception center licensee shall have culinary facilities that are:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(17)(a): adequate to prepare a full meal; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(17)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(17)(b)(i): located on the licensed premises; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(17)(b)(ii): under the same control as the reception center licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(18): (18)(b); (18)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(18)(a): (18)(b) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(18)(a)(i): that is open to the general public; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(18)(a)(ii): at which an alcoholic product is sold or offered for sale.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(18)(b): (18)(a) A reception center licensee may operate an event described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(18)(b)(i): at the reception center no more frequently than once a calendar year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-805(18)(b)(ii): by a nonprofit organization that is organized and qualified under Section 501(c), Internal Revenue Code.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-901 Title.
--------------------------------------
This part is known as "Beer-only Restaurant License."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-902 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-902(1): (1)(b)(ii); Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act; Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act; (1)(b)(i)(B); (1)(b)(i)(B) As used in this part:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-902(1)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-902(1)(a)(i): "Dining area" means an area in the licensed premises of a beer-only restaurant licensee that is primarily used for the service and consumption of food by one or more patrons.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-902(1)(a)(ii): "Dining area" does not include a dispensing area.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-902(1)(b): (1)(b)(ii); Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act; Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act; (1)(b)(i)(B)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-902(1)(b)(i): (1)(b)(ii); Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act; Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act "Dispensing area" means an area in the licensed premises of a beer-only restaurant licensee where a dispensing structure is located and that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-902(1)(b)(i)(A): is physically separated from the dining area and any waiting area by a structure or other barrier that prevents a patron seated in the dining area or a waiting area from viewing the dispensing of beer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-902(1)(b)(i)(B): (1)(b)(ii) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-902(1)(b)(i)(C): Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act; Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act is physically separated from the dining area and any waiting area by a permanent physical structure that complies with the provisions of
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-902(1)(b)(ii): (1)(b)(i)(B) "Dispensing area" does not include any area described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-902(1)(c): (1)(b)(i)(B) "Small beer-only restaurant licensee" means a beer-only restaurant licensee that has a grandfathered bar structure whose dispensing area includes more than 45% of the available seating for patrons on the licensed premises, excluding outdoor seating:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-902(1)(c)(i): (1)(b)(i)(B) when measured in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-902(1)(c)(ii): based on the licensee's floor plan on file with the department on July 1, 2017.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-902(1)(d): "Waiting area" includes a lobby.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-903 Commission's power to issue beer-only restaurant license.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-903(1): Before a person may store, sell, offer for sale, furnish, or allow the consumption of beer on its premises as a beer-only restaurant, the person shall first obtain a beer-only restaurant license from the commission in accordance with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-903(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-903(2)(a): The commission may issue a beer-only restaurant license to establish beer-only restaurant licensed premises at places and in numbers the commission considers proper for the storage, sale, offer for sale, furnishing, and consumption of beer on premises operated as a beer-only restaurant.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-903(2)(b): A person may not sell, offer for sale, furnish, or allow the consumption of liquor on the licensed premises of a beer-only restaurant licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-903(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-903(3)(a): Only one beer-only restaurant license is required for each building or resort facility owned or leased by the same person.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-903(3)(b): A separate license is not required for each beer-only restaurant license dispensing location in the same building or on the same resort premises owned or operated by the same person.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-903(4): 32B-1-202; 32B-1-202(2) Except as otherwise provided in  Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-903(5): To be licensed as a beer-only restaurant, a person shall maintain at least 70% of the restaurant's gross revenues from the sale of food, which does not include a service charge.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-904 Specific licensing requirements for beer-only restaurant license.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-904(1): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process To obtain a beer-only restaurant license a person shall comply with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-904(2): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-904(2)(a): A beer-only restaurant license expires the last day of February of each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-904(2)(b): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process To renew a person's beer-only restaurant license, a person shall comply with the renewal requirements of
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-904(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-904(3)(a): The nonrefundable application fee for a beer-only restaurant license is $330.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-904(3)(b): The initial license fee for a beer-only restaurant license is $825.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-904(3)(c): The renewal fee for a beer-only restaurant license is $605.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-904(4): The bond amount required for a beer-only restaurant license is the penal sum of $5,000.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1 Specific operational requirements for a beer-only restaurant license -- On and after July 1, 2018, or July 1, 2022.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(1): Chapter 5, Part 3, Retail Licensee Operational Requirements; (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(1)(a): Chapter 5, Part 3, Retail Licensee Operational Requirements In addition to complying with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(1)(b): (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act Failure to comply with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(1)(b)(i): a beer-only restaurant licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(1)(b)(ii): individual staff of a beer-only restaurant licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(1)(b)(iii): both a beer-only restaurant licensee and staff of the beer-only restaurant licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(2)(a): A beer-only restaurant licensee on the licensed premises may not sell, offer for sale, furnish, or allow consumption of liquor.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(2)(b): Liquor may not be on the premises of a beer-only restaurant licensee except for use:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(2)(b)(i): as a flavoring on a dessert; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(2)(b)(ii): in the preparation of a flaming food dish, drink, or dessert.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(3): (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(3)(a): An individual who serves beer in a beer-only restaurant licensee's premises shall make a beverage tab for each table or group that orders or consumes beer on the premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(3)(b): (3) A beverage tab described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(4): A beer-only restaurant licensee may not make an individual's willingness to serve beer a condition of employment as a server with a beer-only restaurant licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(5): A beer-only restaurant licensee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish beer at the licensed premises during the following time periods only:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(5)(a): on a weekday, during the period that begins at 11:30 a.m. and ends at 12:59 a.m.; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(5)(b): on a weekend or a state or federal legal holiday or for a private event, during the period that begins at 10:30 a.m. and ends at 12:59 a.m.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(6): (6)(b); 32B-5-304; (6)(b)(ii)(B); 32B-5-307
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(6)(a): (6)(b) A beer-only restaurant licensee may not furnish beer for on-premise consumption except after:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(6)(a)(i): the patron to whom the beer-only restaurant licensee furnishes the beer is seated at:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(6)(a)(i)(A): a table that is located in a dining area or a dispensing area;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(6)(a)(i)(B): a counter that is located in a dining area or a dispensing area; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(6)(a)(i)(C): a dispensing structure that is located in a dispensing area; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(6)(a)(ii): (6)(b) the beer-only restaurant licensee confirms that the patron intends to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(6)(a)(ii)(A): order food prepared, sold, and furnished at the licensed premises; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(6)(a)(ii)(B): (6)(b) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(6)(b): 32B-5-304; (6)(b)(ii)(B)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(6)(b)(i): 32B-5-304 While a patron waits for a seat at a table or counter in the dining area of a beer-only restaurant licensee, the beer-only restaurant licensee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish to the patron one portion of beer as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(6)(b)(i)(A): the patron is in a dispensing area and seated at a table, counter, or dispensing structure; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(6)(b)(i)(B): the beer-only restaurant licensee first confirms that after the patron is seated in the dining area, the patron intends to order food prepared, sold, and furnished at the licensed premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(6)(b)(ii): (6)(b)(ii)(B)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(6)(b)(ii)(A): (6)(b)(ii)(B) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(6)(b)(ii)(B): An employee of the beer-only restaurant licensee shall escort a patron who transports an unfinished portion of the patron's beer to the patron's seat in the dining area.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(6)(c): 32B-5-307 Notwithstanding Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(6)(d): A beer-only restaurant licensee shall maintain on the licensed premises adequate culinary facilities for food preparation and dining accommodations.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(7): A patron may consume a beer on the beer-only licensee's licensed premises only at:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(7)(a): a table that is located in a dining area or a dispensing area;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(7)(b): a counter that is located in a dining area or a dispensing area; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(7)(c): a dispensing structure located in a dispensing area.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(8): A patron may not have more than two beers at a time before the patron.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(9): In accordance with the provisions of this section, an individual who is at least 21 years old may consume food and beverages in a dispensing area.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(10): (10)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(10)(a): (10)(b) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(10)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(10)(b)(i): A minor may be in a dispensing area if the minor is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(10)(b)(i)(A): at least 16 years old and working as an employee of the beer-only restaurant licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(10)(b)(i)(B): performing maintenance and cleaning services as an employee of the beer-only restaurant licensee when the beer-only restaurant licensee is not open for business.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(10)(b)(ii): If there is no alternative route available, a minor may momentarily pass through a dispensing area without remaining or sitting in the dispensing area en route to an area of the beer-only restaurant licensee's premises in which the minor is permitted to be.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(11): (11)(a) A beer-only restaurant licensee may dispense a beer only if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(11)(a): the beer is dispensed from:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(11)(a)(i): a dispensing structure that is located in a dispensing area;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(11)(a)(ii): an area that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(11)(a)(ii)(A): separated from an area for the consumption of food by a patron by a solid, translucent, permanent structural barrier such that the facilities for the dispensing of an alcoholic product are not readily visible to a patron and not accessible by a patron; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(11)(a)(ii)(B): apart from an area used for dining, for staging, or as a waiting area; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(11)(a)(iii): the premises of a bar licensee that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(11)(a)(iii)(A): owned by the same person or persons as the beer-only restaurant licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(11)(a)(iii)(B): located immediately adjacent to the premises of the beer-only restaurant licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(11)(b): (11)(a) any instrument or equipment used to dispense the beer is located in an area described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(12): 32B-6-902(1)(b)(i)(A); (B); (C)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(12)(a): A beer-only restaurant licensee may have more than one dispensing area in the licensed premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(12)(b): 32B-6-902(1)(b)(i)(A); (B); (C) Each dispensing area in a licensed premises may satisfy the requirements for a dispensing area under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(13): A beer-only restaurant licensee may not transfer, dispense, or serve beer on or from a movable cart.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(14): 32B-5-302; 32B-5-302(1); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(14)(a): 32B-5-302; 32B-5-302(1); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act In addition to the requirements described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(14)(a)(i): 32B-5-302(1) a record required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(14)(a)(ii): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act a record that the commission requires a beer-only restaurant licensee to use or maintain under a rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.1(14)(b): The department shall audit the records of a beer-only restaurant licensee at least once annually.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.3 Small beer-only restaurant licensee -- Exemption.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.3(1): 32B-6-905; 32B-6-905.2; (2) Notwithstanding the provisions of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.3(1)(a): seating in the dispensing area is the only seating available for patrons on the licensed premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.3(1)(b): the minor is accompanied by an individual who is 21 years of age or older; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.3(1)(c): the small beer-only restaurant licensee applies for and obtains approval from the department to seat minors in the dispensing area in accordance with this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.3(2): A minor may not sit, remain, or consume food or beverages at a dispensing structure.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-905.3(3): (1)(c); 32B-6-902(1)(e); (1)(c) The department shall:

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1001 Hospitality Amenity License.
-------------------------------------------------------------
This part is known as "Hospitality Amenity License."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1002 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1002(1): "Hospitality guest" means an individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1002(1)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1002(1)(a)(i): who is a resident of a resort;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1002(1)(a)(ii): for whom a resident of a resort provides lodging accommodations for compensation;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1002(1)(a)(iii): for whom a hotel provides lodging accommodations for compensation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1002(1)(a)(iv): for whom a resort provides lodging accommodations for compensation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1002(1)(b): who is at least 21 years of age.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1002(2): "Boundary of a hotel" means the physical boundary of one or more contiguous parcels of real property owned or managed by the same person and on which a hotel is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1002(3): 32B-8-102 "Boundary of a resort building" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1002(4): "Hotel" means a commercial lodging establishment that offers at least 40 rooms as temporary sleeping accommodations for compensation.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1003 Commission's power to issue hospitality amenity license.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1003(1): Before a person may store, sell, offer for sale, furnish, or allow the consumption of an alcoholic product on the person's premises as a hospitality amenity licensee, the person shall first obtain a hospitality amenity license from the commission in accordance with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1003(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1003(2)(a): The commission may only issue a hospitality amenity license to a hotel or a resort.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1003(2)(b): Beginning November 1, 2020, the commission may issue a hospitality amenity license to establish hospitality amenity licensed premises at places and in numbers the commission considers proper for the storage, sale, offer for sale, furnishing, and consumption of alcoholic products on premises operated as a hospitality amenity licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1003(3): The commission may authorize the sale of an alcoholic product at as many as three hospitality amenity locations within the boundary of a hotel or the boundary of a resort building under one hospitality amenity license if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1003(3)(a): the hotel or resort has a minimum of 150 rooms for temporary sleeping accommodations; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1003(3)(b): the commission determines the location, design, and construction of the hotel or resort requires more than one hospitality amenity location within the hotel or resort to serve the public convenience.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1003(4): 32B-1-202; 32B-1-202(2) Except as otherwise provided in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1004 Specific licensing requirements for a hospitality amenity license.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1004(1): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process To obtain a hospitality amenity license a person shall comply with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1004(2): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1004(2)(a): A hospitality amenity license expires on October 31 of each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1004(2)(b): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process To renew a person's hospitality amenity license, a person shall comply with the renewal requirements of
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1004(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1004(3)(a): The nonrefundable application fee for a hospitality amenity license is $330.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1004(3)(b): The initial license fee for a hospitality amenity license is $2,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1004(3)(c): The renewal fee for a hospitality amenity license is $1,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1004(4): The bond amount required for a hospitality amenity license is the penal sum of $10,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1004(5): 32B-5-303(3) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1004(5)(a): upon proper application by a hospitality amenity licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1004(5)(b): in accordance with guidelines the commission approves.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005 Specific operational requirements for hospitality amenity license.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(1): Chapter 5, Part 3, Retail Licensee Operational Requirements; (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(1)(a): Chapter 5, Part 3, Retail Licensee Operational Requirements In addition to complying with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(1)(b): (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act Failure to comply as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(1)(b)(i): the hospitality amenity licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(1)(b)(ii): individual staff of the hospitality amenity licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(1)(b)(iii): both the hospitality amenity licensee and staff of the hospitality amenity licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(2): (2)(b)(ii); (2)(b)(i)(A)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(2)(a): A hospitality amenity licensee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(2)(a)(i): to a hospitality guest; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(2)(a)(ii): for consumption in or on the hospitality amenity licensee's licensed premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(2)(b): (2)(b)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(2)(b)(i): (2)(b)(ii) A hospitality amenity licensee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product that is not spirituous liquor in or on:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(2)(b)(i)(A): licensed premises physically separated from an area to which a hospitality guest or the public has access by a permanent or temporary structure or barrier; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(2)(b)(i)(B): (2)(b)(ii) licensed premises described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(2)(b)(ii): A hospitality amenity licensee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish spirituous liquor in or on licensed premises that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(2)(b)(ii)(A): allows access only through the use of a key or code; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(2)(b)(ii)(B): fills the entirety of a physically and permanently enclosed area within the hotel or resort.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(2)(c): (2)(b)(i)(A) Spirituous liquor may not be in or on the licensed premises described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(2)(c)(i): as a flavoring on a dessert; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(2)(c)(ii): in the preparation of a flaming food dish or dessert.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(2)(d): A hospitality amenity licensee may not allow self-service of an alcoholic product in or on the hospitality amenity licensee's licensed premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(3): (3)(b); (c); (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(3)(a): (3)(b); (c) Subject to Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(3)(b): A hospitality guest may not have more than one spirituous liquor drink at a time before the hospitality guest.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(3)(c): (3)(a) An individual portion of wine is considered to be one alcoholic product under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(4): A hospitality amenity licensee shall make food available at all times that the licensee sells, offers for sale, furnishes, or allows the consumption of an alcoholic product on the licensed premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(5): (5)(b)(iii)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(5)(a): A hospitality amenity licensee may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product any day during a period that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(5)(a)(i): begins at 1:00 a.m.; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(5)(a)(ii): ends at 9:59 a.m.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(5)(b): (5)(b)(iii) A hospitality amenity licensee shall remain open for one hour after the licensee ceases to sell and furnish an alcoholic product, during which time a hospitality guest in or on the hospitality amenity licensed premises may finish consuming:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(5)(b)(i): a single drink containing spirituous liquor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(5)(b)(ii): (5)(b)(iii) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(5)(b)(iii): a single serving not exceeding 16 ounces of hard cider that is furnished in a sealed container and contains no more than 5% of alcohol by volume;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(5)(b)(iv): a single serving of heavy beer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(5)(b)(v): a single serving not exceeding 26 ounces of beer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(5)(b)(vi): a single serving of a flavored malt beverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(5)(c): A hospitality amenity licensee is not required to remain open:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(5)(c)(i): after all individuals have vacated the licensee's licensed premises; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(5)(c)(ii): during an emergency.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(6)(a)(i): the alcoholic product is not a spirituous liquor; and

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(9): A hospitality amenity licensee shall display at each entrance to the licensee's licensed premises a conspicuous sign that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(9)(a): measures at least 8-1/2 inches long and 11 inches wide; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(9)(b): clearly states that entry is limited to individuals who are hospitality guests, as defined in this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(10): A hospitality amenity licensee may not permit a minor to enter the licensee's licensed premises at any time during which an alcoholic product is sold, offered for sale, furnished, or consumed, unless the minor is accompanied at all times on the licensed premises by a hospitality guest.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(11): A staff person of a hospitality amenity licensee shall remain on the licensed premises at all times when an alcoholic product is sold, offered for sale, furnished, or consumed in or on the licensed premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(12): A hospitality amenity licensee may transfer an alcoholic product to or from another licensee within the boundary of the hotel or within the boundary of the resort building, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(12)(a): the hospitality amenity licensee and each licensee involved in the transfer tracks the transfer of the alcoholic product; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(12)(b): the alcoholic product is in a sealed, unopened container.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(13): 32B-5-302; 32B-5-302(1); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-6-1005(13)(b): The department shall audit the records of a hospitality amenity licensee at least once annually.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 32B - Chapter 7 - Off-Premise Beer Retailer Act
***************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Off-premise Beer Retailer Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
Reserved

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-201 State and local licensing -- Limitations.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-201(1): 32B-7-202; Part 3, Off-Premise Beer Retailer Enforcement Act Subject to the other provisions of this title, a local authority may:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-201(1)(a): tax or prohibit the retail sale of beer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-201(1)(b): subject to this part, issue, suspend, and revoke a local license to sell beer at retail for off-premise consumption;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-201(1)(c): establish proximity requirements for establishing premises where beer is sold at retail for off-premise consumption in relation to any community location; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-201(1)(d): 32B-7-202; Part 3, Off-Premise Beer Retailer Enforcement Act otherwise regulate the retail sale of beer for off-premise consumption subject to the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-201(2): A local authority may not issue to a minor a local license to sell beer at retail for off-premise consumption.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202 General operational requirements for off-premise beer retailer.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(1): Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(1)(a): An off-premise beer retailer or staff of the off-premise beer retailer shall comply with the provisions of this title and any applicable rules made by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(1)(b): Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act Failure to comply with this section may result in a suspension or revocation of a local license and, on or after July 1, 2018, disciplinary action in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(2): (2)(a); (2); 32B-13-301; (2)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(2)(a): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(2)(a)(i): An off-premise beer retailer may not purchase, acquire, possess for the purpose of resale, or sell beer, except beer that the off-premise beer retailer lawfully purchases from:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(2)(a)(i)(A): a beer wholesaler licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(2)(a)(i)(B): a small brewer that manufactures the beer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(2)(a)(ii): (2)(a) A violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(2)(b): (2); 32B-13-301; (2)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(2)(b)(i): (2); 32B-13-301 If an off-premise beer retailer purchases beer under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(2)(b)(ii): (2)(b) A violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(3): An off-premise beer retailer may not possess, sell, offer for sale, or furnish beer in a container larger than two liters.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(4)(a): Staff of an off-premise beer retailer, while on duty, may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(4)(a)(i): consume an alcoholic product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(4)(a)(ii): be intoxicated.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(4)(b): A minor may not sell beer on the licensed premises of an off-premise beer retailer unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(4)(b)(i): the sale is done under the supervision of a person 21 years old or older who is on the licensed premises; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(4)(b)(ii): the minor is at least 16 years old.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(5): An off-premise beer retailer may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(5)(a): a minor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(5)(b): a person actually, apparently, or obviously intoxicated;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(5)(c): a known interdicted person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(5)(d): a known habitual drunkard.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(6): (6); (6)(a)(i); (6)(a); (6); (6); (6)(e)(ii); (6)(a)(i); (6)(a)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(6)(a): (6); (6)(a)(i) Subject to the other provisions of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(6)(a)(i): display all beer accessible by and visible to a patron in no more than two locations on the retail sales floor, each of which is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(6)(a)(i)(A): a display cabinet, cooler, aisle, floor display, or room where beer is the only beverage displayed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(6)(a)(i)(B): not adjacent to a display of nonalcoholic beverages, unless the location is a cooler with a door from which the nonalcoholic beverages are not accessible, or the beer is separated from the display of nonalcoholic beverages by a display of one or more nonbeverage products or another physical divider; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(6)(a)(ii): (6)(a)(i) display a sign in the area described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(6)(a)(ii)(A): is prominent;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(6)(a)(ii)(B): is easily readable by a consumer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(6)(a)(ii)(C): meets the requirements for format established by the commission by rule; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(6)(a)(ii)(D): reads in print that is no smaller than .5 inches, bold type, "These beverages contain alcohol.  Please read the label carefully."
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(6)(b): (6)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(6)(c): (6) The requirements of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(6)(c)(i): a malt cooler; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(6)(c)(ii): a beverage that may provide energy.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(6)(d): (6) A violation of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(6)(e): (6)(e)(ii); (6)(a)(i); (6)(a)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(6)(e)(i): (6)(e)(ii); (6)(a)(i) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(6)(e)(ii): (6)(a)(i) For a beer retailer that operates two or more off-premise beer retailers, the provisions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(7): (7); (7)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(7)(a): Staff of an off-premise beer retailer who directly supervises the sale of beer or who sells beer to a patron for consumption off the premises of the off-premise beer retailer shall wear a unique identification badge:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(7)(a)(i): on the front of the staff's clothing;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(7)(a)(ii): visible above the waist;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(7)(a)(iii): bearing the staff's:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(7)(a)(iii)(A): first or last name;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(7)(a)(iii)(B): initials; or

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(7)(a)(iv): with the number or letters on the unique identification badge being sufficiently large to be clearly visible and identifiable while engaging in or directly supervising the retail sale of beer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(7)(b): An off-premise beer retailer shall make and maintain a record of each current staff's unique identification badge assigned by the off-premise beer retailer that includes the staff's:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(7)(b)(i): full name;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(7)(b)(ii): address; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(7)(b)(iii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(7)(b)(iii)(A): driver license number; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(7)(b)(iii)(B): similar identification number.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(7)(c): (7) An off-premise beer retailer shall make available a record required to be made or maintained under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(7)(c)(i): a peace officer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(7)(c)(ii): a representative of the local authority that issues the off-premise beer retailer license; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(7)(c)(iii): for an off-premise beer retailer state license, a representative of the commission or department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(7)(d): (7) A local authority may impose a fine of up to $250 against an off-premise beer retailer that does not comply or require its staff to comply with this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(8): (8)(a); (6)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(8)(a): An off-premise beer retailer may sell, offer for sale, or furnish beer through a drive through window.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(8)(b): (8)(a); (6) Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(9)(a): 76-10-1101; 76-10-1101 engage in or permit any form of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-202(9)(a)(i): 76-10-1101 gambling, as defined in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-301 Title.
--------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Off-premise Beer Retailer Enforcement Act."

--------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-401 Commission's power to issue off-premise beer retailer state license.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-401(1): (3) Beginning on July 1, 2018, and except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-401(2): The commission may issue an off-premise beer retailer state license for the retail sale of beer for consumption off the beer retailer's premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-401(3): (3)(b); 32B-7-402; (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-401(3)(a): (3)(b) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-401(3)(b): 32B-7-402; (3)(a) In addition to the fees described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-401(3)(b)(i): $150, if the person submits the application after March 1, 2019, and on or before April 15, 2019; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-401(3)(b)(ii): $300, if the person submits the application after April 15, 2019, and on or before May 31, 2019.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-402 Application for off-premise beer retailer state license -- Qualifications.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
To obtain an off-premise beer retailer state license, a person shall submit to the department:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-402(1): a written application in a form prescribed by the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-402(2): a nonrefundable application fee of $75;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-402(3): an initial license fee of $250 that is refundable if the commission does not issue the off-premise beer retailer state license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-402(4): written consent of the local authority;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-402(5): a copy of the person's current business license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-402(6): a floor plan of the premises that outlines the location of each beer display;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-402(7): a signed consent form stating the person will permit any authorized representative of the commission or the department or any law enforcement officer to have unrestricted right to enter the licensed premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-402(8): if the person is an entity, proper verification evidencing that the individual who signs the application is authorized to sign on behalf of the entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-402(9): any other information that the commission or department requires.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-403 Renewal of off-premise beer retailer state license.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-403(1): An off-premise beer retailer state license expires on the last day of February each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-403(2): To renew an off-premise beer retailer state license, an off-premise beer retailer state licensee shall, no later than January 31, submit:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-403(2)(a): a completed renewal application to the department in a form prescribed by the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-403(2)(b): a renewal fee of $175.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-403(3): An off-premise beer retailer state licensee automatically forfeits the off-premise beer retailer state license if the off-premise beer retailer state licensee fails to satisfy the renewal requirements described in this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-404 Duties of commission and department before issuing off-premise beer retailer state license.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-404(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-404(1)(a): Before the commission issues an off-premise beer retailer state license, the department shall conduct an investigation and may hold one or more public hearings to gather information and make recommendations to the commission regarding whether the commission should issue an off-premise beer retailer state license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-404(1)(b): The department shall forward the information the department gathers and the department's recommendations to the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-404(2): 32B-1-304 Before the commission issues an off-premise beer retailer state license, the commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-404(2)(a): determine that the person filed a complete application and is in compliance with the provisions of this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-404(2)(b): 32B-1-304 determine that the person is not disqualified under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-404(2)(c): consider the physical characteristics of the premises where the beer is displayed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-404(2)(d): consider any other factor that the commission considers necessary.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-405 Notifying department of change of ownership.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The commission may suspend or revoke an off-premise beer retailer state license if an off-premise beer retailer state licensee does not immediately notify the department of a change in:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-405(1): ownership of the licensee's business;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-405(2): for a corporate owner, a shareholder holding at least 20% of the total issued and outstanding stock of the corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-405(3): for a limited liability company, a member owning at least 20% of the limited liability company.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-406 Conditional off-premise beer retailer state license.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-406(1): As used in this section, "conditional off-premise beer retailer state license" means an off-premise beer retailer state license that conditions the holder's ability to purchase, store, sell, or offer for sale beer for consumption off the holder's licensed premises on the holder submitting to the department a copy of the holder's current business license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-406(2): In accordance with the provisions of this section, the commission may issue a conditional off-premise beer retailer state license to a person if the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-406(2)(a): meets the requirements to obtain an off-premise beer retailer state license, except the requirement to submit a copy of the person's current business license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-406(2)(b): agrees not to purchase, store, sell, or offer for sale beer for consumption off the person's licensed premises before obtaining an off-premise beer retailer state license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-406(3): (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-406(3)(a): For a conditional off-premise beer retailer state license to become an off-premise beer retailer state license, a person who holds the conditional off-premise beer retailer state license shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-406(3)(a)(i): submit to the department a copy of the person's current business license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-406(3)(a)(ii): provide to the department evidence satisfactory to the department that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-406(3)(a)(ii)(A): there has been no change in the information submitted to the commission as part of the person's application for an off-premise beer retailer state license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-406(3)(a)(ii)(B): the person continues to qualify for an off-premise beer retailer state license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-406(3)(b): (3)(a) A conditional off-premise beer retailer state license becomes an off-premise beer retailer state license on the day on which the department notifies the person who holds the conditional off-premise beer retailer state license that the department finds that the person has complied with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-406(4): (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-406(4)(a): A conditional off-premise beer retailer state license expires nine months after the day on which the commission issues the conditional off-premise beer retailer state license, unless the conditional off-premise beer retailer state license becomes an off-premise beer retailer state license before that day.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-406(4)(b): (4)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-406(4)(b)(i): has an active building permit related to the licensed premises; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-406(4)(b)(ii): is engaged in a good faith effort to pursue completion within the three-month period.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-407 Licensing at certain package agencies.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-407(1): (2) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-407(2): (1); 32B-2-605(13) An off-premise beer retailer state licensee described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-407(2)(a): other than beer that is the product of the brewery manufacturing licensee that holds the package agency located on the premises; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-407(2)(b): 32B-2-605(13) at a time other than a time a package agency may sell liquor under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-408 Master off-premise beer retailer state license.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-408(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-408(1)(a): The commission may issue a master off-premise beer retailer state license that authorizes a person to store, sell, or offer for sale beer for consumption off the person's premises at multiple locations as off-premise beer retailers if the person applying for the master off-premise beer retailer state license:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-408(1)(a)(i): owns each of the off-premise beer retailers;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-408(1)(a)(ii): except for the fee requirements, establishes to the satisfaction of the commission that each location of an off-premise beer retailer under the master off-premise beer retailer state license separately meets the requirements of this part; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-408(1)(a)(iii): the master off-premise beer retailer state license includes at least five off-premise beer retailer locations.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-408(1)(b): The person seeking a master off-premise beer retailer state license shall designate which off-premise beer retailer locations the person seeks to have under the master off-premise beer retailer state license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-408(1)(c): An off-premise beer retailer location under a master off-premise beer retailer state license is considered separately licensed for purposes of this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-408(2): 32B-7-403
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-408(2)(a): A master off-premise beer retailer state license expires on the last day of February each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-408(2)(b): 32B-7-403 To renew a person's master off-premise beer retailer state license, a person shall comply with the renewal requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-408(3): 32B-7-402(3); 32B-7-403(2)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-408(3)(a): The nonrefundable application fee for a master off-premise beer retailer state license is $75.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-408(3)(b)(ii): refundable if the commission does not issue the master off-premise beer retailer state license.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-408(4): A new location may be added to a master off-premise beer retailer state license after the master off-premise beer retailer state license is issued if, including payment of the initial license fee, the location separately meets the requirements of this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-408(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-408(5)(a): A master off-premise beer retailer state licensee shall notify the department of a change in the persons managing a location covered by a master off-premise beer retailer state license:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-408(5)(a)(i): immediately, if the management personnel is not management personnel at a location covered by the master off-premise beer retailer state license at the time of the change; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-408(5)(a)(ii): within 30 days of the change, if the off-premise beer retailer state licensee is transferring management personnel from one location to another location covered by the master off-premise beer retailer state license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-408(5)(b): A location covered by a master off-premise beer retailer state license shall keep its own records on its premises so that the department may audit the records.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-408(5)(c): A master off-premise beer retailer state licensee may not transfer beer between different locations covered by the master off-premise beer retailer state license.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-7-408(6)(b)(ii): at least 50% of the locations covered by the master off-premise beer retailer state license have been found by the commission to have violated this title.
