Utah Code Annotated - Title 32B - Chapter 8 - Resort License Act
****************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Resort License Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-102(1): "Boundary of a resort building" means the physical boundary of the real property reasonably related to a resort building and any structure or improvement to that land as determined by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-102(2): "Dwelling" means a portion of a resort building:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-102(2)(a): owned by one or more individuals;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-102(2)(b): that is used or designated for use as a residence by one or more persons; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-102(2)(c): that may be rented, loaned, leased, or hired out for a period of no longer than 30 consecutive days by a person who uses it for a residence.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-102(3): "Engaged in the management of the resort" may be defined by the commission by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-102(4): (4)(a) "Resident" means an individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-102(4)(a): owns a dwelling located within a resort building; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-102(4)(b): (4)(a) rents lodging accommodations for 30 consecutive days or less from:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-102(4)(b)(i): (4)(a) an owner of a dwelling described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-102(4)(b)(ii): the resort licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-102(5): "Resort" means a location:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-102(5)(a): on which is located one resort building; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-102(5)(b): that is affiliated with a ski area that physically touches the boundary of the resort building.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-102(6): (6)(b) "Resort building" means a building:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-102(6)(a): that is primarily operated to provide dwellings or lodging accommodations;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-102(6)(b): that has at least 150 units that consist of a dwelling or lodging accommodations;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-102(6)(c): that consists of at least 400,000 square feet:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-102(6)(c)(i): including only the building itself; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-102(6)(c)(ii): not including areas such as above ground surface parking; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-102(6)(d): (6)(b) of which at least 50% of the units described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-201 Commission's power to issue a resort license.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-201(1): Before a person as a resort under a single license may store, sell, offer for sale, furnish, or allow the consumption of an alcoholic product on sublicense premises, the person shall first obtain a resort license from the commission in accordance with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-201(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-201(2)(a): The commission may issue to a person a resort license to allow the storage, sale, offer for sale, furnishing, and consumption of an alcoholic product in connection with a resort designated in the resort license if the person operates at least four sublicenses under the resort license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-201(2)(b): A resort license shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-201(2)(b)(i): consist of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-201(2)(b)(i)(A): a general resort license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-201(2)(b)(i)(B): four or more sublicenses; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-201(2)(b)(ii): designate the boundary of the resort building.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-201(2)(c): This chapter does not prohibit an alcoholic product in or on the boundary of the resort building to the extent otherwise permitted by this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-201(3): The commission may not issue a total number of resort licenses that at any time totals more than eight.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-202 Specific licensing requirements for resort license.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-202(1): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process To obtain a resort license, in addition to complying with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-202(1)(a): evidence:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-202(1)(a)(i): of proximity of the resort building to any community location;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-202(1)(a)(ii): that each proposed sublicensed premises is entirely within the boundaries of the resort building; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-202(1)(a)(iii): that the building designated in the application as the resort building qualifies as a resort building; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-202(1)(b): a description and boundary map of the resort building.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-202(2): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-202(2)(a): A resort license expires on October 31 of each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-202(2)(b): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process To renew a person's resort license, the person shall comply with the requirements of
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-202(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-202(3)(a): The nonrefundable application fee for a resort license is $300.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-202(3)(b): The initial license fee for a resort license is calculated as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-202(3)(b)(i): if four sublicenses are being applied for under the resort license, $10,000; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-202(3)(b)(ii): if more than four sublicenses are being applied for under the resort license, the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-202(3)(b)(ii)(A): $10,000; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-202(3)(b)(ii)(B): $2,000 for each sublicense in excess of four sublicenses for which the person is applying.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-202(3)(c): The renewal fee for a resort license is $1,000 for each sublicense under the resort license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-202(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-202(4)(a): The bond amount required for a resort license is the penal sum of $25,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-202(4)(b): A resort licensee is not required to have a separate bond for each sublicense, except that the aggregate of the bonds posted by the resort licensee shall cover each sublicense under the resort license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-202(5): 32B-1-202 The commission may not issue a resort license for a resort building that does not meet the proximity requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-202(6): 32B-8d-103(4) In accordance with Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-401 Specific operational requirements for resort license.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-401(1): Chapter 5, Part 3, Retail Licensee Operational Requirements; 32B-8-502; (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act; (1)(b)(i); (iv)

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-401(1)(b)(ii): individual staff of the resort licensee;

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-401(1)(b)(iv): individual staff of a sublicensee or person otherwise operating under a sublicense of the resort licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-401(1)(b)(v): (1)(b)(i); (iv) any combination of the persons listed in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-401(2): Chapter 2, Part 6, Package Agency; (2)(a); 32B-8d-104; Chapter 2, Part 6, Package Agency; (5)

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-401(2)(a)(i): on sublicensed premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-401(2)(a)(ii): pursuant to a permit issued under this title;

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-401(2)(a)(iv): through room service.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-401(2)(b)(i): 32B-8d-104 if on a sublicense premises, in accordance with the operational requirements described in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-401(2)(b)(iii): Chapter 2, Part 6, Package Agency if as a package agency, in accordance with the contract with the department and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-401(2)(b)(iv): (5) if through room service, in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-401(3): A resort licensee shall operate in a manner so that at least 70% of the annual aggregate of the gross receipts related to the sale of food or beverages for the resort license and each of the resort licensee's sublicenses is from the sale of food, not including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-401(3)(a): mix for an alcoholic product; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-401(3)(b): a charge in connection with the service of an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-401(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-401(4)(a): A resort licensee shall supervise and direct a person involved in the sale, offer for sale, or furnishing of an alcoholic product under a resort license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-401(4)(b): A person involved in the sale, offer for sale, or furnishing of an alcoholic product under a resort license shall complete the alcohol training and education seminar.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-401(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-401(5)(a): Room service of an alcoholic product to a lodging accommodation of a resort licensee shall be provided in person by staff of the resort licensee only to an adult occupant in the lodging accommodation.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8-401(5)(b): An alcoholic product may not be left outside a lodging accommodation for retrieval by an occupant.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 32B - Chapter 8b - Hotel License Act
****************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Hotel License Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-102(1): "Boundary of a hotel" means the physical boundary of one or more contiguous parcels of real property owned or managed by the same person and on which a hotel is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-102(2): "Hotel" means one or more buildings that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-102(2)(a): comprise a hotel, as defined by the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-102(2)(b): are owned or managed by the same person or by a person who has a majority interest in or can direct or exercise control over the management or policy of the person who owns or manages any other building under the hotel license within the boundary of the hotel;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-102(2)(c): primarily operate to provide lodging accommodations;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-102(2)(d): have on-premise banquet space and provide on-premise banquet service within the boundary of the hotel meeting the requirements of this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-102(2)(e): have a restaurant or bar establishment within the boundary of the hotel meeting the requirements of this title; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-102(2)(f): have at least 40 rooms as temporary sleeping accommodations for compensation.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-201 Commission's power to issue a hotel license.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-201(1): Before a person as a hotel under a single license may store, sell, offer for sale, furnish, or allow the consumption of an alcoholic product on sublicense premises, the person shall first obtain a hotel license from the commission in accordance with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-201(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-201(2)(a): The commission may issue to a person a hotel license to allow the storage, sale, offer for sale, furnishing, and consumption of an alcoholic product in connection with a hotel designated in the hotel license if the person operates at least three sublicenses under the hotel license:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-201(2)(a)(i): one of which is an on-premise banquet license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-201(2)(a)(ii): one of which is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-201(2)(a)(ii)(A): a full-service restaurant sublicense;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-201(2)(a)(ii)(B): a limited-service restaurant sublicense;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-201(2)(a)(ii)(C): a beer-only restaurant sublicense; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-201(2)(a)(ii)(D): a bar establishment sublicense.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-201(2)(b): (2)(a) A hotel license shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-201(2)(b)(i): (2)(a) consist of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-201(2)(b)(i)(A): a general hotel license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-201(2)(b)(i)(B): (2)(a) three or more sublicenses meeting the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-201(2)(b)(ii): designate the boundary of the hotel and sublicenses.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-201(2)(c): This chapter does not prohibit an alcoholic product on the boundary of the hotel to the extent otherwise permitted by this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-201(3): The commission may not issue a total number of hotel licenses that at any time totals more than 80.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-202 Specific licensing requirements for hotel license.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-202(1): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process To obtain a hotel license, in addition to complying with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-202(1)(a): evidence:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-202(1)(a)(i): of proximity of each building under the hotel license to any community location;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-202(1)(a)(ii): that each proposed sublicensed premises is entirely within the boundary of the hotel; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-202(1)(a)(iii): that each building designated in the application as a building under the hotel license qualifies to be under the hotel license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-202(1)(b): a description and boundary map of the hotel.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-202(2): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-202(2)(a): A hotel license expires on October 31 of each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-202(2)(b): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process To renew a person's hotel license, the person shall comply with the requirements of
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-202(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-202(3)(a): The nonrefundable application fee for a hotel license is $500.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-202(3)(b): The initial license fee for a hotel license is calculated as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-202(3)(b)(i): if three sublicenses are being applied for under the hotel license, $5,000; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-202(3)(b)(ii): if more than three sublicenses are being applied for under the hotel license, the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-202(3)(b)(ii)(A): $5,000; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-202(3)(b)(ii)(B): $2,000 for each sublicense in excess of three sublicenses for which the person is applying.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-202(3)(c): The renewal fee for a hotel license is $1,000 for each sublicense under the hotel license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-202(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-202(4)(a): The bond amount required for a hotel license is the penal sum of $10,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-202(4)(b): A hotel licensee is not required to have a separate bond for each sublicense, except that the aggregate of the bonds posted by the hotel licensee shall cover each sublicense under the hotel license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-202(5): 32B-1-202 The commission may not issue a hotel license that includes a building under the hotel license that does not meet the proximity requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-202(6): 32B-8d-103(4) In accordance with Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301 Specific operational requirements for hotel license.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(1): Chapter 5, Part 3, Retail Licensee Operational Requirements; (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act; (1)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(1)(a): Chapter 5, Part 3, Retail Licensee Operational Requirements In addition to complying with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(1)(b): (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act; (1)(b) Failure to comply as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(1)(b)(i): the hotel licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(1)(b)(ii): individual staff of the hotel licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(1)(b)(iii): a sublicensee or person otherwise operating under a sublicense of the hotel licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(1)(b)(iv): individual staff of a sublicensee or person otherwise operating under a sublicense of the hotel licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(1)(b)(v): (1)(b) any combination of the persons listed in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(2): Chapter 2, Part 6, Package Agency; (2)(a); 32B-8d-104; Chapter 2, Part 6, Package Agency; (4); (2); 32B-8d-104; 32B-5-307
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(2)(a): Chapter 2, Part 6, Package Agency A hotel licensee may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product except:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(2)(a)(i): on sublicensed premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(2)(a)(ii): pursuant to a permit issued under this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(2)(a)(iii): Chapter 2, Part 6, Package Agency under a package agency agreement with the department, subject to
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(2)(a)(iv): through room service.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(2)(b): (2)(a); 32B-8d-104; Chapter 2, Part 6, Package Agency; (4) A hotel licensee who sells, offers for sale, or furnishes an alcoholic product as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(2)(b)(i): 32B-8d-104 if on sublicensed premises, in accordance with the operational requirements described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(2)(b)(ii): if under a permit issued under this title, in accordance with the operational requirements under the provisions applicable to the permit;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(2)(b)(iii): Chapter 2, Part 6, Package Agency if as a package agency, in accordance with the contract with the department and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(2)(b)(iv): (4) if through room service, in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(2)(c): (2); 32B-8d-104; 32B-5-307 Notwithstanding the other provisions of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(3): A hotel licensee shall supervise and direct a person involved in the sale, offer for sale, or furnishing of an alcoholic product under a hotel license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(4)(a): Room service of an alcoholic product to a lodging accommodation of a hotel licensee shall be provided in person by staff of the hotel licensee only to an adult occupant in the lodging accommodation.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(4)(b): An alcoholic product may not be left outside a lodging accommodation for retrieval by an occupant.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(5): A hotel licensee shall operate in a manner so that at least 70% of the annual aggregate of the gross receipts related to the sale of food or beverages for the hotel license and each of the hotel license's sublicenses is from the sale of food, not including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(5)(a): mix for an alcoholic product; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-301(5)(b): a charge in connection with the service of an alcoholic product.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-401(1)(b): individual staff of the hotel licensee;

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-401(2)(a): a hotel licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-401(2)(b): a sublicensee or person operating under a sublicense of a hotel licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8b-401(2)(c): staff of a hotel licensee or sublicensee or other person operating under a sublicense of a hotel licensee.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 32B - Chapter 8c - Arena License Act
****************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Arena License Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-201 Commission's power to issue an arena license.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-201(1): Before a person as an arena under a single license may store, sell, offer for sale, furnish, or allow the consumption of an alcoholic product on sublicensed premises, the person shall first obtain an arena license from the commission in accordance with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-201(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-201(2)(a): Beginning November 1, 2020, the commission may issue to a person an arena license to allow the storage, sale, offer for sale, furnishing, and consumption of an alcoholic product in connection with the arena designated in the arena license, if the person operates at least three sublicenses under the arena license, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-201(2)(a)(i): one of which is an on-premise banquet sublicense;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-201(2)(a)(ii): one of which is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-201(2)(a)(ii)(A): a full-service restaurant sublicense;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-201(2)(a)(ii)(B): a limited-service restaurant sublicense;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-201(2)(a)(ii)(C): a beer-only restaurant sublicense; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-201(2)(a)(ii)(D): a bar establishment sublicense; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-201(2)(a)(iii): one of which is an on-premise beer retailer sublicense that is not a tavern.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-201(2)(b): (2)(a) An arena license shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-201(2)(b)(i): (2)(a) consist of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-201(2)(b)(i)(A): a general arena license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-201(2)(b)(i)(B): (2)(a) three or more sublicenses meeting the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-201(2)(b)(ii): designate the enclosed building that is the arena.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-201(2)(c): This chapter does not prohibit an alcoholic product in an arena to the extent otherwise permitted by this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-201(3): The commission may not issue a total number of arena licenses that at any time totals more than 10.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-202 Specific licensing requirements for arena license.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-202(1): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process To obtain an arena license, in addition to complying with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-202(1)(a): evidence:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-202(1)(a)(i): of proximity of the arena to any community location;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-202(1)(a)(ii): that each proposed sublicense premises is entirely within the arena; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-202(1)(a)(iii): that the building designated in the application as the arena qualifies as an arena; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-202(1)(b): a description and map of the arena.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-202(2): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-202(2)(a): An arena license expires on October 31 of each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-202(2)(b): Chapter 5, Part 2, Retail Licensing Process To renew a person's arena license, the person shall comply with the requirements of
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-202(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-202(3)(a): The nonrefundable application fee for an arena license is $500.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-202(3)(b): The initial license fee for an arena license is calculated as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-202(3)(b)(i): if the person applies for three sublicenses under the arena license, $5,000; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-202(3)(b)(ii): if the person applies for more than three sublicenses under the arena license, the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-202(3)(b)(ii)(A): $5,000; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-202(3)(b)(ii)(B): $1,000 for each sublicense in excess of three sublicenses for which the person applies.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-202(3)(c): The renewal fee for an arena license is $1,000 plus $1,000 for each sublicense under the arena license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-202(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-202(4)(a): The bond amount required for an arena license is the penal sum of $100,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-202(4)(b): An arena licensee is not required to have a separate bond for each sublicense, except that the aggregate of the bonds posted by the arena licensee shall cover each sublicense under the arena license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-202(5): 32B-1-202.1(4); 32B-8d-103(4) Except as prohibited in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-301 Specific operational requirements for arena license.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-301(1): Chapter 5, Part 3, Retail Licensee Operational Requirements; Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act; (1)(b)(i); (iv)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-301(1)(a): Chapter 5, Part 3, Retail Licensee Operational Requirements In addition to complying with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-301(1)(b): Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act; (1)(b)(i); (iv) Failure to comply as provided in Subjection (1)(a) may result in disciplinary action in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-301(1)(b)(i): the arena licensee;

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-301(1)(b)(iii): a sublicensee or person otherwise operating under a sublicense of the arena licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-301(1)(b)(iv): individual staff of a sublicensee or person otherwise operating under a sublicense; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-301(1)(b)(v): (1)(b)(i); (iv) any combination of the persons listed in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-301(2): Chapter 2, Part 6, Package Agency; (2)(a); 32B-8d-104; Chapter 2, Part 6, Package Agency

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-301(2)(a)(i): on sublicensed premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-301(2)(a)(ii): pursuant to a permit issued under this title; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-301(2)(a)(iii): Chapter 2, Part 6, Package Agency under a package agency agreement with the department, subject to
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-301(2)(b): (2)(a); 32B-8d-104; Chapter 2, Part 6, Package Agency An arena licensee who sells, offers for sale, or furnishes an alcoholic product as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-301(2)(b)(i): 32B-8d-104 if on sublicensed premises, in accordance with the operational requirements described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-301(2)(b)(ii): if under a permit issued under this title, in accordance with the operational requirements under the provisions applicable to the permit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-301(2)(b)(iii): Chapter 2, Part 6, Package Agency if as a package agency, in accordance with the contract with the department and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-301(3): An arena licensee shall operate in a manner so that at least 70% of the annual aggregate of the gross receipts related to the sale of food and beverages for the arena license and each of the arena license's sublicenses is from the sale of food, not including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-301(3)(a): mix for an alcoholic product; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-301(3)(b): a charge in connection with the service of an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-301(4): An arena licensee shall, directly or indirectly, supervise and direct a person involved in the sale, offer for sale, or furnishing of an alcoholic product under an arena license.

---------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-401(2)(a): an arena licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8c-401(2)(b): a sublicensee or person operating under a sublicense of an arena licensee;

Utah Code Annotated - Title 32B - Chapter 8d - Sublicense Act
*************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Sublicense Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-102(1): 32B-8b-102 "Boundary of a hotel" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-102(2): 32B-8b-102 "Boundary of a resort building" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-102(3): 32B-8b-102 "Hotel" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-102(4): 32B-8-102 "Resort building" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-102(5): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Spa" means a spa:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-102(5)(a): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act as the commission defines by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-102(5)(b): that is within the:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-102(5)(b)(i): boundary of a resort building; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-102(5)(b)(ii): boundary of a hotel.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103 Commission's power to issue a sublicense.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(1): Chapter 8, Resort License Act; Chapter 8b, Hotel License Act; Chapter 8c, Arena License Act Before a person as a sublicensee may store, sell, offer for sale, furnish, or allow the consumption of an alcoholic product on sublicensed premises, the person shall first obtain a sublicense from the commission in accordance with:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(1)(a): this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(1)(b): Chapter 8, Resort License Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(1)(c): Chapter 8b, Hotel License Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(1)(d): Chapter 8c, Arena License Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(2)(a): The commission may issue to a person a sublicense to allow the storage, sale, offering for sale, furnishing, or consumption of an alcoholic product on the premises of the sublicense, if the person is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(2)(a)(i): a principal licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(2)(a)(ii): a person seeking a principal license, contingent on the issuance of the principal license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(2)(b): The commission may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(2)(b)(i): issue a sublicense that is separate from a principal license; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(2)(b)(ii): issue a single sublicense that covers more than one outlet in or on the boundaries of the principal licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(3): When determining the total number of licenses the commission has issued for each type of retail license, the commission may not include a sublicense as one of the retail licenses issued under the provisions applicable to that sublicense.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(4): 32B-5-201 If a principal licensee seeks to add a sublicense after the commission issues the person's principal license, the principal licensee shall file with the department:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(4)(a): a nonrefundable $300 application fee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(4)(b): an initial license fee of $2,250, which the commission shall refund if the commission does not issue the proposed sublicense;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(4)(c): written consent of the local authority;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(4)(d): a copy of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(4)(d)(i): the principal licensee's current business; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(4)(d)(ii): the proposed sublicensee's current business license, if the relevant political subdivision determines that the proposed sublicensee's business license is separate from the principal licensee's business license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(4)(e): evidence that the proposed sublicensed premises is entirely within the boundary of the principal license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(4)(f): a description, floor plan, and boundary map of the proposed sublicensed premises designating:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(4)(f)(i): each location at which the principal licensee proposes that an alcoholic product be stored; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(4)(f)(ii): each location from which the principal licensee proposes that an alcoholic product be sold, furnished, or consumed;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(4)(g): 32B-5-201 evidence that the principal licensee carries:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(4)(g)(i): public liability insurance in an amount and form satisfactory to the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(4)(g)(ii): 32B-5-201 dramshop insurance coverage in the amount required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(4)(h): a signed consent form stating that the principal licensee will permit any authorized representative of the commission or department, or any law enforcement officer, to have an unrestricted right to enter the proposed sublicensed premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(4)(i): if the principal licensee is an entity, proper verification evidencing that a person who signs the application is authorized to sign on behalf of the entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-103(4)(j): any other information the commission or department may require.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-104 General operational requirements for a sublicense.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-104(1): (2); (3) Except as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-104(2): 32B-8-401(3); 32B-8b-301(5); 32B-8c-301(3) Notwithstanding a requirement in the provisions applicable to the sublicense, a person operating under the sublicense is not subject to a requirement that a certain percentage of the gross receipts for the sublicense be from the sale of food, except to the extent that the gross receipts for the sublicense are included in calculating the percentages under Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-104(3): 32B-5-307; (3)(b)(i); (3)(b)(i) Notwithstanding Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-104(3)(a): a patron may transport beer between the sublicensed premises of an arena licensee's accompanying sublicenses, if the patron transports the beer from and to an area of each sublicensed premises:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-104(3)(a)(i): that is adjacent to the other; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-104(3)(a)(ii): where the consumption of beer is permitted; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-104(3)(b): (3)(b)(i); (3)(b)(i) staff of a sublicensee or person otherwise operating under a sublicense of a hotel licensee or a resort licensee may transport an alcoholic beverage from and to sublicensed premises of the hotel license or resort license, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-104(3)(b)(i): the sublicensee is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-104(3)(b)(i)(A): a full-service restaurant sublicensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-104(3)(b)(i)(B): a limited-service restaurant sublicensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-104(3)(b)(i)(C): a bar establishment sublicensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-104(3)(b)(i)(D): a beer-only restaurant sublicensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-104(3)(b)(i)(E): an on-premise beer retailer sublicensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-104(3)(b)(ii): (3)(b)(i); (3)(b)(i) the individual staff carries the alcoholic beverage:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-104(3)(b)(ii)(A): (3)(b)(i) from the sublicensed premises of a sublicensee described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-104(3)(b)(ii)(B): briefly through an unlicensed area or briefly through sublicensed premises on which the type of alcoholic beverage that the individual staff carries is permitted; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-104(3)(b)(ii)(C): (3)(b)(i) to the sublicensed premises of a sublicensee described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-104(3)(b)(iii): the individual staff at all times stays within:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-104(3)(b)(iii)(A): the boundary of the hotel; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-104(3)(b)(iii)(B): the boundary of the resort building.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-104(4): 32B-8-502 Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-104(4)(a): a requirement imposed on a sublicensee or person operating under a sublicense applies to the principal licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-104(4)(b): a requirement imposed on staff of a sublicensee or person operating under a sublicense applies to staff of the principal licensee.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-105 Enforcement of operational requirements.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-105(1): 32B-8-502(2); (2); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act; (1)(a); (d) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-105(1)(a): a principal licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-105(1)(b): individual staff of a principal licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-105(1)(c): a sublicensee or person otherwise operating under a sublicense;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-105(1)(d): individual staff of a sublicensee or person otherwise operating under a sublicense; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-105(1)(e): (1)(a); (d) any combination of the persons listed in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-105(2): An operational requirement applicable to a sublicensee or person operating under a sublicense is enforced as provided by the provisions applicable to the sublicense.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-201 Title.
---------------------------------------
This part is known as " Spa Sublicense."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-202 Commission's power to issue a spa sublicense.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-202(1): Before a person may store, sell, offer for sale, furnish, or allow the consumption of an alcoholic product on the person's premises as a spa sublicensee, a resort licensee, a hotel licensee, or a person applying for a resort license or a hotel license shall first obtain a spa sublicense from the commission in accordance with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-202(2): The commission may only issue a spa sublicense to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-202(2)(a): a resort licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-202(2)(b): a hotel licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-202(2)(c): a person applying for a resort license, contingent on the issuance of the resort license; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-202(2)(d): a person applying for a hotel license, contingent on the issuance of the hotel license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-202(3): A spa sublicense premises shall fall entirely within the:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-202(3)(a): boundary of a resort building that is part of the resort to which the spa sublicense is connected; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-202(3)(b): boundary of a hotel that is part of the hotel to which the spa sublicense is connected.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-203 Specific licensing requirements for spa sublicense.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-203(1): 32B-8d-103(2); 32B-8d-103(4)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-203(1)(a): 32B-8d-103(2) In accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-203(1)(b): 32B-8d-103(4) If a resort licensee or a hotel licensee seeks to add a spa sublicense after the licensee's resort license or hotel license is issued, the licensee shall comply with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-203(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-203(2)(a): A spa sublicense expires on October 31 of each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-203(2)(b): To renew a spa sublicense, the corresponding resort licensee or hotel licensee shall renew the spa sublicense as part of renewing the licensee's resort license or hotel license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-203(2)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-203(2)(c)(i): Failure of a resort licensee to meet the renewal requirements for a resort license results in an automatic forfeiture of the spa sublicense effective the day on which the resort license expires.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-203(2)(c)(ii): Failure of a hotel licensee to meet the renewal requirements for a hotel license results in an automatic forfeiture of the spa sublicense effective the day on which the hotel license expires.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-204 Specific qualifications for a spa sublicense.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-204(1): 32B-1-304 A person employed to act in a supervisory or managerial capacity for the spa sublicense is subject to qualification requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-204(2): 32B-1-304 If a person no longer possesses the qualifications required by Section

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(1)(c)(vii): (1)(c)(i); (vi) any combination of the persons listed in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(2): 32B-1-205; (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(2)(a): For purposes of the spa sublicense, the corresponding resort licensee or hotel licensee shall ensure that a record is maintained or used for the spa sublicense:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(2)(a)(i): as the department requires; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(2)(a)(ii): for a minimum period of three years.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(2)(b): A spa sublicensee record is subject to inspection by an authorized representative of the commission and the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(2)(c): A resort licensee or a hotel licensee shall allow the department, through a compliance officer of the department, to audit the records for a spa sublicense at the times the department considers advisable.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(2)(d): The department shall audit the records for a spa sublicense at least once annually.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(2)(e): 32B-1-205; (2) Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(3): Chapter 6, Part 7, On-Premise Beer Retailer License; (3)(a); (b); (3)(c)(i)(C)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(3)(a): A spa sublicensee or person operating under a spa sublicense may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish liquor at a spa during a period that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(3)(a)(i): begins at 1 a.m.; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(3)(a)(ii): ends at 9:59 a.m.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(3)(b): Chapter 6, Part 7, On-Premise Beer Retailer License A spa sublicensee or person operating under a spa sublicense may sell, offer for sale, or furnish beer during the hours specified in
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(3)(c): (3)(a); (b); (3)(c)(i)(C)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(3)(c)(i): (3)(a); (b); (3)(c)(i)(C) Notwithstanding Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(3)(c)(i)(A): a single drink containing spirituous liquor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(3)(c)(i)(B): (3)(c)(i)(C) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(3)(c)(i)(C): a single serving not exceeding 16 ounces of hard cider that is furnished in a sealed container and contains no more than 5% of alcohol by volume;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(3)(c)(i)(D): a single serving of heavy beer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(3)(c)(i)(E): a single serving not exceeding 26 ounces of beer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(3)(c)(i)(F): a single serving of a flavored malt beverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(3)(c)(ii): A spa is not required to remain open:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(3)(c)(ii)(A): after all individuals have vacated the spa sublicensee's sublicensed premises; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(3)(c)(ii)(B): during an emergency.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(4): (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(4)(a): A minor may not be admitted into, use, or be on the sublicensed premises of a spa sublicense unless accompanied by an individual 21 years old or older.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(4)(b): (4)(a) A minor permitted under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(4)(b)(i): may only be admitted into or be on a lounge or bar area of the spa sublicensee's sublicensed premises momentarily while en route to another area of the spa; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(4)(b)(ii): may not remain or sit in the lounge or bar area of the spa sublicensee's sublicensed premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(5): A spa sublicensee shall have food available at all times when an alcoholic product is sold, offered for sale, furnished, or consumed on the spa sublicensee's sublicensed premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(6): (6); (6)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(6)(a): (6) Subject to the other provisions of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(6)(b): A spa patron may not have two spirituous liquor drinks before the spa patron if one of the spirituous liquor drinks consists only of the primary spirituous liquor for the other spirituous liquor drink.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(6)(c): (6) An individual portion of wine is considered to be one alcoholic product under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(7)(a): An alcoholic product may only be consumed at a table or counter.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(7)(b): An alcoholic product may not be served to or consumed by a patron at a dispensing structure.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(8): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(8)(a): A spa sublicensee or person operating under a spa sublicense shall have available on the spa sublicense's sublicensed premises for a patron to review at the time that the patron requests it, a written alcoholic product price list or a menu containing the price of an alcoholic product sold or furnished by the spa sublicensee including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(8)(a)(i): a set-up charge;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(8)(a)(ii): a service charge; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(8)(a)(iii): a chilling fee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(8)(b): A charge or fee made in connection with the sale, service, or consumption of liquor may be stated in food or alcoholic product menus including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(8)(b)(i): a set-up charge;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(8)(b)(ii): a service charge; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(8)(b)(iii): a chilling fee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(9): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(9)(a): A resort licensee or hotel licensee shall own or lease premises suitable for the spa sublicense's activities.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(9)(b): A resort licensee or hotel licensee may not maintain premises in a manner that barricades or conceals the spa sublicense's operation.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(10): Subject to the other provisions of this section, a spa sublicensee or person operating under a spa sublicense may not sell an alcoholic product to or allow an individual to be admitted to or use the spa sublicensee's sublicensed premises other than:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(10)(a): a resident; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-8d-205(10)(b): a customer.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 32B - Chapter 9 - Event Permit Act
**************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Event Permit Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-102(1): Part 3, Single Event Permit "Single event permit" means an event permit issued in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-102(2): Part 4, Temporary Beer Event Permit "Temporary beer event permit" means an event permit issued in accordance with


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201 Application requirements for event permit.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201(1): 32B-9-203 To obtain an event permit, a person shall submit to the department:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201(1)(a): a written application in a form that the department prescribes;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201(1)(b): an event permit fee:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201(1)(b)(i): in the amount specified in the relevant part under this chapter for the type of event permit for which the person is applying; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201(1)(b)(ii): that is refundable if an event permit is not issued;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201(1)(c): written consent of the local authority;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201(1)(d): 32B-9-203 a bond as specified by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201(1)(e): the times, dates, location, estimated attendance, nature, and purpose of the event;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201(1)(f): a description or floor plan designating:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201(1)(f)(i): the area in which the person proposes that an alcoholic product be stored;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201(1)(f)(ii): the site from which the person proposes that an alcoholic product be sold, offered for sale, or furnished; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201(1)(f)(iii): the area in which the person proposes that an alcoholic product be allowed to be consumed;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201(1)(g): a signed consent form stating that the event permittee will permit any authorized representative of the commission, department, or any law enforcement officer to have unrestricted right to enter the premises during the event;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201(1)(h): if the person is an entity, proper verification evidencing that a person who signs the application is authorized to sign on behalf of the entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201(1)(i): any other information as the commission or department may require.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201(2): (1); 63J-1-504 If a person substantially changes the person's application under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201(2)(a): 63J-1-504 in an amount the department prescribes in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201(2)(b): that is nonrefundable, regardless of whether the department issues an event permit.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201(3): (1)(b); (c); (d) An entity applying for a permit need not meet the requirements of Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201(3)(a): a state agency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201(3)(b): a political subdivision of the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201(4): 32B-1-304 The director may not issue an event permit to a person who is disqualified under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201(5): 32B-1-202; (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201(5)(a): 32B-1-202 The proximity requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-201(5)(b): (5)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202 Duties before issuing event permit.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(1)(a): Before the director may issue an event permit, the department shall conduct an investigation and may hold public hearings to gather information and make recommendations to the director as to whether the director should issue an event permit.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(1)(b): (1)(a) The department shall provide the information and recommendations described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(2): 32B-9-201; 32B-1-304; (1); (3) Before issuing an event permit, the director shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(2)(a): 32B-9-201 determine that the person filed a complete application and is in compliance with:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(2)(a)(i): 32B-9-201 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(2)(a)(ii): the relevant part under this chapter for the type of event permit for which the person is applying;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(2)(b): 32B-1-304 determine that the person is not disqualified under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(2)(c): consider the purpose of the organization or its local lodge, chapter, or other local unit;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(2)(d): consider the times, dates, location, estimated attendance, nature, and purpose of the event;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(2)(e): to minimize the risk of minors being sold or furnished alcohol or adults being overserved alcohol at the event, determine that adequate and appropriate control measures and adequate and appropriate enforcement measures are in place at the event to assure that minors will not be sold or furnished alcohol and that adults will not be overserved, except that adequate and appropriate control and enforcement measures may be different for small, large, indoor, or outdoor events;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(2)(f): determine that the event permit is not being sought by the person as a means to circumvent other applicable requirements of this title, notwithstanding that the applicant may hold one or more licenses issued under this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(2)(g): consider, for the period of three years before the date of the event, the violation history of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(2)(g)(i): the applicant; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(2)(g)(ii): the venue where the event will be held;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(2)(h): (1) provide the information and recommendations described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(2)(i): (3) notify each commissioner before the director issues the event permit in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(2)(j): consider any other factor the director considers necessary.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(3): (3)(d); (e); (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(3)(a): (3)(d); (e) Except as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(3)(b): The preliminary decision becomes a final decision of the director unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(3)(b)(i): within three business days after the day on which the notice is received at least three of the commissioners request a meeting to discuss whether the event permit should be issued; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(3)(b)(ii): the director modifies or revokes the preliminary decision to issue or deny issuance of the event permit.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(3)(c): If three or more of the commissioners request a meeting:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(3)(c)(i): the applicant for the event permit shall be notified; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(3)(c)(ii): the commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(3)(c)(ii)(A): hold a meeting on the application for an event permit no later than the next regularly scheduled meeting of the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(3)(c)(ii)(B): issue the event permit if the applicant meets the requirements of this chapter or deny issuance of the event permit if the applicant fails to meet the requirements of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(3)(d): (3)(a) The commission may waive the three business day notice period described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(3)(e): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(3)(e)(i): The director may at any time refer an application for an event permit directly to the commission for a determination as to whether an event permit should be issued or denied.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(3)(e)(ii): For purposes of this title, an event permit issued by the commission is to be treated the same as an event permit issued by the director.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(3)(f): If the commission finds that an event permit was improperly issued or that the permittee has violated this chapter, the commission may take any action permitted under this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(4): Once the director issues an event permit, the department shall send a copy of the approved application and the event permit by written or electronic means to the state and local law enforcement authorities at least three days before the event.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(5): The director shall provide the commission a monthly report of the actions taken by the director under this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-202(6): If authorized by the director, the deputy director may act on behalf of the director for purposes of issuing an event permit under this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-203 Bond for event permit.
------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-203(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-203(1)(a): A person applying for an event permit shall post a cash bond or surety bond:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-203(1)(a)(i): in the amount specified in the relevant part under this chapter for the type of event permit for which the person is applying; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-203(1)(a)(ii): payable to the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-203(1)(b): An event permittee shall procure and maintain a bond required under this section for as long as the event permit is in effect.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-203(2): A bond posted by an event permittee under this section shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-203(2)(a): in a form approved by the attorney general; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-203(2)(b): conditioned upon the event permittee's faithful compliance with this title and the rules of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-203(3): No part of a bond posted by an event permittee under this section may be withdrawn during the period the event permit is in effect.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-203(4): (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-203(4)(a): A bond posted by an event permittee under this section may be forfeited if the event permit is revoked.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-203(4)(b): (4)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204 General operational requirements for an event permit.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(1): (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act; (1)(b); (1); 32B-4-206
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(1)(a): An event permittee and a person involved in the storage, sale, offer for sale, or furnishing of an alcoholic product at an event for which an event permit is issued, shall comply with this title and rules of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(1)(b): (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act; (1)(b) Failure to comply as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(1)(b)(i): Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act; (1)(b) may result in:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(1)(b)(i)(A): Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act; (1)(b) disciplinary action in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(1)(b)(i)(A)(I): an event permittee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(1)(b)(i)(A)(II): a person involved in the storage, sale, offer for sale, or furnishing of an alcoholic product at the event; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(1)(b)(i)(A)(III): (1)(b) any combination of the persons listed in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(1)(b)(i)(B): immediate revocation of the event permit;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(1)(b)(i)(C): forfeiture of a bond; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(1)(b)(i)(D): immediate seizure of an alcoholic product present at the event; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(1)(b)(ii): if the event permit is revoked, disqualifies the event permittee from applying for an event permit for a period of three years from the date of revocation of the event permit.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(1)(c): (1); 32B-4-206 An alcoholic product seized under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(2)(a): If there is a conflict between this part and the relevant part under this chapter for the specific type of special use permit held by the special use permittee, the relevant part governs.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(2)(b): Notwithstanding that this part may refer to "liquor" or an "alcoholic product," an event permittee may only sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product specified in the relevant part under this chapter for the type of event permit that is held by the event permittee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(2)(c): Notwithstanding that this part or the relevant part under this chapter for the type of event permit held by an event permittee refers to "event permittee," a person involved in the storage, sale, offer for sale, or furnishing of an alcoholic product at the event for which the event permit is issued is subject to the same requirement or prohibition.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(3): An event permittee shall display a copy of the event permit in a prominent place in the area in which an alcoholic product is sold, offered for sale, furnished, and consumed.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(4): 76-10-1101; 76-10-1101; 76-10-1101 An event permittee may not on the premises of the event:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(4)(a): 76-10-1101; 76-10-1101 engage in or allow any form of gambling, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(4)(b): 76-10-1101 have any fringe gaming device, video gaming device, or gambling device or record as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(4)(c): engage in or permit a contest, game, gaming scheme, or gaming device that requires the risking of something of value for a return or for an outcome when the return or outcome is based upon an element of chance, excluding the playing of an amusement device that confers only an immediate and unrecorded right of replay not exchangeable for value.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(5): Title 58, Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act; 58-37-2; 58-37a-3 An event permittee may not knowingly allow a person at an event to, in violation of
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(5)(a): 58-37-2 sell, distribute, possess, or use a controlled substance, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(5)(b): 58-37a-3 use, deliver, or possess with the intent to deliver drug paraphernalia, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(6): An event permittee may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish beer except beer purchases from:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(6)(a): a beer wholesaler licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(6)(b): a beer retailer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(6)(c): a small brewer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(7): An event permittee may not store, sell, offer for sale, furnish, or allow the consumption of an alcoholic product purchased for an event in a location other than that described in the application and designated on the event permit unless the event permittee first applies for and receives approval from the director, with the approval of the Compliance, Licensing, and Enforcement Subcommittee, for a change of location.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(8): (8)(b); (8)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(8)(a): (8)(b) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(8)(a)(i): in an open original container; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(8)(a)(ii): in a container on draft.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(8)(b): (8)(a) An event permittee may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish beer sold pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(8)(b)(i): in a size of container that exceeds two liters; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(8)(b)(ii): to an individual patron in a size of container that exceeds one liter.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(9): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(9)(a): An event permittee may not sell or offer for sale an alcoholic product at less than the cost of the alcoholic product to the event permittee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(9)(b): An event permittee may not sell an alcoholic product at a discount price on any date or at any time.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(9)(c): An event permittee may not sell or offer for sale an alcoholic product at a price that encourages overconsumption or intoxication.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(9)(d): An event permittee may not sell or offer for sale an alcoholic product at a special or reduced price for only certain hours of the day of an event.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(9)(e): An event permittee may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish more than one alcoholic product at the price of a single alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(9)(f): An event permittee, or a person operating, selling, offering, or furnishing an alcoholic product under an event permit, may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish an indefinite or unlimited number of alcoholic products during a set period for a fixed price, unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(9)(f)(i): the alcoholic product is served to a patron at a seated event;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(9)(f)(ii): food is available whenever the alcoholic product is sold, offered for sale, or furnished; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(9)(f)(iii): no person advertises that at the event a person may be sold or furnished an indefinite or unlimited number of alcoholic products during a set period for a fixed price.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(9)(g): An event permittee may not engage in a public promotion involving or offering a free alcoholic product to the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(10): An event permittee may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(10)(a): a minor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(10)(b): a person actually, apparently, or obviously intoxicated;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(10)(c): a known interdicted person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(10)(d): a known habitual drunkard.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(11): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(11)(a): An alcoholic product is considered under the control of the event permittee during an event.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(11)(b): A patron at an event may not bring an alcoholic product onto the premises of the event.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(12): An event permittee may not permit a patron to carry from the premises an open container that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(12)(a): is used primarily for drinking purposes; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(12)(b): contains an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(13): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(13)(a): A person involved in the storage, sale, or furnishing of an alcoholic product at an event is considered under the supervision and direction of the event permittee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(13)(b): A person involved in the sale, offer for sale, or furnishing of an alcoholic product at an event may not, while on duty:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(13)(b)(i): consume an alcoholic product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(13)(b)(ii): be intoxicated.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(14): A minor may not handle, sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product at an event.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(15): The location specified in an event permit may not be changed without prior written approval of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(16): An event permittee may not sell, transfer, assign, exchange, barter, give, or attempt in any way to dispose of the event permit to another person whether for monetary gain or not.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(17): (17)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(17)(a): An event permittee may not sell, offer for sale, furnish, or allow the consumption of an alcoholic product during a period that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(17)(a)(i): begins at 1 a.m.; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(17)(a)(ii): ends at 9:59 a.m.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(17)(b): (17) This Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(18): A patron may have no more than one alcoholic product of any kind at a time before the patron.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(19): (19)(a)(i); (iii); (19)(a)(iv); (v); (19)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(19)(a): An event permittee shall display, in a prominent place, a sign in large letters that consists of text in the following order:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(19)(a)(i): a header that reads: "WARNING";
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(19)(a)(ii): a warning statement that reads: "Drinking alcoholic beverages during pregnancy can cause birth defects and permanent brain damage for the child.";
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(19)(a)(iii): a statement in smaller font that reads: "Call the Utah Department of Health at [insert most current toll-free number] with questions or for more information.";
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(19)(a)(iv): a header that reads: "WARNING"; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(19)(a)(v): a warning statement that reads: "Driving under the influence of alcohol or drugs is a serious crime that is prosecuted aggressively in Utah."
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(19)(b): (19)(a)(i); (iii); (19)(a)(iv); (v); (19)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(19)(b)(i): (19)(a)(i); (iii); (19)(a)(iv); (v) The text described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(19)(b)(ii): (19)(a) The warning statements in the sign described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-204(19)(c): The Department of Health shall work with the commission and department to facilitate consistency in the format of a sign required under this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-301 Title.
--------------------------------------
This part is known as "Single Event Permit."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-302 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-302(1): "120 hour single event permit" means a single event permit that authorizes under this part the storage, sale, offering for sale, furnishing, and consumption of liquor for a period not to exceed 120 consecutive hours.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-302(2): "72 hour single event permit" means a single event permit that authorizes under this part the storage, sale, offering for sale, furnishing, and consumption of liquor for a period not to exceed 72 consecutive hours.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-302(3): "Single event permit" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-302(3)(a): a 120 hour single event permit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-302(3)(b): a 72 hour single event permit.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-303 Director's power to issue single event permit.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-303(1): Before a person may sell, offer for sale, or furnish liquor at retail for on-premise consumption at an event, the person shall first obtain a single event permit from the director in accordance with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-303(2): (5); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-303(2)(a): (5); (2)(a) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-303(2)(a)(i): partnership;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-303(2)(a)(ii): corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-303(2)(a)(iii): limited liability company;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-303(2)(a)(iv): religious organization;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-303(2)(a)(v): political organization;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-303(2)(a)(vi): incorporated association;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-303(2)(a)(vii): (2)(a) recognized subordinate lodge, chapter, or other local unit of an entity described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-303(2)(a)(viii): state agency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-303(2)(a)(ix): political subdivision of the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-303(2)(b): The director may not issue a single event permit to an entity that has not been in existence as a bona fide entity for at least one year before the day on which the entity applies for a single event permit.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-303(3): (3)(a)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-303(3)(a): (3)(a)(i) A single event permit may authorize:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-303(3)(a)(i): the storage, sale, offering for sale, furnishing, and consumption of liquor at an event at which the storage, sale, offering for sale, furnishing, or consumption of liquor is otherwise prohibited by this title under either:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-303(3)(a)(i)(A): a 120 hour single event permit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-303(3)(a)(i)(B): a 72 hour single event permit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-303(3)(a)(ii): (3)(a)(i) the storage, sale, offer for sale, furnishing, and consumption of beer at the same event for the period that the storage, sale, offer for sale, furnishing, or consumption of liquor is authorized under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-303(3)(b): The single event permit shall state in writing whether the single event permit is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-303(3)(b)(i): a 120 hour single event permit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-303(3)(b)(ii): a 72 hour single event permit.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-303(4): (2); (2) The director may not issue more than:

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-305(4)(a): 32B-9-204(18) A single event permittee may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish a primary spirituous liquor in a quantity that exceeds 1.5 ounces per beverage, except that additional spirituous liquor may be used in a beverage if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-305(4)(a)(i): used as a secondary flavoring ingredient;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-305(4)(a)(ii): used in conjunction with the primary spirituous liquor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-305(4)(a)(iii): the secondary ingredient is not the only spirituous liquor in the beverage; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-305(4)(a)(iv): 32B-9-204(18) subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-305(4)(a)(iv)(A): a patron has no more than 2.5 ounces of spirituous liquor at a time before the patron; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-305(4)(a)(iv)(B): a patron has no more than one spirituous liquor drink at a time before the patron.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-305(4)(b): Spirituous liquor need not be dispensed through a calibrated metered dispensing system.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-305(5): 32B-9-204(18)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-305(5)(a): A single event permittee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish wine by the glass or an individual portion, except that a glass or individual portion may not exceed five ounces.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-305(5)(b): A single event permittee may furnish an individual portion served to a patron in more than one glass if the total amount of wine does not exceed five ounces.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-305(5)(c): 32B-9-204(18) An individual portion of wine is considered to be one alcoholic product under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-305(5)(d): A single event permittee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish wine in a container not exceeding 1.5 liters at a price fixed by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-305(6): A single event permittee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish heavy beer in an original container at a price fixed by the commission, except that the original container may not exceed one liter.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-305(7): A single event permittee may sell, offer for sale, or furnish a flavored malt beverage in an original container at a price fixed by the commission, except that the original container may not exceed one liter.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-305(8): A single event permittee may sell liquor only at a price fixed by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-305(9): A single event permittee may perform a service and assess a service charge as authorized by commission rule for liquor purchased at an event.

--------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-9-402 Definitions.
