Utah Code Annotated - Title 32B - Chapter 10 - Special Use Permit Act
*********************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Special Use Permit Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter, "special use permit" means a special use permit issued under this chapter, including:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-102(1): a religious wine use permit;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-102(2): an industrial or manufacturing use permit;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-102(3): a scientific or educational use permit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-102(4): a public service permit.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-201 Commission's power to issue special use permit.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-201(1): Before a person may purchase, use, store, sell, offer for sale, allow consumption, or manufacture an alcoholic product in a manner that requires a special use permit, the person shall first obtain a special use permit in accordance with this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-201(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-201(2)(a): The commission may issue a special use permit for the purchase, use, storage, sale, offer for sale, consumption, or manufacture of an alcoholic product for a limited purpose specified by this chapter and the rules of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-201(2)(b): A special use permit authorizes the special use permittee to purchase, use, store, sell, offer for sale, consume, or manufacture an alcoholic product only in the quantity, in a type, and for a purpose stated in the special use permit.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202 Application for special use permit -- Qualifications.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202(1): 32B-10-205 To obtain a special use permit, a person shall submit to the department:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202(1)(a): a written application in a form prescribed by the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202(1)(b): a nonrefundable application fee, if required by the relevant part of this chapter applicable to the type of special use permit for which the person applies;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202(1)(c): an initial permit fee:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202(1)(c)(i): if required by the relevant part of this chapter applicable to the type of special use permit for which the person applies; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202(1)(c)(ii): that is refundable if a special use permit is not issued;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202(1)(d): a one-time special use permit fee if required by a section of this chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202(1)(d)(i): applicable to the type of special use permit for which the person applies; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202(1)(d)(ii): that is refundable if a special use permit is not issued;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202(1)(e): a statement of the purpose for which the person applies for the special use permit;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202(1)(f): a description of the types of alcoholic product the person intends to use under authority of the special use permit;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202(1)(g): written consent of the local authority;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202(1)(h): 32B-10-205 if required, a bond as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202(1)(i): a floor plan of the immediate area within the premises in which the person proposes that an alcoholic product will be used, mixed, stored, sold, or consumed if required by the relevant part of this chapter applicable to the type of special use permit for which the person applies;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202(1)(j): a signed consent form stating that the special use permittee will permit any authorized representative of the commission, department, or any other law enforcement officer to have unrestricted right to enter the special use permittee's premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202(1)(k): if the person is an entity, proper verification evidencing that a person who signs the application is authorized to sign on behalf of the entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202(1)(l): any other information the commission or department may require.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202(2): 32B-1-304
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202(2)(a): The commission may issue a special use permit only to a person who qualifies as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202(2)(a)(i): the commission may issue a religious wine use permit to a religious organization;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202(2)(a)(ii): the commission may issue an industrial or manufacturing use permit to a person engaged in an industrial or manufacturing pursuit;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202(2)(a)(iii): the commission may issue a scientific or educational use permit to a person engaged in a scientific or educational pursuit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202(2)(a)(iv): the commission may issue a public service permit to an operator of an airline, railroad, or other public conveyance.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202(2)(b): 32B-1-304 The commission may not issue a special use permit to a person who is disqualified under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-202(2)(c): If a person to whom a special use permit is issued no longer possesses the qualifications required by this title for obtaining that special use permit, the commission may suspend or revoke that special use permit.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-203 Renewal of special use permit.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-203(1): A special use permit expires on December 31 of each year unless otherwise provided on the special use permit.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-203(2): To renew a renewable special use permit, a person shall submit a completed renewal application to the department:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-203(2)(a): no later than November 30; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-203(2)(b): in a form prescribed by the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-203(3): Failure to meet the renewal requirements results in an automatic forfeiture of the special use permit, effective on the date the existing special use permit expires.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-204 Duties of commission and department before issuing special use permit.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-204(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-204(1)(a): Before the commission issues a special use permit, the department shall conduct an investigation and may hold public hearings to gather information and make recommendations to the commission as to whether a special use permit should be issued.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-204(1)(b): The department shall forward the information it gathers and its recommendations to the commission to aid in the commission's determination.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-204(2): 32B-10-202; 32B-1-304 Before issuing a special use permit, the commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-204(2)(a): 32B-10-202 determine that the person filed a complete application and is in compliance with:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-204(2)(a)(i): 32B-10-202 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-204(2)(a)(ii): the relevant part under this chapter that applies to the special use permit for which the person is applying;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-204(2)(b): 32B-1-304 determine that the person is not disqualified under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-204(2)(c): consider the physical characteristics of the premises where an alcoholic product is proposed to be used, mixed, stored, sold, offered for sale, or furnished such as:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-204(2)(c)(i): the condition of the premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-204(2)(c)(ii): public visibility; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-204(2)(c)(iii): safety considerations;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-204(2)(d): consider the person's ability to properly use the special use permit within the requirements of this title and the commission rules including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-204(2)(d)(i): the proposed use of the special use permit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-204(2)(d)(ii): the nature and type of person making use of the special use permit;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-204(2)(e): consider specific factors regarding the specific type of special use permit sought by the person;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-204(2)(f): approve of the location and equipment used by the person to distill alcohol for experimental testing purposes or use as a fuel; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-204(2)(g): consider any other factor the commission considers necessary.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-205 Bond for special use permit.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-205(1): A special use permittee shall post a cash bond or surety bond only if the relevant part under this chapter for the type of special use permit requires posting of a bond.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-205(2): (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-205(2)(a): (1) If a special use permittee is required to post a bond as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-205(2)(b): A bond required under this section shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-205(2)(b)(i): in a form approved by the attorney general; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-205(2)(b)(ii): conditioned upon the special use permittee's faithful compliance with this title and the rules of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-205(3): If a surety bond posted by a special use permittee under this section is canceled due to a special use permittee's negligence, the department may assess a $300 reinstatement fee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-205(4): No part of a bond posted by a special use permittee under this section may be withdrawn during the period that the special use permit is in effect.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-205(5): (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-205(5)(a): A bond posted by a special use permittee under this section may be forfeited if the special use permit is revoked.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-205(5)(b): (5)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206 General operational requirements for special use permit.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(1): (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(1)(a): A special use permittee and staff of the special use permittee shall comply with this title and rules of the commission, including the relevant part of the chapter that applies to the type of special use permit held by the special use permittee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(1)(b): (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act Failure to comply as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(1)(b)(i): a special use permittee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(1)(b)(ii): individual staff of a special use permittee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(1)(b)(iii): a special use permittee and staff of the special use permittee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(1)(c): The commission may suspend or revoke a special use permit with or without cause.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(2)(a): If there is a conflict between this part and the relevant part under this chapter for the specific type of special use permit, the relevant part under this chapter governs.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(2)(b): Notwithstanding that this part may refer to "liquor" or an "alcoholic product," a special use permittee may only purchase, use, store, sell, offer for sale, allow consumption, or manufacture an alcoholic product authorized for the special use permit that is held by the special use permittee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(2)(c): Notwithstanding that this part or the relevant part under this chapter for the type of special use permit held by a special use permittee refers to "special use permittee," a person involved in the purchase, use, storage, sale, offering for sale, allowing consumption, or manufacture of an alcoholic product for which the special use permit is issued is subject to the same requirement or prohibition.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(3): 32B-1-205; (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(3)(a): A special use permittee shall make and maintain a record, as required by commission rule, of any alcoholic product purchased, used, sold, or manufactured.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(3)(b): 32B-1-205; (3) Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(4): (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(4)(a): Except as otherwise provided in this title, a special use permittee may not purchase liquor except from a state store or package agency.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(4)(b): (4) A special use permittee may transport liquor purchased by the special use permittee in accordance with this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(4)(c): A special use permittee shall purchase liquor at prices set by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(4)(d): When authorized by a special use permit, a special use permittee may purchase and receive an alcoholic product directly from a manufacturer for a purpose that is industrial, educational, scientific, or manufacturing.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(4)(e): A health care facility may purchase and receive an alcoholic product directly from a manufacturer for use at the health care facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(5): 32B-10-305 A special use permittee may not use, mix, store, sell, offer for sale, furnish, manufacture, or allow consumption of an alcoholic product in a location other than as designated in a special use permittee's:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(5)(a): application; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(5)(b): 32B-10-305 change of location request, as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(5)(b)(i): the special use permittee is a public service permittee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(5)(b)(ii): the commission approved the special use permittee's change in location request.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(6): Except as otherwise provided, a special use permittee may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(6)(a): a minor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(6)(b): a person actually, apparently, or obviously intoxicated;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(6)(c): a known interdicted person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(6)(d): a known habitual drunkard.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(7): A special use permittee may not employ a minor to handle an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(8): Chapter 18, Part 3, Alcohol License Change of Location; Chapter 18, Part 2, Alcohol License Changes of Ownership
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(8)(a): Chapter 18, Part 3, Alcohol License Change of Location The location specified in a special use permit may not be transferred from one location to another location, except as provided in
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(8)(b): Chapter 18, Part 2, Alcohol License Changes of Ownership A special use permittee may not sell, transfer, assign, exchange, barter, give, or attempt in any way to dispose of the permit to another person whether for monetary gain or not, except as provided in
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(9): A special use permittee may not purchase, use, mix, store, sell, offer for sale, furnish, consume, or manufacture an alcoholic product for a purpose other than that authorized by the special use permit.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(10): The commission may prescribe by policy or rule consistent with this title, the general operational requirements of a special use permittee relating to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(10)(a): physical facilities;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(10)(b): conditions of purchase, use, storage, sale, consumption, or manufacture of an alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(10)(c): purchase, storage, and sales quantity limitations; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-206(10)(d): other matters considered appropriate by the commission.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-207 Notifying department of change of ownership.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The commission may suspend or revoke a special use permit if a special use permittee does not immediately notify the department of a change in:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-207(1): ownership of the permittee's business;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-207(2): for a corporate owner, the:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-207(2)(a): corporate officers or directors; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-207(2)(b): shareholders holding at least 20% of the total issued and outstanding stock of the corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-207(3): for a limited liability company:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-207(3)(a): managers; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-207(3)(b): members owning at least 20% of the limited liability company.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-301 Title.
---------------------------------------
This part is known as "Public Service Permit."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-302 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this part, "hospitality room" means a room or facility:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-302(1): that a public service permittee operates; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-302(2): in which an alcoholic product is sold, offered for sale, furnished, or consumed.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-303 Specific application and renewal requirements for public service permit.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-303(1): 32B-10-202 To obtain a public service permit, in addition to complying with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-303(1)(a): a statement of the total of regularly numbered flights, trains, buses, boats, or other types of public conveyance for which the person plans to use the special use permit;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-303(1)(b): a floor plan of any room or facility in which the person plans to establish a hospitality room; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-303(1)(c): evidence of proximity of a proposed hospitality room to the arrival and departure area used by a person traveling on the person's airline, railroad, bus, boat, or other public conveyance.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-303(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-303(2)(a): The nonrefundable application fee for a public service permit is $75.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-303(2)(b): The initial permit fee for a public service permit is $250.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-303(2)(c): The bond amount required for a public service permittee is the penal sum of $1,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-303(3): 32B-10-203
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-303(3)(a): 32B-10-203 To renew a public service permit, a person shall comply with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-303(3)(b): The renewal fee for a public service permit is $30 for each regularly numbered passenger airplane flight, passenger train, bus, boat, or any other regularly scheduled public conveyance upon which an alcoholic product is sold, offered for sale, or furnished.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304 Specific operational requirements for a public service permit.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(1): 32B-10-206; (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(1)(a): 32B-10-206 In addition to complying with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(1)(b): (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act Failure to comply as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(1)(b)(i): a public service permittee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(1)(b)(ii): individual staff of a public service permittee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(1)(b)(iii): both a public service permittee and staff of the public service permittee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(2)(a): A public service permittee whose public conveyances operate on an interstate basis may do the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(2)(a)(i): purchase an alcoholic product outside of the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(2)(a)(ii): bring an alcoholic product purchased outside of the state into the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(2)(a)(iii): sell, offer for sale, and furnish an alcoholic product purchased outside of the state to a passenger traveling on the public service permittee's public conveyance for consumption while en route on the public conveyance.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(2)(b): A public service permittee whose public conveyance operates solely within the state, to sell, offer for sale, or furnish to a passenger traveling on the public service permittee's public conveyance for consumption while en route on the public conveyance, shall purchase:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(2)(b)(i): liquor from a state store or package agency; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(2)(b)(ii): beer from a beer wholesaler licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(3): (3)(b)(i)(A); (C); (3)(b)(i)(D); (E); (3)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(3)(a): A public service permittee may establish a hospitality room, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(3)(a)(i): the room is located within a depot, terminal, or similar facility adjacent to and servicing the public service permittee's airline, railroad, bus, boat, or other public conveyance;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(3)(a)(ii): the room is completely enclosed and the interior is not visible to the public;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(3)(a)(iii): the sale, offer for sale, or furnishing of an alcoholic product is made only to a person:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(3)(a)(iii)(A): then in transit using the public service permittee's airline, railroad, bus line, or other public conveyance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(3)(a)(iii)(B): holding a valid boarding pass or similar travel document issued by the public service permittee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(3)(a)(iv): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(3)(a)(iv)(A): liquor is purchased from:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(3)(a)(iv)(A)(I): a state store; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(3)(a)(iv)(A)(II): a package agency; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(3)(a)(iv)(B): beer is purchased from a beer wholesaler licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(3)(b): (3)(b)(i)(A); (C); (3)(b)(i)(D); (E); (3)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(3)(b)(i): A public service permittee operating a hospitality room shall display in a prominent place in the hospitality room, a sign in large letters that consists of text in the following order:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(3)(b)(i)(A): a header that reads: "WARNING";
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(3)(b)(i)(B): a warning statement that reads: "Drinking alcoholic beverages during pregnancy can cause birth defects and permanent brain damage for the child.";
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(3)(b)(i)(C): a statement in smaller font that reads: "Call the Utah Department of Health at [insert most current toll-free number] with questions or for more information.";
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(3)(b)(i)(D): a header that reads: "WARNING"; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(3)(b)(i)(E): a warning statement that reads: "Driving under the influence of alcohol or drugs is a serious crime that is prosecuted aggressively in Utah."
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(3)(b)(ii): (3)(b)(i)(A); (C); (3)(b)(i)(D); (E); (3)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(3)(b)(ii)(A): (3)(b)(i)(A); (C); (3)(b)(i)(D); (E) The text described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(3)(b)(ii)(B): (3)(b)(i) The warning statements in the sign described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(3)(b)(iii): The Department of Health shall work with the commission and department to facilitate consistency in the format of a sign required under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-304(3)(c): A hospitality room shall be operated in accordance with this chapter and rules adopted by the commission.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-305 Change in location request for a public service permit.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-305(1): A public service permittee operating at an international airport may request a change in location within the international airport, if the international airport requires the public service permittee to relocate to another location within the international airport.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-305(2): (1) To request a change in location, a public service permittee described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-305(2)(a): a statement of the total number of regularly numbered flights for which the public service permittee plans to use the special use permit;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-305(2)(b): a floor plan of any room or facility in which the public service permittee plans to establish a hospitality room;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-305(2)(c): evidence of the proximity of each proposed hospitality room to the arrival and departure area used by a person traveling the public service permittee's airline; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-305(2)(d): any other information the department requires.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-305(3): (2); (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-305(3)(a): (2) Before approving a public service permittee's request to change location at an international airport, the commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-305(3)(a)(i): (2) determine that the public service permittee filed a complete change in location request, as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-305(3)(a)(ii): determine that the public service permittee is in compliance with this chapter and part;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-305(3)(a)(iii): consider the physical characteristics of the premises where an alcoholic product is proposed to be used, mixed, stored, sold, offered for sale, or furnished, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-305(3)(a)(iii)(A): the conditions of the premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-305(3)(a)(iii)(B): public visibility; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-305(3)(a)(iii)(C): safety considerations; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-305(3)(a)(iv): consider any other factor the commission considers necessary.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-305(3)(b): (3) The commission may delegate to the department:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-305(3)(b)(i): the authority to approve a change in location for a public service permittee at an international airport; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-305(3)(b)(ii): (3) the duties described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-305(4): Upon commission approval of the public service permittee's request to change location, the public service permittee shall move to the newly approved location within the international airport.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-401 Title.
---------------------------------------
This part is known as "Industrial or Manufacturing Use Permit."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-402 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
Reserved

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-403 Specific application requirements for industrial or manufacturing use permit.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-403(1): 32B-10-202 To obtain an industrial or manufacturing use permit, in addition to complying with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-403(1)(a): a floor plan of the immediate area within the premises in which the person proposes that an alcoholic product be used, mixed, stored, sold, offered for sale, furnished, or consumed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-403(1)(b): if the person is applying for an industrial or manufacturing use permit to produce gasohol or any alcoholic product, evidence that the person has:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-403(1)(b)(i): an approved Notice of Registration of Distilled Spirits Plant; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-403(1)(b)(ii): the appropriate permit from the federal Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-403(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-403(2)(a): The nonrefundable application fee for an industrial or manufacturing use permit is $75.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-403(2)(b): The one-time special use permit fee for an industrial or manufacturing use permit is $250.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-403(2)(c): The bond amount required for an industrial or manufacturing use permit is the penal sum of $1,000.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-404 Specific operational requirements for industrial or manufacturing use permit.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-404(1): 32B-10-206; (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-404(1)(a): 32B-10-206 In addition to complying with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-404(1)(b): (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act Failure to comply as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-404(1)(b)(i): an industrial or manufacturing use permittee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-404(1)(b)(ii): individual staff of an industrial or manufacturing use permittee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-404(1)(b)(iii): an industrial or manufacturing use permittee and staff of the industrial or manufacturing use permittee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-404(2): Title 58, Chapter 17b, Pharmacy Practice Act; Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act; Chapter 37b, Imitation Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act An industrial or manufacturing use permittee may produce for lawful use and sale the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-404(2)(a): vinegar;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-404(2)(b): preserved nonintoxicating cider;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-404(2)(c): a food preparation;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-404(2)(d): Title 58, Chapter 17b, Pharmacy Practice Act; Chapter 37, Utah Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37a, Utah Drug Paraphernalia Act; Chapter 37b, Imitation Controlled Substances Act; Chapter 37c, Utah Controlled Substance Precursor Act a United States Pharmacopoeia or national formulary preparation in conformity with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-404(2)(d)(i): conforms to standards established by:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-404(2)(d)(i)(A): the Department of Agriculture and Food; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-404(2)(d)(i)(B): the Department of Health; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-404(2)(d)(ii): contains no more alcohol than is necessary to preserve or extract the medicinal, flavoring, or perfumed properties of the treated substances; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-404(2)(e): wood and denatured alcohol if manufactured in compliance with the formulas and regulations under Title 27, C.F.R. Parts 19, 20, and 21.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-404(3): (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-404(3)(a): An industrial or manufacturing use permittee that produces patent or proprietary medicines containing alcohol may sell or offer for sale the medicines in the original and unbroken container if the medicine contains sufficient medication to prevent its use as an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-404(3)(b): (3) An industrial or manufacturing use permittee described in this Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-501 Title.
---------------------------------------
This part is known as "Scientific or Educational Use Permit."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-502 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
Reserved

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-503 Specific application requirements for scientific or educational use permit.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-503(1): 32B-10-202 To obtain a scientific or educational use permit, a person shall comply with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-503(2): The one-time special use permit fee for a scientific or educational use permit is $125.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-601 Title.
---------------------------------------
This part is known as "Religious Use of Alcoholic Products."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-602 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
Reserved

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-603 Specific application requirements for religious wine use permit.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-603(1): To purchase an alcoholic product from the department at the department's cost plus freight charges, a religious organization shall obtain a religious wine use permit.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-603(2): 32B-10-202 To obtain a religious wine permit, a person shall comply with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-603(3): The one-time special use permit fee for a religious wine use permit is $125.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-604 Specific operational requirements for religious wine use permit.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-604(1): 32B-10-206; (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-604(1)(a): 32B-10-206 In addition to complying with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-604(1)(b): (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act Failure to comply as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-604(1)(b)(i): a religious wine permittee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-604(1)(b)(ii): individual staff of a religious wine permittee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-604(1)(b)(iii): a religious wine permittee and staff of the religious wine permittee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-604(2): A religious wine use permittee may purchase wine from a state store as the department may designate at the department's cost plus freight charges.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-604(3): A religious wine use permittee may not use wine purchased under a religious wine use permit for a purpose other than a religious purpose.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-605 Religious organization exemption.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-605(1): A religious organization that provides or allows to be provided an alcoholic product to a person as part of the religious organization's religious services:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-605(1)(a): does not violate this title by providing or allowing the provision of an alcoholic product as part of a religious service; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-605(1)(b): is not required to hold a license or special use permit to provide or allow the provision of an alcoholic product for religious services.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-605(2): (1) This exemption does not exempt a religious organization from complying with this title with respect to an alcoholic product purchased by the religious organization for a purpose other than the purpose stated in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-701 Title.
---------------------------------------
This part is known as "Health Care Facility or Practitioner Use of Alcoholic Products."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-702 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this part, "health care facility" means a facility that is licensed by the Department of Health and Human Services under

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-703 Health care facility exemption.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-703(1): (1); (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-703(1)(a): (1) This Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-703(1)(b): (1)(a) A health care facility described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-703(1)(b)(i): is not in violation of this title; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-703(1)(b)(ii): is not required to hold a license or special use permit to make or allow the administration of an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-703(2): (1) This exemption does not apply to an alcoholic product purchased by a health care facility for administration to a patient or a use other than one stated in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-704 Health care practitioner exemption.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-704(1): Title 58, Chapter 28, Veterinary Practice Act This section applies to an individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-704(1)(a): Title 58, Chapter 28, Veterinary Practice Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-704(1)(a)(i): is a health care practitioner; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-704(1)(a)(ii): Title 58, Chapter 28, Veterinary Practice Act is a veterinarian licensed under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-704(1)(b): is acting within the scope of individual's professional responsibility; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-704(1)(c): in a professional capacity, prescribes, prepares, or administers an alcoholic product to a person being treated or within the scope of the health care practitioner's license authority.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-704(2): (1) A person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-704(2)(a): is not in violation of this title; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-10-704(2)(b): is not required to hold any type of license or permit to use an alcoholic product professionally.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 32B - Chapter 11 - Manufacturing and Related Licenses Act
*************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Manufacturing and Related Licenses Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter, "manufacturing license" means an alcoholic product manufacturing license issued under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201 Commission's power to issue a manufacturing license -- Certificates of approval.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(1): 32B-11-202; (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(1)(a): 32B-11-202 Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(1)(b): A separate license is required for each place of storage, sale, and manufacture of an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(1)(c): (1) A violation of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(2): The commission may issue an alcoholic product manufacturing license to a manufacturer whose business is located in this state for the storage, sale, and manufacture of an alcoholic product for each type of manufacturing license provided by this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(3): The types of manufacturing licenses issued under this chapter are known as:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(3)(a): a winery manufacturing license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(3)(b): a distillery manufacturing license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(3)(c): a brewery manufacturing license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4): (4)(a); (4); (4)(d)(i); (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(a): A brewer located outside the state is not required to be licensed under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(b): (4)(a) A brewer described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(b)(i): beer to a beer wholesaler licensee in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(b)(ii): a flavored malt beverage to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(b)(ii)(A): the department; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(b)(ii)(B): a military installation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(b)(iii): if a small brewer, beer to one of the following in the state:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(b)(iii)(A): a beer wholesaler licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(b)(iii)(B): a beer retailer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(b)(iii)(C): an event permittee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(c): To obtain a certificate of approval, a brewer shall submit to the department:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(c)(i): a written application in a form prescribed by the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(c)(ii): a nonrefundable $75 application fee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(c)(iii): an initial certificate of approval fee of $300 that is refundable if a certificate of approval is not issued;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(c)(iv): evidence of authority from the federal Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau of the United States Department of the Treasury to brew beer, heavy beer, or a flavored malt beverage; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(c)(v): any other information the commission or department may require.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(d): (4); (4)(d)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(d)(i): (4) One of the following shall sign and verify a written application under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(d)(i)(A): a partner if the brewer is a partnership; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(d)(i)(B): an executive officer, manager, or person specifically authorized by a corporation or limited liability company to sign the application.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(d)(ii): (4)(d)(i) A brewer filing an application shall attach to the application written evidence of the authority of the person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(e): (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(e)(i): (4) A certificate of approval under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(e)(ii): A brewer desiring to renew its certificate of approval shall submit to the department by no later than November 30 of the year the certificate of approval expires:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(e)(ii)(A): a completed renewal application in the form prescribed by the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(e)(ii)(B): a renewal fee of $250.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(4)(e)(iii): Failure to meet the renewal requirements results in an automatic forfeiture of the certificate of approval effective on the date the existing certificate of approval expires.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(5): (5)(a); (5); (5); (5)(c)(i); (5)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(5)(a): An importer or supplier of beer, heavy beer, or flavored malt beverages who is not required to be licensed under this title shall obtain a certificate of approval from the department before selling or delivering:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(5)(a)(i): beer to a beer wholesaler licensee in this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(5)(a)(ii): heavy beer or a flavored malt beverage to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(5)(a)(ii)(A): the department; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(5)(a)(ii)(B): a military installation.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(5)(b): (5)(a) To obtain a certificate of approval, an importer or supplier described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(5)(b)(i): a written application in a form prescribed by the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(5)(b)(ii): a nonrefundable $75 application fee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(5)(b)(iii): an initial certificate of approval fee of $300 that is refundable if a certificate of approval is not issued;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(5)(b)(iv): evidence of authority from the federal Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau of the United States Department of the Treasury to brew beer, heavy beer, or a flavored malt beverage; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(5)(b)(v): any other information the commission or department may require.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(5)(c): (5); (5); (5)(c)(i)

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(5)(c)(i)(B): an executive officer, manager, or person specifically authorized by a corporation or limited liability company to sign the application.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(5)(c)(ii): (5); (5)(c)(i) An importer or supplier filing an application under this Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(5)(d)(ii)(B): a renewal fee of $250.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(5)(d)(iii): Failure to meet the renewal requirements results in an automatic forfeiture of the certificate of approval effective on the date the existing certificate of approval expires.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(6): (7); (6)(a); (6)

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(6)(b)(iii): set forth the exact geographical area of the sales territory.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(6)(c): (6) A brewer, importer of beer, or supplier of beer may have more than one agreement described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(6)(d): A brewer, importer of beer, or supplier of beer may not enter into an agreement with more than one beer wholesaler licensee to distribute the same brand of beer in the same sales territory or any portion of the sales territory.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-201(7): (6) A small brewer is not subject to the requirements of Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202 Exemption for manufacture of fermented beverage.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(1): As used in this section, "fermented alcoholic beverage" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(1)(a): beer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(1)(b): heavy beer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(1)(c): wine.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(2): An individual may without being licensed under this chapter manufacture a fermented alcoholic beverage if:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(2)(a): the individual ferments the alcoholic beverage:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(2)(a)(i): in the individual's personal residence; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(2)(a)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(2)(a)(ii)(A): on the premises of a winery manufacturing license or brewery manufacturing license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(2)(a)(ii)(B): under the supervision of a winery manufacturing licensee or brewery manufacturing licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(2)(b): the individual is 21 years old or older;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(2)(c): the individual manufactures no more than:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(2)(c)(i): 100 gallons in a calendar year, if there is one individual that is 21 years old or older residing in the household; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(2)(c)(ii): 200 gallons in a calendar year, if there are two or more individuals who are 21 years old or older residing in the household;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(2)(d): the fermented alcoholic beverage is manufactured and used for personal or family use and consumption, including use at an organized event where fermented alcoholic beverages are judged as to taste and quality; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(2)(e): the fermented alcoholic beverage is not for:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(2)(e)(i): sale or offering for sale; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(2)(e)(ii): consumption on a licensed premise.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(3): (2) An individual may store a fermented alcoholic beverage manufactured as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(4): (2); 41-6a-526 A fermented alcoholic beverage manufactured in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(4)(a): for personal or family use, including use at an organized event where fermented alcoholic beverages are judged as to taste and quality;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(4)(b): 41-6a-526 if the fermented alcoholic beverage is transported in compliance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(4)(c): if the fermented alcoholic beverage is removed only in the following quantities:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(4)(c)(i): for personal and family use that is unrelated to an organized event where fermented alcoholic beverages are judged as to taste and quality, the quantity that may be possessed at one time is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(4)(c)(i)(A): one liter of wine for each individual who is 21 years old or older residing in the household;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(4)(c)(i)(B): 72 ounces of heavy beer for each individual who is 21 years old or older residing in the household; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(4)(c)(i)(C): 72 ounces of beer for each individual who is 21 years old or older residing in the household; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(4)(c)(ii): for on-premise consumption at an organized event where fermented alcoholic beverages are judged as to taste and quality, the quantity that may be removed for each organized event is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(4)(c)(ii)(A): one liter of wine for each wine category in which the individual enters, except that the individual may not remove wine for more than three categories for the same organized event;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(4)(c)(ii)(B): 72 ounces of heavy beer for each heavy beer category in which the individual enters, except that the individual may not remove heavy beer for more than three categories for the same organized event; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(4)(c)(ii)(C): 72 ounces of beer for each beer category in which the individual enters, except that the individual may not remove beer for more than three categories for the same organized event.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-202(5): (2) A partnership, corporation, or association may not manufacture a fermented alcoholic beverage under this section for personal or family use and consumption without obtaining a license under this chapter, except that an individual who operates a brewery under this chapter as an individual owner or in partnership with others, may remove beer from the brewery for personal or family use in the amounts described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-203 Application requirements for a manufacturing license.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
To obtain an alcoholic product manufacturing license, a person shall submit to the department:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-203(1): a written application in a form prescribed by the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-203(2): a nonrefundable application fee of $300;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-203(3): an initial license fee of $3,800:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-203(3)(a): unless otherwise provided in this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-203(3)(b): that is refundable if a license is not issued;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-203(4): written consent of the local authority;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-203(5): a statement of the purpose for which the person has applied for the manufacturing license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-203(6): evidence that the person is authorized by the United States to manufacture an alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-203(7): 32B-11-207 a bond as specified by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-203(8): evidence that the person is carrying public liability insurance in an amount and form satisfactory to the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-203(9): a signed consent form stating that the manufacturing licensee will permit any authorized representative of the commission, department, or any law enforcement officer to have unrestricted right to enter the licensed premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-203(10): if the person is an entity, proper verification evidencing that a person who signs the application is authorized to sign on behalf of the entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-203(11): any other information the commission or department may require.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-204 Renewal requirements for a manufacturing license.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-204(1): A manufacturing license expires on December 31 of each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-204(2): (2)(b)(ii) To renew a manufacturing license, a person shall submit by no later than November 30 of the year the license expires:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-204(2)(a): a completed renewal application to the department, in a form prescribed by the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-204(2)(b): (2)(b)(ii) a renewal fee in the following amount of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-204(2)(b)(i): (2)(b)(ii) $2,900, except for a wine manufacturing license described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-204(2)(b)(ii): $1,400 for a winery manufacturing license if the winery manufacturing licensee produces less than 20,000 gallons of wine in the calendar year preceding the year in which the manufacturing licensee seeks renewal.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-204(3): Failure to meet the renewal requirements results in an automatic forfeiture of a manufacturing license effective on the date the existing manufacturing license expires.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-205 Specific qualifications for a manufacturing license.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-205(1): 32B-1-304 The commission may not issue a manufacturing license to a person who:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-205(1)(a): 32B-1-304 is disqualified under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-205(1)(b): has not met an applicable federal requirement for the operation of a winery, distillery, or brewery.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-205(2): If a person to whom a manufacturing license is issued under this chapter no longer possesses the qualifications required by this title for obtaining that manufacturing license, the commission may suspend or revoke that manufacturing license.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-206 Duties of commission and department before issuing manufacturing license.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-206(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-206(1)(a): Before the commission may issue a manufacturing license, the department shall conduct an investigation and may hold public hearings to gather information and make recommendations to the commission as to whether a manufacturing license should be issued.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-206(1)(b): (1)(a) The department shall forward to the commission the information and recommendations under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-206(2): 32B-11-203; 32B-11-205; 32B-1-304 Before issuing a manufacturing license, the commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-206(2)(a): 32B-11-203; 32B-11-205 determine that the person filed a complete application and is in compliance with:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-206(2)(a)(i): 32B-11-203; 32B-11-205 Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-206(2)(a)(ii): the relevant part under this chapter for the specific type of manufacturing license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-206(2)(b): 32B-1-304 determine that the person is not disqualified under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-206(2)(c): consider the physical characteristics of the premises where an alcoholic product is proposed to be stored, mixed, or manufactured such as:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-206(2)(c)(i): condition of the premises; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-206(2)(c)(ii): safety and security considerations;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-206(2)(d): consider the person's ability to properly use the manufacturing license within the requirements of this title and the commission rules including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-206(2)(d)(i): manufacturing capacity;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-206(2)(d)(ii): extent of product distribution; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-206(2)(d)(iii): the nature and type of entity making use of the manufacturing license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-206(2)(e): consider any special factor as provided in this chapter that may be unique to the specific type of manufacturing license sought by the person;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-206(2)(f): approve of the location and equipment used by the person to manufacture an alcoholic product; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-206(2)(g): consider any other factor the commission considers necessary.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-207 Bond for manufacturing license.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-207(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-207(1)(a): A manufacturing licensee shall post a cash bond or surety bond in the penal sum of $10,000 payable to the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-207(1)(b): A manufacturing licensee shall procure and maintain a bond required by this section for as long as the manufacturing licensee continues to operate as a manufacturing licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-207(2): A bond posted under this section shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-207(2)(a): in a form approved by the attorney general; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-207(2)(b): conditioned upon a manufacturing licensee's faithful compliance with this title and the rules of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-207(3): If a surety bond posted by a manufacturing licensee under this section is cancelled due to a manufacturing licensee's negligence, the department may assess a $300 reinstatement fee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-207(4): No part of a bond posted under this section may be withdrawn during the period the manufacturing license is in effect.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-207(5): (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-207(5)(a): A bond posted by a manufacturing licensee under this section may be forfeited if the manufacturing license is revoked.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-207(5)(b): (5)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208 General operational requirements for manufacturing license.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(1): (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(1)(a): A manufacturing licensee and staff of the manufacturing licensee shall comply with this title and the rules of the commission, including the relevant part of this chapter applicable to the type of manufacturing license held by the manufacturing licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(1)(b): (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act Failure to comply as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(1)(b)(i): a manufacturing licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(1)(b)(ii): individual staff of a manufacturing licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(1)(b)(iii): a manufacturing licensee and staff of the manufacturing licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(2): A manufacturing licensee shall prominently display the manufacturing license on the licensed premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(3): 32B-1-205; (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(3)(a): A manufacturing licensee shall make and maintain the records required by the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(3)(b): 32B-1-205; (3) Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(4): A manufacturing licensee may not sell liquor within the state except to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(4)(a): the department; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(4)(b): a military installation.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(5): Chapter 18, Part 3, Alcohol License Change of Location A manufacturing license may not be transferred from one location to another location, except as provided in
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(6): Chapter 18, Part 2, Alcohol License Changes of Ownership
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(6)(a): Chapter 18, Part 2, Alcohol License Changes of Ownership A manufacturing licensee may not sell, transfer, assign, exchange, barter, give, or attempt in any way to dispose of the license to another person, whether for monetary gain or not, except as provided in
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(6)(b): A manufacturing license has no monetary value for any type of disposition.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(7): A manufacturing licensee may not advertise the manufacturing licensee's product in violation of this title or any other federal or state law, except that nothing in this title prohibits the advertising or solicitation of an order for industrial alcohol from a holder of a special use permit.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(8): A manufacturing licensee shall from time to time, on request of the department, furnish for analytical purposes a sample of the alcoholic product that the manufacturing licensee has:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(8)(a): for sale; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(8)(b): in the course of manufacture for sale in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(9): The commission may prescribe by policy or rule, consistent with this title, the general operational requirements of a manufacturing licensee relating to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(9)(a): physical facilities;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(9)(b): conditions of storage, sale, or manufacture of an alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(9)(c): storage and sales quantity limitations; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-208(9)(d): other matters considered appropriate by the commission.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-209 Notifying department of change in ownership.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The commission may suspend, revoke, or deem forfeited a manufacturing license if the manufacturing licensee does not immediately notify the department of a change in:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-209(1): ownership of the manufacturing licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-209(2): for a corporate owner, the:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-209(2)(a): corporate officers or directors; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-209(2)(b): shareholders holding at least 20% of the total issued and outstanding stock of the corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-209(3): for a limited liability company:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-209(3)(a): managers; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-209(3)(b): members owning at least 20% of the limited liability company.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210 Tasting provided by manufacturing licensee.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(1)(a): "Parcel" means the same identifiable contiguous unit of property that is treated as separate for valuation or zoning purposes and includes an improvement on that unit of property.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(1)(b): "Taste" means an amount of an alcoholic product provided by a manufacturing licensee for consumption under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(2): A manufacturing licensee may provide for a tasting in accordance with this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(3): 32B-1-202 Before conducting a tasting, the manufacturing licensee shall provide the department:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(3)(a): 32B-1-202 evidence of proximity to any community location, with proximity requirements being governed by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(3)(b): a floor plan, and boundary map where applicable, of the premises of the manufacturing licensee, including any:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(3)(b)(i): consumption area; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(3)(b)(ii): area where the person proposes to store, sell, offer for sale, or furnish an alcoholic product to be tasted;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(3)(c): evidence that the manufacturing licensee is carrying public liability insurance in an amount and form satisfactory to the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(3)(d): evidence that the manufacturing licensee is carrying dramshop insurance coverage in an amount and form satisfactory to the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(3)(e): any other information the commission or department may require.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(4): A manufacturing licensee may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish a taste on any day during the period that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(4)(a): begins at midnight; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(4)(b): ends at 10:59 a.m.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(5): A person who serves a taste on behalf of the manufacturing licensee shall complete an alcohol training and education seminar as if the person were employed by a retail licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(6): (6); (6)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(6)(a): A manufacturing licensee shall establish a distinct area for consumption of a taste outside the view of minors on the licensed premises and in which minors are not allowed during the time period when tasting occurs.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(6)(b): (6); (6)(b) The distinct area for consumption for a taste established under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(7): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(7)(a): A manufacturing licensee shall have substantial food available that is served on the licensed premises to an individual consuming a taste.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(7)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The commission may define what constitutes "substantial food" by rule made in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(8): A manufacturing licensee shall charge an individual for a taste and may not sell, offer for sale, or furnish a taste at less than the cost of the taste to a retail licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(9): (9)(a)(i)(B)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(9)(a): (9)(a)(i)(B) A manufacturing licensee may provide a taste in more than one container except that the aggregate total of the taste in all of the containers may not exceed:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(9)(a)(i): (9)(a)(i)(B) for a winery manufacturing licensee:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(9)(a)(i)(A): (9)(a)(i)(B) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(9)(a)(i)(B): 16 ounces of hard cider that is furnished in a sealed container and contains no more than 5% of alcohol by volume;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(9)(a)(ii): for a distillery manufacturing licensee, 2.5 ounces of spirituous liquor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(9)(a)(iii): for a brewery manufacturing licensee, 16 ounces of beer, heavy beer, or flavored malt beverages.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(9)(b): A manufacturing licensee may not allow an individual to participate in more than one tasting within a calendar day.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(10): 32B-11-503(4)(c) A manufacturing licensee may provide a taste of alcoholic product that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(10)(a): manufactured by the manufacturing licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(10)(b): 32B-11-503(4)(c) purchased by the manufacturing licensee from:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(10)(b)(i): a state store or package agency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(10)(b)(ii): 32B-11-503(4)(c) for beer, the off-premise retail licensee described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(11): (11)(a)(i); (iii); (11)(a)(iv); (v); (11)(a); (11)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(11)(a): A manufacturing licensee shall display in a prominent place in the location where tastes are consumed a sign in large letters that consists of text in the following order:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(11)(a)(i): a header that reads: "WARNING";
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(11)(a)(ii): a warning statement that reads: "Drinking alcoholic beverages during pregnancy can cause birth defects and permanent brain damage for the child.";
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(11)(a)(iii): a statement in smaller font that reads: "Call the Utah Department of Health and Human Services at [insert most current toll-free number] with questions or for more information.";
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(11)(a)(iv): a header that reads: "WARNING"; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(11)(a)(v): a warning statement that reads: "Driving under the influence of alcohol or drugs is a serious crime that is prosecuted aggressively in Utah."
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(11)(b): (11)(a)(i); (iii); (11)(a)(iv); (v); (11)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(11)(b)(i): (11)(a)(i); (iii); (11)(a)(iv); (v) The text described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(11)(b)(ii): (11)(a) The warning statements in the sign described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(11)(c): (11) The Department of Health and Human Services shall work with the commission and department to facilitate consistency in the format of a sign required under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(12): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act A manufacturing licensee shall provide educational information as defined by rule by the commission in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-210(13): 32B-10-206(1)(c) A manufacturing licensee that conducts tastings under a scientific or educational use permit issued by the commission as of May 10, 2016, shall comply with this section by no later than December 31, 2016, in conducting a tasting. Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-301 Title.
---------------------------------------
This part is known as "Winery Manufacturing License."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-302 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
Reserved

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303 Specific authority and operational requirements for winery manufacturing license.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303(1): A winery manufacturing license allows a winery manufacturing licensee to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303(1)(a): store, manufacture, transport, import, or export wine;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303(1)(b): sell wine at wholesale to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303(1)(b)(i): the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303(1)(b)(ii): an out-of-state customer who is at least 21 years old, as the state in which the customer is located permits;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303(1)(c): purchase liquor for fortifying wine, if the department is notified of the purchase and date of delivery; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303(1)(d): warehouse on the licensed premises liquor that is manufactured or purchased for manufacturing purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303(2)(a): A wine, brandy, wine spirit, or other liquor imported under authority of a winery manufacturing license shall conform to the standards of identity and quality established in the regulations issued under Federal Alcohol Administration Act, 27 U.S.C. Sec. 201 et seq.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303(2)(b): The federal definitions, standards of identity, and quality and labeling requirements for wine, in regulations issued under Federal Alcohol Administration Act, 27 U.S.C. Sec. 201 et seq., are adopted to the extent the regulations are not contrary to or inconsistent with the laws of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303(3): If considered necessary, the commission or department may require:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303(3)(a): the alteration of the plant, equipment, or licensed premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303(3)(b): the alteration or removal of unsuitable wine-making equipment or material;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303(3)(c): a winery manufacturing licensee to clean, disinfect, ventilate, or otherwise improve the sanitary and working conditions of the plant, licensed premises, and wine-making equipment;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303(3)(d): that a marc, pomace, or fruit be destroyed, denatured, or removed from the licensed premises because it is considered:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303(3)(d)(i): unfit for wine making; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303(3)(d)(ii): as producing or likely to produce an unsanitary condition;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303(3)(e): a winery manufacturing licensee to distill or cause to be distilled or disposed of under the department's supervision:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303(3)(e)(i): any unsound, poor quality finished wine; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303(3)(e)(ii): unfinished wine that will not be satisfactory when finished; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303(3)(f): that a record pertaining to the grapes and other materials and ingredients used in the manufacture of wine be available to the commission or department upon request.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303(4): 32B-11-210 A winery manufacturing licensee may not permit wine to be consumed on the winery manufacturing licensee's premises, except that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303(4)(a): a winery manufacturing licensee may allow the winery manufacturing licensee's on-duty staff to taste on the licensed premises the alcoholic product that the winery manufacturing licensee manufactures on the winery manufacturing licensee's premises without charge, but only in connection with the on-duty staff's duties of manufacturing the alcoholic product during the manufacturing process and not otherwise;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303(4)(b): a winery manufacturing licensee may allow a person who can lawfully purchase wine for wholesale or retail distribution to consume a bona fide sample of the winery manufacturing licensee's product on the licensed premises; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-303(4)(c): 32B-11-210 a winery manufacturing licensee may conduct a tasting as provided in Section
