Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403 Specific authority and operational requirements for distillery manufacturing license.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(1): (2); (1)(f)(ii) A distillery manufacturing license allows a distillery manufacturing licensee to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(1)(a): store, manufacture, transport, import, or export liquor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(1)(b): (2) sell liquor to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(1)(b)(i): the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(1)(b)(ii): an out-of-state customer who is at least 21 years old, as the state in which the customer is located permits; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(1)(b)(iii): (2) as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(1)(c): purchase an alcoholic product for mixing and manufacturing purposes if the department is notified of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(1)(c)(i): the purchase; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(1)(c)(ii): the date of delivery;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(1)(d): warehouse on the distillery manufacturing licensee's licensed premises an alcoholic product that the distillery manufacturing licensee manufactures or purchases for manufacturing purposes;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(1)(e): if the distillery manufacturing licensee holds two or more distillery manufacturing licenses under this chapter, transport an alcoholic product from one of the distillery manufacturing licensee's licensed premises to another, if the transportation occurs for the purpose of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(1)(e)(i): continuing or completing the manufacturing process; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(1)(e)(ii): storing a bulk container or an alcoholic product that is distilled and packaged in the state, including the transport of an alcoholic product to a package agency located at any of the distillery manufacturing licensee's licensed premises; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(1)(f): (1)(f)(ii) receive samples of an alcoholic product from a person outside the state for the sole purpose of performing tests and analysis, if the distillery manufacturing licensee:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(1)(f)(i): performs the tests and analysis in accordance with 27 C.F.R. Secs. 19.434(a), (c), (d), (e), and (f), Secs. 19.435 through 19.437, and Sec. 19.616;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(1)(f)(ii): keeps records of the samples received, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(1)(f)(ii)(A): all data required under 27 C.F.R. Sec. 19.616;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(1)(f)(ii)(B): a description of the sample; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(1)(f)(ii)(C): the date the distillery manufacturing licensee receives the sample; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(1)(f)(iii): (1)(f)(ii) upon request, provides the records described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(2): (2); (2)(a); Chapter 10, Special Use Permit Act; (2)(b); (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(2)(a): (2) Subject to the other provisions of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(2)(a)(i): a mechanical or industrial business that requires the use of an alcoholic product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(2)(a)(ii): scientific pursuits that require the use of an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(2)(b): (2)(a); Chapter 10, Special Use Permit Act A person who purchases an alcoholic product under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(2)(c): (2)(b) A distillery manufacturing licensee may sell to a special use permittee described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(2)(d): (2) The sale of an alcoholic product under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(3): The federal definitions, standards of identity and quality, and labeling requirements for distilled liquor, in the regulations issued under Federal Alcohol Administration Act, 27 U.S.C. Sec. 201 et seq., are adopted to the extent the regulations are not contrary to or inconsistent with laws of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(4): If considered necessary, the commission or department may require:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(4)(a): the alteration of the plant, equipment, or licensed premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(4)(b): the alteration or removal of unsuitable alcoholic product-making equipment or material;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(4)(c): a distillery manufacturing licensee to clean, disinfect, ventilate, or otherwise improve the sanitary and working conditions of the plant, licensed premises, and equipment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(4)(d): that a record pertaining to the materials and ingredients used in the manufacture of an alcoholic product be made available to the commission or department upon request.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(5): 32B-11-210 A distillery manufacturing licensee may not permit an alcoholic product to be consumed on the distillery manufacturing licensee's premises, except that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(5)(a): a distillery manufacturing licensee may allow the distillery manufacturing licensee's on-duty staff to taste on the licensed premises an alcoholic product that the distillery manufacturing licensee manufactures on the distillery manufacturing licensee's licensed premises without charge, but only in connection with the on-duty staff's duties of manufacturing the alcoholic product during the manufacturing process and not otherwise;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-403(5)(b): a distillery manufacturing licensee may allow a person who can lawfully purchase an alcoholic product for wholesale or retail distribution to consume a bona fide sample of the distillery manufacturing licensee's product on the licensed premises; and

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503 Specific authority and operational requirements for brewery manufacturing license.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(1): (5) A brewery manufacturing license allows a brewery manufacturing licensee to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(1)(a): store, manufacture, brew, transport, or export beer, heavy beer, and flavored malt beverages;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(1)(b): sell heavy beer and a flavored malt beverage to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(1)(b)(i): the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(1)(b)(ii): a military installation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(1)(b)(iii): an out-of-state customer who is at least 21 years old, as the state in which the customer is located permits;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(1)(c): sell beer to a beer wholesaler licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(1)(d): (5) in the case of a small brewer, in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(1)(d)(i): a retail licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(1)(d)(ii): an off-premise beer retailer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(1)(d)(iii): an event permittee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(1)(e): warehouse on the brewery manufacturing licensee's premises an alcoholic product that the brewery manufacturing licensee manufactures or purchases for manufacturing purposes; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(1)(f): if the brewery manufacturing licensee holds two or more brewery manufacturing licenses, transport beer, heavy beer, or flavored malt beverage from one of the brewery manufacturing licensee's licensed premises to another, if the transportation occurs for the purpose of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(1)(f)(i): continuing or completing the manufacturing process; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(1)(f)(ii): transferring the beer, heavy beer, or flavored malt beverage for storage at a licensed premises of the brewery manufacturing licensee that is at a package agency.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(2): A brewery manufacturing licensee may not sell the following to a person within the state except the department or a military installation:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(2)(a): heavy beer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(2)(b): a flavored malt beverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(3): If considered necessary, the commission or department may require:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(3)(a): the alteration of the plant, equipment, or licensed premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(3)(b): the alteration or removal of any unsuitable alcoholic product-making equipment or material;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(3)(c): a brewery manufacturing licensee to clean, disinfect, ventilate, or otherwise improve the sanitary and working conditions of the plant, licensed premises, and equipment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(3)(d): that a record pertaining to the materials and ingredients used in the manufacture of an alcoholic product be available to the commission or department upon request.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(4): Chapter 7, Part 2, Off-Premise Beer Retailer Local Authority; 32B-11-210 A brewery manufacturing licensee may not permit any beer, heavy beer, or flavored malt beverage to be consumed on the licensed premises, except that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(4)(a): a brewery manufacturing licensee may allow the brewery manufacturing licensee's on-duty staff to taste the alcoholic product that the brewery manufacturing licensee manufactures on the brewery manufacturing licensee's premises without charge, but only in connection with the on-duty staff's duties of manufacturing the alcoholic product during the manufacturing process and not otherwise;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(4)(b): a brewery manufacturing licensee may allow a person who can lawfully purchase the following for wholesale or retail distribution to consume a bona fide sample of the brewery manufacturing licensee's product on the licensed premises:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(4)(b)(i): beer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(4)(b)(ii): heavy beer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(4)(b)(iii): a flavored malt beverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(4)(c): Chapter 7, Part 2, Off-Premise Beer Retailer Local Authority a brewery manufacturing licensee may operate a retail facility that complies with the requirements of
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(4)(d): 32B-11-210 a brewery manufacturing licensee may conduct a tasting as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(5): (1)(d); (1)(d); (1)(d); (5)(c)(i); 32B-1-205; (5); 32B-1-205
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(5)(a): (1)(d); (1)(d) A small brewer shall own, lease, or maintain and control a warehouse facility located in this state for the storage of beer to be sold to a person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-503(5)(a)(i):

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-504 Department's authority regarding small-brewer status.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-504(1): A brewer seeking to obtain small-brewer status shall provide to the department any documentation or information the department determines necessary to determine if the brewer is part of a controlled group of manufacturers.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-504(2): The department may revoke a brewer's small-brewer status at any time, if the department determines the brewer does not qualify as a small brewer.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-601 Title.
---------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Local Industry Representative License Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-602 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
Reserved

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-603 Commission's power to issue local industry representative license.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-603(1): (2); (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-603(1)(a): (2) Before a person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-603(1)(b): (1) A violation of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-603(2): The commission may issue a local industry representative license to a person who is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-603(2)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-603(2)(a)(i): an individual resident of Utah;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-603(2)(a)(ii): a Utah partnership;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-603(2)(a)(iii): a Utah corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-603(2)(a)(iv): a Utah limited liability company; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-603(2)(b): employed by a manufacturer, supplier, or importer, to represent a liquor product with the department, a package agency, licensee, or permittee under this title, whether compensated by salary, commission, or another means.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-603(3): An individual staff member of a local industry representative licensee is not required to be separately licensed.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-603(4): A local industry representative may represent more than one manufacturer, supplier, or importer at a time.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-603(5): (5)(a); Chapter 4, Criminal Offenses and Procedure Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-603(5)(a): A manufacturer, supplier, or importer is not required to use a local industry representative to represent its products with the department, a package agency, licensee, or permittee, except that staff of a manufacturer, supplier, or importer who is not a local industry representative shall register with the department, on a form provided by the department, before the staff represents an alcoholic product while in the state with the department, a package agency, licensee, or permittee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-603(5)(b): (5)(a); Chapter 4, Criminal Offenses and Procedure Act A manufacturer, supplier, or importer described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-604 Application for local industry representative license.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-604(1): To obtain a local industry representative license, a person shall submit to the department:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-604(1)(a): a written application in a form prescribed by the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-604(1)(b): a nonrefundable $75 application fee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-604(1)(c): an initial license fee of $125, which is refundable if a local industry representative license is not issued;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-604(1)(d): verification that the person is:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-604(1)(d)(i): a resident of Utah;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-604(1)(d)(ii): a Utah partnership;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-604(1)(d)(iii): a Utah corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-604(1)(d)(iv): a Utah limited liability company;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-604(1)(e): an affidavit stating the name and address of any manufacturer, supplier, or importer the person will represent;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-604(1)(f): a signed consent form stating that the local industry representative will permit any authorized representative of the commission, department, or any law enforcement officer to have an unrestricted right to enter, during normal business hours, the specific premises where the local industry representative conducts business;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-604(1)(g): if the person is an entity, proper verification evidencing that a person who signs the application is authorized to sign on behalf of the entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-604(1)(h): any other information the commission or department may require.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-604(2): A local industry representative licensee is not required to pay an additional license fee to represent more than one manufacturer, supplier, or importer.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-605 Renewal requirements for local industry representative license.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-605(1): A local industry representative license expires on December 31 of each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-605(2): To renew a local industry representative license, a person shall submit to the department by no later than November 30 of the year the license expires:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-605(2)(a): a completed renewal application in a form prescribed by the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-605(2)(b): a renewal fee of $125; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-605(2)(c): an affidavit stating the name and address of any manufacturer, supplier, or importer the local industry representative licensee represents at the time of submitting the renewal application.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-605(3): Failure to meet the renewal requirements results in an automatic forfeiture of the local industry representative license effective on the date the existing local industry representative license expires.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-606 Specific qualifications for local industry representative.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-606(1): 32B-1-304 The commission may not issue a local industry representative license to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-606(1)(a): 32B-1-304 a person who is disqualified under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-606(1)(b): unless otherwise provided:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-606(1)(b)(i): a retail licensee that sells, offers for sale, or furnishes liquor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-606(1)(b)(ii): staff of a retail licensee that sells, offers for sale, or furnishes liquor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-606(1)(b)(iii): an individual, partnership, corporation, or limited liability company who holds an interest in a retail licensee that sells, offers for sale, or furnishes liquor.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-606(2): If a person to whom a local industry representative license is issued under this part no longer possesses the qualifications required by this title for obtaining that local industry representative license, the commission may suspend or revoke that local industry representative license.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-607 Commission and department duties before issuing local representative license.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-607(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-607(1)(a): Before the commission may issue a local industry representative license, the department shall conduct an investigation and may hold public hearings to gather information and make recommendations to the commission as to whether a local industry representative license should be issued.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-607(1)(b): (1)(a) The department shall forward the information and recommendations described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-607(2): 32B-11-604; 32B-11-606; 32B-1-304 Before issuing a local industry representative license, the commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-607(2)(a): 32B-11-604; 32B-11-606 determine that the person filed a complete application and is in compliance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-607(2)(b): 32B-1-304 determine that the person is not disqualified under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-607(2)(c): consider any other factor the commission considers necessary.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608 Operational requirements for local industry representative license.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(1): (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act; (1)(c); (1)(b)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(1)(a): A local industry representative licensee, staff of the local industry representative licensee, or staff of a manufacturer, supplier, or importer who is conducting business in the state, shall comply with this title and rules of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(1)(b): (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act; (1)(c) If a person knowingly violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(1)(b)(i): Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act the violation may result in disciplinary action in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(1)(b)(i)(A): a local industry representative licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(1)(b)(i)(B): individual staff of a local industry representative licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(1)(b)(i)(C): both a local industry representative licensee and staff of the local industry representative licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(1)(b)(ii): (1)(c) if the conditions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(1)(b)(ii)(A): the removal of the manufacturer's, supplier's, or importer's products from the department's sales list; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(1)(b)(ii)(B): a suspension of the department's purchase of those products for a period determined by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(1)(c): (1)(b)(ii) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(1)(c)(i): directly commits the violation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(1)(c)(ii): solicits, requests, commands, encourages, or intentionally aides another to engage in the violation.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(2): A local industry representative licensee shall display its license in the local industry representative licensee's principal place of business.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(3)(a): A local industry representative licensee shall maintain on file with the department a current accounts list of the names and addresses of the manufacturers, suppliers, and importers the local industry representative licensee represents.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(3)(b): A local industry representative licensee shall notify the department in writing of a change to its accounts list within 14 days from the date the local industry representative licensee:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(3)(b)(i): acquires the account of a manufacturer, supplier, or importer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(3)(b)(ii): loses the account of a manufacturer, supplier, or importer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(4): 32B-1-205; (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(4)(a): A local industry representative licensee shall make and maintain the records the department requires for at least three years.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(4)(b): 32B-1-205; (4) Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(5): Staff of a local industry representative licensee may not be:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(5)(a): a retail licensee that sells, offers for sale, or furnishes liquor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(5)(b): staff of a retail licensee that sells, offers for sale, or furnishes liquor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(5)(c): a minor.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(6)(a): A local representative licensee may not sell, transfer, assign, exchange, barter, give, or attempt in any way to dispose of the license to another person, whether for monetary gain or not.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(6)(b): A local industry representative license has no monetary value for any type of disposition.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(7): Chapter 4, Criminal Offenses and Procedure Act; Chapter 4, Part 7, Trade Practices Act; 32B-4-705 A local industry representative licensee, staff of the local industry representative licensee, or staff of a manufacturer, supplier, or importer who is conducting business in the state:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(7)(a): Chapter 4, Criminal Offenses and Procedure Act only to the extent authorized by
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(7)(a)(i): assist the department in:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(7)(a)(i)(A): ordering, shipping, and delivering merchandise;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(7)(a)(i)(B): providing new product notification;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(7)(a)(i)(C): obtaining listing and delisting information;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(7)(a)(i)(D): receiving price quotations;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(7)(a)(i)(E): providing product sales analysis;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(7)(a)(i)(F): conducting shelf management; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(7)(a)(i)(G): conducting educational seminars; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(7)(a)(ii): to acquire new listings:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(7)(a)(ii)(A): solicit orders from the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(7)(a)(ii)(B): submit to the department price lists and samples of the products of the manufacturer, supplier, or importer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(7)(b): may not sell liquor within the state except to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(7)(b)(i): the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(7)(b)(ii): a military installation;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(7)(c): may not ship or transport, or cause to be shipped or transported, liquor into this state or from one place to another within this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(7)(d): may not sell or furnish any liquor to any person within this state other than to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(7)(d)(i): the department; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(7)(d)(ii): a military installation;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(7)(e): except as otherwise provided, may not advertise a product the local industry representative licensee represents in violation of this title or any other federal or state law;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(7)(f): Chapter 4, Part 7, Trade Practices Act shall comply with the trade practices provided in
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(7)(g): 32B-4-705 may only provide a sample of a product of the manufacturer, supplier, or importer for tasting and sampling purposes as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8): (8); (8)(b)(i) A local industry representative licensee may, to become educated as to the quality and characteristics of a liquor that the licensee represents, taste and analyze an industry representative sample under the conditions listed in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(a): A local industry representative licensee may not receive more than two industry representative samples of a particular type, vintage, and production lot of a particular branded product within a consecutive 120-day period.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(b): (8)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(b)(i): An industry representative sample of liquor may not exceed one liter.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(b)(ii): (8)(b)(i) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(b)(ii)(A): wine;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(b)(ii)(B): heavy beer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(b)(ii)(C): a flavored malt beverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(c): An industry representative sample may only be of a product not presently listed on the department's sales list.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(d)(i): An industry representative sample shall be shipped:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(d)(i)(A): prepaid by the manufacturer, supplier, or importer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(d)(i)(B): by common carrier and not via United States mail; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(d)(i)(C): directly to the department's central administrative warehouse office.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(d)(ii): An industry representative sample may not be shipped to any other location within the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(e): An industry representative sample shall be accompanied by a letter from the manufacturer, supplier, or importer:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(e)(i): clearly identifying the product as an "industry representative sample"; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(e)(ii): clearly stating:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(e)(ii)(A): the FOB case price of the product; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(e)(ii)(B): the name of the local industry representative for whom it is intended.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(f): The department shall assess a reasonable handling, labeling, and storage fee for each industry representative sample received.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(g): The department shall affix to a container a label clearly identifying the product as an "industry representative sample."
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(h): The department shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(h)(i): account for and record each industry representative sample received;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(h)(ii): account for the industry representative sample's disposition; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(h)(iii): maintain a record of the industry representative sample and its disposition for a two-year period.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(i): An industry representative sample may not leave the premises of the department's central administrative warehouse office.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(j): A local industry representative licensee's and a local industry representative licensee's staff may, at regularly scheduled days and times established by the department, taste and analyze one or more industry representative samples on the premises of the department's central administrative warehouse office.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(k): The department shall destroy the unused contents of an opened product remaining after a product is sampled under controlled and audited conditions established by the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(l): An industry representative sample that is not tasted within 30 days of receipt by the department shall be disposed of at the discretion of the department in one of the following ways:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(l)(i): the contents destroyed under controlled and audited conditions established by the department; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-608(8)(l)(ii): added to the inventory of the department for sale to the public.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-609 Notifying department of change in ownership.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The commission may suspend, revoke, or deem forfeited a local industry representative license if a local industry representative licensee does not notify the department, within 60 days after the day on which the change occurs, of a change in:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-609(1): ownership of the business;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-609(2): for a corporate owner, the:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-609(2)(a): corporate officers or directors; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-609(2)(b): shareholders holding at least 20% of the total issued and outstanding stock of the corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-609(3): for a limited liability company:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-609(3)(a): managers; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-11-609(3)(b): members owning at least 20% of the limited liability company.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 32B - Chapter 12 - Liquor Warehousing License Act
*****************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Liquor Warehousing License Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
Reserved

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-201 Commission's power to issue liquor warehousing license.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-201(1): (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-201(1)(a): Before a person may warehouse, distribute, or transport liquor for resale to a wholesale or retail customer, the person shall first obtain a liquor warehousing license issued by the commission in accordance with this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-201(1)(b): A separate liquor warehousing license is required for each warehousing facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-201(1)(c): (1) A violation of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-201(2): The commission may issue a liquor warehousing license in accordance with this chapter for the warehousing, distribution, and transportation of liquor.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-202 Application requirements for liquor warehousing license.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
To obtain a liquor warehousing license, a person shall submit to the department:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-202(1): a written application in a form prescribed by the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-202(2): a nonrefundable $300 application fee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-202(3): an initial license fee of $850, which is refundable if a liquor warehousing license is not issued;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-202(4): written consent of the local authority;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-202(5): a copy of the person's current business license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-202(6): 32B-12-206 a bond as specified by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-202(7): a floor plan of the person's warehouse, including the area in which the person proposes that liquor be stored;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-202(8): evidence that the person is carrying public liability insurance in an amount and form satisfactory to the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-202(9): a signed consent form stating that the liquor warehousing licensee will permit any authorized representative of the commission, department, or any law enforcement officer to have unrestricted right to enter the licensed premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-202(10): if the person is an entity, proper verification evidencing that a person who signs the application is authorized to sign on behalf of the entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-202(11): any other information the commission or department may require.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-203 Renewal requirements for liquor warehousing license.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-203(1): A liquor warehousing license expires on December 31 of each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-203(2): To renew a liquor warehousing license, a person shall submit to the department by no later than November 30 of the year the license expires:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-203(2)(a): a completed renewal application in a form prescribed by the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-203(2)(b): a renewal fee of $1,200.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-203(3): Failure to meet the renewal requirements results in an automatic forfeiture of the liquor warehousing license effective on the date the existing liquor warehousing license expires.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-204 Specific qualifications for liquor warehousing license.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-204(1): 32B-1-304 The commission may not issue a liquor warehousing license to a person who is disqualified under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-204(2): Chapter 11, Manufacturing and Related Licenses Act A person, through its staff, or otherwise, either directly or indirectly, may not hold at the same time both a liquor warehousing license and another kind of package agency, license, or permit issued under this title except:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-204(2)(a): a temporary beer event permit;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-204(2)(b): Chapter 11, Manufacturing and Related Licenses Act a manufacturing license issued in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-204(2)(c): a beer wholesaling license issued in accordance with this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-204(3): If a person to whom a liquor warehousing license is issued under this chapter no longer possesses the qualifications required by this title for obtaining that liquor warehousing license, the commission may suspend or revoke that liquor warehousing license.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-205 Duties of commission and department before issuing liquor warehousing license.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-205(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-205(1)(a): Before the commission may issue a warehousing license or approve a change of location for a licensee's warehouse facility, the department shall conduct an investigation and may hold public hearings to gather information and make recommendations to the commission as to whether a liquor warehousing license should be issued or a change of location granted.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-205(1)(b): (1)(a) The department shall forward the information and recommendations described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-205(2): 32B-12-202; 32B-12-204; 32B-1-304 Before issuing a liquor warehousing license, the commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-205(2)(a): 32B-12-202; 32B-12-204 determine that the person filed a complete application and has complied with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-205(2)(b): 32B-1-304 determine that the person is not disqualified under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-205(2)(c): consider the physical characteristics of the premises where the person proposes to warehouse liquor, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-205(2)(c)(i): location;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-205(2)(c)(ii): proximity to transportation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-205(2)(c)(iii): condition, size, and security of the licensed premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-205(2)(d): consider the person's ability to properly use the liquor warehousing license within the requirements of this title and the commission rules including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-205(2)(d)(i): the types of products other than liquor that the person is warehousing;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-205(2)(d)(ii): the brands of liquor the person intends to warehouse; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-205(2)(d)(iii): the means the person intends to use to distribute the liquor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-205(2)(e): consider any other factor the commission considers necessary.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-205(3): Before approving a liquor warehousing licensee's request to change the location of the licensee's warehouse facility, the commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-205(3)(a): determine that the licensee filed a complete change of location application;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-205(3)(b): consider the physical characteristics of the premises where the licensee proposes to warehouse liquor, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-205(3)(b)(i): location;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-205(3)(b)(ii): proximity to transportation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-205(3)(b)(iii): condition, size, and security of the licensed premises; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-205(3)(c): consider any other factor the commission considers necessary.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-206 Bond for liquor warehousing license.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-206(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-206(1)(a): A liquor warehouser licensee shall post a cash bond or surety bond in the penal sum of $10,000 payable to the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-206(1)(b): A liquor warehouser licensee shall procure and maintain the bond required by this section for as long as the liquor warehouser licensee continues to operate as a liquor warehouser licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-206(2): A bond posted under this section shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-206(2)(a): in a form approved by the attorney general; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-206(2)(b): conditioned upon the liquor warehouser licensee's faithful compliance with this title and the rules of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-206(3): If a surety bond posted by a liquor warehouser licensee under this section is canceled due to a liquor warehouser licensee's negligence, the department may assess a $300 reinstatement fee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-206(4): No part of a bond posted under this section may be withdrawn during the period the liquor warehousing license is in effect.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-206(5): (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-206(5)(a): A bond posted by a liquor warehouser licensee may be forfeited if the liquor warehousing license is revoked.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-206(5)(b): (5)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-301 General operational requirements for liquor warehousing license.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-301(1): (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-301(1)(a): A liquor warehouser licensee and staff of the liquor warehouser licensee shall comply with this title and the rules of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-301(1)(b): (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act Failure to comply as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-301(1)(b)(i): a liquor warehouser licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-301(1)(b)(ii): individual staff of a liquor warehouser licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-301(1)(b)(iii): both a liquor warehouser licensee and staff of the liquor warehouser licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-301(2): 32B-1-205; (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-301(2)(a): A liquor warehouser licensee shall make and maintain records required by the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-301(2)(b): 32B-1-205; (2) Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-301(3): A liquor warehousing license may not be transferred from one location to another location, without prior written approval of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-301(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-301(4)(a): A liquor warehouser licensee may not sell, transfer, assign, exchange, barter, give, or attempt in any way to dispose of the license to another person, whether for monetary gain or not.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-301(4)(b): A liquor warehousing license has no monetary value for any type of disposition.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-301(5): A liquor warehouser licensee may not employ a minor to handle an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-301(6): Title 72, Chapter 9, Motor Carrier Safety Act Liquor that is warehoused in this state and sold to an out-of-state consignee may be transported out of the state only by a motor carrier regulated under
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-301(7): Liquor that is warehoused in this state and sold to the department may be transported only by a motor carrier approved by the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-301(8): Liquor transported to or from a liquor warehouser licensee's licensed premises shall be carried in a sealed conveyance that is made available for inspection by the department while en route within the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-301(9): A liquor warehouser licensee may not ship, convey, distribute, or remove liquor from a warehouse in less than a full case lot.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-301(10): A liquor warehouser licensee may not ship, convey, distribute, or remove liquor from a warehouse to a consignee outside the state that is not licensed as a liquor wholesaler or retailer by the state in which the consignee is domiciled.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-301(11): A liquor warehouser licensee may not receive, warehouse, distribute, transport, ship, or convey liquor that the commission has not authorized the liquor warehouser licensee to handle through its warehouse.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-301(12): The commission may prescribe by policy or rule, consistent with this title, the general operational requirements of licensees relating to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-301(12)(a): physical facilities;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-301(12)(b): conditions of storage, distribution, or transport of liquor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-301(12)(c): other matters considered appropriate by the commission.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-302 Notifying the department of change in ownership.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The commission may suspend, revoke, or deem forfeited a liquor warehousing license if a liquor warehouser licensee does not notify the department, within 60 days after the day on which the change occurs, of a change in:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-302(1): ownership of the liquor warehouser licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-302(2): for a corporate owner, the:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-302(2)(a): corporate officers or directors; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-302(2)(b): shareholders holding at least 20% of the total issued and outstanding stock of the corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-302(3): for a limited liability company:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-302(3)(a): managers; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-12-302(3)(b): members owning at least 20% of the limited liability company.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 32B - Chapter 13 - Beer Wholesaling License Act
***************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Beer Wholesaling License Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
Reserved

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-201 Commission's power to issue beer wholesaling license.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-201(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-201(1)(a): Before a person may purchase, store, sell, offer for sale, distribute, or import beer to a person who sells at retail or acts in any way as a beer wholesaler, the person shall first obtain a beer wholesaling license issued by the commission in accordance with this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-201(1)(b): (1)(a) A violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-201(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-201(2)(a): The commission may issue a beer wholesaling license for the purchase, storage, sale, distribution, transportation, and import of beer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-201(2)(b): A beer wholesaling license entitles the beer wholesaler licensee to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-201(2)(b)(i): purchase and import beer into the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-201(2)(b)(ii): store beer in an approved warehouse; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-201(2)(b)(iii): sell and distribute beer directly to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-201(2)(b)(iii)(A): a beer retailer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-201(2)(b)(iii)(B): an event permittee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-201(3): Nothing in this section precludes a small brewer from selling beer the small brewer manufactures directly to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-201(3)(a): a retail licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-201(3)(b): an off-premise beer retailer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-201(3)(c): an event permittee.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-202 Application requirements for beer wholesaling license.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
To obtain a beer wholesaling license, a person shall submit to the department:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-202(1): a written application in a form prescribed by the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-202(2): a nonrefundable $300 application fee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-202(3): an initial license fee of $2,300 that is refundable if a beer wholesaling license is not issued;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-202(4): written consent of the local authority;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-202(5): a copy of the person's current business license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-202(6): 32B-13-206 a bond as specified in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-202(7): a statement of the brands of beer the person is authorized to sell and distribute;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-202(8): 32B-11-201; 32B-11-503 a statement of the one or more sales territories in which the person is authorized to sell and distribute beer under an agreement required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-202(9): evidence that the person is carrying public liability insurance in an amount and form satisfactory to the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-202(10): a signed consent form stating that the beer wholesaling licensee will permit any authorized representative of the commission, department, or any law enforcement officer to have unrestricted right to enter the licensed premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-202(11): if the person is an entity, proper verification evidencing that a person who signs the application is authorized to sign on behalf of the entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-202(12): any other information that the commission or department may require.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-203 Renewal requirements for beer wholesaling license.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-203(1): A beer wholesaling license expires on December 31 of each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-203(2): To renew a beer wholesaling license, a person shall submit to the department by no later than November 30 of the year the license expires:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-203(2)(a): a completed renewal application in a form prescribed by the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-203(2)(b): a renewal fee in the following amount:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-203(3): Failure to meet the renewal requirements results in an automatic forfeiture of the beer wholesaling license effective on the date the existing beer wholesaling license expires.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-204 Specific qualifications for beer wholesaling license.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-204(1): 32B-1-304 The commission may not issue a beer wholesaling license to a person who:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-204(1)(a): 32B-1-304 is disqualified under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-204(1)(b): does not meet any applicable federal requirement for beer wholesaling.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-204(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-204(2)(a): The commission may not issue one of the following licenses to a beer wholesaler licensee simultaneously with the beer wholesaling license, and a beer wholesaler licensee may not, directly or indirectly, hold, through a wholly or partially owned subsidiary or otherwise, one of the following licenses:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-204(2)(a)(i): a brewery manufacturing license; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-204(2)(a)(ii): a beer retailer license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-204(2)(b): The commission may not issue to a beer retailer, and a beer retailer, directly or indirectly, may not hold, through a wholly or partially owned subsidiary or otherwise, a beer wholesaling license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-204(3): If a person to whom a beer wholesaling license is issued under this chapter no longer possesses the qualifications required by this title for obtaining that beer wholesaling license, the commission may suspend or revoke that beer wholesaling license.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-205 Commission and department duties before issuing beer wholesaling license.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-205(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-205(1)(a): Before the commission may issue a beer wholesaling license, the department shall conduct an investigation and may hold public hearings to gather information and make recommendations to the commission as to whether a beer wholesaling license should be issued.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-205(1)(b): (1)(a) The department shall forward the information and recommendations described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-205(2): 32B-13-202; 32B-13-204; 32B-1-304 Before issuing a beer wholesaling license, the commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-205(2)(a): 32B-13-202; 32B-13-204 determine that the person filed a complete application and is in compliance with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-205(2)(b): 32B-1-304 determine that the person is not disqualified under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-205(2)(c): consider the physical characteristics of the licensed premises where it is proposed that beer be stored by the person, such as:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-205(2)(c)(i): location;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-205(2)(c)(ii): proximity to transportation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-205(2)(c)(iii): condition, size, and security of the licensed premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-205(2)(d): consider the person's ability to manage and operate a beer wholesaling operation, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-205(2)(d)(i): management experience;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-205(2)(d)(ii): past wholesaling experience;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-205(2)(d)(iii): the brands the person intends to wholesale; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-205(2)(d)(iv): the means the person intends to use to distribute beer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-205(2)(e): consider any other factor that the commission considers necessary.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-206 Bond for a beer wholesaling license.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-206(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-206(1)(a): A beer wholesaler licensee shall post a cash bond or surety bond in the penal sum of $10,000 payable to the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-206(1)(b): A beer wholesaler licensee shall procure and maintain a bond required by this section for as long as the beer wholesaler licensee continues to operate as a beer wholesaler licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-206(2): A bond posted under this section shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-206(2)(a): in a form approved by the attorney general; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-206(2)(b): conditioned upon a beer wholesaler licensee's faithful compliance with this title and the rules of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-206(3): If a surety bond posted by a beer wholesaler licensee under this section is canceled due to a beer wholesaler licensee's negligence, the department may assess a $300 reinstatement fee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-206(4): No part of a bond posted under this section may be withdrawn during the period the beer wholesaling license is in effect.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-206(5): (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-206(5)(a): A bond posted under this section by a beer wholesaler licensee may be forfeited if the beer wholesaling license is revoked.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-206(5)(b): (5)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301 General operational requirements for beer wholesaling license.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(1): (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(1)(b): (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act Failure to comply as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(1)(b)(i): a beer wholesaler licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(1)(b)(ii): individual staff of a beer wholesaler licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(1)(b)(iii): both a beer wholesaler licensee and staff of the beer wholesaler licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(2): 32B-1-205; (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(2)(a): A beer wholesaler licensee shall make and maintain the records required by the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(2)(b): 32B-1-205; (2) Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(3): A beer wholesaler licensee may not employ a minor to handle an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(4): A beer wholesaler licensee may not sell, transfer, assign, exchange, barter, give, or attempt in any way to dispose of the beer wholesaling license to a person, whether for monetary gain or not, unless it is done:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(4)(a): in accordance with the commission rules; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(4)(b): after written consent is given by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(5): A beer wholesaler licensee may not wholesale a beer manufactured within the state by a brewer who is not licensed by the commission as a brewery manufacturing licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(6): A beer wholesaler licensee may not wholesale a beer manufactured out of state by a brewer who has not obtained a certificate of approval from the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(7): (7)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(7)(a): A beer wholesaler licensee may not sell or distribute beer to a person within the state except to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(7)(a)(i): a retail licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(7)(a)(ii): an off-premise beer retailer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(7)(a)(iii): an event permittee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(7)(b): (7) A violation of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(8): 32B-13-202(8); (8)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(8)(a): 32B-13-202(8) A beer wholesaler licensee may not sell or distribute a beer to a person who sells the beer at retail outside of a sales territory designated on its application and authorized by an agreement described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(8)(a)(i): a retail licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(8)(a)(ii): an off-premise beer retailer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(8)(b): (8) A violation of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(9): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(9)(a): A beer wholesaler licensee shall own, lease, or otherwise control and maintain a warehouse facility located in this state for the receipt, storage, and further distribution of beer sold by the beer wholesaler licensee to a person within the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(9)(b): A beer wholesaler licensee may not sell beer to a person in this state, other than the department, unless the beer is first:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(9)(b)(i): physically removed from the vehicle used to transport the beer from the supplier to the beer wholesaler licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(9)(b)(ii): delivered into the actual possession and control of the beer wholesaler licensee in its warehouse or other facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(10): Chapter 1, Part 6, Malted Beverage Act A beer wholesaler licensee may not sell or distribute an alcoholic product that has not had its label and packaging approved by the department in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(11): The commission may prescribe by policy or rule, consistent with this title, the general operational requirements of a beer wholesaling licensee relating to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(11)(a): physical facilities; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-301(11)(b): the conditions of importation, purchase, storage, sale, offering for sale, distribution, or transportation of beer within the state.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-302 Notifying the department of a change of ownership.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The commission may suspend or revoke a beer wholesaling license if a beer wholesaler licensee does not immediately notify the department of change in:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-302(1): ownership of the beer wholesaler licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-302(2): for a corporate owner, the:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-302(2)(a): corporate officers or directors; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-302(2)(b): shareholders holding at least 20% of the total issued and outstanding stock of the corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-302(3): for a limited liability company:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-302(3)(a): managers; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-13-302(3)(b): members owning at least 20% of the limited liability company.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 32B - Chapter 14 - Utah Beer Industry Distribution Act
**********************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-101 Title -- Legislative intent.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-101(1): This chapter is known as the "Utah Beer Industry Distribution Act."
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-101(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-101(2)(a): It is the policy of the Legislature to regulate and control the importation, sale, and distribution of beer within the state in the exercise of its powers under the Twenty-first Amendment to the Constitution of the United States and pursuant to the Utah Constitution.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-101(2)(b): (2)(a) In furtherance of the policy described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-101(2)(b)(i): promote good faith and fair dealing in the business relationships between suppliers, wholesalers, and retailers of beer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-101(2)(b)(ii): provide for the establishment and maintenance of an orderly system for the distribution of beer in accordance with the laws of the state regulating the sale and distribution of beer to the public.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-102(1): "Affected party" means a supplier or wholesaler who is a party to a distributorship agreement that a terminating party seeks to terminate or not renew.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-102(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-102(2)(a): "Distributorship agreement" means a written agreement between a supplier and a wholesaler pursuant to which the wholesaler has the right to purchase, resell, and distribute in a designated geographical area any brand of beer manufactured, imported, or distributed by the supplier.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-102(2)(b): For purposes of this chapter, a separate agreement between a supplier and a wholesaler is considered to be part of a distributorship agreement if it relates to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-102(2)(b)(i): the relationship between the supplier and the wholesaler; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-102(2)(b)(ii): the duties of either the supplier or the wholesaler under a distributorship agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-102(3): Part 2, Termination "Good cause" means the material failure by a supplier or a wholesaler to comply with an essential, reasonable, and lawful requirement imposed by a distributorship agreement if the failure occurs after the supplier or wholesaler acting in good faith provides notice of deficiency and an opportunity to correct in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-102(4): 70A-1a-201(2)(t) "Good faith" is as defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-102(5): "Retailer" means a beer retailer.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-102(6): "Sales territory" means the geographic area of distribution and sale responsibility designated by a distributorship agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-102(7): 32B-1-102 "Supplier," notwithstanding Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-102(8): "Terminating party" means a supplier or wholesaler who:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-102(8)(a): is a party to a distributorship agreement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-102(8)(b): seeks to terminate or not renew the distributorship agreement.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-103 Modifying statutory requirements not permitted.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-103(1): Nothing in this chapter is intended to restrict the right of a supplier to contractually require its wholesaler to comply with the supplier's operational standards of performance that are:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-103(1)(a): consistent with this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-103(1)(b): uniformly established for its wholesalers according to the supplier's good faith business judgment.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-103(2): (1) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-103(3): An agreement that by its terms modifies the requirements of this chapter is void and unenforceable to the extent it attempts to modify the requirements of this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-201 Termination of distributorship agreements.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-201(1): (2); (3) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-201(1)(a): terminate a distributorship agreement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-201(1)(b): fail to renew a distributorship agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-201(2): (1); 32B-14-202; 32B-14-202; 32B-14-202 A supplier or wholesaler may take an action prohibited by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-201(2)(a): the supplier or wholesaler has good cause for the action; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-201(2)(b): 32B-14-202; 32B-14-202; 32B-14-202 if notification is required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-201(2)(b)(i): 32B-14-202 the terminating party provides the affected party prior notification in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-201(2)(b)(ii): 32B-14-202 the affected party has not eliminated the reasons specified in the notification as the reasons for the action within 90 days after the date the notification is mailed in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-201(3): (1) A supplier may take an action prohibited by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-201(3)(a): the supplier gives the wholesaler 30 days written notice before termination or nonrenewal;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-201(3)(b): the supplier discontinues production or discontinues distribution throughout the state of all brands of beer sold by the supplier to the wholesaler; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-201(3)(c): the termination or nonrenewal does not violate the distributorship agreement.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-202 Notice of termination.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-202(1): (3); 32B-14-201(1); (2) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-202(2): (1); (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-202(2)(a): (1) A terminating party shall provide the notification required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-202(2)(a)(i): in writing;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-202(2)(a)(ii): by registered mail, return receipt requested; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-202(2)(a)(iii): to the affected party not less than 90 days before the date on which the distributorship agreement will be terminated or not renewed.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-202(2)(b): (1) A terminating party shall state in the notification required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-202(2)(b)(i): the intention to terminate or not renew;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-202(2)(b)(ii): the reasons for the termination or nonrenewal; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-202(2)(b)(iii): the date, not less than 90 days from the date of mailing, on which the termination or nonrenewal shall take effect if the reasons for the action are not eliminated by that date.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-202(3): 32B-14-201(1) A supplier or wholesaler may take an action described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-202(3)(a): the affected party is insolvent, bankrupt, in dissolution, or in liquidation;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-202(3)(b): the affected party makes an assignment for the benefit of creditors or similar disposition of substantially all of the assets of the affected party's business; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-202(3)(c): the affected party or a person owning more than 10% of the stock or other ownership interest in the affected party:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-202(3)(c)(i): is convicted of, pleads guilty to, or pleads no contest to a felony under federal law or a law of this state that in the reasonable, good faith judgment of the terminating party materially and adversely affects the good will or business of the terminating party;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-202(3)(c)(ii): has its license or permit revoked or suspended for a period of 31 days or more; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-202(3)(c)(iii): engages in intentional fraudulent conduct in its dealings with the terminating party that in the reasonable, good faith judgment of the terminating party materially and adversely affects the good will or business of the terminating party.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-202(4): (3)(c)(i); (3)(c)(i); (4)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-202(4)(a): any other approved owner of the affected party purchases the ownership interest of the offending owner;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-202(4)(b): the offending owner was not materially involved in the management of the affected party; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-202(4)(c): (4)(a) the purchase described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-202(5): (3)(c)(iii) Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-301 Distributorship agreements in general.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
A distributorship agreement may be for a definite or indefinite period.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-302 Prohibited conduct of supplier.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-302(1): A supplier may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-302(1)(a): induce or coerce, or attempt to induce or coerce, a wholesaler to engage in an illegal act or course of conduct;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-302(1)(b): impose a requirement that is discriminatory by its terms or in the methods of enforcement as compared to requirements imposed by the supplier on similarly situated wholesalers;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-302(1)(c): prohibit a wholesaler from selling a product of another supplier;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-302(1)(d): fix or maintain the price at which a wholesaler may resell beer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-302(1)(e): fail to execute with each wholesaler of its brands a written distributorship agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-302(1)(f): require a wholesaler to accept delivery of beer or any other item that is not voluntarily ordered by the wholesaler;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-302(1)(g): restrict or inhibit, directly or indirectly, the right of a wholesaler to participate in an organization representing interests of wholesalers for a lawful purpose;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-302(1)(h): require a wholesaler to participate in or contribute to a local, regional, or national advertising fund or other promotional activity that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-302(1)(h)(i): is not used for an advertising or promotional activity in the wholesaler's sales territory; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-302(1)(h)(ii): would require a contribution by the wholesaler in excess of the amounts specified in the distributorship agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-302(1)(i): retaliate against a wholesaler that files a complaint with the department or the applicable federal agency regarding an alleged violation by the supplier of a state or federal statute or administrative rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-302(1)(j): require without good cause a change in the manager of a wholesaler who has previously been approved by the supplier;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-302(1)(k): if a wholesaler changes its approved manager, prohibit the change unless the new manager fails to meet the reasonable standards for similarly situated wholesalers of the supplier as stated in the distributorship agreement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-302(1)(l): refuse to deliver a beer product covered by a distributorship agreement to the wholesaler:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-302(1)(l)(i): in a reasonable quantity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-302(1)(l)(ii): within a reasonable time after receipt of the wholesaler's order.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-302(2): (1)(l) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-302(2)(a): the wholesaler's failure to pay the supplier pursuant to the distributorship agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-302(2)(b): an unforeseeable event beyond the supplier's control;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-302(2)(c): a work stoppage or delay due to a strike or labor problem;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-302(2)(d): a bona fide shortage of materials; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-302(2)(e): a freight embargo.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-303 Prohibited conduct of wholesaler.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-303(1): A wholesaler may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-303(1)(a): induce or coerce, or attempt to induce or coerce, a retailer to engage in an illegal act or course of conduct;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-303(1)(b): impose a requirement that is discriminatory by its terms or in the methods of enforcement as compared to requirements imposed by the wholesaler on similarly situated retailers;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-303(1)(c): prohibit a retailer from selling a product of another wholesaler;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-303(1)(d): fix or maintain the price at which a retailer may resell beer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-303(1)(e): require a retailer to accept delivery of beer or any other item that is not voluntarily ordered by the retailer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-303(1)(f): restrict or inhibit, directly or indirectly, the right of a retailer to participate in an organization representing interests of retailers for a lawful purpose;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-303(1)(g): require a retailer to participate in or contribute to a local, regional, or national advertising fund or other promotional activity;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-303(1)(h): retaliate against a retailer that files a complaint with the department or the applicable federal agency regarding an alleged violation by the wholesaler of a state or federal statute or administrative rule; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-303(1)(i): refuse to deliver a beer product carried by the wholesaler to a properly licensed retailer who resides within the wholesaler's sales territory:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-303(1)(i)(i): in a reasonable quantity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-303(1)(i)(ii): within a reasonable time after receipt of the retailer's order.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-303(2): (1)(i); 32B-4-704(6) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-303(2)(a): 32B-4-704(6) the retailer's failure to pay the wholesaler pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-303(2)(b): an unforeseeable event beyond the wholesaler's control;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-303(2)(c): a work stoppage or delay due to a strike or labor problem;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-303(2)(d): a bona fide shortage of materials; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-303(2)(e): a freight embargo.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-304 Sale or transfer of business assets or ownership.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-304(1): Without the prior written approval of a sale or transfer by the supplier:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-304(1)(a): a wholesaler may not sell or transfer its business, or any portion of its business, including the distributorship agreement, to a successor in interest; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-304(1)(b): the owner of an interest in a wholesaler may not sell or transfer all or part of the owner's interest in the wholesaler to a successor in interest.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-304(2): A supplier may not unreasonably withhold or delay its approval of a sale or transfer, including the wholesaler's rights and obligations under the terms of the distributorship agreement, if the person to be substituted meets reasonable standards that are imposed:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-304(2)(a): by the supplier pursuant to the distributorship agreement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-304(2)(b): on other wholesalers of that supplier of the same general class, taking into account the size and location of the sales territory and market to be served.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-304(3): (1); 32B-13-301(8) Notwithstanding Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-305 Sale or transfer of supplier's business.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-305(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-305(1)(a): For purposes of this section, "successor" means a supplier who obtains a distribution right of a brand that a wholesaler distributes in this state pursuant to a distributorship agreement with another supplier who previously had the distribution rights of the brand.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-305(1)(b): (1)(a) For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-305(1)(b)(i): by any means, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-305(1)(b)(i)(A): merger;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-305(1)(b)(i)(B): purchase of corporate shares; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-305(1)(b)(i)(C): purchase of assets; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-305(1)(b)(ii): from:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-305(1)(b)(ii)(A): a supplier; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-305(1)(b)(ii)(B): a person acting in an official capacity who is not a supplier including a nominee, representative, or fiduciary.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-305(2): (2)(a); (2)(c); (2)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-305(2)(a): A successor to a supplier that acquires a supplier's product or brand in this state is bound by the terms and conditions of each distributorship agreement with a wholesaler in this state that was in effect on the date on which the successor receives the assets or rights of the previous supplier.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-305(2)(b): (2)(a); (2)(c) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-305(2)(b)(i): execute a new distributorship agreement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-305(2)(b)(ii): comply with the successor's operational standards of performance.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-305(2)(c): (2)(b) A successor may impose a requirement under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-305(2)(c)(i): the operational standards of performance being required are consistent with this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-305(2)(c)(ii): the operational standards of performance being required are uniformly imposed by the successor on similarly situated wholesalers; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-305(2)(c)(iii): the successor provides the wholesaler at least one year to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-305(2)(c)(iii)(A): execute a new distributorship agreement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-305(2)(c)(iii)(B): comply with the operational standards of performance.
