------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-401(1): 32B-14-201; 32B-14-304
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-401(1)(a): 32B-14-201; 32B-14-304 If a supplier violates Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-401(1)(a)(i): the laid-in cost of inventory of the affected brands; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-401(1)(a)(ii): any diminution in the fair market value of the wholesaler's business with relation to an affected brand.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-401(1)(b): In determining fair market value, consideration shall be given to all elements of value, including good will and going concern value.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-401(2): 32B-14-304; (1); (2)(b); (2)(b); (2)(b); (2)(c)(i); (ii); (2)(c)(iii); (2)(c)(i); (ii); Title 78B, Chapter 11, Utah Uniform Arbitration Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-401(2)(a): A distributorship agreement may require that any or all disputes between a supplier and a wholesaler be submitted to binding arbitration.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-401(2)(b): 32B-14-304; (1) In the absence of an applicable arbitration provision in a distributorship agreement, either the supplier or the wholesaler may request arbitration if a supplier and a wholesaler are unable to mutually agree on:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-401(2)(b)(i): whether good cause exists for termination or nonrenewal;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-401(2)(b)(ii): 32B-14-304 whether the supplier unreasonably withheld approval of a sale or transfer under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-401(2)(b)(iii): (1) the reasonable compensation to be paid for the value of the wholesaler's business in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-401(2)(c): (2)(b); (2)(b); (2)(b); (2)(c)(i); (ii) If a supplier or wholesaler requests arbitration under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-401(2)(c)(ii): (2)(b) one member selected by the wholesaler in a writing delivered to the supplier within 10 business days of the date arbitration was requested under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-401(2)(c)(iii): (2)(c)(i); (ii) one member selected by the two arbitrators appointed under Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-401(2)(d): (2)(c)(iii); (2)(c)(i); (ii) If the arbitrators fail to choose a third arbitrator under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-401(2)(e): Arbitration costs shall be divided equally between the wholesaler and the supplier.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-401(2)(f): The award of the arbitration panel is binding on the parties unless appealed within 20 days from the date of the award.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-14-401(2)(g): Title 78B, Chapter 11, Utah Uniform Arbitration Act Subject to the requirements of this chapter, arbitration and a proceeding on appeal are governed by

Utah Code Annotated - Title 32B - Chapter 15 - Alcoholic Product Liability Act
******************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Alcoholic Product Liability Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-102(1): "Death of a third person" includes recovery for all damages, special and general, resulting from the death, except punitive damages.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-102(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-102(2)(a): "Injury" includes injury in person, property, or means of support.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-102(2)(b): "Injury" also includes recovery for intangibles such as:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-102(2)(b)(i): mental and emotional injuries;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-102(2)(b)(ii): loss of affection; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-102(2)(b)(iii): loss of companionship.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201 Liability for injuries and damage resulting from distribution of alcoholic products -- Prima facie evidence.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(1): 32B-15-202(2); (3); (1)(b); 78B-3-105; (1)(a); (1)(b)(ii); (1)(a); (1)(a); (1)(b)(ii)(B); (C); (1)(b)(iii); 41-6a-502
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(1)(a): 32B-15-202(2); (3); (1)(b); 78B-3-105 Except as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(1)(a)(i): 78B-3-105 any and all injury and damage, except punitive damages to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(1)(a)(i)(A): a third person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(1)(a)(i)(B): 78B-3-105 the heir, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(1)(a)(ii): the death of a third person.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(1)(b): (1)(a); (1)(b)(ii); (1)(a) A person is liable under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(1)(b)(i): (1)(b)(ii) the person directly gives, sells, or otherwise provides an alcoholic product:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(1)(b)(i)(A): (1)(b)(ii) to a person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(1)(b)(i)(B): as part of the commercial sale, storage, service, manufacture, distribution, or consumption of an alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(1)(b)(ii): those actions cause the intoxication of:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(1)(b)(ii)(A): an individual under 21 years old;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(1)(b)(ii)(B): an individual who is apparently under the influence of an alcoholic product or drug;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(1)(b)(ii)(C): an individual whom the person furnishing the alcoholic product knew or should have known from the circumstances was under the influence of an alcoholic product or drug; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(1)(b)(ii)(D): an individual who is a known interdicted person; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(1)(b)(iii): (1)(a) the injury or death described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(1)(c): (1)(a); (1)(b)(ii)(B); (C); (1)(b)(iii); 41-6a-502 It is prima facie evidence that a person is liable under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(1)(c)(i): (1)(b)(iii) the person directly gives, sells, or otherwise provides the individual the last alcoholic product the individual consumes before the injury or death described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(1)(c)(ii): the individual consumes the alcoholic product at the location where the person directly gives, sells, or otherwise provides the individual the alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(1)(c)(iii): the injury or death occurs within 30 minutes after the time at which the individual leaves, and within a 10 mile radius of, the location where the person gives, sells, or otherwise provides the individual the alcoholic product; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(1)(c)(iv): 41-6a-502 the individual is charged with a criminal violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(2): (2)(b); 78B-3-105; (2)(a); (2)(a); (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(2)(a): (2)(b); 78B-3-105 A person 21 years old or older who is described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(2)(a)(i): 78B-3-105 any and all injury and damage, except punitive damages to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(2)(a)(i)(A): a third person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(2)(a)(i)(B): 78B-3-105 the heir, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(2)(a)(ii): the death of the third person.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(2)(b): (2)(a); (2)(a); (1) A person is liable under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(2)(b)(i): the person directly gives or otherwise provides an alcoholic product to an individual who the person knows or should have known is under 21 years old;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(2)(b)(ii): those actions caused the intoxication of the individual provided the alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-201(2)(b)(iii): (2)(a) the injury or death described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-202 Liability for employees -- Employee protected in exercising judgment.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-202(3): Title 34A, Chapter 5, Utah Antidiscrimination Act An employer who terminates an employee or imposes sanctions on the employee contrary to this section is considered to have discriminated against that employee and is subject to the conditions and penalties set forth in


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-203 Governmental immunity.
-------------------------------------------------------
This title does not create civil liability on the part of the following arising out of one of the following's actions in regulating, controlling, authorizing, or otherwise being involved in the sale or other distribution of an alcoholic product:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-203(1): the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-203(2): a state agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-203(3): a state employee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-203(4): the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-203(5): the department; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-203(6): a political subdivision.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-301 Cause of action -- Statute of limitations.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-301(1): 32B-15-201; 32B-15-201
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-301(1)(a): 32B-15-201; 32B-15-201 A person who suffers an injury under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-301(1)(b): If a person having rights or liabilities under this chapter dies, the rights or liabilities provided by this chapter survive to or against that person's estate.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-301(2): The total amount that may be awarded to any person pursuant to a cause of action for injury and damage under this chapter that arises after January 1, 2010, is limited to $1,000,000 and the aggregate amount which may be awarded to all persons injured as a result of one occurrence is limited to $2,000,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-301(3): An action based upon a cause of action under this chapter shall be commenced within two years after the date of the injury and damage.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-301(4): (2); 78B-5-817; 78B-5-823
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-301(4)(a): Nothing in this chapter precludes any cause of action or additional recovery against the person causing the injury.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-301(4)(b): (2) A cause of action or additional recovery against the person causing the injury and damage, which action is not brought under this chapter, is exempt from the damage cap in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-301(4)(c): 78B-5-817; 78B-5-823 A cause of action brought under this chapter is exempt from Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-301(5): Chapter 7, Off-Premise Beer Retailer Act This section does not apply to a business licensed in accordance with


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-302 Action for contribution by provider of an alcoholic product.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-302(1): (2); (3); 32B-15-201; 32B-15-202(1)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-302(1)(a): (2); (3); 32B-15-201; 32B-15-202(1) Except as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-302(1)(b): The maximum amount for which a person causing the injury and damage may be liable to a person seeking contribution is that percentage or proportion of the damages equivalent to the percentage or proportion of fault attributed to that person causing the injury and damage.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-302(2): 32B-15-201(1)(a)(i); (ii); 32B-15-201(2)(a)(i); (ii) This action for contribution under this section may not be brought against:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-302(2)(a): 32B-15-201(1)(a)(i); (ii) a person entitled to recovery as described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-302(3): 32B-15-201(1)(a)(i); (ii); 32B-15-201(2)(a)(i); (ii) An action for contribution under this section may not diminish the amount of recovery for injury or damages awarded and received to a person entitled to recover as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-302(3)(a): in a cause of action brought under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-15-302(3)(b): in a separate cause of action for injury and damage that is not brought under this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 32B - Chapter 16 - Minor Liability Act
******************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Minor Liability Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-102(1): "Applicable fine" means the sum of the following imposed or assessed under this title by the commission for a violation related to a minor:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-102(1)(a): a fine; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-102(1)(b): administrative costs of a disciplinary proceeding.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-102(2): Chapter 1, Part 4, Proof of Age Act "Violation related to a minor" means a violation under this title:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-102(2)(a): that is, in whole or in part, based on a retail licensee, or staff of the retail licensee:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-102(2)(a)(i): selling, offering for sale, or furnishing an alcoholic product to a minor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-102(2)(a)(ii): purchasing or otherwise obtaining an alcoholic product for a minor;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-102(2)(a)(iii): permitting a minor to consume an alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-102(2)(a)(iv): permitting a minor to gain admittance to an area into which a minor is not permitted under this title; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-102(2)(a)(v): offering or providing employment to a minor that under this title may not be obtained by a minor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-102(2)(b): Chapter 1, Part 4, Proof of Age Act if as part of the violation the minor uses proof of age in violation of


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-201 Liability related to applicable fine.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-201(1): (2); (1)(a); Chapter 1, Part 4, Proof of Age Act A minor is liable to a retail licensee in an amount described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-201(1)(a): the commission imposes an applicable fine against the retail licensee on the basis of a violation related to a minor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-201(1)(b): (1)(a); Chapter 1, Part 4, Proof of Age Act the minor, as part of the minor's involvement in the violation described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-201(2): (1); 32B-16-301 If the conditions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-201(2)(a): one-half of the amount of the applicable fine imposed against the retail licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-201(2)(b): 32B-16-301 the costs and attorney fees incurred by the retail licensee under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-301 Bringing an action.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-301(1): 32B-16-201; 32B-16-201 Subject to the other provisions of this section, a retail licensee to whom a minor is liable under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-301(2): The action allowed under this section may be brought against:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-301(2)(a): the minor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-301(2)(b): if the minor is less than 18 years of age, a parent or guardian of the minor.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-301(3): An action under this chapter may not be commenced more than two years after the day on which the applicable fine is imposed by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-301(4): Nothing in this chapter precludes a cause of action or additional recovery against a minor under law other than this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-301(5): (5)(a) Notwithstanding the other provisions of this part:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-301(5)(a): the state or an agency of the state is not liable under this part when a state agency has legal or protective custody of, or has guardianship of a minor at the time:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-301(5)(a)(i): the minor engages in conduct with regard to a violation related to a minor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-301(5)(a)(ii): an applicable fine is imposed on the retail licensee by the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-301(5)(b): (5)(a) a retail licensee may not bring an action against the state or an agency of the state under the circumstances described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-302 Action for contribution.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-302(1): (2); (3); 32B-16-201; 32B-16-201; (1)(a); 32B-16-201; 32B-16-201
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-302(1)(a): (2); (3); 32B-16-201; 32B-16-201 Subject to Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-302(1)(b): (1)(a); 32B-16-201; 32B-16-201 The maximum amount for which a person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-302(2): An action for contribution under this section may not be brought against:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-302(2)(a): the retail licensee to whom the minor is liable; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-302(2)(b): staff of the retail licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-16-302(3): An action for contribution under this section may not diminish the amount collected by a retail licensee under this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 32B - Chapter 17 - Liquor Transport License Act
***************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Liquor Transport License Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-102(1): "Airport licensee" means a person who holds a valid:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-102(1)(a): retail license for premises located at an international airport or domestic airport; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-102(1)(b): special use permit for premises located at an international airport or domestic airport.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-102(2): (2)(b); (2)(b) "Central receiving and distribution center" means a facility that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-102(2)(a): operates at an international airport or domestic airport;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-102(2)(b): receives goods and supplies delivered to the international airport or domestic airport for an airport licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-102(2)(c): (2)(b) screens the goods and supplies described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-102(2)(d): (2)(b) distributes the goods and supplies described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201 Commission's power to issue liquor transport license.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(1)(a): A person who is not a retail licensee shall obtain a liquor transport license issued by the commission in accordance with this chapter before the person may:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(1)(a)(i): pickup liquor on behalf of a retail licensee and deliver the liquor to a retail licensee or a central receiving and distribution center; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(1)(a)(ii): if the person is a central receiving and distribution center:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(1)(a)(ii)(A): pickup liquor on behalf of an airport licensee and deliver the liquor to the central receiving and distribution center's premises; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(1)(a)(ii)(B): receive, screen, store, or deliver alcoholic product as part of the central receiving and distribution center's operations.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(1)(b): (1)(a) A violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(2): The commission may issue a liquor transport license for:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(2)(a): the pickup of liquor on behalf of a retail licensee and the delivery of the liquor to the retail licensee or a central receiving and distribution center; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(2)(b): the receipt, screening, storage, and distribution of alcoholic product by a central receiving and distribution center.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(3): In accordance with this chapter, a liquor transport license entitles the holder to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(3)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(3)(a)(i): pickup liquor from a package agency or state store on behalf of a retail licensee using the retail licensee's funds; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(3)(a)(ii): transport and deliver the liquor directly to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(3)(a)(ii)(A): the retail licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(3)(a)(ii)(B): if the retail licensee is an airport licensee, a central receiving and distribution center; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(3)(b): if the holder is a central receiving and distribution center:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(3)(b)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(3)(b)(i)(A): pickup liquor from a package agency or state store on behalf of an airport licensee using the airport licensee's funds; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(3)(b)(i)(B): transport the liquor directly to the central receiving and distribution center's premises for screening, storage, and delivery to the airport licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(3)(b)(ii): receive at the central receiving and distribution center's premises:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(3)(b)(ii)(A): liquor purchased by or on behalf of an airport licensee and delivered to the central receiving and distribution center by the airport licensee or a liquor transport licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(3)(b)(ii)(B): beer delivered to the central receiving and distribution center for an airport licensee by a beer wholesaler licensee or a small brewer;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(3)(b)(iii): screen and store alcoholic product picked up or received by the central receiving and distribution center; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(3)(b)(iv): transport and deliver the alcoholic product to the airport licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-201(4): Nothing in this chapter prohibits a retail licensee from picking up liquor purchased by the retail licensee and transporting the liquor to the retail licensee's licensed premises in accordance with the other provisions of this title.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-202 Application requirements for liquor transport license.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
To obtain a liquor transport license, a person shall submit to the department:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-202(1): a written application in a form prescribed by the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-202(2): a nonrefundable $300 application fee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-202(3): an initial license fee of $2,300 that is refundable if the commission does not issue a liquor transport license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-202(4): a copy of the person's current business license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-202(5): 32B-17-206 a bond as specified in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-202(6): evidence that the person carries liability insurance in an amount and form satisfactory to the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-202(7): if the person is a central receiving and distribution center:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-202(7)(a): a floor plan of each premises where the central receiving and distribution center proposes to receive, screen, store, or deliver alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-202(7)(b): a statement of the number of airport licensees for which the central receiving and distribution center proposes to provide services under the liquor transport license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-202(7)(c): a signed consent form stating that the central receiving and distribution center will permit any authorized representative of the commission or the department or a law enforcement officer to have unrestricted right to enter the central receiving and distribution center's premises, in compliance with applicable federal security procedures; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-202(8): any other information the commission or department requires.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-203 Renewal requirements for liquor transport license.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-203(1): A liquor transport license expires on May 31 of each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-203(2): 32B-17-206 To renew a liquor transport license, a person shall submit to the department by no later then April 30 of the year in which the license expires:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-203(2)(a): a completed renewal application in a form prescribed by the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-203(2)(b): a copy of the person's current business license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-203(2)(c): 32B-17-206 a bond as specified in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-203(2)(d): evidence that the person carries liability insurance in an amount and form satisfactory to the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-203(2)(e): if the person is not a central receiving and distribution center, a report that includes the following information for the period since the liquor transport licensee obtained or renewed a liquor transport license:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-203(2)(e)(i): the number of deliveries the liquor transport licensee made to each type of retail licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-203(2)(e)(ii): each state store and each package agency from which the liquor transport licensee picked up liquor as a liquor transport licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-203(2)(f): if the person is a central receiving and distribution center, a report that includes the following information for the period since the liquor transport licensee obtained or renewed a liquor transport license:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-203(2)(f)(i): the number of times the liquor transport licensee picked up liquor on behalf of an airport licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-203(2)(f)(ii): each state store and each package agency from which the liquor transport licensee picked up liquor on behalf of an airport licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-203(2)(g): any other information the commission or department requires; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-203(2)(h): a $1,200 renewal fee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-203(3): Failure to meet the renewal requirements described in this section results in an automatic forfeiture of the liquor transport license effective on the date the existing liquor transport license expires.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-204 Qualifications for liquor transport license.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-204(1): 32B-1-304 The commission may not issue a liquor transport license to a person who is disqualified under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-204(2): If a person to whom a liquor transport license is issued under this chapter no longer possesses the qualifications required by this title for obtaining the liquor transport license, the commission may suspend or revoke the person's liquor transport license.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-205 Commission and department duties before issuing liquor transport license.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-205(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-205(1)(a): Before the commission may issue a liquor transport license, the department shall conduct an investigation and may hold public hearings to gather information and make recommendations to the commission as to whether a liquor transport license should be issued.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-205(1)(b): (1)(a) The department shall forward the information and recommendations described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-205(2): 32B-17-202; 32B-17-204; 32B-1-304 Before issuing a liquor transport license, the commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-205(2)(a): 32B-17-202; 32B-17-204 determine that the person filed a complete application that complies with Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-205(2)(b): 32B-1-304 determine that the person is not disqualified under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-205(2)(c): consider the person's ability to manage and operate a liquor transport operation, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-205(2)(c)(i): management experience;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-205(2)(c)(ii): past related experience; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-205(2)(c)(iii): the means the person intends to use to deliver liquor to retail licensees; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-205(2)(d): consider any other factor that the commission considers necessary.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-206 Bond for liquor transport license.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-206(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-206(1)(a): A liquor transport licensee shall post a cash bond or surety bond in the penal sum of $10,000 payable to the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-206(1)(b): A liquor transport licensee shall procure and maintain a bond in accordance with this section for as long as the liquor transport licensee operates as a liquor transport licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-206(2): A bond posted under this section shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-206(2)(a): in a form approved by the attorney general; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-206(2)(b): conditioned upon a liquor transport licensee's faithful compliance with this title and the rules of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-206(3): If a surety bond posted by a liquor transport licensee under this section is canceled due to the liquor transport licensee's negligence, the department may assess a $300 reinstatement fee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-206(4): No part of a bond posted under this section may be withdrawn during the period the liquor transport license is in effect.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-206(5): (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-206(5)(a): A bond posted under this section may be forfeited if the liquor transport license is revoked.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-206(5)(b): (5)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301 General operational requirements for liquor transport license.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301(1): (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301(1)(a): A liquor transport licensee and staff of the liquor transport licensee shall comply with this title and the rules of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301(1)(b): (1)(a); Chapter 3, Disciplinary Actions and Enforcement Act Failure to comply as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301(1)(b)(i): a liquor transport licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301(1)(b)(ii): individual staff of a liquor transport licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301(1)(b)(iii): both a liquor transport licensee and staff of the liquor transport licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301(2): A liquor transport licensee may not employ a minor to handle an alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301(3): A liquor transport licensee may not sell, transfer, assign, exchange, barter, give, or attempt in any way to dispose of the liquor transport license to a person, regardless of whether done for monetary gain.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301(4): (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301(4)(a): A liquor transport licensee may not deliver alcoholic product to a person within the state except to:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301(4)(a)(i): a retail licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301(4)(a)(ii): a central receiving and distribution center; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301(4)(a)(iii): if the liquor transport licensee is a central receiving and distribution center, an airport licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301(4)(b): (4) A violation of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301(5): Alcoholic product in the possession or control of a liquor transport licensee is the property of the retail licensee or airport licensee whose funds were used to purchase the alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301(6): The commission may prescribe by rule, consistent with this title, the general operational requirements of a liquor transport licensee.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301.5 Additional operational requirements for liquor transport license held by a central receiving and distribution center.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301.5(1): A liquor transport licensee that is a central receiving and distribution center shall establish a secure process for:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301.5(1)(a): receiving alcoholic product from airport licensees, liquor transport licensees, beer wholesaler licensees, and small brewers at the central receiving and distribution center's premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301.5(1)(b): screening and storing alcoholic product the central receiving and distribution center receives or brings to the premises; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301.5(1)(c): delivering alcoholic product to the airport licensee that owns the alcoholic product.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301.5(2): (1) As part of the secure process described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301.5(2)(a): clearly identify and keep separate each airport licensee's alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301.5(2)(b): maintain alcoholic product in a locked storage area or container at all times except during:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301.5(2)(b)(i): a security screening of the alcoholic product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301.5(2)(b)(ii): transportation of the alcoholic product;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301.5(2)(c): notify the receiving airport licensee when screening is complete and alcoholic product is ready for delivery; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301.5(2)(d): deliver the alcoholic product to the receiving airport licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-301.5(3): The commission may prescribe by rule, consistent with this title, the operational requirements of a liquor transport licensee that is a central receiving and distribution center.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-302 Notifying the department of change of ownership.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The commission may suspend or revoke a liquor transport license if a liquor transport licensee does not immediately notify the department of a change in:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-302(1): ownership of the liquor transport service;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-302(2): for a corporate owner:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-302(2)(a): the corporate officers or directors; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-302(2)(b): shareholders holding at least 20% of the total issued and outstanding stock of the corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-302(3): for a limited liability company:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-302(3)(a): the managers; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-17-302(3)(b): the members owing at least 20% of the limited liability company.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 32B - Chapter 18 - Change of Alcohol License or Location Act
****************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101(1)(a): "Alcohol license" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101(1)(a)(i): a retail license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101(1)(a)(ii): an off-premise beer retailer state license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101(1)(a)(iii): a brewery manufacturing license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101(1)(a)(iv): a distillery manufacturing license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101(1)(a)(v): a winery manufacturing license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101(1)(a)(vi): a liquor warehousing license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101(1)(a)(vii): a special use permit that is an industrial or manufacturing use permit.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101(1)(b): "Alcohol license" does not include a:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101(1)(b)(i): master full-service restaurant license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101(1)(b)(ii): master limited-service restaurant license; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101(1)(b)(iii): master off-premise beer retailer state license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101(2): "Business entity" means a corporation, partnership, limited liability company, sole proprietorship, or similar entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101(3): "Interim alcoholic beverage management agreement" means a management agreement:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101(3)(a): in connection with:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101(3)(a)(i): a change of ownership in the entity holding an alcohol license; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101(3)(a)(ii): a transfer of the management of an alcohol license to another entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101(3)(b): under which the new owner or new management agrees to perform the operations of the alcohol licensee during the period that:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101(3)(b)(i): begins when:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101(3)(b)(i)(A): the change of ownership closes; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101(3)(b)(i)(B): the new management agreement is executed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101(3)(b)(ii): ends on the day after the day on which the commission approves the alcohol license for the new owner.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101(4): "Inventory transfer agreement" means an agreement under which an alcohol licensee agrees to sell or otherwise transfer all or part of the alcohol licensee's inventory of alcoholic products.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-101(5): "Management agreement" means an agreement between two people regarding the operation and management of an alcohol license.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-201 Transferability of an alcohol license.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-201(1): An alcohol license:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-201(1)(a): is not ascribed any value in the sale or transfer of a business entity or the business entity's assets;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-201(1)(b): is neither tangible nor intangible property to the holder of the license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-201(1)(c): is completely separate from other property of an alcohol licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-201(2): The Legislature may terminate or modify the existence of any type of alcohol license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-201(3): Except as provided in this part, a person may not sell, transfer, assign, exchange, barter, give, or attempt in any way to dispose of the alcohol license to another person whether for monetary gain or not.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-202 Effect of change of ownership of business entity.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-202(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-202(1)(a): When the ownership of 51% or more of the shares of stock of a corporation is restructured to include one or more persons who did not hold the ownership of 51% of those shares of stock on the day on which an alcohol license is issued to the corporation, the corporation shall comply with this chapter to reflect the restructuring.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-202(1)(b): When there is a new general partner or when the ownership of 51% or more of the capital or profits of a limited partnership is restructured to include one or more persons as general or limited partners and who did not hold ownership of 51% or more of the capital or profits of the limited partnership on the day on which an alcohol license is issued to the limited partnership, the limited partnership shall comply with this chapter to reflect the restructuring.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-202(1)(c): When the ownership of 51% or more of the interests in a limited liability company is restructured to include one or more persons as members who did not hold ownership of 51% or more of the interests in the limited liability company on the day on which an alcohol license is issued to the limited liability company, the limited liability company shall comply with this chapter to reflect the restructuring.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-202(2): A business entity shall comply with this section within 60 days after the day on which a restructuring of the business entity becomes effective.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-203 Application -- Approval process.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-203(1): 32B-18-207; (1); (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-203(1)(a): 32B-18-207 A person seeking an alcohol license in accordance with this part that is currently held by another person shall submit to the department:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-203(1)(a)(i): a written application for a new license in a form prescribed by the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-203(1)(a)(ii): 32B-18-207 a fee in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-203(1)(b): (1) If the person seeking an alcohol license as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-203(1)(b)(i): provides for all proceeds from the sale of alcohol, less cost of goods sold, to accrue to the current alcohol licensee;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-203(1)(b)(ii): provides for the duration of the agreement, that the current alcohol licensee:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-203(1)(b)(ii)(A): shall comply with the requirements of this title that are applicable to the alcohol license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-203(1)(b)(ii)(B): in accordance with this title, is subject to disciplinary action by the commission for a violation of this title; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-203(1)(b)(iii): the department approves.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-203(1)(c): (1) If the person seeking an alcohol license as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-203(2): 32B-18-207 An alcohol licensee seeking to restructure the alcohol licensee's internal ownership of 51% or more shall submit to the department:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-203(2)(a): a written application in a form prescribed by the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-203(2)(b): 32B-18-207 a fee in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-203(3): A person or business entity shall comply with this section within 60 days after the day on which the sale of the business's assets closes or the restructuring of the business entity becomes effective.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-203(4): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act In accordance with this section and


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-204 Notifying department of change in ownership.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The commission may suspend, revoke, or deem forfeited an alcohol license if the alcohol licensee does not notify the department, within 60 days after the day on which the change occurs, of a change in:Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-204(1): ownership of the business entity holding the alcohol license;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-204(2): for a corporate owner, the:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-204(2)(a): corporate officers or directors of the alcohol licensee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-204(2)(b): shareholders holding at least 20% of the total issued and outstanding stock of the corporation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-204(3): for a limited liability company:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-204(3)(a): managers of the limited liability company; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-204(3)(b): members owning at least 20% of the limited liability company.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-205 Management agreements -- Inventory transfers.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-205(1): (1)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-205(1)(a): A management agreement may provide for the sharing of revenue from a business utilizing an alcohol license, including revenue from the sale of an alcoholic product, if, regardless of which party holds the alcohol license, neither the owner nor operator is disqualified from holding the license for a previous violation of this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-205(1)(b): The parties to a management agreement shall submit to the department:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-205(1)(b)(i): a copy of the management agreement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-205(1)(b)(ii): any other information the department requires.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-205(1)(c): (1)(b) If there is a material change to the management agreement submitted to the department under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-205(1)(c)(i): a copy of the changed management agreement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-205(1)(c)(ii): any other information the department requires.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-205(2): 32B-18-202; (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-205(2)(a): 32B-18-202 Notwithstanding any other provision of this title, in connection with a change of ownership described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-205(2)(b): (2)(a) The inventory transfer agreement described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-205(3): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act In accordance with this section and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-205(3)(a): a management agreement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-205(3)(b): an inventory transfer agreement.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-206 Operational requirements for change of ownership or location.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-206(1): (1)(b); (c); (1)(a); (1)(b); (1)(c)(i)(A)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-206(1)(a): (1)(b); (c) Except as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-206(1)(b): (1)(a) The department may grant an extension of the time period described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-206(1)(b)(i): 30 days; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-206(1)(b)(ii): the number of days until the day on which the commission holds the commission's next regularly scheduled commission meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-206(1)(c): (1)(b); (1)(c)(i)(A) After the department authorizes an extension described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-206(1)(c)(i): (1)(c)(i)(A) the alcohol licensee demonstrates to the commission that the alcohol licensee cannot begin operations because the alcohol licensee:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-206(1)(c)(i)(A): is improving the licensed premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-206(1)(c)(i)(B): (1)(c)(i)(A) has obtained a building permit for the improvements described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-206(1)(c)(i)(C): is working expeditiously to complete the improvements to the licensed premises; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-206(1)(c)(ii): the commission determines that circumstances beyond the control of the alcohol licensee negate the licensee's ability to begin operations in a timely manner.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-206(2): (2)(a); (2)(a); (2)(a); (2)(a) An alcohol licensee is considered to have begun operations of the alcohol license if the alcohol licensee:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-206(2)(a): has a licensed premises that is open for business;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-206(2)(b): (2)(a); (2)(a); (2)(a); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-206(2)(b)(i): (2)(a) sells, offers for sale, or furnishes an alcoholic product to a patron on the licensed premises described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-206(2)(b)(ii): (2)(a) manufactures an alcoholic product on the licensed premises described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-206(2)(b)(iii): (2)(a) engages in an industrial or manufacturing pursuit containing alcohol on the licensed premises described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-206(2)(b)(iv): (2)(a) warehouses liquor on the licensed premises described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-206(2)(c): has a valid business license.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-206(3): (1); 32B-18-207 If an alcohol licensee fails to begin operations of the alcohol license within the time period required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-206(3)(a): the alcohol license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-206(3)(b): 32B-18-207 the fee described in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-207 Change fees.
---------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-207(1): 32B-18-202 The department shall charge the following fees for a change of ownership under this part:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-207(1)(a): for a change of ownership of an alcohol license from an alcohol licensee to another person, the change fee equals the initial license fee amount specified in the relevant chapter or part for the type of alcohol license for which the change of ownership occurs; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-207(1)(b): 32B-18-202 for a change of ownership described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-207(2): (1) The department shall deposit a fee collected under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-301 Change of location provisions.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-301(1): Except as provided in this part, a person may not move an alcohol license from one location to another.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-301(2): Before an alcohol licensee moves the alcohol licensee's license from one location to another, the alcohol licensee shall submit to the department:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-301(2)(a): an application for a change of location, in the form the department determines; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-301(2)(b): a change of location fee.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-301(3): Before the commission approves a change of location requested in accordance with this part, the commission shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-301(3)(a): ensure that the new location meets the physical requirements for the type of license for which the change of location is requested, including any proximity requirement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-301(3)(b): consider the locality within which the proposed licensed premises is located, including the relevant factors for the type of license for which the change of location is requested.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-302 Operational requirements for change of location.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-302(1): (1)(b); (c); (1)(a); (1)(b); (1)(c)(i)(A)

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-302(1)(b)(ii): the number of days until the next regularly scheduled commission meeting.

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-302(1)(c)(i): (1)(c)(i)(A) the alcohol licensee demonstrates to the commission that the alcohol licensee cannot begin operations because the alcohol licensee:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-302(1)(c)(i)(A): is improving the licensed premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-302(1)(c)(i)(B): (1)(c)(i)(A) has obtained a building permit for the improvements described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-302(1)(c)(i)(C): is working expeditiously to complete the improvements to the licensed premises; or
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-302(1)(c)(ii): the commission determines that circumstances beyond the control of the alcohol licensee negate the licensee's ability to begin operations in a timely manner.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-302(2): (1)(a); (2)(a); (2)(a); (2)(a) An alcohol licensee is considered to have begun operations of the alcohol license if the alcohol licensee:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-302(2)(a): has a licensed premises that is open for business;
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-302(2)(b): (1)(a); (2)(a); (2)(a); (2)(a)

Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-302(3)(b): the change of location fee.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-303 Change of location fees.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-303(1): The department shall charge a $300 fee for a change in location of an alcohol licensee's licensed premises.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-303(2): (1) The department shall deposit a fee collected under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-401 License not to be pledged as security -- Prohibited changes, transfers, and moves.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-401(1): An alcohol licensee may not enter into any agreement under which the alcohol licensee pledges the alcohol license as security for a loan or as security for the fulfillment of any agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-401(2): An alcohol licensee may not change, transfer, or move an alcohol license except as expressly permitted under this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-402 Effect of change, transfer, or move in violation of this chapter.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-402(1): If an alcohol license is changed, transferred, or moved in violation of this chapter, the commission may:
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-402(1)(a): void the change, transfer, or move; and
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-402(1)(b): require the alcohol license to be forfeited.
Utah Code Annotated § 32B-18-402(2): (1) Subsection
